Title: ISA NT-114/500 AZ Telescope
Body (HTML):
Start your journey into space exploration with this ISA Space Exploration NASA-themed Telescope NT-114/500 AZ. This high-quality reflecting telescope combines powerful optics with a compact design – perfect for beginners and star enthusiasts who like to travel light or are looking for a simple starter telescope to take a first step into the fascinating science of Astronomy.

Stunning views through excellent wide-field optics:

From different structures of the Milky Way to open star clusters and vast nebulae, the telescope’s high light-gathering aperture and short focal length offer impressive wide-field views of many celestial objects both within and beyond our solar system. With the included 26mm and 5mm eyepieces, various Solar System objects are displayed at 20x and 100x magnification. Enjoy extremely sharp images of the moon as well as some impressive views of the larger planets such as Jupiter & Saturn thanks to the diffraction-limited primary mirror. The 40mm secondary mirror ensures optimal field illumination. 

Easy entry into astronomy with the telescope:

From the moment you unpack it, your telescope is ready to use. Simply set it up and start exploring the universe – this beginner’s telescope arrives almost fully assembled. The user-friendly azimuth mount allows you to easily swing from one object to another, just like a regular camera tripod. The optics remain stable on the robust, height-adjustable stainless steel tripod.

See and experience even more with the included telescope accessories:

In addition to the essential accessories, this reflector telescope includes extra highlights for your night sky explorations. You can even capture and share your astronomical discoveries with the smartphone holder to take unique photos of the night sky with your phone. Or use the T2 camera adapter ring to connect your SLR or astro camera with a specific adapter (not included). And what about our own star (our Sun)? With the included solar filter, you can safely observe transits, eclipses, and sunspots through your telescope.

Make your dream of exploring space a reality now – with the ISA Space Exploration NASA-themed Telescope NT-114/500 AZ.

Features:

  • High-quality, compact reflecting telescope
  • Wide-field optics, ideal for travel
  • Large 40mm secondary mirror for ideal field illumination
  • Excellent sharpness thanks to the diffraction-limited primary mirror
  • Magnification with included accessories: 20x, 100x (max. recommended: 228x)
  • Focal length, aperture ratio: 500 mm, f/4.4
  • Easy-to-use azimuth mount
  • Height-adjustable stainless steel field tripod
  • Suitable for solar observation with safe solar filter
  • Smartphone camera adapter for first astrophotos
  • Stable eyepiece holder
  • Eyepiece holder diameter: 31.7 mm (1.25")

Whats included:

  1. Reflecting telescope
  2. Azimuth telescope mount
  3. Stainless steel tripod with accessory tray
  4. 2 eyepieces: Super Plössl 26 mm, Plössl 5 mm
  5. LED red dot finder
  6. Solar filter
  7. Smartphone camera adapter
  8. T2 camera adapter ring (M42x0.75 mm)
  9. Software (downloadable)
  10. Rotatable star chart
  11. Battery
  12. Instruction manual

Title: Celestron StarSense Explorer - LT80AZ
Body (HTML):
Celestron has reinvented the manual telescope with the StarSense Explorer - the first telescope that uses your smartphone to analyze the night sky and calculate its position in real time. The StarSense Explorer is ideal for beginners thanks to its user-friendly interface and detailed tutorials. It's like having your own personal guide to the night sky.

Dock, launch, explore:
Leave complicated star charts, imprecise planetarium programs, and computerized mounts behind. With the StarSense Explorer, finding objects has never been easier, faster, and more accurate. Within minutes of setting up the telescope, you can begin moving confidently in the sky.

Simply place your phone in the unique StarSense Dock and launch the StarSense Explorer app. After aiming your phone at the telescope's optics (which can be done in two minutes), the StarSense Explorer generates a list of currently visible celestial objects. Make your selection, and arrows appear on the screen to help you move the telescope. When the object is visible in the eyepiece, the crosshairs turn green.

Smartphone compatibility:
StarSense Explorer works with most current smartphones, including iPhone 6 and newer and most devices running Android 7.1.2 or higher manufactured since 2016. For a full compatibility list, click here .

Patent pending StarSense Sky technology:
StarSense Explorer uses patent-pending technology and your smartphone to determine exactly where the telescope is pointed in the night sky. A Lost-in-Space Algorithm (LISA), the same algorithm used by orbiting satellites to correctly reorient themselves, helps the app match the star patterns it detects with its internal database.

While other astronomy apps claim to help you find objects, they rely solely on the phone's compass, gyroscopes, and accelerometers, which are not as accurate as LISA's technology. No other app can tell you exactly when your target will be visible in the eyepiece.

Robust azimuthal mount:
The StarSense Explorer LT's intuitive alt-azimuth mount makes it easy to point the telescope at the target. A fine adjustment knob for the altitude axis helps you fine-tune the telescope to the object and track targets as the Earth rotates beneath the night sky. Everything is mounted on a large, height-adjustable tripod.

Perfect views with high-quality optics:
You can expect sharp, bright images through this 80mm refractor. The fully coated glass optics provide increased light transmission, making details in celestial objects more clearly visible. The telescope also features a 90-degree prism for an erect image, allowing you to observe nature during the day including birds, wildlife, scenery and more.

Perfect for the city as well as dark locations:
Even if you live in a place with slightly bright skies and moderate light pollution, the StarSense Explorer is powerful enough to locate Jupiter, Saturn, Venus, the Orion Nebula, binary stars, and some of the most famous celestial objects.

However, if you can move the telescope to a slightly darker location, even more objects will become visible. The entire telescope weighs just 4.17kg, making it perfectly portable and easy to take with you on your next camping trip or to a remote observing site.

Specs:

  • Optical Design: Refractor
  • Resolution (DAWES): 1.45 arcseconds
  • Resolution (RAYLEIGH): 1.74 arcseconds
  • Focal length: 900mm (35.43")
  • Limit size: 12
  • Highest useful magnification: x189
  • Light gathering capacity (compared to the human eye): x 131
  • Lowest useful magnification: x11
  • Telescope aperture: 80mm (3.1")
  • Tube (material): Aluminum
  • Tube weight: 2.45kg
  • Tube size (max): 90mm (3.54")
  • Tube length: 97cm (38")
  • Fully coated glass optics
  • Aperture ratio: f/11

Mount Spec:

  • Alignment Methods: StarSense Explorer App
  • Mount type: Azimuthal mount (manual)
  • Mount control: Manual
  • Dovetail: no
  • Dovetail compatible: CG-5 dovetail rail
  • Panning speed: Manually
  • Features: StarSense Explorer App, SkyPortal App, Celestron Starry Night Basic Edition Software

Whats included:

  1. Refractor Telescope
  2. StarSense Smartphone Dock
  3. Eyepiece with low (25 mm) and high magnification (10 mm) 
  4. 2x Barlow lens to double the magnification of each eyepiece
  5. Amici prism – straightens the image by 90° and displays it the right way round (1.25")
  6. StarPointer finderscope, perfect for using the telescope during the day or without the StarSense Explorer app
  7. Altazimuth mount with fine drive
  8. Large tripod with accessory tray

Title: Bresser Messier 130 Tabletop Dobsonian Telescope - 5"
Body (HTML):
The Bresser Messier 5" Dobsonian offers the performance and qualities rivaling many other more expensive telescopes, infact there are many dedicated Dobsonian telescope users groups, passionate about these designs and given the outstanding performance of these telescopes and their price, its easy to see why.

The attraction lies in the uncomplicated handling. Simply place the entire telescope on a stable table or flat surface and align it to view the desired object. The Messier 5" Dobsonian telescope is delivered largely pre-assembled and is therefore ready to go after a few minutes. With the 130 mm diameter optics, observation is not limited to the moon and the planets of our solar system - you can look much further into the night sky and observe globular clusters, nebulae and galaxies.

The wide-field optics with a low focal ratio of f/5.0 simplifies the finding and observation of even faint objects in the night sky.
This 5" Dobsonian is also equipped with a large 2.0" focuser, which allows the use of 2.0" eyepieces with even larger fields of
view. Due to the included eyepiece adapter even 1.25" eyepieces can be used.

The parabolic primary mirror offers significantly better image sharpness and contrast than comparable telescopes with a simple spherical mirrors. In addition to this, the telescope has a particularly large secondary mirror of 55mm diameter for an ideal illumination of the image field. The entire telescope tube can be moved and twisted in the tube clamps. The telescope OTA also has a standard GP dovetail bar, which means that the optics can also be used on almost any other telescope mount with a vixen fitting.

Telescope Specs:

  • Optical design: Reflector
  • Mirror diameter: 130 mm
  • Focal length: 650 mm / f/5
  • Maximum recommended magnification: x 260
  • High quality BRESSER Newton optics
  • Parabolic primary mirror
  • Primary mirror diameter: 130 mm
  • 2.0" Rack & Pinion focuser.
  • primary mirror made using special-purpose glass with very little thermal expansion
  • OTA can be attached to other mountings
  • Differently sized adjusting- and lock-screws

Dimensions & Weight:

  • Net weight OTA: (incl. accessories) 3.5 kg
  • Total length: 35 cm
  • Total width: 35 cm
  • Total height: 71 cm
  • Tube diameter: 150 mm
  • Tube length: 610 mm
  • Net Weight total (incl. accessories): 6.6 kg
  • Net weight mount (incl. accessories): 4.5 kg

Whats included:

  • Newtonian Reflector
  • Lens Solar Filter
  • 2 tube clamps with universal dovetail rail
  • Telescopic mount with universal prism mount
  • 25mm + 9mm Eyepiece (Ø 31.7mm / 1.25'')
  • LED light point viewfinder (battery incl.)
  • Moon filter (Ø 31.7 mm / 1.25'')
  • Operating instructions

SAFETY NOTICE: Never look directly at the Sun through your Binoculars or Telescope - immediate and permanent eye damage may result. For Solar viewing please ensure you have a dedicated Solar Filter fitted correctly to your telescope.

Title: Bresser Messier AR-90S/500 EXOS 2
Body (HTML):
The Bresser Messier AR-90S Refractor telescope is designed for both ambitious beginners and advanced observers alike. This small refractor offers some great views of both the larger Solar System objects as well as a whole range of deep sky targets such as star clusters and brighter galaxies and nebula.

Although better suited for large deep sky objects like galaxies, nebula and star clusters, when using a stronger eyepiece / Barlow (sold seperately) this 90mm refractor telescope can still also provide some really sharp views of the moons surface along with some details on the larger planets such as Jupiters cloud bands as well as Saturns rings (1.5 billion km away). If you venture to darker skies away from the city lights then its also possible to make some nice observations of the brighter galaxies such as Bodes Galaxy or Andromeda Galaxy as well as a whole range of star clusters and brighter nebula such as the Orion Nebula.

With an Aperture of 90mm @ f/5.5, this refractor offers some good light gathering characteristics which is especially useful if you would like to try your hand at some Astrophotography. The sharp and sturdy 'Hexafoc' focuser enables precise focusing and there is also a 1/4" mounting bolt on the handle of the telescope to separately mount a DSLR camera if required. 

The Mount:
The EXOS-2 German Equatorial Mount is a long established, intermediate level mount designed to offer a sturdy platform for equipment weighing up to 13kg. While this is the non-computerised version of the mount, a conversion kit is available separately to upgrade it to provide full electronic tracking and GOTO functions also - Essential for long exposure Astrophotography

Telescope main features:
  • Optical design: Refractor telescope
  • Aperture: 90mm
  • Focal length: 500mm
  • Focal Ratio: f/5.5
  • OTA Weight: 1.9kg
  • Maximum recommended magnification: x 180
  • 6x30 viewfinder with crosshair eyepiece
  • Optimised finder mount for comfortable viewing
  • 31.7mm (1.25") zenith mirror
  • Smartphone adapter included
Equatorial Mount Features:
  • Stable parallactic mount with fine drives on both axis.
  • Ball bearings in both axis for more precise movements
  • Stable height adjustable stainless steel tripod (Min. 69cm / Max. 109.5cm)
  • Load capacity up to 13kg
  • Circular bubble level for easy horizontal alignment
  • Pole height scale for setting the latitude
  • Scaled graduated circular rings to facilitate finding objects using a star atlas or planetarium software
  • Tripod weight: 4.7 kg
  • Mount weight: 5.6 kg (without counterweight)
  • Total weight incl. counterweight: 14.8 kg
  • Batteries: not included
Whats included:
  1. Refractor OTA
  2. 26mm Super Plössl eyepiece (31.7mm / 1.25")
  3. 31.7mm (1.25") zenith mirror
  4. 6x30 Optical View finder
  5. Rotatable star map
  6. Aperture Solar Filter

Title: Bresser Messier AR-80/640 Nano AZ Telescope
Body (HTML):
The Bresser Messier AR-80/640 Nano is a great starter telescope for both adults and young children looking for a first telescope to view some of the larger objects in the solar system such as the Moon and the larger planets.

Solar System objects like the Moon will appear nice and sharp, especially the larger craters and surface features such as the 'Montes Apenninus' mountain range. Under steady sky conditions, using a stronger eyepiece eg. a 15mm eyepiece and x2 Barlow (sold seperately) it will also possible to make out Saturns rings or the two main cloud belts on Jupiter as well as Jupiters 3 larger moons.

You can even share your fantastic views of space with your friends and family, as this telescope also includes a small smartphone holder so you can use your smartphone to capture some nice photos through the eyepiece.

The Mount:
An essential part of any beginner telescope is the mounts simplicity, and the Nano ALT-AZ mount is exactly that. Having a telescope that is quick and easy to setup and use means you will most likely use it a lot more often - an important consideration when choosing a telescope. This is why Alt-AZ mounts are so popular with both beginners and experienced amateurs as a convenient grab and go telescope. The Nano Alt-AZ mount offers a sturdy platform with smooth controls to allow you to effortlessly scan the night sky.

The mount is as easy to use as a photo tripod, it is just more stable and easily carries telescopes weighing up to 4kg and with a weight of only 3.4kg, its also very easy to store and transport. The telescope is securely held by a clamp for 44mm prism rails, (the so-called GP Level) which is an international standard and all telescopes with a GP prism rail can also be used on this mount.

Features:

  • High quality and compact Refractor telescope - Ideal for beginners
  • Sturdy & easy to use Bresser Nano Mount
  • Telescope arrives almost pre-assembled
  • MgF2-coated optics
  • Aperture: 80mm
  • Focal length: 640mm
  • Stainless steel field tripod
  • Smartphone holder bracket included - for taking pictures
  • Eyepiece diameter: 31.7mm (1.25")
  • Suitable for Astro and Solar observation (with included Solar filter securely attached)
  • 5 Year Manufacturer Warranty

  2. Azimuth Mount
  3. Stainless steel tripod with accessory shelf
  4. Eyepiece: Bresser Super Plössl 26mm
  5. Red dot finder
  6. Diagonal mirror 1.25"(31,7mm)
  7. Aperture Solar-filter
  8. Smartphone camera adapter
  9. Camera-Adapter Ring T2 (M42x0.75mm)
  10. Star Chart Software & Rotatable star-map

Title: Bresser Messier 150 Dobsonian Telescope - 6"
Body (HTML):
The Bresser Messier 6" Dobsonian offers the performance and qualities rivaling many other more expensive telescopes, in fact there are many dedicated Dobsonian telescope users groups, passionate about these designs and given the outstanding performance of these telescopes and their price, its easy to see why.

The attraction lies in the uncomplicated handling. Simply place the entire telescope on a flat surface and align it to view the desired object. With the 150 mm diameter optics, observation is not limited to the moon and the planets of our solar system - you can look much further into the night sky and observe globular clusters, nebulae and galaxies.

Despite its lower price, it offers a range of functions and quality, which one would expect to find on more advanced telescopes of this type. With an aperture diameter of 150mm and a 1200mm focal length with color-pure mirror optics, observations of the moon, the planets and star clusters can be viewed quite easily. The craters and grooves on the moons surface as well as the rapidly changing shadow cast on the so-called Terminator are particularly exciting targets to view through this telescope. Saturn with its imposing ring structure, Jupiter with the cloud bands and the movement of its easily visible moons, the crescent shape of Venus and the reddish smoldering Mars are also good examples of what can be viewed with this telescope..

In short, this is a telescope primarily suitable for detailed space observations and is an excellent choice for beginners in Astronomy. For stowage or transport the base assembly can be disassembled quite easily and flat packed for convenience.

Title: Bresser Messier NT-150/750 EXOS-2 - 6"
Body (HTML):
For many years Bresser Newtonian telescopes have become the standard workhorse for those wanting to advance in the exciting world of Astronomy & Astrophotography. Now the second generation of this telescope, the Bresser NT-150/750 comes with an improved Hexafoc focusser and fast parabolic main mirror. 

The Bresser Messier NT-150 telescope excels with high rigidity and tack-sharp parabolic optics. The 150mm (6") aperture enables you to observe some bright nebulas in the depth of space or find the remnants of gigantic stellar explosions from the year 1054 in the Taurean constellation, or scan the glowing bands of the great Orion Nebula. Detect the famous Whirlpool Galaxy in the Big Dipper or find the Dumpbell-Nebula in the constellation Vulpecula (little fox). The high rigidity of the EXOS-2 mount allows for a very relaxed observation experience and is also helpful for those making their first attempts at astrophotography.

We recommend a Telescope such as this for those looking to engage into a more advanced level of Astronomy with the option of progressing further into Astrophotography, as the 6" aperture of the Telescope and the sturdy Equatorial Mount (with the option to upgrade to a tracked version) means that this package offers a great range of targets to see both visually and through a camera.  

BRESSER EXOS-2 Equatorial Mount:
The Bresser EXOS-2 is a rugged German Equatorial Mount offering high rigidity and precision tracking for visual observation as well as astrophotography. The tripod is extremely sturdy and designed to suppress vibrations very well. As with all the Bressier Messier range, this mount is built to extremely high standards and comes with an illuminated polar finder scope and precise graduated circles for more accuracy and ease of use during polar alignement. - If you wish at a later stage to upgrade the mount to a full computerised GOTO system, a powered two axis GOTO-Kit is available as an optional extra. The EXOS-2 mounts is designed to take a max payload weight up to 13kg allowing you to use refractors of up to 152 mm aperture or mirror telescopes of up to 203 mm aperture.

Title: National Geographic 90/1200 Maksutov Cassegrain Telescope
Body (HTML):
This 90mm Maksutov-Cassegrain telescope can be operated both on a table/platform or with the supplied tripod. The telescope has been designed in conjunction with The National Geographic Society and well respected German Telescope maker Bresser.

Its an ideal entry level scope for someone who wants to casually view some of the beautiful objects in the night sky and will offer some truly memorable views of the Moon, various star clusters and some interesting details on the larger planets such as Jupiter's cloud bands and larger moons as well as Saturn's rings.

The in-built GOTO computer control helps to align the telescope and to automatically find and point the telescope to various objects without the user having much prior knowledge of navigating the night sky. The computer menu settings are also multilingual and can be set to English, German, French, Spanish or Italian.

  • Optical design: Maksutov-Cassegrain
  • Mirror diameter: 90mm

Title: Bresser Messier 150 Tabletop Dobsonian Telescope - 6"
Body (HTML):
The Bresser Messier 6" Dobsonian offers the performance and qualities rivaling many other more expensive telescopes, infact there are many dedicated Dobsonian telescope users groups, passionate about these designs and given the outstanding performance of these telescopes and their price, its easy to see why.

The attraction lies in the uncomplicated handling. Simply place the entire telescope on a stable table or flat surface and align it to view the desired object. The Messier 6" Dobsonian telescope is delivered largely pre-assembled and is therefore ready to go after a few minutes. With the 150 mm diameter optics, observation is not limited to the moon and the planets of our solar system - you can look much further into the night sky and observe globular clusters, nebulae and galaxies.

The wide-field optics with a low focal ratio of f/5.0 simplifies the finding and observation of even faint objects in the night sky.
This 6" Dobsonian is also equipped with a large 2.0" focuser, which allows the use of 2.0" eyepieces with even larger fields of
view. Due to the included eyepiece adapter even 1.25" eyepieces can be used.

The parabolic primrary mirror offers significantly better image sharpness and contrast than comparable telescopes with a simple spherical mirrors. In addition to this, the telescope has a particularly large secondary mirror of 55mm diameter for an ideal illumination of the image field. The entire telescope tube can be moved and twisted in the tube clamps. The telescope OTA also has a standard GP dovetail bar, which means that the optics can also be used on almost any other telescope mount with a vixen fitting.

Telescope Specs:

  • Optical design: Reflector
  • Mirror diameter: 150 mm
  • Focal length: 750 mm / f/5
  • Maximum recommended magnification: x 300
  • High quality BRESSER Newton optics
  • Parabolic primary mirror
  • Primary mirror diameter: 150 mm
  • 2.0" Rack & Pinion focuser.
  • primary mirror made using special-purpose glass with very little thermal expansion
  • OTA can be attached to other mountings
  • Differently sized adjusting- and lock-screws

Title: Vixen Porta II A80MF Refractor Telescope
Body (HTML):
The Vixen Porta II A80MF telescope set includes everything you need to get started in Astronomy. The A80MF is an Achromatic Refractor which offers very good color correction and is ideal for observing the moon and planets but is also suitable for viewing some of the brighter nebula and galaxies such as Orion or Andromeda.

The unrivalled clarity of Refractor telescopes is always one of their main positive features and a view of lunar surface with the crater landscapes will be an unforgettable experience.

The A80Mf refractor is Vixens entry-level model for astronomy newcomers who value high quality optics and craftmanship. The 80mm lenses deliver excellent quality, and also included is two Plössl eyepieces (6.3 mm and 20 mm) and a 90° diagonal mirror.
The 6x24 viewfinder makes finding targets in the night sky very quick and easy and the T2 thread permanently installed on the focuser allows a connection for your DSLR camera with an optional T adapter for the camera

The Porta II mount is very popular with beginners, but also offers experienced astronomers the opportunity to mount their devices quickly and easily as part of a grab-and-go setup. The Porta II does not require clamping, as it has a slip clutch, which makes it easy to adjust the mount with fine tune increments to center on an object. It then automatically holds your position making it super easy for anyone to use.

Grip positions as well as height and azimuth slow motion controls can be changed in 45° increments. This allows the user to use the handles on the mount for a more comfortable position. The accessory holder is provided with cut-outs for your eyepieces.
It can also be used to hold smaller photo accessories. The holder is mounted via a centrally mounted screw and a built-in
key is included to be able to adjust the friction of the slip clutch.

  • Optics: Achromatic Refractor.
  • Main Lens: 80mm 2-lens achromat, multi-coated
  • Focal length: 910 mm (f11.4)
  • Resolution and limit size: 1.45 arc seconds; 11,3
  • Light collecting capacity: 131x

Title: Bresser Messier MC-100/1400 EXOS 2
Body (HTML):
The Bresser Messier MC-100 telescope is a small Maksutov telescope for both ambitious beginners and advanced observers alike. If your preference is viewing the Moon and Planets, then Maksutov designs such as this are hard to beat.

Maksutov Telescopes are more specialised designs which are really well suited for planetary viewing and imaging. Their unique design incorporates both lenses and mirrors which result in extremely long focal lengths (which is required for higher magnification) but in a small compact tube. For planetary viewing, focal length is extremely important and at 1400mm focal length, this telescope is designed for the much higher magnifications needed to view some exceptionally clear surface details on the Moon and Planets. Under the right seeing conditions, coupled with a x2 barlow lens for example, surface features on the Moon are simply spectacular. Saturns rings and much more cloud structure on Jupiter become more visible as well as the polar caps on Mars and the sturdy EXOS 2 mount offers the perfect stable platform to keep everything in check at these higher magnifications.

The Mount:
The EXOS-2 German Equatorial Mount is a long established, intermediate level mount designed to offer a sturdy platform for equipment weighing up to 13kg. While this is the non-computerised version of the mount, a conversion kit is available separately to upgrade it to provide full electronic tracking and GOTO functions also - Essential for long exposure Astrophotography

Telescope main features:
  • High-quality Maksutov-Cassegrain optics with high focal length and extremely sharp optics.
  • Exceptional views of the Moon & Planets.

Title: Bresser Messier AR-102/600 Nano AZ Telescope
Body (HTML):
The Bresser Messier AR-102 Nano is a really excellent starter telescope for both adults and children. This small refractor on an ALT-AZ mount is ideal if you are looking for a good beginner telescope which will provide some really nice views of the moon or planets in our solar system or even catch a glimpse of some of the larger deep sky objects from dark sky locations.

Solar System objects like the Moon will appear nice and sharp, especially the larger craters and surface features such as the 'Montes Apenninus' mountain range. Under steady sky conditions, using a stronger eyepiece eg. a 15mm eyepiece and x2 Barlow (sold seperately) it can also possible to make out Saturns rings or the two main cloud belts on Jupiter as well as Jupiters 3 larger moons.

The Mount:
An essential part of any beginner telescope is the mounts simplicity, and the Nano ALT-AZ mount is exactly that. Having a telescope that is quick and easy to setup
and use means you will most likely use it a lot more often - an important consideration when choosing a telescope. This is why Alt-AZ mounts are so popular with both beginners and experienced amateurs as a convenient grab and go telescope. The Nano Alt-AZ mount offers a sturdy platform with smooth controls to allow you to effortlessly scan the night sky.

The mount is as easy to use as a photo tripod, it is just more stable and easily carries telescopes weighing up to 4 kg and with a weight of only 3.4kg, its also very easy to store and transport. The telescope is securely held by a clamp for 44mm prism rails, (the so-called GP Level) which is an international standard and all telescopes with a
GP prism rail can also be used on this mount.

Title: Bresser Messier AR-102S/600 EXOS 2
Body (HTML):
The Bresser Messier AR-102S Refractor telescope is designed for both ambitious beginners and advanced observers alike. This medium sized refractor offers great views of both the larger Solar System objects as well as a whole range of deep sky targets such as star clusters and brighter galaxies and nebula.

A Refractor telescope of this size can provide some extremely sharp views of the Moon which will appear nice and sharp, especially the larger craters and surface features such as the 'Montes Apenninus' mountain range.

Under steady sky conditions, using a stronger eyepiece eg. a 15mm eyepiece and x2 Barlow (sold seperately) it will also possible to make out Saturns rings or the two main cloud belts on Jupiter as well as Jupiters 3 larger moons.. If you venture to darker skies away from the city lights then its also possible to make some nice observations of the brighter galaxies such as Bodes Galaxy or Andromeda Galaxy as well as a whole range of star clusters and brighter nebula such as the Orion Nebula.

With an Aperture of 102mm @ f/5.9, this refractor offers some good light gathering characteristics allowing you to try your hand at some Astrophotography. The sharp and sturdy 'Hexafoc' focuser enables precise focusing and there is also a 1/4" mounting bolt on the handle of the telescope to separately mount a DSLR camera if required.

Title: Vixen Porta II R130SF Reflector
Body (HTML):
This lightweight 5" Newtonian is the ideal entry-level telescope for demanding newcomers to the exciting field of Astronomy. It delivers bright and sharp images thanks to the high light gathering ability, at an excellent price-to-performance ratio.

Not only is it great for the moon and planets, but you can also use it to observe other objects such as star clusters, nebulae or brighter galaxies. You will be particularly amazed when you see the lunar surface with its many craters, and under the right seeing conditions you can see the rings of Saturn. The Orion Nebula and the Andromeda Galaxy are also a great experience under the sky with this telescope.

The T2 connection to the focuser allows the connection of a DSLR camera, in conjunction with an optional T2 ring.
The Vixen dovetail slide rail also allows quick mounting even on many third-party mounts.
The focuser is designed for 31.7mm plug-in diameter and therefore offers you a countless range of accessory options to expand your telescope abilities.

The Porta II mount is not only very popular with beginners, but also offers experienced astronomers the opportunity to mount their devices quickly and easily and has fine adjustment in both axes.

The Porta II does not require clamping, it has a slip clutch, which makes it easy to adjust the mount to an object. It automatically holds your position and is therefore very easy to use for everyone.

Title: ZWO Seestar S30 - Smart Telescope
Body (HTML):
ZWO Seestar S30 Smart Telescope

This revolutionary smart Telescope gives you all the tools you need to capture the stars, the Galaxy and beyond at your fingertips. Smart Telescopes are revolutionising the field of Astrophotography by offering complete beginners the chance to photograph distant nebulas in our galaxy or galaxies far beyond that with an all in one Telescope that is so easy to setup and use. This means you can literally view and photograph some of the most amazing wonders of the universe with the smart phone in your pocket.  

The Seestar smart app allows you to explore the solar system, stargaze, or enjoy scenic view, with multiple imaging modes, voice prompts, and seamless smartphone control, Seestar S30 transforms beginners into astronomy pros with ease.

The Seestar S30 integrates two telescopes, an electric focuser, an astronomical camera, a dew heater, an ASIAIR intelligent controller, an altazimuth mount and a filter wheel (UV/IR cut, duo-band, dark) into a single unit, with a body weight of only 1.79 kg, meaning you can literally take it anywhere including far away from the city light pollution to really open up the heavens from a dark sky location.

Fully control your imaging:

Quickly learn the weather and recommendations for tonights viewing, then select the celestial targets or landscape mode you are going to shoot. Click to start shooting - its literally as easy as that!

Discover the hidden universe:

Observe the universe like never before: Seestar S30 allows you to create stunning images using live stacking mode. The more images you capture the more color and details will grow before your eyes. Things you can not witness with your naked eye will be gradually revealed.

Immersive visual experience:

The professional grade triplet apochromatic optics offers beautifully crisp images of the night sky with excellent control of chromatic aberration. The high-quality coating also helps reduce light loss. To increase the contrast of emission nebulae, it is possible to replace the UV/IR cut filter normally in the beam path with a dual-band filter by means of a built-in filter changer. This filter will block much of the light pollution and natural sky lightening.

Sony IMX662 Sensor (Starvis 2):

With high sensitivity and low noise, even during extended deep-sky captures, noise interference is minimized, ensuring superior performance in the darkest nights.

Smart noise reduction with automatic post-processing:

One-tap image creation, reducing noise while preserving celestial detail, ensures clarity even in heavily light-polluted areas. You can also fine-tune your image´s style to suit your taste and share your stunning shots instantly with family & friends.

Built-in Wi-Fi/Bluetooth:

The telescope comes with Wi-Fi/Bluetooth and can be used anywhere.

Built-in sensors:

Built-in sensors assist in tripod leveling using your mobile phone screen.

Light weight design:

The entire setup weighs only 1.79 kg, so the Seestar S30 can easily accompany you when travelling.

Automatic setup and guidance:

Using the built-in sensors and star maps, combined with your phone´s GPS sensor, Seestar S30 will automatically complete the self-calibration and alignment process. Seestar is really simple to use and easy to learn, you don´t need to be an astronomy expert - Seestar will guide you along your journey.

Auto focus:

The auto focus system takes the hassle out of focusing. Seestar´s auto focus will ensure your images are sharp and crisp every time, it will even provide auto foucs in scenery mode.

Auto GoTo and tracking:

Finding your object is easy. Choose the object on your phone and Seestar´s will automatically align to the target and start tracking, and also compensating for earth´s rotation ensuring your object remains centered.

Star map and object database:

Turn your smartphone or tablet into your telescope command center.

With a few clicks, you will have access to Seestar´s amazing star and deep sky object lists and get detailed information about your chosen celestial target.

Just minutes between you and the universe:

Seestar, using its built-in sensors, star maps, the innovative Sky Atlas and "Night´s Best Objects" will help you plan your evenings viewing.

A growing worldwide Seestar Community:

If you like you can even upload your photo to AstroNet using the hashtag #Seestar, Other Seestar astrophotographers will be able to find you and its a great way to share tips, advice and knowledge to other Seestar users worldwide.

Title: Bresser Messier AR-102/460 EXOS 1
Body (HTML):
The perfect Astronomy Telescope for ambitious beginners and advanced observers alike. View some of the details around the core of the Great Orion Nebula M42 or scan the lunar terminator in incredible sharpness and detail.

This is a widefield telescope with an ED glass lens and a short focal length of 460mm making it a very good wide field of view instrument.

The Mount & Tripod.
The Bresser Messier EXOS-1 mount is part of Bresser's entry level Equatorial Mount options making it an ideal platform for smaller telescopes such as refractors and Maksutov designs. Many beginner equatorial mounts are flimsy and under engineered mounts which can lead to a lot of frustration and discouragement for beginners in Astronomy. The EXOS-1 however, comes with a robust steel tripod and can comfortably carry optical tubes weighing up to 7kg for a stable visual observation of the night sky.

The optional motor drive for the RA axis makes usage even more comfortable, so there is no need to manually track the object and it is kept steadily in the eyepiece field of view.

Title: Bresser Messier AR-102/1000 Refractor Telescope
Body (HTML):
The Bresser First Light AR-102/1000 telescope is ideal for both ambitious beginners and experienced astronomers.

The stable mount keeps the telescope stable, even at higher magnifications and thanks to the high-quality mechanics, you can take your own photos of the moon and planets.

This refractor telescope features an equatorial mount (also called a parallactic mount). Thanks to this two-axis mechanism, it is possible to compensate for the rotation of the earth, enabling you to precisely track your desired celestial object.

The telescope also comes with a wide range of accessories for exploring the night sky, including a prism for an upright and laterally correct image.

Title: Bresser Messier NT-150S/750 EXOS-2 PMC 8
Body (HTML):
The Bresser Messier NT-150s/750 Newtonian Telescope and the modern EXOS-2 PMC-Eight GoTo mount, is an impressive combination of portable, powerful optics and a user-friendly and very sturdy German Equatorial Mount. Thanks to the parabolic primary mirror and the 150mm aperture of the Telescope, you can capture impressive details of nebulae, galaxies, and many other fascinating celestial objects.

The high-quality solar filter also allows for safe solar observation. With the reliable GoTo control and the user-friendly 'ExploreStars' app, navigating the sky becomes effortless. Additionally, the tracking to compensate for Earth’s rotation is exceptionally precise with the PMC-Eight GoTo mount.

The Telescope:

The Bresser Messier NT-150 Newtonian Telescope is distinguished by its good portability and razor-sharp optics with a parabolic primary mirror. The 150mm aperture allows you to observe even smaller nebulae in the vastness of space. Discover the remnants of a massive star explosion from the year 1054 in the Taurus constellation or trace the glowing filaments of the Great Orion Nebula. 

Spot the famous Pinwheel Galaxy in the constellation Ursa Major or find the Dumbbell Nebula in the constellation Vulpecula all of these targets are possible with this 6" Newtonian Reflecting Telescope. With the high-quality objective solar filter, you can also safely observe sunspots, eclipses, and planetary transits. (Warning: Never aim the telescope at the Sun without a solar filter!)

The EXOS-2 PMC-Eight Mount:

The Explore Scientific EXOS-2 PMC-Eight GoTo Mount is equipped with a modern and very precise GoTo control system. It consists of a robust Wi-Fi controller unit that provides all the necessary interfaces. The NEMA-11 stepper motors are directly connected to this unit via cable, and an ST-4 compatible autoguider interface is also available. In addition, the control system supports micro-stepping to ensure precise tracking.

Intuitive operation via app and graphical star chart:
The ExploreStars App, developed specifically for the PMC-Eight system, impresses with a very well-designed, intuitive user interface. The featured 'alignment stars' for initializing the control system, as well as all celestial objects in the database, are displayed as a star chart with additional text information. All these objects can be easily viewed and selected.

Powerful controller unit with Open GoTo for customization:
The heart of the controller unit consists of a completely autonomous 2-channel multi-processor with 8 CPUs and a Wi-Fi Ethernet 10/100 adapter with IP function. This allows remote operation via browser, ASCOM, app, or serial connection. The Open GoTo also allows you to write your own firmware and upload it to the controller unit. This enables custom adjustments to the device’s functions as well as the creation of custom object lists, etc.

Polar finder included:
The included and pre-installed polar finder scope allows for quick and precise polar alignment for longer exposure times without star trails. The integrated LED lighting unit further enhances the comfort of using the polar finder.

Title: Celestron NexStar Evolution - 9.25" EdgeHD (With StarSense)
Body (HTML):
The innovative NexStar Evolution is a compact, portable and mechanically solid telescope. This set adds the StarSense AutoAlign module to the Evo mount, taking the alignment process off your hands: the built-in camera orients itself to the sky and initiates the telescope for computer control and automatic tracking. The 9.25" EdgeHD tube delivers a flat, bright image of the sky.

You don't have to do anything during setup, the telescope automatically orients itself with the sky within a few minutes! With the additional options, the NexStar Evolution 9.25" HD set is an extremely powerful, user-friendly and quick-to-use combination.

  • Differences between the EdgeHD tube instead of the standard Schmidt-Cassegrain : 
    The EdgeHD telescopes not only offer photographers the advantage of a flattened field of view, but also have an improved focusing mechanism, ventilation openings with fine dust sieves for faster temperature equalization and, above all, the Schmidt plate is prepared for Hyperstar - so you can transform the optics into an ultra-fast astrograph with 400mm/f2.
  • A 2x Barlow lens, doubles the focal length for visual observations or planetary photography.
  • 1.25" moon filter.
  • StarSense module – The telescope automatically orients itself to the starry sky, all you have to do is set it up and switch it on.
  • StarPointer Pro instead of StarPointer – With aiming circles and brighter, dimmable LED is also suitable for daytime observations.
  • Perfect WiFi control via tablet or smartphone.
  • The planetarium program on your smartphone shows you the current sky view or a list of observation targets for your location. The SkyPortal app for iOS and Android also supports automatic initialization of the computer control ("alignment") via the StarSense module.

Simple and convenient operation:
The NexStar Evolution telescopes have been developed based on customer feedback from the past few years. They offer many well thought-out details so that you can enjoy the most beautiful night possible under the starry sky. 

No more worrying about batteries or an external power supply. The NexStar Evolution is the first amateur telescope to have a built-in lithium iron phosphate battery. One charge lasts up to ten hours. You can even use the Evolution's USB port to power other devices you want to use at night.

The NexStar Evolution is easy to set up thanks to the large, ergonomic handles. The steel tripod has markings so you can easily extend all legs to the same length. The azimuth and elevation clamps allow you to point the telescope at a target even without power. Up to seven eyepieces can be stored in two storage compartments - one even has a dimmable red LED light.

More power and safety thanks to lithium iron phosphate battery:
Instead of a typical lithium polymer battery, a lithium iron phosphate battery is used in the Evolution telescopes. These LiFePO 4 batteries have several advantages over simple LiPo batteries:

High safety & Reliability:

  • Unlike LiPo batteries, LiFePO 4 batteries cannot explode or ignite, but are considered intrinsically safe. The improved power density ensures a high load capacity even with continuous current consumption.
  • Long service life and cycle stability.
  • Wide temperature range for storage and operation
  • Low self-discharge
  • Excellent tracking accuracy, suitable for astrophotography

If you're interested in astrophotography, a NexStar Evolution is an excellent and affordable way to get started. It's the only fork-mounted telescope series in this price range with worm gears, along with improved motors. Planetary photography with a DSLR or a planetary camera is also no problem at all, and with a polar wedge you can also set it up equatorially to take long exposure deep sky images, be it with a DSLR or an Astro Camera.

The Schmidt-Cassegrain telescopes with the StarBright XLT coating deliver bright, sharp images and are just as interesting for visual observers as they are for astrophotographers.

Title: Explore Scientific 254 Dobsonian Telescope - 10"
Body (HTML):
Explore Scientific Ultra Light Dobson 254mm Telescope - GENERATION II

No type of telescope has changed amateur astronomy as much as the Dobsonian design telescopes. Before John Dobson introduced the Dobson telescope, the vast majority of amateur telescopes consisted of small lens telescopes with primitive mechanics - just enough to barely make out the polar caps of Mars or the rings of Saturn. Larger telescopes, such as Schmidt-Cassegrains, were reserved for a much more expensive and specialised market, however this all changed with the introduction of the Dobsonian Telescope. The Dobsonian design combines simple but effective mechanics with the largest possible aperture, which has given the Dobsonian telescope a unique triumph worldwide. Nowhere else do you get so much light gathering ability for your money as with a good Dobsonian Telescope.

At 254mm (10") Aperture things start to get very serious in terms of what you can see through the eyepiece. The Moon and Planets are simply awe inspiring and even fainter objects like Galaxies and nebula start to show lots of real detail - Particularly if you are viewing from a dark sky location. A telescope with a mirror diameter of 254mm collects more than 1300 times as much light than the naked eye.

The easy disassembly of this telescope allows for problem-free transport, even in relatively small cars - the assembly then is quick and easy without the need for tools. The entire construction has been optimized for maximum stiffness without neglecting weight. The combination of large height wheels with an optimized aluminum sandwich construction enables the finest correction movements at the highest magnifications. The focus position has already been prepared for the use of a coma corrector. A device with a mirror diameter of 254mm collects more than 1300 times as much light as the naked eye. Details on the planets become visible even to inexperienced observers, and countless deep-sky objects show structures. Bright star clusters are dissolved down to the core, and the sight of the Terminator on the moon becomes an unforgettable experience.

Transport dimensions for mobile use:

  • Rocker box: 395mm x 395mm x 310mm
  • Mirror box: 330mm x 330mm x 295mm
  • Rod length approx: 700mm
  • Viewing height in zenith position approx: 1.15m
  • 10" total weight: 26.4kg, 10" mirror box: 14 kg, 10" top with secondary mirror + rocker box: 9.7 kg, 10" 4 pairs of struts: 1.5kg, 10" height wheels pair: 1.2kg,
  • Threaded connection focuser: M54 x 0.75mm

  • Friction adjustment on both sides and brake system for the height bearings.

Title: Bresser Messier 254 Dobsonian Telescope - 10"
Body (HTML):
The Bresser Messier 10" Dobsonian is an extremely large Reflector telescope which offers amateur Astronomers of all levels some of the most spectacular views and experiences of our Solar Systems and other deep space objects. Although they are quite big, Dobsonian designs like this are extremely easy and intuitive to use.

The optical diameter of 254mm (10") does not limit your observations to solar system objects such as the moon or the planets - At this size of telescope you will reach much further into deep space and explore globular / open star clusters, nebulae and galaxies, all in much more detail than smaller telescopes.

With a Telescope of this aperture objects are beginning to show some structure: globular clusters are no longer only fuzzy circles, but are resolved into masses of individual stars. Nebulae, that can only be barely detected in smaller scopes, start to reveal structures within. The excellent Hexafoc focuser boosts a large 2.5" diameter so that you don't have vignetting in big widefield eyepieces that can occur in smaller focuser barrels.

The big altitude wheels handle the large heavy optics without issue - and if you decide to use even larger accessories (like a bino-viewer with two eyepieces) then you can move the tube in its tube rings and achieve balance within seconds. If you need to transport or store the telescope, the rocker box disassembles (and re-assembles) very easily.

Title: Celestron NexStar - 6SE
Body (HTML):
Each Celestron Nexstar SE telescope is exceptionally easy to use and offers all the conveniences of a modern, computerized telescope that can automatically locate over 38,000 objects and even suggests which celestial objects are best observed from your location at the moment. They are also suitable for even getting started in astrophotography.

Thanks to the powerful SkyAlign technology, setting up the telescope correctly to find even the most difficult galaxies is no longer a problem. Simply point the telescope at three stars and it will be ready for use in no time. This gives you an exceptionally affordable telescope with a range of features that previous generations of amateur astronomers could only have dreamed of (Note: you only need to see the three "guide stars", you don't need to know them).

You can even remotely control this telescope with your iPhone, iPad or Windows PC via WiFi using the optional SkyQ-Link WiFi adapter and the SkyQ app, which is available separately from the Apple AppStore - simply use the star map on the screen. So if you are looking for a telescope with the most modern control electronics, then choose the Celestron NexStar SE. With the optional StarSense module, the telescope even takes over the initialization in the starry sky itself - all you have to do is set up the telescope, switch it on and wait three minutes.

The NexStar 6SE - the lightweight all-rounder for deep sky and planets:
The NexStar 6SE is the middle of the range Schmidt-Cassegrain in the NexStar SE series with a 6" aperture. It is the ideal compromise between portability and performance - with this aperture, globular clusters are partially resolved, for example, and galaxies and nebulae are easy to see under dark skies. Near cities, nebula filters help to block out the scattered light from cities.

The telescope has the 1.25" focuser connection that is common in astronomy. This means that all common astronomical 1.25" eyepieces (plug size: 31.7mm) can be used which covers all useful magnifications and enables quick switching between different magnifications. Adapters are also available to use 2" eyepieces and accessories.

SLR cameras and numerous other accessories can also be connected using a separately available T-adapter. The T-thread is a standard item that can be used to connect almost any accessory - from SLR cameras to binocular attachments.

The NexStar 6/8SE mount:
The mount of the 6SE and 8SE telescopes are larger and more stable than the mount of the smaller models. This azimuthal single-arm mount is optimized to be ready for use quickly and easy to transport. Unlike the classic parallactic mount, you do not have to spend time aligning the telescope to the north, setting the polar height or taking counterweights with you. The mount is simply set up horizontally and after alignment (in which you simply set any three bright stars), the computer automatically ensures that the telescope moves to the desired objects and keeps them in the eyepiece: the automatic tracking automatically compensates for the rotation of the earth.

This makes the SE telescopes ideal for anyone who wants to observe the starry sky themselves: very portable, quickly ready for use and with all the necessary comfort.

The telescope is attached to the mount with a standard prism rail with quick coupling, so it can be easily removed. The mount can also provide stable support for other telescopes up to approx. 5.5kg. However, this is not necessary for transport: the complete mount including telescope is very handy and fits, for example, in the separately available, padded transport case. It is simply attached to the stable steel tripod with three easy-to-grip screws; a centering pin helps when placing it on the tripod.

The NexStar 6/8SE mount also offers everything you need for photography: lunar photography with an SLR camera or planetary photography with a video camera are also possible without any problems in azimuthal operation with the correct camera adapter. Long exposures are also possible using the optional Heavy Duty Deluxe polar wedge: The mount is aligned parallel to the earth's axis, like a classic parallactic ("astronomical") mount. 

A software installed in the hand controller helps you to easily align the mount with high precision even without a polar finder. This not only prevents the image field from rotating when you photograph for example a lunar eclipse over a long period of time but also allows deep sky imaging. An AUX connection enables the connection of additional accessories - from GPS receivers to StarSense modules.

Comprehensive star catalogs and TOUR function for an overview:
The hand controller contains a database with over 38,000 objects. These include, of course, the planets of the solar system as well as countless galaxies, gas nebulae, star clusters and interesting stars. Are you having trouble choosing? Then use the TOUR mode, which shows you a selection of the most beautiful objects every evening and explains them on the display.

SkyAlign - Setup without knowledge of the sky:
The NexStar SE mount has motors with encoders on both axes and a hand controller with 38,181 objects in the database. To initialize the computer control, all you have to do is enter the time and location (selectable from the database) into the hand controller and move to any three bright celestial objects - it doesn't matter which ones, you don't even have to know them! After this SkyAlign, the mount knows what the sky above it looks like and controls each additional object at the touch of a button.

With the optional Celestron SkySync GPS module, you save yourself the trouble of entering the date, time and observation location, making setup even easier. This data is automatically transferred to the telescope via the GPS satellites.

The SE telescopes are also compatible with the StarSense module. Behind this is a small camera that is mounted on the telescope and uses to orient the telescope fully automatically in the sky - without GPS. With StarSense, all you have to do is set up the telescope, switch it on and wait about three minutes. Since StarSense is compatible with all modern, computer-controlled Celestron telescopes, you can continue to use it even if you ever buy a larger telescope - StarSense also works with observatory-class telescopes.

This means that a NexStar SE telescope can be updated at any time when there are technical innovations - this ensures that your telescope retains its value!

Control via PC and iPhone:
Like all Celestron NexStar telescopes, the NexStar SE can also be controlled via PC. All you need is the optional Celestron RS cable and, if necessary, an adapter from RS232 to USB. You can then control the telescope from a Windows PC using the NexRemote software or the widely used ASCOM interface.

But the SE telescopes also support wireless control! You can control the telescope wirelessly using the optional SkyQ Link WLAN adapter - either via a Windows PC or via iPhone or iPad (with the optional SkyQ planetarium program). This means you don't have to take a laptop with you on your observation nights, an iPhone is enough, and you have a modern graphic telescope control in addition to the hand controller.

Well thought-out mount:
The mount of the Celestron NexStar SE telescopes is a solid azimuthal single-arm mount that can be set up without tools. The large, easy-to-grip screws mean that this can also be done with gloves. The sturdy steel tripod has a shelf for accessories and a holder for the hand control box. The SE mount can carry devices weighing up to approx. 5.5kg, depending on the design. The clamping device on the arm of the mount fits any standardized Vixen (V) dovetail and holds it securely.

The hand controller is neatly integrated into the fork arm and can be removed if necessary. The telescope can also be operated comfortably when it is in the fork arm holder.

Power supply:
The computer control is of course dependent on electricity. The mount offers several options for power supply: Either via eight standard AA batteries if you want to be completely independent, or via an optional connection cable for the cigarette lighter socket of a car or via an optional power supply unit. The battery compartment integrated into the mount avoids cable clutter and enables maximum mobility.

* Important: Avoid electronic damage – remember to use the right power supply!

To ensure the device works properly, please only use high-quality power supplies that meet the specifications for astro-use, i.e. outdoor use – cheap power supplies often only deliver the specified voltage and power at room temperature and can even damage the electronics in the worst case.

Specs:

  • Optical design: Schmidt-Cassegrain
  • Optical coating: Starbright XLT (Fully multi-coated)
  • Resolution (DAWES): 0.77 arcseconds
  • Resolution (RAYLEIGH): 0.93 arcseconds
  • Focal length: 1500mm
  • Secondary mirror obstruction: 5.6cm
  • Secondary mirror obstruction relative to diameter: 37.00%
  • Secondary mirror obstruction relative to surface: 14.00%
  • Visual field: 0.83 °
  • Limit size: 13.4
  • Highest useful magnification: x354
  • Light gathering capacity (compared to the human eye): x459
  • Linear Field of View (@1000 yds): 44 ft (13 m)
  • Lowest useful magnification: x21
  • Telescope aperture: 150mm (5.91")
  • Focuser size (inches): 1.25“
  • Tube length: 41cm
  • Aperture ratio: f/10

Mount Spec:

  • Connections: USB on the hand controller, Aux port
  • Multi-language: Yes
  • GPS: with optional SkySync module
  • Hand controller: NexStar+ hand controller, two-line LCD display with 16 characters, 19 backlit keys, USB 2.0 port for PC connection
  • Power requirements: 8-AA batteries (not included), optional power supply
  • Alignment Methods: SkyAlign, Auto 2-Star Align, 1-Star Align, 2-Star Align, Solar System Align
  • Database: Over 38,000+ properties, 100 custom listings, More information on over 200 properties
  • Mount: Azimuthal mount (motorized)
  • Mount control: Computer controlled (GOTO)
  • Tracking speeds: Sidereal, solar and lunar
  • Tracking modes: Azimuthal, EQ-North, EQ-South
  • Dovetail compatible: EQ Standard (Vixen Style)
  • Panning speed: Nine speeds
  • Mount Type: Alt-Azimuth single-arm mount

Whats included:

  1. Focal length eyepiece: 25mm
  2. Incl. accessories: 6" Schmidt-Cassegrain telescope, pre-assembled steel tripod, accessory tray, computer-controlled Nexstar 6/8SE mount with NexStar hand controller, StarPointer red dot finder, 25mm eyepiece, 1.25" star diagonal prism, cigarette lighter cable
  3. Viewfinder: StarPointer
  4. Zenith prism: 1.25"
  5. Accessory tray: with eyepiece tray

Body (HTML):
The Bresser Messier MC-127 Maksutov-Cassegrain telescope offers high rigidity and tack-sharp optics - Its an ideal telescope for Lunar and Planetary viewing as well as some of the brighter deep space targets.

The high rigidity of the EXOS-2 EQ5 mount allows for more stable and relaxed observations and is an ideal platform for those looking for a more capable mount for visual astronomy. An Star Tracker kit is also available to upgrade the mount to a full GOTO system.

Title: Bresser Messier AR-127L/635 EXOS-2 PMC 8
Body (HTML):
The Bresser Messier AR-127S/635 tube with its compact design offers particularly large and bright fields of view making it ideal for Astrophotography.

The Telescope:

Thanks to the large aperture, the Messier AR-127S/635 can use nebula filters that enhance gas nebulae with remarkable contrast. The special construction consists of a four-lens achromat which achieves minimal color error and better photographic correction than comparable two-lens devices, even with a very fast focal ratio of f/5 for a refractor. 

With the high-quality solar filter, you can safely observe sunspots, eclipses, and planetary transits. (Warning: Never point the telescope at the sun without a solar filter.)

The EXOS-2 PMC-Eight Mount:

The Explore Scientific EXOS-2 PMC-Eight GoTo Mount is equipped with a modern and very precise GoTo control system. It consists of a robust Wi-Fi controller unit that provides all the necessary interfaces. The NEMA-11 stepper motors are directly connected to this unit via cable, and an ST-4 compatible autoguider interface is also available. In addition, the control system supports micro-stepping to ensure precise tracking.

Intuitive operation via app and graphical star chart:
The ExploreStars App, developed specifically for the PMC-Eight system, impresses with a very well-designed, intuitive user interface. The featured 'alignment stars' for initializing the control system, as well as all celestial objects in the database, are displayed as a star chart with additional text information. All these objects can be easily viewed and selected.

Powerful controller unit with Open GoTo for customization:
The heart of the controller unit consists of a completely autonomous 2-channel multi-processor with 8 CPUs and a Wi-Fi Ethernet 10/100 adapter with IP function. This allows remote operation via browser, ASCOM, app, or serial connection. The Open GoTo also allows you to write your own firmware and upload it to the controller unit. This enables custom adjustments to the device’s functions as well as the creation of custom object lists, etc.

Polar finder included:
The included and pre-installed polar finder scope allows for quick and precise polar alignment for longer exposure times without star trails. The integrated LED lighting unit further enhances the comfort of using the polar finder.

Telescope Spec:

  • Type: Refractor telescope
  • Lens diameter: 127mm / Focal length: 635mm / F/5
  • OTA weight (inc. acc): 7.7kg
  • Maximum useful magnification: x254
  • High-quality Bresser refractor optics
  • Four-lens design for enhanced imaging performance
  • Ideal telescope for planets, double stars, planetary nebulae, and deep-sky imaging
  • Very high-quality Hexafoc focuser with a 2.5" internal diameter
  • 6x30 finder with crosshair eyepiece; optimized holder for comfortable viewing
  • 31.7mm (1.25") star diagonal mirror
  • Handle for easy transport with integrated camera holder (photo thread)
  • Smartphone camera adapter for sky navigation included
  • Prism rail with stainless steel clamping surface (44-mm universal dovetail for GP/EQ5/LXD75)
  • 50.8 to 31.7mm adapter with integrated T2 thread (optional T2 ring required)

Mount Spec:

  • Powerful PMC-8 Open GoTo system
  • User-friendly and graphically appealing ExploreStars OpenGoto App
  • Wi-Fi control via a tablet, notebook, or desktop PC with at least 7" display and Wi-Fi function (not included)
  • Compatible operating systems: WIN8.1, WIN10/11, iOS, or Android 4.4 and higher
  • Classic control via directional buttons or joystick for guiding, centering, correcting, and moving with a touchscreen
  • Intuitive 2-star and 3-star alignment for GoTo control initialization
  • Multiprocessor microcontroller with 8 CPUs (processor cores)
  • Micro-stepper motors NEMA-11
  • Highly precise and quiet belt drive
  • ST-4 compatible autoguider interface
  • ASCOM driver available, also supports pulse guiding
  • Possibility to create your own firmware and object lists and load them into the PMC-8
  • GPS compatible / settings depend on the computer or tablet used
  • Power supply via 12V DC, power consumption at full load max. 1.6 amps
  • Max Load: 13kg

Whats included:

  1. 127mm Optical tube with Hexafoc focuser
  2. Solar filter
  3. Eyepieces: 26mm Super Plössl, 31.7mm (1.25")
  4. 2" eyepiece adapter
  5. 8x50 finder scope
  6. Star diagonal mirror
  7. Tube rings with carrying handle and camera holder
  8. Smartphone adapter for navigation
  9. Prism rail with stainless steel clamping surface (44mm universal dovetail for GP/EQ5/LXD75)
  10. Astronomy PC software Stellarium (downloadable)
  11. Rotatable star map
  12. EXOS2-GT mount with Open GoTo PMC-8

  16. 12V / 2A power adapter

Title: Bresser Messier MC-152/1900 EXOS-2 PMC 8
Body (HTML):
The Bresser Messier MC-152 Maksutov-Cassegrain excells at detailed lunar and planetary observations and astrophotography. One of the main advantages of the Maksutov design is its robustness and compact size, making it ideal for trips to dark sky locations.

The Telescope:

The compact optics define the Messier MC-150 and its short physical length make it ideal for mobile use. With the very long 1900mm focal length, you can look forward to exciting planetary observations at high magnifications. The 150mm aperture allows you to observe smaller nebulae in the vastness of space. Find the remnants of a massive star explosion from 1054 in the constellation Taurus, or trace the glowing filaments of the Great Orion Nebula. Spot the famous Whirlpool Galaxy in the constellation Ursa Major, or find the Dumbbell Nebula in the constellation Vulpecula. Additionally, the high-quality objective solar filter enables safe observations of sunspots, eclipses, and planetary transits. (Caution: Never point the telescope at the sun without the solar filter!)

Title: Bresser Messier NT-203/800 EXOS-2 - 8"
Body (HTML):
For many years Bresser Newtonian telescopes have become the standard workhorse for Deep Sky astrophotography, now the second generation of this telescope, the Bresser NT-203s/800 comes with an improved Hexafoc focusser and fast parabolic main mirror.

The Bresser NT-203s/800 f3.9 will deliver you much more detailed images at shorter exposures due to its oversized primary mirror and therefore faster optical system (f3.9, compared to standard f5 telescopes of this size). The large 85 mm secondary mirror also helps reduce vignetting for maximum optimal illumination of the target. The excellent 2,5" Hexafoc focuser also helps reduce vignetting due to its large diameter and makes focussing a joy - the smoothness and shifting-free operation sets a new standard in this price class.

BRESSER EXOS-2 Equatorial Mount:
The Bresser EXOS-2 is a rugged German Equatorial Mount offering high rigidity and precision tracking for visual observation as well as astrophotography. The tripod is extremely sturdy and designed to suppress vibrations very well. As with all the Bressier Messier range, this mount is built to extremely high standards and comes with an illuminated polar finder scope and precise graduated circles for more accuracy and ease of use during polar alignement. - If you wish at a later stage to upgrade the mount to a full computerised GOTO system, a powered two axis GOTO-Kit is available as an optional extra. The EXOS-2 mounts is designed to take a max payload weight up to 13kg allowing you to use refractors of up to 152 mm aperture or mirror telescopes of up to 203 mm aperture.

Title: Bresser Messier 305 Dobsonian Telescope - 12"
Body (HTML):
The Bresser Messier 12" Dobsonian really does take your Astronomy journey to another level. This well loved telescope series even provides good portability due to its lightweight fibreglass telescope tube and optics of this size offer some of the best views you will see of our Solar System and beyond.

Thanks to the powerful telescope aperture of 305mm, you get significantly more light-gathering capacity than with the smaller models and are therefore not limited to observing the moon and the planets of our solar system - you can already look far out into the universe and observe globular clusters, nebulae and galaxies with even greater brightness. Details become visible in most deep-sky objects: globular clusters are clearly resolved into individual stars and gas nebulae, which can only be guessed at with smaller devices, show structure. 

The device is unrivalled in its versatility: The excellent large Hexafoc focuser has an aperture of 65mm - so there is no noticeable obstruction from the focuser tube even with large wide-field eyepieces. 

Thanks to the large altitude wheels, even these heavier eyepieces are held effortlessly. And if a particularly large number of accessories is attached, such as a binocular attachment, then the entire tube can be moved inside the tube clamps - and everything is balanced again in a flash. The unrivalled rigidity of the focuser makes focusing very easy - so photography with this telescope is also possible. 

This is another strength of this universal telescope: if you want to take photos, you can simply unscrew the altitude wheels from the tube and attach it to an equatorial mount using a dovetail bar - so there's nothing standing in the way of astrophotography. An optional 10:1 gear reduction for the focuser is available for the highest demands. Considering that the focuser is the most frequently used part of the telescope, the use of the Hexafoc in this device is a quantum leap for this price range. 

In addition, the new 12" Bresser Messier makes it easy to transport the device as compactly as possible - the rocker box can be dismantled in a few simple steps because the parts are assembled with metal quick-release connectors. This quickly turns a bulky rocker box into a handy flat package of individual parts. This really is a telescope whose versatility, performance and user-friendliness set new standards in this price class. 

The package also includes a high-quality objective solar filter for safe observation of sunspots, eclipses and planetary transits.

Title: Bresser Messier MC-127/1900 EXOS-2 GOTO - 5"
Body (HTML):
The Bresser Messier MC-127 Maksutov-Cassegrain telescope offers high rigidity and tack-sharp optics - Its an ideal telescope for Lunar and Planetary viewing as well as some of the brighter deep space targets.

The high rigidity of the EXOS-2 GoTo mount allows for more stable and relaxed observations and is an ideal platform for those making their first attempts at astrophotography - particularly for planetary work.

BRESSER EXOS-2 GoTo Equatorial Mount:
This German Equatorial Mount has tracking motors in both axes that follow celestial objects very smoothly and precisely. The hand controller with full GOTO abilities works reliably and is very user friendly - See Manual download below. Precision ball bearings in both axes help ensure minimal backlash at all nine possible tracking speeds and the 12V battery pack is conveniently fastened to the tripod shelf and takes eight size D batteries. The mount can also be powered using a mains or car plug adapter (sold seperately)

EXOS-2 GOTO System:
The Startracker GoTo System enables beginners with little experience to start astronomical observations in just a few minutes, and guides you to various objects in the nigt sky that are not visible through the small finder scope. At the push of a button you can locate Planets, Nebulae or Galaxies in minutes. The database on the Startracker system holds thousands of celestial objects to choose from.
The Bresser StarTracker GoTo systems also uses servo motors for both axes and features an ST-4 compatible autoguiding input - essential for long exposure Astrophotography. The menu and navigation of the Startracker hand controller is also multilingual and offers a choice of German, English, French, Spanish and Italian.
