Title: Celestron Origin - Smart Telescope
Body (HTML):
The Celestron Origin Intelligent Home Observatory is at the forefront of a new era in amateur astronomy, combining stargazing and astrophotography into a single, user-friendly experience.

EAA (Electronically Aided/Assisted Astronomy) combines modern camera technology with live observation of the sky. This smart telescope takes care of the complex technicalities of modern telescopes for you, transforming your backyard into a gateway to the cosmos. Equipped with cutting-edge technology and user-friendly operation, Celestron Origin captures the beauty of celestial objects and wirelessly transmits them to your tablet, smartphone, or even a TV screen.

Celestron engineers applied their decades of experience to every technical detail, from the patented optics to an intuitive control app. The result is a revolutionary, ground-up system that builds on Celestron's long-standing heritage and experience, making astronomy more accessible, exciting, and fun than ever before.

RASA optical technology:
At the heart of the Celestron Origin lies the patented Rowe-Ackermann Schmidt Astrograph (RASA ) - a milestone in optics development. The RASA design places the image sensor at the front of the telescope, not the back, resulting in an extremely fast f/2.2 system with an exceptionally wide field of view while enabling sharp images right to the edge. Since its introduction in 2014, RASA technology has become the first choice for space surveillance and satellite tracking. Companies, researchers, and governments rely on RASA telescopes to do things like scan the skies for dangerous, tiny pieces of satellite debris that could destroy our vital communications satellites. For the Origin, Celestron engineers developed a brand-new 6-inch RASA that offers all the capabilities of an observatory-grade instrument in a portable package.

Thanks to RASA optics, the Origin is in a class of its own among smart telescopes, far surpassing other telescope designs. A RASA collects more light in less time than a smaller and slower Newtonian reflector, refractor, or other entry-level telescopes. The unique combination of fast image acquisition, aperture, and therefore detail resolution defines the RASA's performance. In short, it delivers unparalleled detail in photos while maintaining short exposure times.

To fully utilize the RASA optics, Celestron selected the Sony IMX178 color CMOS sensor for image capture. It features STARVIS back-illuminated technology for maximum sensitivity and fast readout with low noise, also contributing to fast image acquisition and high sharpness. This sensitive chip features small 2.4µm pixels for high resolution—perfect for the fast optical design.

Now everyone can become a real astrophotographer:
Celestron Origin, with its built-in AI algorithms, represents a paradigm shift in sophisticated astrophotography. As the telescope acquires data, these intelligent algorithms automatically stack and process each  image in real time. The result is a stunning display of celestial objects, in color and with a wealth of detail only seen in images taken by experienced astrophotographers. For the first time, astrophotography is accessible to enthusiasts of all experience levels, including those who have never used a telescope before.

Using the Celestron Origin Smart Telescope:
A universe in your hands: StarSense technology & the Origin app
Setting up the Celestron Origin is a breeze thanks to the automated initialization process powered by StarSense technology. Place the Origin under a clear night sky, turn it on, and connect it to the app. Then you can decide whether to stay with your telescope or head indoors. In less than two minutes, the Origin focuses itself, scans the night sky, self-orients itself by comparing star patterns with its internal database, and notifies you that it's ready to use.

The Celestron Origin app , developed in collaboration with Simulation Curriculum, the creators of SkySafari™, offers an intuitive planetarium interface that simplifies navigating the night sky. Use the planetarium view, point your device at the sky, and look around in "Compass Mode," then simply tap on any object you want to see (the most beautiful ones are highlighted). Or try the "Tonight's Best" list, where Origin displays all the most impressive galaxies, nebulae, star clusters, and more—based on your exact location and time of observation. Never again will you need to consult a star atlas or plan ahead; Origin is ready to show you the universe, even if clear skies catch you off guard.

Once you select a target, the Origin precisely centers it in the field of view. Switch to the camera view and press "Start Imaging" to begin capturing 10-second exposures. It couldn't be easier! You'll see in real time how the summed photos reveal increasing detail. As the Origin works, it continuously tracks the sky and adjusts its built-in dew protection system and fans to the ambient conditions, ensuring the optics are optimally tempered for razor-sharp images.

A shared cosmic experience:
With Origin, no one has to wait their turn to look through an eyepiece. Whether your friends and family are gathered in the same room or outdoors,  multiple people can connect to Origin and view the live image on their own devices . Origin also lets you stream the live feed to your smart TV or instantly save and share your astrophotography, creating unforgettable moments beyond your viewing spot.

Ready for more? Advanced features:
As your interest in the hobby grows, you'll be able to take advantage of more advanced features and capabilities. For example, Origin has a built-in filter drawer that accepts standard 1.25" and 2" filters. This allows you to optionally install astronomical filters, which are especially useful when photographing nebulae in light-polluted environments, such as typical suburban gardens. For imaging broadband objects such as galaxies and star clusters, or objects under dark skies, remove the filter for more light transmission and brighter images. Experiment with different and interchangeable filters to achieve results you can't achieve with the fixed filters of other systems.

If you'd like to try advanced image processing, that's also possible. Origin saves all your raw images for you. Connect via USB to import them into your favorite image editing software for manual editing and stacking.

And how about letting Origin work for you while you sleep? It's easy with the Scheduled Observations feature. Simply tell the app which objects you want to capture. When you wake up, you'll be greeted by spectacular images.

Take your astrophotography studio anywhere:
Celestron Origin is a portable system that doesn't require external Wi-Fi networks, so you can easily take it with you in any car to distant dark skies. The optical tube, mount, and tripod all assemble and disassemble easily without tools. Each component weighs less than 7 kg.

Your Origin system comes complete with everything you need to get started right away including: 

  • 6-inch RASA optics with integrated camera
  • Origin single-arm fork mount with internal lithium battery
  • Celestron CMOS color camera with Sony IMX178LQJ sensor (back-illuminated / 2.4μm x 2.4μm pixel size)
  • Integrated computer and Wi-Fi 
  • Two built-in fans (one for the optics, one for the computer) prevent heat from accumulating in the electronics or penetrating the optical tube and impairing visibility.
  • Autofocuser
  • Dew protection heater with environmental sensor, heating ring and dew cap
  • Integrated filter drawer
  • Tripod
  • Dust cover
  • 230V charger
  • Future upgrades

When you invest in a Celestron Origin, you can count on Celestron engineers as your long-term partners in astronomy. Celestron teams are constantly working hard to develop further upgrades and improvements for your telescope.

  • Control system electronics: Onboard computer: Raspberry Pi 4 Model B

Title: Explore Scientific 305 Dobsonian Telescope - 12"
Body (HTML):
Explore Scientific Ultra Light Dobson 254mm Telescope - GENERATION II

No type of telescope has changed amateur astronomy as much as the Dobsonian design telescopes. Before John Dobson introduced the Dobson telescope, the vast majority of amateur telescopes consisted of small lens telescopes with primitive mechanics - just enough to barely make out the polar caps of Mars or the rings of Saturn. Larger telescopes, such as Schmidt-Cassegrains, were reserved for a much more expensive and specialised market, however this all changed with the introduction of the Dobsonian Telescope. The Dobsonian design combines simple but effective mechanics with the largest possible aperture, which has given the Dobsonian telescope a unique triumph worldwide. Nowhere else do you get so much light gathering ability for your money as with a good Dobsonian Telescope.

At 305mm (12") Aperture things start to get very serious in terms of what you can see through the eyepiece. The Moon and Planets are simply awe inspiring and even fainter objects like Galaxies and nebula start to show lots of real detail and structure - Particularly if you are viewing from a dark sky location. A telescope with a mirror diameter of 305mm collects more than 1800 times as much light than the naked eye.

The easy disassembly of this telescope allows for problem-free transport, even in relatively small cars - the assembly then is quick and easy without the need for tools. The entire construction has been optimized for maximum stiffness without neglecting weight. The combination of large height wheels with an optimized aluminum sandwich construction enables the finest correction movements at the highest magnifications. The focus position has already been prepared for the use of a coma corrector. 

Transport dimensions for mobile use:

  • Rockerbox: 450mm x 450mm x 320mm

  • Threaded connection focuser: M54 x 0.75 mm

Title: Bresser Messier 203 Dobsonian Telescope - 8"
Body (HTML):
The Bresser Messier 8" Dobsonian offers the performance and qualities rivaling many other more expensive telescopes, infact there are many dedicated Dobsonian telescope users groups, passionate about these designs and given the outstanding performance of these telescopes and their price, its easy to see why.

The optical diameter of 203mm (8") does not limit your observations to solar system objects such as the moon or the planets - These telescope designs allow you to reach much further into deep space and explore globular / open star clusters, nebulae and galaxies.

With a Telescope of this aperture objects are beginning to show some structure: globular clusters are no longer only fuzzy circles, but are resolved into masses of individual stars. Nebulae, that can only be barely detected in smaller scopes, start to reveal structures within. The excellent Hexafoc focuser boosts a large 2.5" diameter so that you don't have vignetting in big widefield eyepieces that can occur in smaller focuser barrels.

The big altitude wheels handle the large heavy optics without issue - and if you decide to use even larger accessories (like a bino-viewer with two eyepieces) then you can move the tube in its tube rings and achieve balance within seconds. If you need to transport or store the telescope, the rocker box disassembles (and re-assembles) very easily.

Title: Celestron AVX - C9.25
Body (HTML):
The AVX-C9.25 combines the quality optics of a Celestron 9.25 Schmidt-Cassegrain telescope with the computer-controlled equatorial Advanced-VX mount, providing an affordable entry into astrophotography.

The 9.25" was specifically designed for observations with 2" eyepieces and has an optimized aperture system to minimize vignetting at the edge of the field of view when photographing. Its primary mirror with a longer focal length and the secondary mirror with a lower magnification enable a flatter image and reduce optical aberrations.

The adjustable counterweight allows you to easily balance the telescope. The optics deliver clear images thanks to the StarBright XLT coating and collect 33% more light than the 8" model. The optimized aperture system increases contrast when observing planets and is an advantage when doing astrophotography. An optional polar finder scope and the software routine of the hand control box make it easier to align to the north.

The Advanced VX is designed as an ideal platform for astrophotography with smaller telescopes. For telescopes up to approx. 13.6kg (depending on the lever), the sophisticated functions of this large parallactic mount is now also available. Thanks to PEC (Periodic Error Correction), the periodic worm error that occurs in all mounts with classic worm gears can be compensated, so that long-exposure shots are easily carried out. You can also track objects far beyond the meridian without having to immediately turn carry out a meridian flip. This means you can observe the most interesting part of the sky without interruption. The Advanced VX also has a much wider base than its predecessor, which further increases stability even with large loads. The improved motors have a higher torque and can better compensate for slight imbalances.

Since spring 2019, it has been delivered with the dual dovetail clamp , so that both telescopes with the small CG5 rail (EQ standard) and the large CGE rail (3" standard) fit on the AVX - without additional adapters! All you have to do is move the clamping screws. Larger telescopes in particular benefit from the wider rail, which offers more stability.

Third-party dovetail plates:
The Advanced VX is still compatible with Vixen format dovetail rails. However, the rail must be at least 100mm long as the clamping points on the new AVX are 90mm apart. If a user wants to use the AVX with a telescope that has a Vixen (or CG-5) dovetail rail that is shorter than 100mm, the rail must be replaced with a longer dovetail rail however suitable rails are available separately.

The new AVX mount is not compatible with Losmandy D format dovetail rails. The CGE and Losmandy D formats are similar but not identical. Losmandy rails are about a millimeter wider, while CGE plates are deeper and have more surface contact with the dovetail clamp. To use an AVX with a telescope with a Losmandy D dovetail rail, the existing rail must also be replaced with a compatible dovetail rail.

State-of-the-art technology for mobile use:
Celestron Advanced VX mounts set a new standard for medium-sized telescopes up to 13.6kg. The mount was developed from scratch, always with astrophotography in mind. It offers many of the features of the large Celestron mounts at a very attractive price.

Solid cast parts and heavy-duty mechanics:
Based on the proven Advanced GT mount, the Advanced VX not only offers large, easy-to-grip adjustment screws and more powerful motors that can cope even better with unevenly distributed loads, but also a wider base for the tripod connection and an improved dual dovetail mount with two clamping screws. No premature tilting! Tracking is possible up to 20° beyond the meridian passage.

State-of-the-art software:
The AVX mount is supplied with the cold-resistant, much more powerful NexStar+ hand controller. This means you have a modern computer control system at your disposal - with over 40,000 objects stored. Thanks to the built-in clock, setup is even faster than before. The software automatically moves to the reference stars, you only have to center them in the eyepiece.

Advanced VX mounts can be controlled via Celestron PWI Telescope Control Software via the PC connection on the hand controller

Orientation made easy:
With the AVX, you no longer have to laboriously adjust the North Star using the polar finder scope: Align the mount roughly to the north, perform a 2-star alignment - and then call up the All-Star Polar Alignment. The software now helps you to align the mount precisely to the north, even if you cannot see the North Star. You can look comfortably through the telescope and do not have to kneel under the polar finder scope (which is still available as an option).

Versatile & Future proof:
In addition to an RS232 port, the AVX also has an autoguider input and two AUX ports. Here you can connect additional, separately available expansion modules - for example the SkyPortal WiFi module for control via WLAN with iPhone/iPad/Windows PC or the StarSense module, with which the mount automatically moves to its reference stars and centers them perfectly.

Experienced photographers will appreciate how easily this mount can be transported to a dark observing site. If you are new to astronomy or astrophotography, the Advanced VX will make it easy to get started and will serve you well for many years to come.

Avoid electronic damage – remember to use the right power supply!
To ensure the device works properly, please only use high-quality power supplies that meet the specifications for astro-use, i.e. outdoor use – cheap power supplies often only deliver the specified voltage and power at room temperature and can even damage the electronics in the worst case. We also have a range of power supply adapters available for these mounts and many others, just contact us.

Title: Celestron StarSense Explorer - 8" Dobsonian
Body (HTML):
Celestron has reinvented the manual telescope with the StarSense Explorer - the first telescope that uses your smartphone to analyze the night sky and calculate its position in real time. The StarSense Explorer is ideal for beginners thanks to its user-friendly interface and detailed tutorials. It's like having your own personal guide to the night sky.

High quality azimuthal mount:
The Rockerbox, developed by Celestron, is an ultra-stable, aesthetically pleasing mount with Teflon azimuth bearings. Large 15cm diameter altitude bearings ensure smooth up and down movement. The altitude bearings have a "braking system" that allows the resistance to be adjusted to allow smooth movement even with slight imbalances. Bracing for the side panels provides additional stability and rigidity - a feature normally only seen on larger Dobsonians.

With the handle at the front of the tube you can move the telescope easily and sensitively.

High-quality optics for the perfect view into space:
With the large 8" primary mirror, this Dobson has enough light gathering power to see impressive details in celestial objects. The highly reflective coating on both the primary and secondary mirrors provides sharp, bright images.

The primary and secondary mirrors are coated with StarBright XLT coating to increase contrast and light transmission. StarBright XLT reveals subtle details whether you are looking at the moon and planets or faint galaxies and nebulae. For more information on the patented StarBright XLT coatings, click  here .

This telescope is also equipped with a high-quality 2" Crayford focuser . The Crayford system enables precise and smooth focusing without focus drift. The scope of delivery also includes a 2" to 1.25" reducer and a 2" extension sleeve, so you can use virtually any 1.25" or 2" eyepiece on your StarSense Explorer Dobson. The focuser also has a locking screw that allows you to lock it in the sharpest position.

Ideal for every location:
Even if you live in a location with slightly bright skies and moderate light pollution, StarSense Explorer can locate Jupiter, Saturn, Venus, the Orion Nebula, binary stars, and many more of the most famous celestial objects.

From a darker location, you can see these objects better, and observe many other targets. From an aperture of 8" deep sky observation is really fun, as many globular clusters can be clearly resolved into individual stars, and the first galaxies show details such as spiral arms. At the observation location, all you have to do is put the telescope in the mount, insert the eyepiece and smartphone, and start the app, and you can start observing! The eyepiece holder ensures that you always have all eyepieces within reach when observing.

The entire telescope weighs only 19.6kg, making it perfectly portable and easy to take with you on your next camping trip or to a remote observing site.

Title: Bresser Messier NT-203/800 EXOS-2 GOTO - 8"
Body (HTML):
For many years Bresser Newtonian telescopes have become the standard workhorse for Deep Sky astrophotography, now the second generation of this telescope, the Bresser NT-203s/800 comes with an improved Hexafoc focusser and fast parabolic main mirror.

The Bresser NT-203s/800 f3.9 will deliver you much more detailed images at shorter exposures due to its oversized primary mirror and therefore faster optical system (f3.9, compared to standard f5 telescopes of this size). The large 85 mm secondary mirror also helps reduce vignetting for maximum optimal illumination of the target. The excellent 2,5" Hexafoc focuser also helps reduce vignetting due to its large diameter and makes focussing a joy - the smoothness and shifting-free operation sets a new standard in this price class.

BRESSER EXOS-2 GoTo Equatorial Mount:
This German Equatorial Mount has tracking motors in both axes that follow celestial objects very smoothly and precisely. The hand controller with full GOTO abilities works reliably and is very user friendly - See Manual download below. Precision ball bearings in both axes help ensure minimal backlash at all nine possible tracking speeds and the 12V battery pack is conveniently fastened to the tripod shelf and takes eight size D batteries. The mount can also be powered using a mains or car plug adapter (sold seperately)

EXOS-2 GOTO System:
The Startracker GoTo System enables beginners with little experience to start astronomical observations in just a few minutes, and guides you to various objects in the nigt sky that are not visible through the small finder scope. At the push of a button you can locate Planets, Nebulae or Galaxies in minutes. The database on the Startracker system holds thousands of celestial objects to choose from.
The Bresser StarTracker GoTo systems also uses servo motors for both axes and features an ST-4 compatible autoguiding input - essential for long exposure Astrophotography. The menu and navigation of the Startracker hand controller is also multilingual and offers a choice of German, English, French, Spanish and Italian.

Title: Explore Scientific 406 Dobsonian Telescope - 16"
Body (HTML):
Explore Scientific Ultra Light Dobson 406mm Telescope - GENERATION II

No type of telescope has changed amateur astronomy as much as the Dobsonian design telescopes. Before John Dobson introduced the Dobson telescope, the vast majority of amateur telescopes consisted of small lens telescopes with primitive mechanics - just enough to barely make out the polar caps of Mars or the rings of Saturn. Larger telescopes, such as Schmidt-Cassegrains, were reserved for a much more expensive and specialised market, however this all changed with the introduction of the Dobsonian Telescope. The Dobsonian design combines simple but effective mechanics with the largest possible aperture, which has given the Dobsonian telescope a unique triumph worldwide. Nowhere else do you get so much light gathering ability for your money as with a good Dobsonian Telescope.

At 406mm (16") Aperture things start to get very serious in terms of what you can see through the eyepiece. The Moon and Planets are simply incredible and even fainter objects like Galaxies and nebula start to show lots of real detail and structure as well as hints of colour - Particularly if you are viewing from a dark sky location. A telescope with a mirror diameter of 406mm collects more than 3300 times as much light than the naked eye.

The easy disassembly of this telescope allows for problem-free transport, even in relatively small cars - the assembly then is quick and easy without the need for tools. The entire construction has been optimized for maximum stiffness without neglecting weight. The combination of large height wheels with an optimized aluminum sandwich construction enables the finest correction movements at the highest magnifications. The focus position has already been prepared for the use of a coma corrector.

Title: Celestron CGEM II - 800
Body (HTML):
The CGEM II 800 Schmidt-Cassegrain Telescope features Celestron’s premium StarBright XLT coated optics and the newly redesigned CGEM II computerized equatorial mount. It is the most lightweight and portable of the three size models.

This telescope is especially at home as a solid platform for long exposure photography with optional CCD cameras or photographic equipment. At 8 inches of aperture with the premium StarBright XLT coatings, the CGEM II 800 gives you over 800 times the light gathering power than the unaided eye.

A fresh update to the venerable CGEM mount, the CGEM II has a fresh, attractive, bold appearance and is capable of carrying Celestron’s higher-end SCT optical tubes (up to 11") securely and vibration free, which is ideal for both imaging and visual observing. Capable of holding 40 lbs. of payload and slewing at 5° per second, you will be able to instantly point to any of the celestial objects in the database.

Ergonomic Design:
CGEM II was designed to be ergonomically friendly with large Altitude and Azimuth adjustment knobs for quick and easy polar alignment adjustment. The internal RA and DEC motor wiring provides a clean look and an easy and trouble free set up.

Innovation:
The CGEM II series features Celestron’s innovative Polar alignment procedure called All-Star™. All-Star allows users to choose any bright star, while the software calculates and assists with polar alignment. Another great feature of the CGEM II sure to please astroimagers, is the Permanent Periodic Error Correction (PEC) which will allow users to train out the worm gears periodic errors, while the mount retains the PEC recordings.

Performance:
For objects near the Meridian (imaginary line passing from North to South), the CGEM II will track well past the Meridian for uninterrupted imaging through the most ideal part of the sky. The CGEM II mount has a robust database with over 40,000 objects, 100 user defined programmable objects and enhanced information on over 200 objects. Celestron's CGEM II mount is the perfect fit between the Advanced Series and CGE Series. Offering the portability of the Advanced Series and the precision of the CGE.

Title: Celestron CPC 800 - GPS
Body (HTML):
The CPC 800 GPS XLT is the portable fork-mounted top-class telescope from Celestron and features the StarBright XLT coating. The telescope is perfect for visual observations and, with an optional polar wedge and an astro camera, also enables professional astrophotography.

If you point the telescope at the planets, you'll see fascinating details on the surface of Jupiter, the Cassini division of Saturn's rings, and surface details on Mars. Even Uranus, Neptune, and Pluto are within your reach.

Despite the large aperture, the telescope is so portable thanks to the practical carrying handle and a weight of around 19kg so that you can set it up easily in your garden as well as in your favorite spot under a dark sky.

Professional XLT computer telescopes:
With the CPC series, Celestron is introducing the most stable fork mount that has ever been available in the 40 years of production of Celestron Schmidt-Cassegrain telescopes. The completely newly designed tripod and a huge 280mm ball bearing in the fork base enable vibration-free observation even at the highest magnifications.

The azimuthal fork mount is not as variable as the German mount, as it is tailored to the tube diameter. This disadvantage is compensated for by the compact design, low weight, good portability and, most importantly, incredibly quick setup. You are ready to observe in just a few minutes. Simply set up the tripod, level it with the built-in bubble level, put on the fork mount - and switch it on.

Built-in GPS:
The 16-channel GPS receiver transmits the time, date and location coordinates to the electronics. This means you no longer have to enter the time and location yourself - the telescope automatically has the exact data.

Sky Align:
This is the name of the brand new alignment process from Celestron for perfect GoTo positioning. The telescope no longer needs a defined base position: you place three bright stars (planets and the moon are also possible) in the field of view of the telescope one after the other and voilá, your CPC telescope is ready for automatic GoTo positioning on any object from the hand control database.

SkyAlign calculates the setup of your telescope from the travel distances of the three stars and the corresponding angles. SkyAlign also gets the other data required (date, time, and location coordinates) via the integrated 16-channel GPS receiver.

"SkyAlign" only works when the telescope is in azimuthal operation, i.e. when the telescope is operated directly on the tripod without a polar wedge. But Celestron also has some new and simplified alignment methods for parallactic operation in the CPC series.

Extensive database:
The CPC telescope database contains over 40,000 celestial objects, including the Messier and Caldwell catalogs, as well as galaxies and nebulae from the NGC catalog and the planets. You can narrow down your selection to make searching this comprehensive database easier and to hide objects that are currently below the horizon.

The "Identify" function tells you what you are currently seeing in the telescope and also allows you to easily explore the sky. Simply point the telescope at any area of ​​the sky and have it show you, for example, the nearest Messier objects - the telescope will navigate to them for you. You can do this in different areas of the sky and with different objects!

The CPC telescopes also score points with the following details:
The azimuthal fork mount has been completely redesigned. It is less susceptible to vibrations and the drive motors and gears run "whisper quiet" in GoTo mode. The tripod that supports the mount and telescope has also become more stable.
The completely newly designed tripod (landing pad) has a self-centering mounting device - no searching in the dark for the right attachment point for the mounting foot on the tripod. By rotating the mount on the tripod, the screw holes lock into the right position. Three spring-supported screws, which are anchored in the tripod, enable quick and, above all, effortless assembly in a matter of seconds. The built-in bubble level makes leveling easier. The large tripod triangle also serves as a storage area for several eyepieces.

Other features include:

  • Illuminated on/off switch on the top of the housing - so no more searching in the dark,
  • Large, easy-to-grip clamping wheels (suitable for gloves) in both axles instead of fiddly small clamping levers,
  • The "Permanent PEC" function stores the periodic errors of the screw to improve the tracking accuracy,
  • The electronics work with all autoguiders and planetarium programs available on the market,
  • The "Alignment Sync" function allows you to improve positioning accuracy during operation by confirming a new alignment object,
  • The "Precise Goto" function allows very faint objects to be brought extremely precisely into the center of the field of view or a CCD chip. First, a bright star close to the object being searched for is selected by the electronics and moved to it. The observer must then move it precisely to the center of the field of view using the arrow keys on the hand controller. The computer then calculates the distance from this star to the object being searched for and moves to it with high precision.
  • Finally, another new "feature" of the hand controls of version 4.0 of the CPC series: thanks to a flash EPROM, the control and motor software can be upgraded via the Internet.

Avoid electronic damage – remember to use the right power supply!
To ensure the device works properly, please only use high-quality power supplies that meet the specifications for astro-use, i.e. outdoor use – cheap power supplies often only deliver the specified voltage and power at room temperature and can even damage the electronics in the worst case. Suitable high-quality power supplies can be found on the left under Optional Accessories.

Title: Celestron CGEM II - 1100
Body (HTML):
The CGEM II 1100 Schmidt-Cassegrain Telescope features Celestron’s premium StarBright XLT coated optics and the newly redesigned CGEM II computerized equatorial mount. With the optical tube assembly of the CGEM II 1100 weighing only 12.5kg, this telescope is still portable enough to be taken to dark skies, and it has 89% more light gathering power than an 8" telescope and more than 40% more than the 9.25".

This telescope is especially at home as a solid platform for long exposure photography with optional CCD cameras or photographic equipment; it is a serious scientific research tool that comes with Celestron's premium StarBright XLT coatings.

A fresh update to the venerable CGEM mount, the CGEM II has a fresh, attractive, bold appearance and is capable of carrying Celestron’s higher-end SCT optical tubes (up to 11") securely and vibration free, which is ideal for both imaging and visual observing. Capable of holding 40 lbs. of payload and slewing at 5° per second, you will be able to instantly point to any of the celestial objects in the database.

Ergonomic Design:
CGEM II was designed to be ergonomically friendly with large Altitude and Azimuth adjustment knobs for quick and easy polar alignment adjustment. The internal RA and DEC motor wiring provides a clean look and an easy and trouble free set up.

Innovation:
The CGEM II series features Celestron’s innovative Polar alignment procedure called All-Star™. All-Star allows users to choose any bright star, while the software calculates and assists with polar alignment. Another great feature of the CGEM II sure to please astroimagers, is the Permanent Periodic Error Correction (PEC) which will allow users to train out the worm gears periodic errors, while the mount retains the PEC recordings.

Performance:
For objects near the Meridian (imaginary line passing from North to South), the CGEM II will track well past the Meridian for uninterrupted imaging through the most ideal part of the sky. The CGEM II mount has a robust database with over 40,000 objects, 100 user defined programmable objects and enhanced information on over 200 objects. Celestron's CGEM II mount is the perfect fit between the Advanced Series and CGE Series. Offering the portability of the Advanced Series and the precision of the CGE.

Title: Celestron AVX - C8
Body (HTML):
Celestron's C8 Schmidt-Cassegrain telescopes have been impressive for decades and owe their good reputation to the combination of excellent optics with a compact, lightweight design. The AVX-C8 is the perfect choice if you want to get started "properly" right away or want to afford a larger optic.

The adjustable counterweight allows you to easily balance the telescope at any time. Thanks to the StarBright XLT coating, the optics deliver clear images and collect 843 times more light than the naked eye. An optional polar finder scope and the software routine of the hand control box make it easier to align the telescope north.

The Advanced VX is designed as an ideal platform for astrophotography with smaller telescopes. For telescopes up to approx. 13.6kg (depending on the lever), the sophisticated functions of this large parallactic mount is now also available. Thanks to PEC (Periodic Error Correction), the periodic worm error that occurs in all mounts with classic worm gears can be compensated, so that long-exposure shots are easily carried out. You can also track objects far beyond the meridian without having to immediately turn carry out a meridian flip. This means you can observe the most interesting part of the sky without interruption. The Advanced VX also has a much wider base than its predecessor, which further increases stability even with large loads. The improved motors have a higher torque and can better compensate for slight imbalances.

Since spring 2019, it has been delivered with the dual dovetail clamp , so that both telescopes with the small CG5 rail (EQ standard) and the large CGE rail (3" standard) fit on the AVX - without additional adapters! All you have to do is move the clamping screws. Larger telescopes in particular benefit from the wider rail, which offers more stability.

Third-party dovetail plates:
The Advanced VX is still compatible with Vixen format dovetail rails. However, the rail must be at least 100mm long as the clamping points on the new AVX are 90mm apart. If a user wants to use the AVX with a telescope that has a Vixen (or CG-5) dovetail rail that is shorter than 100mm, the rail must be replaced with a longer dovetail rail however suitable rails are available separately.

The new AVX mount is not compatible with Losmandy D format dovetail rails. The CGE and Losmandy D formats are similar but not identical. Losmandy rails are about a millimeter wider, while CGE plates are deeper and have more surface contact with the dovetail clamp. To use an AVX with a telescope with a Losmandy D dovetail rail, the existing rail must also be replaced with a compatible dovetail rail.

State-of-the-art technology for mobile use:
Celestron Advanced VX mounts set a new standard for medium-sized telescopes up to 13.6kg. The mount was developed from scratch, always with astrophotography in mind. It offers many of the features of the large Celestron mounts at a very attractive price.

Solid cast parts and heavy-duty mechanics:
Based on the proven Advanced GT mount, the Advanced VX not only offers large, easy-to-grip adjustment screws and more powerful motors that can cope even better with unevenly distributed loads, but also a wider base for the tripod connection and an improved dual dovetail mount with two clamping screws. No premature tilting! Tracking is possible up to 20° beyond the meridian passage.

State-of-the-art software:
The AVX mount is supplied with the cold-resistant, much more powerful NexStar+ hand controller. This means you have a modern computer control system at your disposal - with over 40,000 objects stored. Thanks to the built-in clock, setup is even faster than before. The software automatically moves to the reference stars, you only have to center them in the eyepiece.

Advanced VX mounts can be controlled via Celestron PWI Telescope Control Software via the PC connection on the hand controller

Orientation made easy:
With the AVX, you no longer have to laboriously adjust the North Star using the polar finder scope: Align the mount roughly to the north, perform a 2-star alignment - and then call up the All-Star Polar Alignment. The software now helps you to align the mount precisely to the north, even if you cannot see the North Star. You can look comfortably through the telescope and do not have to kneel under the polar finder scope (which is still available as an option).

Versatile & Future proof:
In addition to an RS232 port, the AVX also has an autoguider input and two AUX ports. Here you can connect additional, separately available expansion modules - for example the SkyPortal WiFi module for control via WLAN with iPhone/iPad/Windows PC or the StarSense module, with which the mount automatically moves to its reference stars and centers them perfectly.

Experienced photographers will appreciate how easily this mount can be transported to a dark observing site. If you are new to astronomy or astrophotography, the Advanced VX will make it easy to get started and will serve you well for many years to come.

Avoid electronic damage – remember to use the right power supply!
To ensure the device works properly, please only use high-quality power supplies that meet the specifications for astro-use, i.e. outdoor use – cheap power supplies often only deliver the specified voltage and power at room temperature and can even damage the electronics in the worst case. We also have a range of power supply adapters available for these mounts and many others, just contact us.

Title: TS-Optics UNC f/6 Newtonian - 8"
Body (HTML):
The TS Optics UNC Newtonian series offers an alternative to Newtonians made in the far east. With these telescopes you do not have to settle for any compromises. UNC stands for Universal Newtonian telescope with Carbon tube. Each UNC Newtonian is individually manufactured for you in Germany.

The 8" f/6 UNC Newtonian is a specialist for moon and planets but also good for deep-sky observing. For the moon and planets only the atmosphere limits the resolution of the telescope, as the regular small secondary mirror provides a high contrast due to the low obstruction of only 25%.

Deep sky images with high detail resolution and high contrast, typically common with high quality APO Refractors, are also within your reach as the secondary mirror offers 100% illumination at 19mm. With flats, sensors up to APS-C format can be used.

The advantages of the TS UNC Newtonian telescopes:

  • High-quality, German-made high quality carbon tube.
  • Easy collimation of primary and secondary mirror - by hand, without tools.
  • The edge of the secondary mirror is blackened.
  • TS UNCN2-G2 2" rack and pinion focuser with M54x0.75 intermediate thread.
  • The secondary is Pre-attached to the secondary mount with the correct offset.
  • 94% reflectivity on primary mirror and secondary mirror for a brighter image
  • Diffraction limited primary mirror - each telescope is tested on an optical bench before shipment

The carbon tube - finest precision work:
The carbon tube is extra solid and completely reinforced, not only around the focuser. This makes the tubes much stiffer and the adjustment stability is high. The openings for the secondary are precisely fitted with turned mating parts, ensuring that the secondary spider vanes are correct and the telescope produces perfect spikes right from the start.

Focus position optimized for astrophotography:
The focus point is 135mm above the tube. This allows you to use different focusers and still have a comfortable working distance. With the standard focuser UNCN2-G2 you even get 80mm working distance, this even allows the use of focal reducers or a binoviewer with moderate glass path compensation. For standard correctors we recommend a 20mm spacer, which sits between the focuser. This gives you 60mm backfocus.

Note: For visual observation you need a 2" extension tube - Click here.

The 2" TS UNCN2-G2 RAP focuser:

  • A core component of the TS UNC-Newtons is the modern TS UNCN2-G2 focuser. The focuser builds up only 58mm from the tube edge and still carries heavy cameras and accessories without tilting. The focuser is superior to conventional Crayford focusers.
  • High stiffness with extremely short length
  • Exact 1:10 dual-speed gear - for perfectly focused astrophotographs
    Adjustment is decoupled from the ball bearing - a clear advantage over Crayford focusers
  • Threaded connection of accessories is possible - the 2" receptacle can be unscrewed, then an M54x0.75 female thread is available.

Parabolic primary mirror:
Newtonian primary mirrors made of fused silica are free of strain and provide an image that is usually much better than diffraction limited types. The surface is coated with an enhanced 94% reflection layer and a protective quartz layer. The primary mirror has a central marking as an adjustment aid.

Primary mirror fan for faster cool-down time:
A cooling fan to accelerate cool-down time to ambient temperature. Until a mirror is properly cooled down, it will create currents of warm air that will deteriorate the image - no matter which mirror substrate is used. Only after the mirror has cooled down does this effect stop.

Every TS Carbon Newtonian is tested on our optical bench before shipping:
These are a solid telescope for life. After assembly, Each UNC Newtonian is subjected to an optical test at the workshop before shipping. This ensures that the telescope will fit your accessories perfectly and will deliver the optical performance promised.

Before shipping, the primary mirror with the cell is removed from the tube and packed separately. This is to guarantee a safe shipment and avoid unnecessary transport damages.

Choose your focus positions and change of secondary mirror diameter:

  1. Focus position No.1 - with 60mm above the 2" receptacle has proven to be very versatile. Nevertheless, we can also offer you individual focus positions and other secondary mirror sizes - Just contact us prior to purchase.
  2. Focus position No.2 - 30mm above the 2" connection - optimal for visual observation. The secondary mirror can be slightly smaller, we recommend a secondary mirror with 63mm (minor axis) which is sufficient even for 2" eyepieces.
  3. Focus position No.3 - 90mm above the 2" connection - this allows you to use a 0.73x reducer/corrector and change the focal ratio from f/6 to f/4.4 (@876mm). The combination is then designed for cameras up to APS-C format. We recommend the secondary mirror with 70mm (minor axis).

Assembly and collimation instructions:
The telescope is delivered disassembled into several units for safety. The assembly and adjustment are not complicated, you can download the instructions in advance. To see what's involved the PDF can be found here.

Specs:

  • Telescope type: Newtonian telescope
  • Diameter primary mirror: 200 mm - 8"
  • Focal length: 1200mm
  • Focal ratio: f/6
  • Primary mirror: Parabolic primary mirror - mirror substrate quartz glass
  • Optical quality: Significantly better than diffraction limited
  • Reflectivity of primary mirror and secondary mirror: 94 %, enhanced
  • Diameter secondary mirror: 50mm minor axis - other secondary mirror sizes on request
  • Tube: Carbon tube - solid material with reinforcing aluminum ring - wall thickness 2.5 mm
  • Tube inner diameter: 230 mm
  • Support surface on the bottom of the tube rings: Flat support surface with an M6 thread
  • Support surface on the top of the tube rings: Flat support surface with a 1/4” internal thread (tripod socket)
  • Focuser: 2" UNCN2-G2 rack and pinion focuser with M54x0.75 adapter thread for screw adaptions
  • Weight: approx. 8 kg with tube rings
  • Length: approx. 1200mm (depending on focus position). Dimensions: The specified dimensions and weights are to be regarded as approximate values, they may vary depending on individualization.

Whats included:

  1. TS UNC Carbon Newtonian telescope with 2" UNCN2-G2 focuser.
  2. Aluminum tube rings with two flat bearing surfaces per ring.
  3. Dust caps for the telescope opening and the focuser.
  4. Vixen style finder shoe.
  5. 8x50 finder with finder bracket.
  6. Reduction from 2" to 1.25"
  7. Fan for cooling down the primary mirror.
  8. Instructions for assembling and collimating the telescope.

FREQUENTLY BOUGHT WITH THIS ITEM

  • 0.73x Reducer & Corrector - Click here >

  3. Focus position No.3 - 90mm above the 2" connection - this allows you to use a 0.73x reducer/corrector and change the focal ratio from f/5 to f/3.6 (@730mm). The combination is then designed for cameras up to APS-C format. We recommend the secondary mirror with 70mm (minor axis).

Title: TS-Optics UNC f/6 Newtonian - 6"
Body (HTML):
The TS Optics UNC Newtonian series offers an alternative to Newtonians made in the far east. With these telescopes you do not have to settle for any compromises. UNC stands for Universal Newtonian telescope with Carbon tube. Each UNC Newtonian is individually manufactured for you in Germany.

These Telescopes are specially made to order.

The 6" f/6 UNC Newtonian is a compact and transportable all-round telescope. It is ideally suitable for visual observation and astrophotography. Astrophotographers will appreciate fine stars because of the small secondary mirror and in combination with suitable coma-correctors, deep-sky photography are possible in a relatively short time.

The advantages of the TS UNC Newtonian telescopes:

  • High-quality, German-made high quality carbon tube.
  • Easy collimation of primary and secondary mirror - by hand, without tools.
  • The edge of the secondary mirror is blackened.
  • TS UNCN2-G2 2" rack and pinion focuser with M54x0.75 intermediate thread.
  • The secondary is Pre-attached to the secondary mount with the correct offset.
  • 94% reflectivity on primary mirror and secondary mirror for a brighter image
  • Diffraction limited primary mirror - each telescope is tested on an optical bench before shipment

The carbon tube - finest precision work:
The carbon tube is extra solid and completely reinforced, not only around the focuser. This makes the tubes much stiffer and the adjustment stability is high. The openings for the secondary are precisely fitted with turned mating parts, ensuring that the secondary spider vanes are correct and the telescope produces perfect spikes right from the start.

Focus position optimized for astrophotography:
The focus point is 135mm above the tube. This allows you to use different focusers and still have a comfortable working distance. With the standard focuser UNCN2-G2 you even get 80mm working distance, this even allows the use of focal reducers or a binoviewer with moderate glass path compensation. For standard correctors we recommend a 20mm spacer, which sits between the focuser. This gives you 60mm backfocus.

Note: For visual observation you need a 2" extension tube - Click here.

  • The 2" TS UNCN2-G2 RAP focuser:
    A core component of the TS UNC-Newtons is the modern TS UNCN2-G2 focuser. The focuser builds up only 58mm from the tube edge and still carries heavy cameras and accessories without tilting. The focuser is superior to conventional Crayford focusers.
  • High stiffness with extremely short length.
  • Exact 1:10 dual-speed gear - for perfectly focused astrophotographs.
    Adjustment is decoupled from the ball bearing - a clear advantage over Crayford focusers
  • Threaded connection of accessories is possible - the 2" receptacle can be unscrewed, then an M54x0.75 female thread is available.

Parabolic primary mirror:
Newtonian primary mirrors made of fused silica are free of strain and provide an image that is usually much better than diffraction limited types. The surface is coated with an enhanced 94% reflection layer and a protective quartz layer. The primary mirror has a central marking as an adjustment aid.

Every TS Carbon Newtonian is tested on our optical bench before shipping:
These are a solid telescope for life. After assembly, Each UNC Newtonian is subjected to an optical test at the workshop before shipping. This ensures that the telescope will fit your accessories perfectly and will deliver the optical performance promised.

Before shipping, the primary mirror with the cell is removed from the tube and packed separately. This is to guarantee a safe shipment and avoid unnecessary transport damages.

Choose your focus positions and change of secondary mirror diameter:

  1. Focus position No.1 - with 60mm above the 2" receptacle has proven to be very versatile. Nevertheless, we can also offer you individual focus positions and other secondary mirror sizes - Just contact us prior to purchase.
  2. Focus position No.2 - 30mm above the 2" connection - optimal for visual observation. The secondary mirror can be slightly smaller, we recommend a secondary mirror with 63mm (minor axis) which is sufficient even for 2" eyepieces.
  3. Focus position No.3 - 90mm above the 2" connection - this allows you to use a 0.73x reducer/corrector and change the focal ratio from f/6 to f/4.4 (@657mm). The combination is then designed for cameras up to APS-C format. We recommend the secondary mirror with 70mm (minor axis).

Assembly and collimation instructions:
The telescope is delivered disassembled into several units for safety. The assembly and adjustment are not complicated, you can download the instructions in advance. To see what's involved the PDF can be found here.

  • Primary mirror: Parabolic primary mirror - mirror substrate quartz glass
  • Optical quality: Significantly better than diffraction limited
  • Reflectivity of primary mirror and secondary mirror: 94 %, enhanced
  • Diameter secondary mirror: 45mm minor axis - other secondary mirror sizes on request
  • Tube: Carbon tube - solid material with reinforcing aluminum ring - wall thickness 2.5 mm
  • Tube inner diameter: 175 mm
  • Support surface on the bottom of the tube rings: Flat support surface with an M6 thread
  • Support surface on the top of the tube rings: Flat support surface with a 1/4” internal thread (tripod socket)

Title: TS-Optics APO Refractor - ED 94 (Triplet)
Body (HTML):
TS94 f/5.5 Triplet APO:
This 94 mm APO has a fast aperture ratio of f/5.5 and is aimed at all amateur astronomers looking for a premium compact, color-pure and bright APO. The triplet lens design includes two special ED elements which provides an image that is free of color errors even at higher magnifications. The optical performance of this newly developed lens is equivalent to that of an FPL53 triplet. This lens is mounted inside in a CNC-machined socket, which is of course adjustable.

Mounting the TS94 APO:
The CNC clamp has a GP and EQ5 level dovetail rail at the base so you can attach the telescope to the corresponding quick couplings of a variety of mounts.

The handle not only facilitates mounting on the photo tripod, but it is also the basis for further adaptations, for example, you can attach a ball head to it and mount a second camera. Next to the carrying handle is a viewfinder shoe for finderscopes or guidescopes.

Observations with the TS 94-mm-f/5.5-APO:
Of course, being a color-pure triplet lens means excellent and clear visual observations too. The high-contrast and 94mm aperture is perfect for viewing the crater landscape on the moon or some of the fascinating details on the planets of the solar system. Many thousands of deep sky objects are also within reach of these APO's.

Title: Askar FRA400 - 72 APO (Quintuplet)
Body (HTML):
Askar is the new line of specialised telescopes for astrophotography with particular emphasis on optical and also mechanical quality.

The Anotation 'FRA' represents refractor telescopes with an integrated corrector element for a flat and corrected field of view. The FRA series is mainly used for astrophotography.
The ASKAR FRA400 is a Petzval 5-element Apochromat with 400mm focal length, f/5.6 focal ratio and 72mm aperture. 2 ED glasses are installed in the front lens for improved colour correction. This APO is also suitable for cameras up to full frame sized sensors.

The dew cap also provides good protection against stray light and is retractable. The large focuser also holds heavy cameras and allows for precise focusing thanks to the microfocus adjustment wheel. A 2", 1.25" and an M68x1 thread are available for additional connections. Also included with this telescope is an adapter up to M48 x 0.75, which is ideal for all cameras with a standard 55mm working distance.

Title: Vixen SD115S Super ED Refractor
Body (HTML):
This Super ED (SD) Apochromatic Refractor is made using FPL53 glass which produces an extremely clear and sharp image which is extremely well color corrected. Its large 115mm aperture and 890mm focal length make it an extremely capable optical system for lunar and planetary viewing.

With its respectable f/7.7 its also an excellent choice for astrophotography, especially some of the smaller deep space targets. The SD series has also been optimized for the use of full-frame cameras by replacing new inner panels and the large focuser allows the attachment of heavy cameras without tilting.

The advantage of these SD refractors lies in their short overall length and low weight. The SD glass is designed to bring together all the rays of violet, red, blue, yellow and green very precisely to the same point, offering an almost perfect colour corrected image. In combination with the new optional SD Reducer or SD Flattener, these Refractors enable illumination with a 44mm image circle for full-frame SLR cameras.

The included diagonal mirror also allows for more comfortable observation of objects near the zenith. I also has a T2 thread for connecting a DSLR camera.

Title: Explore Scientific APO FCD-100 ALU - ED 102 (Triplet)
Body (HTML):
This highly corrected 102mm triplet Apochromat (three-lens refractor) with a light weight outer tube and 2.5" HEXAFOC precision focuser offers tack sharp stars, contrast and detail and a substantial 714mm focal length.

With the new Explore Scientific FCD-100 ALU Hex, the color and clarity of this telescope sets new standards for refractors in this class. The optical design achieves a polystrehl of 0.97 - (a value that represents the highest correction) making this small excellent Apochromat a very versatile device. The fast aperture ratio of f/7 allows for shorter exposure times in astrophotography, resulting in high image sharpness and excellent contrast making observations of targets such as the North American Nebula or the Andromeda Galaxy just as clean and sharp as planetary observations. Refractors at this focal length (particularly Triplets), many smaller deep sky objects frame up extremely well allowing even more detail to be seen on targets such as M51, M57 and many more. This scope is also extremely light and compact - as the dew protection cap can be inserted to save space.

The state-of-the-art glass optics and meticulous production techniques have meant that these telescopes offer observation quality at the highest level. The high-quality 2.5" HEXAFOC focuser with 1:10 reduction completes the setup of this all round device - and due to the large diameter of the focuser (65mm), no vignetting occurs even in astrophotography using larger sensors.

  • Focus position: 150mm from plug-in connection
  • Three-lens apochromat with two air gaps and central FCD-100 element

Title: Explore Scientific APO FCD-100 ALU - ED 127 (Triplet)
Body (HTML):
This highly corrected 127mm triplet Apochromat (three-lens refractor) with a light weight carbon fiber outer tube and 2.5" HEXAFOC precision focuser offers tack sharp stars, contrast and detail and a substantial 952mm focal length.

With the new Explore Scientific FCD-100 Alu Hex, the color and clarity of this telescope sets new standards for refractors in this class. The optical design achieves a polystrehl of 0.97 - (a value that represents the highest correction) making this small excellent Apochromat a very versatile device. The fast aperture ratio of f/6 allows for shorter exposure times in astrophotography, resulting in high image sharpness and excellent contrast making observations of targets such as the North American Nebula or the Andromeda Galaxy just as clean and sharp as planetary observations. Refractors at this focal length (particularly Triplets), many smaller deep sky objects frame up extremely well allowing even more detail to be seen on targets such as M51, M57 and many more. This scope is also light and compact - as the dew protection cap can be inserted to save space. 

The state-of-the-art glass optics and meticulous production techniques have meant that these telescopes offer observation quality at the highest level. The high-quality 2.5" HEXAFOC focuser with 1:10 reduction completes the setup of this all round device - and due to the large diameter of the focuser (65mm), no vignetting occurs even in astrophotography using larger sensors.

Telescope Spec:

  • Aperture: 127mm
  • Focal length: 952mm
  • Aperture ratio: f/7.5
  • Tube weight: 7.7 kg
  • Focus position: 150mm from plug-in connection
  • Three-lens apochromat with two air gaps and central FCD-100 element

Weight & Dimensions:
  • Net weight of optical tube (incl. accessories): 7.7 kg
  • Total length: 80 cm
  • Total width: 18 cm
  • Total height:18 cm
Whats included:
  1. OTA
  2. 2" 99% zenith mirror
  3. Two extension sleeves for focuser
  4. Tube clamps with dovetail rail and carrying handle
  5. Dust caps for lens & focuser
  6. universal viewfinder shoe

Title: Celestron CPC 800 HD - Deluxe
Body (HTML):
The CPC 800 HD Deluxe is the portable fork-mounted top-class telescope from Celestron and features the StarBright XLT coating. The telescope is perfect for visual observations and, with an optional polar wedge and an astro camera, also enables professional astrophotography.

New Optical Design:
EdgeHD (Edge High Definition) optics combine the compact design of a Schmidt-Cassegrain with significantly improved image quality at the edge of the image. This optical system not only offers astrograph characteristics, but also produces completely undistorted, sharp images right up to the edge of the large visual and photographic field of view. This not only corrects off-axis coma—as with other so-called "coma-free" optical designs available on the market—but also field curvature! All EdgeHD telescopes deliver a large, flat field of view, enabling sharp star images even at the edge of large CCD sensors.

Built-in GPS:
The CPC Deluxe HD telescopes feature a built-in GPS sensor that automatically receives the date, time, and your exact location from the GPS satellites. This eliminates the need to manually enter this data.

SkyAlign:
This is Celestron's incredibly easy alignment process for perfect GoTo positioning. The telescope no longer requires a defined home position: Simply align three bright stars (planets and the moon are also possible) one after the other in the telescope's field of view, and voilà! Your CPC telescope is ready for automatic GoTo positioning to any object from the hand control's database.

SkyAlign calculates your telescope's alignment based on the trajectories of the three stars and the corresponding angles. SkyAlign retrieves the other required data (date, time, and location coordinates) via the integrated 16-channel GPS receiver.

" SkyAlign " only works in azimuthal mode, i.e., when the telescope is operated directly on the tripod without a polar wedge. Celestron also offers several new and simplified alignment methods for equatorial operation in the CPC series.

Comprehensive Database:
The CPC telescope database contains over 40,000 celestial objects, including the Messier and Caldwell catalogs, as well as galaxies and nebulae from the NGC catalog and planets. You can narrow down your search to simplify your search in this comprehensive database and hide objects that are currently below the horizon.

The "Identify" function tells you what you're currently seeing in the telescope, and it also lets you easily explore the sky. Simply point the telescope at any area of the sky and, for example, display the nearest Messier objects—the telescope will move to them for you. You can do this in different areas of the sky and with different objects!

With "Solar Sys Align" you can align the telescope using the sun or moon even during the day to observe the planets or the brightest stars in the daytime sky.

Hyperstar Compatible: All EdgeHD tubes allow you to remove and replace the secondary mirror. The result: With the optional HyperStar optics, your standard Celestron EdgeHD telescope becomes a digital Schmidt Design for your CCD or DSLR camera for primary focus photography.

Innovative features of the Mount:

Design - For the CPC Deluxe HD telescopes, Celestron has redesigned the drive mechanism. It features a 15 cm (6 inch) brass gear with 180 teeth and a stainless steel worm gear, as well as a unique steel and nylon ball bearing design for even smoother tracking for long-exposure deep-sky imaging.

Innovation - The CPC Deluxe HD telescopes feature the innovative All-Star™ Polar Alignment . When used with the optional polar wedge, you can align the telescope to any bright star in equatorial mode—no need to look at Polaris! Astrophotographers will also appreciate the Permanent Periodic Error Correction (PEC) feature. You can record the helical error so it's automatically corrected in the future.

Power Management - The redesigned electronics supply the motors with constantly regulated voltage, allowing them to move the telescope even when it's not fully balanced. This maintains smooth operation and high GoTo accuracy.

Performance - You can track objects far beyond the meridian, allowing you to observe the most interesting part of the sky without interruption.
Avoid electronic damage – remember to use the right power supply!

Mount Spec:

  • Alignment methods: SkyAlign, Auto Two-Star Alignment, Two-star Align,
  • SolarSystem Align, EQ North, EQ South, One-Star Align
  • Database: Over 40,000+ objects, 100 custom objects
  • Mount control: Computer-controlled (GOTO)
  • Tracking speeds: Sidereal, solar and lunar
  • Tracking modes: Azimuthal, EQ-North, EQ-South
  • Screw defect control (PPEC): PEC, permanently programmable
  • Panning speed: Nine speeds, maximum 3°/second
  • Type: Azimuthal double fork
  • GPS: Built in - 16 channels
  • Hand Control Box - Yes
  • Power Consumption: 12V DC, 2.5A

Telescope Spec:

  • Resolution (DAWES): 0.57 arcseconds
  • Resolution (RAYLEIGH): 0.69 arcseconds
  • Focal length: 2032mm (93 in)
  • F/Ratio: f/10
  • Telescopic Aperture: 203.2mm (8")
  • secondary mirror obstruction: 6.9cm
  • Secondary mirror obstruction relative to diameter: 33.80%
  • Secondary mirror obstruction relative to the surface: 11.4%
  • field of vision: 0.8°
  • Highest useful magnification: 480x
  • Light gathering capacity (to the human eye): 843x naked eye
  • Lowest useful magnification: 29x
  • Optical design: EdgeHD
  • Optical coating: Starbright XLT (Fully multi-coated)
  • Telescope series: CPC Deluxe HD
  • Tube weight: 19.5 kg (telescope and mount, without tripod)

Whats included:

  1. Focal length eyepiece: 40mm
  2. Incl. accessories: 8" Schmidt-Cassegrain in computer-controlled CPC double fork mount, height-adjustable tripod, storage plate, 8x50 finder.
  3. Viewfinder: 8x50 finder with quick coupling.
  4. Zenith prism: 1.25".
  5. Accessory tray: Tripod spreader/eyepiece holder.

Title: Vixen R130F OTA - 5"
Body (HTML):
This lightweight 5" Newtonian is the ideal entry-level telescope for demanding newcomers to astronomy looking for a very capable telescope suitable for both visual Astronomy and entry into Astrophotography.

Thanks to the high light intensity, it delivers both bright and sharp images making it a great all-rounder. The R130SF is not only ideal for viewing and photographing the moon and planets, but you can also use it to observe other deep space objects such as star clusters, nebulae and galaxies.

You will be amazed when you look at the lunar surface with incredible clarity and sharpness at its many craters and geographical features. Saturn's rings through this high-quality Newtonian is also a sight you will never forget. Even from darker skies the views of the Orion Nebula or the Andromeda galaxy becomes also a remarkable experience.

For astrophotography, the T2 connector on the focuser allows you to connect a DSLR camera with an optional T2 ring so you won't need a separate camera adapter.
You can also use the Vixen dovetail slide rail to attach the telescope to many other Alt AZ / Equatorial mounts.

The focuser is designed for a 31.7mm plug-in eyepiece, so that you can choose from a wide range of accessories to expand the telescopes range and options.

  • Aperture: 130mm (5")
  • Focal Length: 650mm

Title: TS-Optics FPL53 APO Refractor - 80 (Triplet)
Body (HTML):
TSQ-80APO 80/544mm FPL53 Flatfield APO Refractor.
This flatfield Apochromat provides a color-pure and well-corrected image on the axis as well as in the field and thanks to the 2-element corrector in the OTA, it has a well-corrected image circle of 45 mm in diameter. This means you can also use cameras with full-frame sensors giving you a nice wider field of view of the target you are imaging.

Adaptation of Cameras:
The generous working distance is between 65mm and 155mm from the M68 thread and to connect a DSLR or an Astrocamera via the M48 thread, you will need the M68A-M48A-30 adapter. Cameras with a T2 (M42x0.75) connection will require a TSM48i-T2A reduction adapter. The adapter itself is only 6mm thick, so you still have enough space for a DSLR camera with T2 adapter or an Astrocamera.

Features and benefits of the TSQ-80APO:
  • Modern 80 mm f/6 FPL53 triplet lens
  • Integrated 2-element field corrector with optimized distance to the lens
  • 2.5" CNC gear focuser (Rack & Pinion) with ball bearing and 1:10 micro reduction
  • Each Quadruplet Apo is checked by Teleskop-Service before shipping.
  • The moderate aperture ratio of f/6.8 is well suited for DSLR cameras and Astrocameras.

Title: Celestron NexStar Evolution - 8" EdgeHD (With StarSense)
Body (HTML):
The innovative NexStar Evolution is a compact, portable and mechanically solid telescope. This set adds the StarSense AutoAlign module to the Evo mount, taking the alignment process off your hands: the built-in camera orients itself to the sky and initiates the telescope for computer control and automatic tracking. The 8" EdgeHD tube delivers a flat, bright image of the sky.

You don't have to do anything during setup, the telescope automatically orients itself with the sky within a few minutes! With the additional options, the NexStar Evolution 8" HD set is an extremely powerful, user-friendly and quick-to-use combination.

  • Differences between the EdgeHD tube instead of the standard Schmidt-Cassegrain : 
    The EdgeHD telescopes not only offer photographers the advantage of a flattened field of view, but also have an improved focusing mechanism, ventilation openings with fine dust sieves for faster temperature equalization.
  • StarSense module – The telescope automatically orients itself to the starry sky, all you have to do is set it up and switch it on.
  • StarPointer Pro instead of StarPointer – With aiming circles and brighter, dimmable LED is also suitable for daytime observations.
  • Perfect WiFi control via tablet or smartphone.
  • The planetarium program on your smartphone shows you the current sky view or a list of observation targets for your location. The SkyPortal app for iOS and Android also supports automatic initialization of the computer control ("alignment") via the StarSense module.

Simple and convenient operation:
The NexStar Evolution telescopes have been developed based on customer feedback from the past few years. They offer many well thought-out details so that you can enjoy the most beautiful night possible under the starry sky. 

No more worrying about batteries or an external power supply. The NexStar Evolution is the first amateur telescope to have a built-in lithium iron phosphate battery. One charge lasts up to ten hours. You can even use the Evolution's USB port to power other devices you want to use at night.

The NexStar Evolution is easy to set up thanks to the large, ergonomic handles. The steel tripod has markings so you can easily extend all legs to the same length. The azimuth and elevation clamps allow you to point the telescope at a target even without power. Up to seven eyepieces can be stored in two storage compartments - one even has a dimmable red LED light.

More power and safety thanks to lithium iron phosphate battery:
Instead of a typical lithium polymer battery, a lithium iron phosphate battery is used in the Evolution telescopes. These LiFePO 4 batteries have several advantages over simple LiPo batteries:

High safety & Reliability:

  • Unlike LiPo batteries, LiFePO 4 batteries cannot explode or ignite, but are considered intrinsically safe. The improved power density ensures a high load capacity even with continuous current consumption.
  • Long service life and cycle stability.
  • Wide temperature range for storage and operation
  • Low self-discharge
  • Excellent tracking accuracy, suitable for astrophotography

If you're interested in astrophotography, a NexStar Evolution is an excellent and affordable way to get started. It's the only fork-mounted telescope series in this price range with worm gears, along with improved motors. Planetary photography with a DSLR or a planetary camera is also no problem at all, and with a polar wedge you can also set it up equatorially to take long exposure deep sky images, be it with a DSLR or an Astro Camera.

The Schmidt-Cassegrain telescopes with the StarBright XLT coating deliver bright, sharp images and are just as interesting for visual observers as they are for astrophotographers.

Specs:

  • Optical design: Edge HD
  • Resolution (DAWES): 0.57 arcseconds
  • Resolution (RAYLEIGH): 0.68 arcseconds
  • Focal length: 2032mm
  • Secondary mirror obstruction: 6.9cm
  • Secondary mirror obstruction relative to diameter: 33.80%
  • Secondary mirror obstruction relative to surface: 11.40%
  • Highest useful magnification: x480
  • Light gathering capacity (compared to the human eye): x843
  • Lowest useful magnification: x29
  • Optical coating: Starbright XLT (Fully multi-coated)
  • Telescope aperture: 203.2mm (8")
  • Aperture ratio: f/10
  • Focuser size (inches): 2" SC thread, 1.25"
  • Tube length: 41cm
  • Tube Weight: 5.67kg
  • Fastar/Hyperstar compatible: With f/2, exposure times that are sufficiently short for deep-sky photography.

Mount Specs:

  • Alignment Methods: SkyAlign, 3-Star Align, Solar System Align
  • Database: Hand controller with over 120,000+ objects, 220 user-defined entries, additional information on over 200 objects; SkyPortal app with over 120,000 entries
  • Mount: Azimuthal mount (motorized)

Title: TS-Optics Imaging Star APO Refractor - 100 (Triplet)
Body (HTML):
TSQ-100ED Quadruplet APO comes with a permanently built-in field corrector.
The 100 mm f/5.8 quadruplet from the TS Imaging Star line is highly respected by professional astrophotographers around the world.

The telescope is an interesting alternative to the Takahashi FSQ-106ED and due to the air-spaced FPL53 objective, the image is free from chromatic aberration and provides outstanding image contrast. Through the integrated corrector the field is also perfectly flattened and you will get perfect stars in the field right to the edge.

Although this APO is optimized for Astrophotography, it also offers very good performance visually. The stars are pinpoint and are visible without any chromatic correction. The image stays sharp with exceptional contrast right up to 300x magnification.

The photographic 4" Rack & Pinion focuser:
The CNC focuser is optimized for astrophotography and can handle a payload of up to 6kg and the travel of the focuser tube is carried out via rack and pinion. The construction of the drawer is similar to the Starlight Feather Touch and the mechanical stability comes very close to that of the Starlight Feather Touch as well. In addition to 2" and 1.25" receptacles, an M78x1 thread is also available for screw adaptations.

Features and advantages:

  • Excellent FPL53 triplet objective (glass from Ohara, Japan)
  • Integrated flattener with factory-set optimized distance to the objective for optimal sharpness in the field
  • 4" CNC rack and pinion focuser with male M82x1 Connection thread - payload up to 6kg
  • The system is free from annoying reflections
  • Objective and corrector are adjustable - but are already delivered optimally factory adjusted
  • Each quadruplet APO is also checked by engineers before shipping and the optical system is also tested
Before you receive your TS Imaging Star 100 APO:
Every single TS Imaging Star 100 APO is checked in the TS Optics technical department before its put into storage, in order to guarantee a consistently high product quality.
  1. The mechanics are tested, the focuser is optimally adjusted.
  2. The objective is cosmetically checked and cleaned. In addition, it is checked to make sure all counter screws are correctly tightened. Often these become loose during transport.
  3. The optics are collimated and the results are verified on the optical bench.
  4. Only then are the telescopes transferred to the warehouse and prepared for shipment.
Technical Details:
  • Design: APO Triplet Refractor
  • Aperture: 100 mm
  • Focal length: 580 mm
  • Focal ratio: f/5.8
  • Objective: Air-spaced triplet objective
  • Field corrector: Single lens field corrector system
  • Corrected and fully illuminated field: 49 mm
  • Back Focus from 2" connection: 98.5 mm - inner draw tube position
  • Drawtube travel: 40 mm
  • Clear aperture: 90 mm with anti-reflex thread
  • Connections on the eyepiece site: M82x1 female (draw tube) / male (gender changed by rotator) and 2" connection
  • Connections on tilter: M82x1 female at telescope side, M82x1 male at eyepiece side
  • Fine focusing: 1/10 micro transmission
  • Maximum photographic load: 6 kg
  • Tube: Painted ultra black inside - length 490 mm (19.25") with retracted dew shield
  • Dew shield diameter: 140 mm
  • Weight: only 5.3 kg (10.8 pounds)
  • Weight of the case: 3.5 kg (7.7 pounds)
  • Size of the case: 615 mm x 260 mm x 220 mm

  2. 4" rack-and-pinion focuser with finder shoe
  3. CNC rings
  4. Transport case

Title: Lunt LS40THa/B500 H-Alpha Solar Telescope
Body (HTML):
Solar observation in H-alpha is the most spectacular way to see the suns constantly changing features, including Sunspots, Solar Flares and other features on its surface. This H-Alpha solar telescope has a 40mm aperture with a half-width of < 0.7 Angtröm - B500 blocking filter and Helical focuser.

The LS40THa/B500 is a complete telescope for observing the Sun in H-alpha light, with 40mm free aperture (no central obstruction) and 400mm focal length.

The Etalon filter with mechanical tilt tuning achieves a half-value width of <0.7 Angström and focusing is done using a 1.25" helical focuser. The zenith mirror contains the blocking filter is internally and is equipped with a holder for 1.25 inch eyepieces. This telescope's ease of use and simple setup makes it ideal for getting started with H-Alpha solar observation.

Note: Lunt Solar telescopes come with B500, B600 & B1200 filters with the larger ones providing a wider field of view and less shading on the edges. These telescopes are ideal of visual observation of the Sun however as they have a very small back focus, only cameras with a very sort distance to the sensor can be used for photography.

Features:

  • Aperture: 40mm (2-lens lens)
  • Focal length: 400mm
  • Half-value width: < 0.7 Angström
  • Tuning: Mechanical tilt tuning
  • Blocking Filter: B500 with 1.25 inch connector
  • Focuser: Helical focuser
  • Dovetail : Standard GP Vixen
  • 1/4-20 thread (standard thread for photo tripods)
  • Sun viewfinder included
  • Weight: 1.2kg
  • Length: 41cm
Whats included:
  1. LS40THa Solar Telescope
  2. B500 Blocking Filter in Zenith Mirror
  3. 1.25 inch Helical focuser
  4. GP Vixen rail
  5. Sun Viewfinder
  6. Operating instructions

Note: Lunt Solar telescopes come with B500, B600 & B1200 filters with the larger ones providing a wider field of view and less shading on the edges. These telescopes are ideal of visual observation of the Sun however as they have a very small back focus, only cameras with a very sort distance to the sensor can be used for photography.
