Title: Lunt LS50THa/B600 H-Alpha Solar Telescope
Body (HTML):
Solar observation in H-alpha is the most spectacular way to see the suns constantly changing features, including Sunspots, Solar Flares and other features on its surface. 

The LS50THa solar telescope is a 50mm Aperture, 350mm Focal Length solar telescope which provides a bandwidth of <0.75 Angstrom. The telescope is fitted as standard with an air-pressure tuning system "Pressure-Tuner" and the Etalon is safely installed inside the telescope. Prominences and surface detail can quickly be viewed spontaneously over a bigger area than the smaller 40mm telescopes.

A B600 blocking filter is installed inside the star diagonal and this filter is good for visual solar observations - Telescope focusing is achieved by a non rotational Helical focuser.

Note: Lunt 50mm Solar telescopes come with B400 & B600 filters with the larger ones providing a wider field of view and less shading on the edges. These telescopes are ideal of visual observation of the Sun however as they have a very small back focus, only cameras with a very sort distance to the sensor can be used for photography.

Double-stacking with a bandwidth of only <0.5 Angstrom is also possible by using an additional LS50C filter. This filter threads directly onto the LS50THa telescope and will provide even more contrast and details on the sun's surface.

Features:

  • Aperture: 50mm
  • Focal Length: 350mm
  • Bandwidth: <0.75 Angstrom
  • Tuning: Air-pressure tuning system "Pressure-Tuner"
  • Blocking Filter: B600
  • Non-rotating Helical focuser
  • Tube-ring with 1/4-20 tapped base (standard thread for photo-tripods)
  • Length: 37cm
  • Weight: 2.1kg

Whats included:

  1. LS50THa H-alpha Solar Telescope
  2. B600 Blocking Filter installed in the star-diagonal
  3. Pressure-Tuner
  4. Tube ring with 1/4-20 connection for mounting on photo-tripods
  5. Non-rotating Helical focuser
  6. Instruction manual

Title: Celestron CGEM II - 925
Body (HTML):
CGEM II 925 HD combines Celestron's newly redesigned CGEM II computerized equatorial mount with its acclaimed EdgeHD optical system. With over 9 inches of aperture and our premium StarBright XLT coatings, the CGEM II 925 HD gives you over 1000 times the light gathering power than the unaided eye.

Designed to give diffraction limited performance and offer more resolution than the 800 with less weight than the 1100, the CGEM II 925 HD is a premier astroimaging telescope.

Optical Tube Info:

See the Universe in HD:
EdgeHD is an aplanatic, flat field Schmidt-Cassegrain telescope that produces aberration-free images across a wide visual and photographic field of view. The optical system was designed to reduce more than just off-axis star coma; it also provides an astrograph-quality flat focal plane all the way to the edge of the field of view.

True Astrograph Quality:
Many optical designs that advertise themselves as "astrographs" actually only produce pinpoint stars across a curved focal plane. While this may be acceptable for some visual observing, stars will appear out of focus at the edge when used with the flat chip sensor of a digital camera. EdgeHD optics produce a focal plane more than three-times flatter than a standard Schmidt-Cassegrain telescope and dramatically flatter than competing coma-free designs. This guarantees you visibly sharp stars across some of the largest CCD chips available today. Learn more about EdgeHD technology.

Improved Performance:
Superior edge performance not only creates rounder, more pleasing stars, but actually improves the resolution and limiting magnitude when compared to telescopes of equal aperture. With Celestron’s StarBright XLT optical coatings on every surface, EdgeHD optics gives you maximum light throughput across the widest visual and photographic spectrum.

Mechanical Features:
In addition to EdgeHD’s optimized optical design, the telescope tube has been redesigned to make sure you get the most from your optics each and every night.

Mirror clutches - Flexible tension clutches hold the mirror in place and reduce image shift when taking long exposure astro-images. Once focused, the flexible rods allow the mirror to be held in place without putting any force or pressure on the mirror assembly, keeping the image centered in the eyepiece (or on the sensor).
Tube vents - Cooling vents located on the rear cell allow hot air to be released from behind the primary mirror. Each vent has an integrated 50-mesh filter guaranteed to let warm air out without letting dust in.
Fastar versatility - EdgeHD is the most versatile imaging telescope available today. At its native f/10, you can achieve the image scale necessary to capture the smallest of deep sky objects. A Barlow gives you added power for high-resolution planetary, lunar and solar imaging. All EdgeHD optical tubes are Fastar-compatible, allowing the secondary mirror to be removed and replaced with a third party lens accessory for ultra-fast f/2 wide field imaging.
Individually Tested
Every EdgeHD that ships has been tested not only for the surface quality of each optical component, but also with a camera and artificial star to ensure the imaging system meets our rigid quality assurance. This “final acceptance test” confirms the EdgeHD will perform in the field and deliver high-quality astroimages.

  • Optical coating: Starbright XLT (Fully multi-coated)
  • Telescope aperture: 234.95mm (9.25")
  • Focuser size (inches): 2" SC thread, 1.25"
  • Tube (material): Aluminum
  • Tube weight: 9.53kg
  • Tube length: 22in (559 mm)
  • Aperture ratio: f/10
  • Resolution (DAWES): 0.49 arcseconds
  • Resolution (RAYLEIGH): 0.59 arcseconds
  • Focal length: 2350mm (93 in)
  • Secondary mirror obstruction: 8.5cm
  • Secondary mirror obstruction relative to diameter: 36.20%
  • Secondary mirror obstruction relative to surface: 13.00%
  • Visual field: 0.55°
  • Limit size: 14.4
  • Highest useful magnification: x555
  • Light gathering capacity (compared to the human eye): x1127

  • Alignment Methods: AutoAlign, 2-Star Align, Quick Align, 1-Star Align, Last
  • Alignment, Solar System Align
  • Database: Over 40,000+ properties, 100 custom listings, More information on over 200 properties
  • Counterweights: 1 x 7.7kg
  • Mount: Equatorial mount (motorized)

  • Mount control: Computer controlled (GOTO)
  • Tracking speeds: Sidereal, solar and lunar
  • Tracking modes: EQ North and EQ South
  • Pole height adjustment: 15º – 70º
  • Dovetail compatible: 3" CGE rail
  • Panning speed: 9 speeds, maximum 5°/sConnections: 1x hand controller, 1x AUX, 1x autoguider port, 1 USB 2.0 (on the hand controller)

  • Power requirements: 12VDC, 3.2A

  2. Incl. accessories: 9.25" EdgeHD telescope with 3" rail (Losmandy style) 9x50 finder, 2" star diagonal, 1.25" adapter, 23mm Luminos wide angle eyepiece, CGEM-II mount, 2 counterweights, tripod, NexStar hand controller
  3. Viewfinder: 9x50

Title: Celestron CGX - 9.25 EdgeHD
Body (HTML):
The CGX mount only looks similar to the cheaper CGEM-II at first glance, but it has been completely redesigned and offers many more features.

The 20kg mount has a real photographic payload of 25kg, so you can really work with 25kg payload and don't have to plan for generous reserves for photography, as is often the case. Thanks to the large carrying handles, it is even easier to transport than a comparable, slightly lighter classic parallactic mount! With the dual dovetail clamp for CG-5 (Vixen, Celestron) or CGE (3-inch), you can easily switch between small solar telescopes and large Schmidt-Cassegrains, for example.

The mount has been given more powerful, faster-reacting motors that are connected to the axes via a sturdy toothed belt. This means the mount responds almost immediately to control commands, even from an autoguider. There is no play in the gears, and since the worm gears are also spring-loaded, the play is largely eliminated - you don't have to readjust even when there are large temperature differences, as the worms and gears have optimal contact.

The new, large screws are easy to grip, so you can loosen or tighten them easily even when wearing gloves - the polar height adjustment has also been revised so that you can easily adjust the mount even when it is fully loaded. A polar finder will be available as an option, but is generally unnecessary: ​​With the All-Star Polaralign you can align the mount to any brighter star through the telescope, and for perfection, the polar finder has always been superior to the polar finder. As a special feature, you can move the mount on the base plate of the extra-wide tripod head - this allows you to position the center of gravity perfectly over the tripod, for the entire usable latitude range from 3 to 65° north or south latitude. The flat base can also be easily adapted to your own columns. Celestron provides a flange drawing ( PDF ) for fixed installation.

As a photo mount, it is just as suitable for mobile use as it is for remote operation. Internal sensors (“switches”) automatically bring the mount into the home position and prevent it from moving too far and hitting something when panning. The internal cabling also serves to ensure safety: all connections (power, hand controller, AUX and autoguider) are in the base of the mount and do not move with it.

The hand controller can be controlled in the traditional way via ASCOM and the hand controller (new: with USB connection) via PC, or you can use the control software included in the delivery, which was developed together with Planewave Instruments. Multipoint GoTo modeling, plate solving and control of the focuser are just a few functions that you normally have to add for remote operation - with the CGX this software is included in the delivery. Here you do not need the hand controller, but can use the USB connection on the mount directly.

The Telescope Optics:
The EdgeHD optics (Edge High Definition) combine the compact design of a Schmidt-Cassegrain with significantly improved imaging at the edge of the image. This optical system not only offers the properties of astrographs, but also produces completely undistorted, sharp images right up to the edge of the large visual and photographic field of view. Not only is the coma outside the optical axis corrected - as with other so-called "coma-free" optical designs available on the market (see also our test image) - but also the field curvature!

Many optical systems are promoted as "astrographs"; however, they produce the coveted "pinpoint" star image along a curved image plane. On images taken with modern CCD cameras, the result is a noticeable field curvature that increases towards the edge of the image field and becomes stronger the larger the chip is; i.e. the stars remain round, but are blown up into small rings ("donuts") towards the edge.

With the Celestron Edge HD telescopes, this field curvature is corrected right up to the edge in addition to the coma, so that even images taken with large CCD chips are completely sharp, with a uniformly large star image across the entire chip - right into the corners of the image field.

This also significantly improves the resolution and limiting magnitude compared to competing optical systems with a similar aperture. The Celestron XLT multi-coating also helps the Edge HD optics to achieve a significant increase in performance compared to similar systems on the market.

In addition to the new optics, the mechanics and tube have also been completely redesigned. The new features include:

  • Mirror locks hold the main mirror in any focus position without exerting pressure on the optical elements. The image always remains stable on the chip, even with long exposure times.
  • Ventilation openings behind the main mirror ensure rapid air exchange, so that the optics cool down at an unrivalled speed. Thanks to an air filter system, no dust gets into the tube.
  • HyperStar Compatible – All EdgeHD tubes allow you to remove the secondary mirror and replace it with the optional HyperStar optics. The result: your standard Celestron EdgeHD telescope becomes a digital Schmidt Design for your CCD or DSLR camera for primary focus photography at f/2 (C8, C11) and f/1.9 (C14).
    To learn more about this system, visit the dedicated EdgeHD website .
  • Adapted telecompressors (f/7.5) and Barlow lenses (f/20) are under development.
  • Axiom eyepieces - The Edge HD 9.25 comes with an Axiom eyepiece from Celestron. With a 23mm focal length and 82° field of view, you get an impressive combination of magnification and field of view.

Title: Vixen SXD2 Mount & SD115S Refractor Telescope
Body (HTML):
SXD2 German Equatorial Mount with SD115S Refractor. Vixens unrivalled Japanese build quality and tack sharp optics have been a baseline for professional Astronomers around the world for years. This SD 115S uses Super ED Glass (SD) which provides even better colour correction and contrast.

Coupled with its generous 115mm aperture, 890mm focal length and f/7.7 focal ratio, this telescope is ideally placed for photographing those smaller deep space galaxies and nebula.

The SD115S Features:

  • A new Apochromatic refractor with high-performance Super ED glass (SD).
  • The FPL53 glass reproduces an extremely clear and sharp image through extraordinarily high elimination of residual color errors.
  • The advantage of these SD refractors lies in their short overall length and low weight.
  • The SD glass is designed to bring together all the rays of violet, red, blue, yellow and green very precisely to the same point.
  • The special lens material, reduces chromatic aberration across all colors.
  • In combination with the new optional SD Reducer HD Kit or SD Flattener HD, these refractors enable a 44mm image circle for full-frame SLR cameras.
  • The large focuser allows the attachment of heavy cameras without tilting
  • The included diagonal mirror allows comfortable observation, even close to the Zenith also has a T2 thread for connecting a DSLR camera.

SXD2 German Equatorial Mount

The SXD2 mount comes with the new Starbook Ten controller and the PFL-II polar finder, which allows the mount to be aligned quickly and easily via reference stars. With a combination of the best features of the Sphinx series and the new Starbook Ten controller, Vixen has developed a new generation of SX mounts for demanding observers and astrophotographers alike.

The SXD2 is quieter in its tracking than the previous SX mounts and the increased precision of the motors allows for improved performance during long exposures in astrophotography. Precision stepper motors and the micro-step motion control system are at the heart of the SXD2, which offer even better performance and response times than other mount models.

The bearings of the R.A. and DEC axes and the worm shafts have been significantly improved to reduce the load on the motors. This makes the movement of the mount extremely quiet and more robust R.A. and DEC shafts increase the performance and overall robustness of the SXD2 mount.

The STARBOOK TEN controller features:

Large LCD color monitor:
The LCD monitior of the STAR BOOK TEN has a 5 inch TFT Color Liquid crystal display with high WVGA (800×480 pixels, 65,535 colors) resolution.

Functional Moon Map:
The latest version of the STAR BOOK TEN firmware includes a "Moon Map" function. This allows the user to view a map of the visible part of the moon on the screen. All major landmarks on the surface of the moon are highlighted and can be selected for the GoTo feature.

Night mode in red:
During astronomical observations at night, the eyes of the observer adapt to the darkness. The observer sees less of the night sky because bright white light reduces this dark adaptation of the eyes. For this reason, the display of the Starbook Ten can be switched to red backlight. The red light does not affect this dark adaptation as much as white light.

Illuminated buttons:
All command and direction buttons can be illuminated in red so that you can keep track even in the dark. The illuminated buttons can be switched on or off.

Fast CPU:
Starbook Ten has a CPU with 324 MHz clock frequency, which is about 5 times as fast as the CPU of the old STAR BOOK. This will make the star map load faster and make the screen more vivid.

Simple menu:
With the STAR BOOK TEN you can call up your celestial bodies in both scope and chart mode. In addition, you can select your objects by scrolling the star map in chart mode. Frequently used menus can be found on any of the ten buttons. This allows you to quickly and easily reach the most important functions directly at the touch of a button.

Object Database:
The STAR BOOK TEN contains more than 270,000 celestial objects, including 258,977 stars from the SAO star catalog, 109 Messier objects, 7,840 objects and NGC 5386 IC objects, the sun, the moon and the planets of our solar system. Simply call the objects with their common names.

P-PEC function:
You can save a periodic error correction to improve tracking accuracy of the mount. This is stored and retained even if you turn off the device and put it back into operation the next time.

On the hunt for satellites:
You can enter the orbital elements of a satellite directly into the Starbook via the LAN connection of a PC. You can store up to 10 satellites in your Starbook.

Viewing Comets:
You can enter the orbital elements of a comet directly into the Starbook via a LAN connection of a PC. You can save up to 10 comets in your Starbook.

User defined objects:
The Starbook Ten is able to save user-defined objects. You can save other interesting celestial objects that you want to observe or photograph on your Starbook Ten. You can enter position data of up to 10 objects directly on the Starbook Ten or via the LAN connection of a PC.

Multiple tracking speeds:
It is possible to change the speed rate according to the type of object you are observing. The movement of the sun, moon, planets or comets can be tracked at different speeds.

Advanced alignment algorithm:
You can achieve an exact alignment of the mount by simply approaching 2 stars with a distance of at least 10 degrees one after the other and saving them. You can enter the position data of up to 20 stars on the Starbook Ten controller.

The more stars you store, the more accurate the positioning of the mount will become. If you save more than 20 stars, existing position data will be deleted The Starbook Ten memory has a large backup storage in which your information can be stored. This allows you to turn off the device and conserve the batteries. When the mount resumes its work, the data remains stored.

Atmospheric refraction:
This option allows you to compensate for or reduce atmospheric refraction on the celestial objects near the horizon.

Cross Over Meridian:
The mount has a safety function that rotates the optical tube in the opposite direction when the observation object comes to its highest position to prevent the optics from hitting the mount. However, you are free to choose or turn off this feature if you want to shoot with your equipment.

Features:

  • Optics: 115 SD Refractor. SD lenses for high contrast and sharpness
  • Aperture: 115mm
  • Focal Length: 890mm
  • Focal Ratio: f/7.7
  • Limit size: 12.1
  • Resolution: 1.01
  • High-quality SLV eyepieces
  • SXD2 mount with 20kg load capacity (15kg Photographic)
  • High-quality modern STARBOOK TEN control
  • Automatic tracking with GOTO function
  • Total weight: 27.9 kg

  2. SLV 20mm and SLV 5mm eyepiece
  3. SXD2 mount with GOTO control
  4. SXG-HAL130 Tripod
  5. SXG Half Column
  6. 2 counterweights 1.9 and 3.7kg
  7. 7x50 viewfinder telescope
  8. Illuminated polar finder scope
  9. Cigarette Lighter Cable
  10. Carrying handle

Title: Vixen AXD2 with VMC 260 Maksutov-Cassegrain
Body (HTML):
The optics of the VMC260L surpass that of the traditional Schmidt-Cassegrain and are only 650mm long despite its high focal length of 3000mm. With its large aperture of 260mm (10"), this optical telescope collects a huge amount of light for serious professional observations and photography of the planets, as well as countless deep-sky objects.

The dielectrically coated mirrors of the VMV260L guarantee extremely high sharpness and maximum brightness. Thanks to the open tube, these devices also cool down faster than conventional closed Cassegrain systems. For further expansion, an optional 0.62x focal reducer is available to reduce the aperture ratio to 1:7.1. This results in a shortening of the exposure times and easier photography of larger objects. Included with this telescope is a dovetail rail and a carrying handle, which can also be used as a camera mount for star field shots.

The AXD2 mount in detail:
This hight quality professional grade mount is made from using robust construction and a lightweight housing with a max load capacity of 30 kg (Photographic). The A7075 Super alloy, which is the strongest of aluminum alloys, is used for the R.A. and DEC axes. The stability of the A7075 superalloy is stronger than titanium, which is known as a lightweight material with extremely high strength. Its density is 38% less than titanium. The use of the A7075 super alloy for the axles makes the AXD mount lightweight yet stable and the rotating parts of the AXD mount have a total of 21 bearings. This ensures a very even movement to pan and track objects.

Stepper Motors:
Vixen chose more accurate stepper motors for the mount to excercise its full performance potential. The disadvantage of large stepper motors with equally large steps has been eliminated by the Micro-Step Motion Control System which generates 400 pulses per second at high speed. This creates a very quiet sampling without vibrations and the stepper motors of the AXD mount have more than sufficient torque for high loading equipment. This is most evident when working at high magnification and photographing using CCD photography with small pixel sizes.

Worm gears:
The sizes of the worm gears have been increased in the latest Atlux version. The AXD mount has 270 teeth in R.A. and 216 teeth in DC. Both axes are 50mm in diameter. As a result, the mount achieves a very high degree of accuracy and running stability.

Low play:
Thanks to the Vixen Micro-Step Motion Control System, the stepper motors run extremely smoothly from low to high speed. This eliminates the use of reduction gears in the drive and therefore reduces the play in the transmission.

Elegant design:
The flat sides of the mount have been taken from previous generations of the New Atlux range. The white and silver-coloured housing ensures a modern and elegant exterior with high functionality - The AXD is the flagship of the Vixen mount series.

The AXD mount is equipped with a 6x20 polar finder telescope as standard. With the scale built into the polar finder, you can achieve a simple and accurate pole alignment in the northern hemisphere and for observation in southern latitudes, the constellation Octans is viewed in the polar viewfinder, which is then set congruently with the real stars.

Periodic Errors Correction VPEC:
Usually, periodic errors are measured on mounts and corrected by the user. Since the old StarBook did not save this error permanently, the Starbook Ten has addressed this problem and now the periodic error of the mount is measured in the factory and eliminated before delivery. This is called VPEC and works automatically as soon as you use the mount. They achieve an accuracy of +/- 2.8 arc seconds. You will even be able to further increase tracking accuracy by saving your own recorded periodic error.

Telescope & Mount Spec:

  • AXD2 Goto mount with VMC260L telescope
  • OTA Aperture: 260mm
  • OTA Focal Length: 3000mm
  • Focal Ratio: f/11.5
  • Resolution: 0.45 arc seconds
  • Mount with 30 kg load capacity (Photographic)
  • Modern Starbook Ten control with autoguider input
  • More than 270,000 celestial objects stored
  • Illuminated polar viewfinder with direct star adjustment
  • Professional Maksutov-Cassegrain with 260 mm opening
  • Very stable metal observatories column
  • Total weight: 70.1 kg

Whats included:

  1. VMC 260 Maksutov-Cassegrain Telescope
  2. P85 Observatories Column
  3. 2 counterweights 1.5 and 7.0 kg
  4. 7x50 viewfinder telescope
  5. Folding mirror
  6. Carrying handle

Title: Vixen AXD2 Goto mount with AX103S APO Triplet - 4"
Body (HTML):
The AX103S Refractor is a professional grade ED Triplet Apochromat and has been developed for astrophotography for all cameras up to and including full-frame cameras and this one has a Triplet ED lens and at the rear area there is an image field flattening lens.

This f8 refractor can also use an optional focal reducer which can further reduce the focal ratio to achieve even faster results in astrophotography. The 60 mm ring on the focuser allows you to attach 2" eyepieces and a camera adapter. While the AX103S has been specially developed for professional astrophotography purposes, its also a real visual highlight, especially when observing the moon and planets using an eyepiece. This is a telescope that will delight you for a lifetime.

The AXD2 mount in detail:

The Observatory class AXD2 mount comes with the new 'Starbook Ten' controller and the PFL polar finder, which makes it quick and easy to align the mount via reference stars. Robust construction and a lightweight housing with a photographic load capacity of 30 kg. The A7075 Super alloy, which is the strongest aluminum alloy available, is used for the R.A. and DEC axes.

The stability of the A7075 superalloy is stronger than titanium, which is known as a lightweight material for high strength. Its density is 38% less than titanium. The use of the A7075 super alloy for the axles makes the AXD mount lightweight yet stable. The rotating parts of the AXD mount have a total of 21 bearings ensuring the smoothest of movement.

Stepper motors:
Vixen chose more accurate stepper motors for this mount in order to exploit the full performance potential. The disadvantage of stepper motors with large steps has been eliminated by the Micro-Step Motion Control System. The system generates 400 pulses per second at high speed. This creates a very quiet sampling without vibrations while the stepper motors of the AXD mount have more than sufficient torque for higher loads. This is most evident when working at high magnification and astrophotography using CCD astrophotography cameras with small pixel sizes.

Worm gears:
The sizes of the worm gears have been increased in the latest Atlux version. The AXD mount has 270 teeth in R.A. and 216 teeth in DC. Both axes are 50 mm in diameter. As a result, the mount achieves a high degree of accuracy and running stability.

Low backlash:
Thanks to the Vixen Micro-Step Motion Control System, the stepper motors run extremely smoothly from low to high speed. This eliminates the use of reduction gears in the drive system and therefore reduces the play in the gears.

Elegant design:
The flat sides of the mount have been taken from previous generations of the New Atlux range. The white and silver-coloured housing ensures a modern and elegant exterior with high functionality. This AXD mount is the flagship of the Vixen mount series.

Polar finder telescope:
The AXD mount is equipped with a 6 x 20 polar finder telescope as standard. With the scale built into the polar finder, you can achieve a simple and accurate poler alignment in the northern hemisphere.
For observation in southern latitudes, the constellation Octans is imaged in the polar viewfinder, which is then set congruently with the real stars.

Periodic Errors Correction VPEC:
Usually, periodic errors are measured on mounts and corrected by the user. Since the old StarBook did not save this error permanently, the Starbook Ten has addressed this problem. The periodic error of the mount is now measured in the factory and eliminated before delivery. This is called VPEC and it works automatically as soon as you use the mount.
They achieve an accuracy of +/- 2.8 arc seconds. You will be able to further increase tracking accuracy by saving your own recorded periodic errors.

Telescope Spec:
  • Optical Design: Triplet Refractor
  • Lens Material: Ohara Japan FPL-53 ED Glass
  • Aperture: 103mm
  • Focal Length: 890
  • Focal Ratio: f/8
  • Resolution: 1.13 arc Seconds
  • Observatorty class GOTO AXD2 Mount
  • Tracking accuracy of +/- 2.8 arc seconds
  • Mount with 35 kg payload capacity (30kg photographic)
  • Modern STARBOOK TEN control with autoguider input
  • Illuminated polar viewfinder with direct star adjustment
  • Very stable vibration-free P85DX observatory column
  • Total weight: 64.6 kg
Whats included:
  1. TR102 Tripod
  2. AX103S Apochromat
  3. AXD2 Goto Mount
  4. AXD Half Column
  5. 2 counterweights 1.5 and 7.0 kg
  6. 7x50 viewfinder telescope
  7. Folding mirror
  8. Carrying handle

Title: TS-Optics Ritchey-Chrétien F/8 - 12"
Body (HTML):
TS-Optics 12" f/8 RC Ritchey-Chrétien Telescope with Carbon Truss Tube:

This telescope is optimized for astrophotography in fixed installations such as observatories. The tube is supplied with carbon connecting rods, which on the one hand are light weight but also have a favorable expansion behavior resulting from changing temperatures. The tube weight is around 30kg and the tube comes with a Losmandy-level dovetail rail on both sides. With a length of approx. 850mm, the 12" RC is still suitable for compact private or professional observatories.

The 12" f/8 RC astrograph illuminates about 70 mm field very well and without a corrector lens, a field with a diameter of approx. 35 mm with very good correction is available.

The advantages of TS-Optics RC telescopes at a glance:

  1. Hyperbolic primary mirror and secondary mirror for a large fully corrected field of view.
  2. Astrophotography with camera sensors up to 30 mm in diameter is also possible without a corrector. For larger sensors, e.g full-frame, there are ready-made correctors available.
  3. 99% mirroring and dielectric coating on primary and secondary mirrors for an even brighter image.
  4. Significantly faster cooling time due to open design and active primary mirror ventilation.
  5. Inner bezels in the tube for even more contrast.
  6. Large back focus for correctors, reducers or binoculars.
  7. High-quality 3" MONORAIL focuser with M77 x 0.75 female thread on the pull-out tube and M74 x 0.75 male thread and 2" / 1.25" plug connection.

Astrophotography through the RC telescope:
Due to the large corrected field of view of the RC telescopes, you can, shoot with DSLR cameras up to APS-C format without a corrector. To shoot directly in focus, you'll need the M117 x 1 extension sleeves that are included. These are screwed between the telescope and the focuser and thus reduce the back focus. The generous back focus also allows the connection of correctors, which we recommend when using use of full-frame sensors.

You can also connect a focal length reduction, which further increases the light intensity by reducing the f ratio. You can clamp the camera directly via the 2" receptacle or you can screw everything via the threads of the focuser.
Suitable adapters can be found in the accessories area.

Telescope Specs:

  • Optics: RC Ritchey Chrétien Optics
  • Aperture: 304 mm / 12"
  • Focal length: 2432 mm
  • Aperture ratio: f/8
  • Resolution: 0,38"
  • Reflection: 99 % reflection on main and secondary mirrors
  • Back focus: 285 mm from the back, 179 mm from the 2" receptacle of the extract
  • Connection eyepiece side: 2" and 1.25" receptacle
  • Additional thread: M77x0,75 female thread on the pull-out tube and M74x0,75 male thread
  • Tube diameter: 485 mm
  • Tube length: 850 mm without focuser
  • Weight: 24 kg
  • Shading by secondary mirrors: 150 mm
  • Dovetail rails: 2x Losmandy level
  • Tube: Carbon Truss Tube

Title: Bresser Spezial-Astro Binoculars - 20 x 80
Body (HTML):
Thanks to fully multi coated Bak-4 glass material and the extra large objective lens diameter the Bresser Spezial-Astro 20x80 Porro Binoculars provide bright, crisp images from edge to edge.

Their high x20 magnification makes these excellent binoculars convenient not only for observing astronomical objects, but also terrestrial targets and nature study. Their optical design and coatings minimise stray light and ghosting (even near brighter objects like the Moon), which would otherwise disrupt and detract from observing enjoyment. Diopter compensation and foldable rubber eyecups give wearers of glasses better use of these binoculars.

With the tripod thread integrated in the strong central support column, which is adjustable along the centre axis bar, the Bresser Spezial-Astro 20x80 Porro Binoculars can directly be mounted onto any suitable camera-style tripod and balanced front to back, once in place.

Features:

  • Binoculars for astronomical and terrestrial observations
  • Extremely high light gathering capacity
  • Can directly be mounted onto tripods with standard 1/4" attachments

Whats included:

  1. Binoculars
  2. Carry case

Download the Spezial Astro Binocular Manual Here

    SAFETY NOTICE: Never look directly at the Sun through your Binoculars or Telescope - immediate and permanent eye damage may result. For Solar viewing please ensure you have a dedicated Solar Filter fitted correctly to your telescope.

Title: Bresser Spezial Astro Binoculars - 25 x 70
Body (HTML):
These Bresser 'Spezial Astro' Binoculars are perfectly suited for astronomy observations as well as and landscape viewing too.

Thanks to the fully multi coated 'Bak-4' glass material and the extra large objective lens diameter, these binoculars provide bright and high resolution views. The high x25 magnification make them particularly well suited for observing astronomical objects in the night sky and due to a very effective reduction of stray light, (by multi coating all the air to glass surfaces), these binoculars deliver the best possible performance and excellent contrast.

They are of course very practical for viewing wildlife and distant terrestrial objects too. Diopter compensation and foldable rubber eyecups make them much more comfortable to use for eye glass wearers while making the best use of the optics full field of view.

With the tripod thread in the lengthened centre axis, the These Spezial Astro Binoculars can be mounted onto any photographic tripod (we would definitely recommend this). To attach them to a tripod you just need to use the optional tripod adapter (sold seperately here).

Note: The use of a tripod is highly recommended with these binoculars, because at their larger size and higher x25 magnification it's difficult to maintain a steady image by hand while holding them for longer periods of time.

Binocular Features:

  • Binoculars for astronomical and long distance observations
  • Extremely high light gathering capacity
  • High x25 magnification
  • Aperture: 70mm
  • Fully multi coated lenses
  • Dimensions: 275 x 205 x 82mm
  • Weight: 1.3kg
  • Tripod adapter available seperately

Whats included:

Title: Celestron SkyMaster Astronomy Binoculars - 20 x 80
Body (HTML):
The SkyMaster 20x80 has a reinforced housing with a center pole and integrated tripod adapter for maximum mechanical and collimation stability. At 20x magnification you will be able to see a lot of more details on objects such as the Moon, but you should definitely use a tripod.

With a weight of just over 2kg, a good photo tripod with a solid tilt head is recommended so that you can observe in a relaxed manner and really enjoy some of the amazing things the night sky has to offer.

To ensure that the image does not shake while you are observing, all binoculars have a built-in tripod adapter. This means you can mount them on a ball head or - better - a two- or three-way tilt head without an additional adapter. A carrying case and strap round off the package and of course, all SkyMaster binoculars have diopter compensation adjustments.

Large binoculars with more than ten times magnification can only be used hands-free for a short time. Anything more than this will require a Tripod which gives the binoculars a stable base and allows you to observe in a much more relaxed manner and if the binoculars are mounted on a tripod, you can also take photos with a digital camera through one of the eyepieces.

Spec:

  • Eye relief: 18mm
  • Exit Pupil: 4mm
  • Optical design: Porro binoculars
  • Optical coating: Multi-Coated
  • Prism glass: BaK-4
  • Aperture: 80mm
  • Tripod adaptable: Yes, built-in adapter
  • Carrying bag: Yes
  • Magnification: 20x
  • Waterproof: Water resistant (Do not submerge in water)

    SAFETY NOTICE: Never look directly at the Sun through your Binoculars or Telescope - immediate and permanent eye damage may result. For Solar viewing we have dedicated filters and Telescopes available for this purpose.

Title: Celestron SkyMaster Astronomy Binoculars - 25 x 70
Body (HTML):
The SkyMaster 25x70 Astro Binoculars combine a large light-gathering aperture with a handy and not too heavy construction. It can be attached to a photo tripod using the angle adapter provided.

Due to the high magnification, it shows its full performance when used with a tripod. The larger aperture and magnification reveal details, especially in the sky, that remain hidden in smaller devices.

Large binoculars are the link between small handy binoculars and large telescopes. The larger aperture allows for greater resolution compared with smaller devices, and binocular vision allows relaxed observation over long periods of time. Even in poor lighting conditions such as at dusk, they still show details, while smaller devices simply run out of light.

Astronomical quality:

Do you want to observe distant targets on earth, or would you prefer astronomical targets in the sky? The SkyMaster binoculars are perfect for both tasks.

To ensure that the image does not shake while you are observing, all binoculars have a built-in tripod adapter. This means you can mount them on a ball head or - better - a two- or three-way tilt head without an additional adapter. All SkyMaster binoculars have diopter focus adjustments and if the binoculars are mounted on a tripod, you can also take photos with a small camera through one of the eyepieces.

  • Exit pupil: 2.8mm

  • Lens aperture: 70mm

Title: Bresser Spezial Astro SF ED Binoculars - 20 x 80
Body (HTML):
These Bresser 'Spezial Astro' ED Binoculars are perfectly suited for astronomy observations as well as and landscape viewing too.

These are Professional grade large binoculars which contain ED glass objective lenses (Similar to higher end astronomy telescopes).

Thanks to the fully multi coated Bak-4 glass material, the extra large objective lens and highly corrected eyepieces (containing 5 lenses in 3 groups) these binoculars provide very bright, crisp views from edge to edge. Their high x20 magnification
means they are excellent for astronomy use, capturing rich wide field views of incredible star fields and other deep space objects. They can also be used for viewing distant terrestrial objects during the daytime too.

Due to a very high reduction of stray light, these binoculars deliver the best possible views and with the individual eyepiece focus, once focus is set correctly you can get amazingly sharp views for all distant astronomical objects. Foldable rubber eyecups also make them much more comfortable for eye glass wearers allowing you to take advantage of the optics full field of view.

These Astro ED binoculars are also water-resistant and filled with 'Argon' gas to avoid internal fogging. The ergonomic rubber armouring provides a good grip and also protects the internals against knocks and bumps. With the included heavy duty tripod adapter these Spezial Astro ED binoculars are ready to be mounted onto any camera tripod which offers a standard 1/4inch or 3/8inch thread. (something we would definitely recommend with larger binoculars like these). 

Note: The use of a tripod is highly recommended with these binoculars, because at their larger size, heavier weight and higher x20 magnification it's difficult to maintain a steady image by hand while holding them for longer periods of time.

Binocular Features:

  • Binoculars for astronomical and landscape observations
  • Extremly high light gathering capacity
  • High magnification for distant objects
  • Fully multi coated optics
  • Waterproof and Argon gas filled to prevent fogging
  • Magnification: x20
  • Aperture: 80mm
  • Individual eyepiece focus and foldable rubber eyecups
  • Highly corrected eyepieces for sharp views from edge to edge
  • Ergonomic rubber armouring - protected against shocks
  • Dimensions: 310 x 250 x 100mm
  • Weight: 2.7kg
  • Heavy duty photo tripod adapter included

Title: Explore Scientific BT-120 SF Giant Binoculars
Body (HTML):
Observe the beauty of the starry night sky in almost 3D with these specialised Explore Scientific Giant Astro Binoculars. Globular star clusters, glowing gas nebulae, the moon with its many craters and even planets can be observed in outstanding detail on a clear night. Also suitable for viewing nature and landscape during the day.

These large, light-gathering lenses and professional grade coatings on all lens surfaces, ensure these binoculars produce bright and brilliant views all the time. The comfortable 45 degree viewing angle allows fatigue-free use, even when the binoculars are tilted upwards towards the zenith. Large binoculars of this type can also be called a double refractor telescope because in this configuration, the full light gathering power of one single telescope is available to each eye. Experience a whole new dimension of observing as a consequence making the moon and stars appear like you can reach out and literally touch them - one of the main advantages that binoculars have over small basic telescopes.

These extremely robust binoculars have a magnesium housing, sealed and filled with nitrogen gas to prevent fogging and moisture on the inside of the optics. The BT series binoculars are designed for tough outdoor use. The very light magnesium housing saves weight and makes them easier to handle (however they do need to be mounted on a tripod due to their physical size). Two Explore Scientific 20mm eyepieces from the 62° LER series range are also included. However you can change the eyepieces to achieve higher magnification and almost any plug in type 1.25" eyepieces are suitable.

You can even use standard 1.25" colour or nebula filters which thread into the eyepiece for astronomical observations to further enhance your views of deep sky objects. However do keep in mind the use of eyepieces and colour / nebula filters must of course always be done in pairs.

The 45-degree viewing angle allows nice relaxed observation positions even when the binoculars are tilted towards the zenith. Also the individual interpupillary distance can be adjusted in a range from 54 to 76mm. With the fine helical individual focuser, precise focusing is achieved quite effortlessly. The integrated dew caps can also be removed in high humidity as well as cold conditions and even extended - This helps avoid fogging of the outer objective lenses and offers a barrier against stray light from the side.

A metal carrying handle located at the Bino's center of gravity which facilitates transport and ensures a secure grasp during tripod assembly. When using these large binoculars, a sturdy photo tripod with an appropriate load capacity is
required. The connection is made via two 1/4 inch or one 3/8 inch threaded holes (standard photo tripod thread) in the tripod adapter of the binoculars.

Features:

  • Large binoculars for observing the night sky as well as landscape and nature
  • Observe globular star clusters, glowing gas nebulae, the moon with all its craters and even planets
  • High light gathering lenses produce a bright and high-contrast image
  • These are all-round binoculars, but they are especially suited for Astronomy
  • The comfortable 45 degree viewing angle allows fatigue-free use
  • Extremely robust binoculars with magnesium housing, sealed and filled with nitrogen.
  • Two Explore Scientific 20mm eyepieces are included
  • x33 magnification and an apparent field of view of 62°, true visible field of 1.8°
  • Large interpupillary distance of 15mm to the eyepiece lens for comfortable viewing
  • Eyepieces are interchangeable with standardized plug-in eyepieces of 1.25" / 31.7mm
  • The magnification can be adjusted with optional eyepieces from x25 to x75
  • Precise brass eyepiece compression ring clamps for tilt-free fit
  • Color and nebula filters can be used for astronomical observations
  • Extendable dew caps prevent fogging of the outer objective lenses and stray light
  • Integrated carrying handle facilitates transport and mounting on the tripod
  • Tripod connection via two 1/4 inch or one 3/8 inch threaded holes (standard photo tripod thread)
  • Objective type: Air spaced achromatic lens (2 elements/ 1 group)
  • Coating: full multilayer coating on all optical surfaces
  • Aperture: 120mm
  • Focal length: 660mm
  • F ratio: f/5.5
  • Close focus distance: 35 meters
  • Adjustable interpupillary distance: 54 to 76 mm
  • Helical single focus: yes
  • BAK-4 prism system for a bright and high-contrast image
  • Dimensions: 654 x 290 x 156mm
  • Weight: 8.3kg

What's included

  1. Giant binoculars with carrying handle (excl. tripod)
  2. Eyepieces ES 20mm 62° LER Series (2pcs)
  3. Dust covers for objectives and eyepiece sockets
  4. Instruction manual

    SAFETY NOTICE: Never look directly at the Sun through your Binoculars or Telescope - immediate and permanent eye damage may result. For Solar viewing please ensure you have a dedicated Solar Filter fitted correctly to your telescope.

Title: Explore Scientific Large Binoculars U-Mount
Body (HTML):
This large fork mount with precision adjustable mechanics for large binoculars are designed for use with large professional binoculars such as our Explore Scientific BT range.

When using giant binoculars such as these, a stable mount and tripod with an appropriate load capacity is absolutely necessary. The experience of viewing the night sky using extremely high power with both eyes is quite a memorable experience, making you feel like you can reach out and literally touch the stars.

The new Explore Scientific U-mount with field tripod also fits most other binoculars from 70 to 120mm lens diameter, which have a 1/4 inch photo thread connection on the underside. With the U-mount there is no shaking or annoying vibrations, the combination is as solid as a rock and provides the unlimited observation pleasure in all binocular positions. Whether you are observing the starry sky or the landscape, the U-mount allows soft and smooth movements in both axis.

The Explore Scientific U-mount has an excellent mechanism with adjustable friction in both axis, which allows you to adjust the friction to your preference making movement and tracking much more comfortable even when fully loaded. The binoculars can be mounted and removed in a few seconds using the quick-release adapter plate included. This is a major advantage, especially for mobile outdoor use. The connection between binoculars and adapter plate is made by two 1/4 inch threaded bolts (standard photo tripod thread), which are variably guided in a slotted hole. The double screw connection guarantees a very secure fit for the binoculars. The adapter plate itself is also attached to the U-mount by two large clamping screws, which are easy to use even when wearing gloves.

The Explore Scientific tripod provides a firm safe stand for the mount. The solid aluminium and stainless steel construction effectively suppresses most vibrations and the large 50mm diameter stainless steel tripod legs and the aluminium tripod head plate offer maximum stability with a moderate transport weight of only 5.8kg. With retracted tripod legs, the transport dimensions are only 80cm long (Adjustable working range 100 to 140cm.) The included accessory tray additionally gives some tension outwards to the tripod legs and therefore increases the stability even further.

Explore Scientific U-Mount Features:

  • Solid fork mount with tripod for giant binoculars
  • Comfortable observation position in all orientations
  • Excellent mechanism for adjustment of tracking friction in both axis
  • Large hand wheels for adjustments - no problem even with gloves
  • Secure mounting of the binoculars in all adjustment positions
  • Integrated aluminium accessory tray
  • Carries binoculars up to 12kg
  • Adjustment range vertical axis: 0 to 90 degrees
  • Adjustment range azimuth axis: 360 degrees (without limitation)
  • Maximum possible width of the binoculars: 290mm
  • Quick change adapter plate with 2 x 1/4 inch photo thread screws
  • Double prismatic clamping of the quick-change adapter plate
  • Working height of tripod with the mount: approx. 100 to 140cm
  • Tripod leg tube diameter: 50mm
  • Transportation size tripod: approx 80cm length
  • Weight Mount/Tripod: 5.5kg / 5.8kg
  • Material Mount/Tripod: Aluminium / Stainless Steel
  • Shipping size/weight of Mount: 51 x 42 x 28cm, 7.6kg
  • Shipping size/weight of Tripod: 87 x 21 x 22cm, 6.5kg

Title: Bresser Sliding Mount for Binoculars
Body (HTML):
The Bresser Slider binocular mount, with its revolutionary design, offers unprecedented comfort when observing the night sky with binoculars.

The variable extension length of the two support rails (crossbars), the gimbal mounting head and various adjustable slip couplings mean that almost all binocular positions can be effortlessly adjusted. The binoculars then remain in the respective position thanks to the counterweights. During observation, it is usually not necessary to touch the binoculars themselves and regardless of whether you want to observe while standing, sitting on a swivel chair or lying on a sleeping mat or lounger, everything is possible. 

The mount also represents an interesting alternative to normal tripod solutions for wheelchair users, where a tripod leg is usually always in the way. A steady view can be seen despite using larger binoculars. Normally at high magnification and medium-weight binoculars weighing 500 grams or more can be difficult, especially during longer observation periods because after just a short time,  your arms get tired and trying to maintain a steady view is almost impossible. A high photo tripod with a 360deg ball joint can certainly make a significant improvement but this solution is sometimes limited in terms of the freedom of movement of the binoculars and the position of the observer.  

The Bresser Slider binocular mount offers far more options here and means that almost all desired binocular positions can be reached effortlessly. The patented design with 2 counter-rotating support rails (traverses) is guided on special linear roller bearings inside the mount head with virtually no play. This allows the observer to vary the extension length as desired with little muscle power. The sliding resistance can be continuously adjusted using 2 adjustment screws. In the middle of the center of gravity of the slider mount there is an axis with an adjustable slip clutch for the tilt and rotation movement. All bearings work absolutely smoothly and without play. For quick leveling, there is even a 30mm fluorescent circular bubble level in the mount base, which is easy to read even in the dark. 

The Gimbal mount head:
The gimbal mount head works in a similar way to a ball head. However, it offers a significantly higher load capacity and more stability. Here, too, the sliding resistance of all moving parts can be adjusted to suit the respective needs. The mount head has several mounting holes for mounting a binocular holder using a 1/4 inch photo screw or a standard GP prism clamp for mounting small telescopes. There are also various holes on the side walls of the mount head for additional accessories such as red light reading lamps, smartphone holders for using Sky apps such as 'Stellarium' or LED viewfinders for quickly targeting celestial objects.

Balancing weights:
Several balancing weights enable the binoculars or telescope to be precisely balanced. 2 counterweights each weighing 2.5 kg, 1.25 kg and 0.5 kg are included with the mount and can be attached to the mounting bolts on both sides at the rear end of the mount. The weights are secured to the bolts using the 2 spring tensioners included. Instead of counterweights, a filled sandbag can be attached to the existing mounting hook. This procedure reduces the transport weight for planned excursions.

Suitable for binoculars weighing up to 3.5 kg:
The Bresser slider mount can be used with binoculars weighing up to 3.5kg. But it is also very beneficial for much smaller binoculars too by obtain blur-free images during long-term observations. The mount is made using an optionally available binocular tripod adapter, which is attached to the mount head using a 1/4 inch photo thread screw.

Tripod connection:
The appropriate tripod adapter for using the optionally available Bresser stainless steel tripod ST-3 is already included in the scope of delivery of the slider mount. This converts the standardized large 3/8-inch photo tripod thread (internal thread) in the base of the slider mount into a metric M10 thread. This means that after dismantling the adapter, a stable standard photo or video tripod with 3/8-inch threaded bolts can also be used.

See instruction video here >

Title: Bresser Laser Collimator 31.7mm (1,25")
Body (HTML):
Laser collimators are an essential maintenance tool for owners of mirror optical telescopes such as a Newtonian to ensure you can always achieve the best focus possible.

This laser-collimator makes aligning the mirrors of a Newtonian telescope a simple, fast and precise job. With this laser you can even collimate your optics even in the dark without additional accessories. Its precisely machined to fit a 1.25" focuser without any tilting. The built-in projection area enables collimating even long focal length scopes a simple task. Suitable for Newtonian, Schmidt-Newtonian and Maksutov-Newtonian telescopes.

Details:

  • 31.7mm(1.25") Eyepiece Barrel Diameter
  • Machined anodized aluminum housing with all internal surfaces coated non-reflective flat black
  • Helps to ensure your Primary & Secondary mirrors remain perfectly aligned.

IMPORTANT: Please keep laser products out of reach from children.

Title: Air Blower Bulb
Body (HTML):
Keep your Telescope and camera optics in pristine condition. This Air Blower is a simple yet an essential part of any astronomers Telescope maintenance kit. This simple device allows you to blow off any particles or fine dust either prior to use or prior to cleaning your telescope optics.

Simply squeeze the large bulb to create a jet of air through the nozzle to safely blow off any small particles or dust off your optics. This is also the first important step when cleaning your optics as it helps to prevents minute particles getting rubbed into your lens or mirrors during the cleaning process which can cause small surface scratches.

Features:

  • Perfect for blowing off any dust or particles from your Telescope correctors, eyepieces, filters and camera sensors prior to fitting to your telescope.
  • Can be used on Lenses, Mirrors, Cameras, Eyepieces, Filters and all other optical equipment

Title: Celestron Telescope Lens Cleaning Kit
Body (HTML):
Remove dust, dirt, fingerprints, and other particles from your glass lenses for clear vision with this Lens Cleaning Kit. This cleaning kit works on all glass and optical surfaces, including telescopes, binoculars and even your camera lenses.

This kit includes an extendable cleaning brush for removing dust particles and dirt, as well as two options for cleaning your optics from smudges and fingerprints:

  1. Moist lens cleaning wipes.
  2. A Bottle of lens cleaning fluid with a soft cloth.

IMPORTANT NOTE: This lens cleaning fluid, cloth, and wipes can be used on the corrector lens of Schmidt-Cassegrain telescopes or any other glass Telescope lenses but should NOT be used on the primary or secondary mirrors of telescopes. 

The durable carrying case is divided into three sections to keep all items organized and within easy reach. The convenient belt loop allows the lens cleaning kit to be taken anywhere.

Materials:

Title: TS LED Collimator for RC & Cassegrains (2")
Body (HTML):
TS RCKOLLI 2" LED collimator..

This collimator is compatible with almost all common optical systems such as Schmidt-Cassegrain, RC, Dall-Kirkham and similar telescope types. Collimation can be easily done during the day and the collimator is very precise and the collimation result is largely independent of tilt.

To achieve high-quality collimation even in bright daylight, simply insert the collimator into your focuser and follow the appropriate operating instructions for your OTA if necessary. This collimator has two basic operating configurations: a refractor mode with active white LEDs and a Newtonian/reflector mode with active red LEDs. In addition, there is a third operating mode with LEDs off, which is intended for other OTAs.

Collimation of Ritchey-Chrétien telescopes and similar systems.
It is well known that collimating an RC is not an easy task. Thanks to this TS collimator, it is possible to achieve a very good collimation result even during the day. This means that you always have an optimally adjusted RC telescope at your disposal at night. Collimation is easy and can be carried out by anyone, however it is important that the secondary mirror of your telescope has a central marking.

Spec:

  • Telescope side connection: 2" socket
  • Power supply: 1x lithium battery CR2032

Title: Protective Telescope Cover - Large (178cm length)
Body (HTML):
These high quality Telescope covers offer perfect protection for your telescope against dust and moisture and are a great way to quickly protect your equipment from any impromptu passing showers or even if you want to leave it outside for a short term basis. The cover also has a bottom strap to secure it to the scope and prevent the wind from blowing it off.

This cover is suitable for:
  • Telescopes such as refractors up to 150 mm aperture or Newtonian telescopes up to 12" aperture.
  • All Schmidt-Cassegrain or Maksutov telescopes up to 12" aperture.
  • This cover is 178cm long and should protect the Telescope, Mount and upper part of the tripod.
Practical tips:
We don't recommend using this waterproof telescope cover on its own as permanent solution for covering your telescope outside or in an observatory without first using a cotton cloth (such as a bed sheet) to act as a barrier against condensation.

Title: Vixen Porta II Alt-Azimuth Mount
Body (HTML):
The Vixen Porta II mount is an azimuthal mount in award-winning Vixen quality. It is ideal for beginners or experienced astronomers looking for a Grab-and-Go setup thanks to its simplicity, versatility and reliability. It has been specially developed to make fast and precise observations in vertical and horizontal orientation with your telescope without having to operate a complicated GEM setup.

The mount includes fine adjustments with handles for a fine tracking of celestial objects and the dovetail mounting system (Vixen Standard) ensures maximum compatibility of a wide range of telescopes. The mount head can be quickly removed from the tripod via an M10 screw, making the system very transportable

The Vixen Porta II mount in detail:

Easy handling:
The Porta II does not require clamping, it has a slip clutch, which makes it easy to adjust the mount to an object. It automatically holds your position and is therefore very easy to use for everyone. The Porta II mount head can be disassembled by removing a single screw, making it also very portable.

Easy to use:
The Porta II adjustment system provides slow motion movements in full circle. Grip positions as well as height and azimuth slow motion controls can be changed in 45° increments. This allows the user to use the handles for a comfortable position, whichever sized optical tube used. The accessory holder is provided with cut-outs for your eyepieces.

It can also be used to hold smaller photo accessories. The holder is mounted via a centrally mounted screw. A convenient built-in tool key is installed under the rubber mat and can be used to adjust the friction of the slip clutch.

Mount Specs:
  • 360° fine movement through worm gears
  • No axle clamping required
  • Slip clutch friction system
  • Dovetail system (compatible with GP and Sphinx mount)
  • Adjustment by up to 45° possible
  • Mounting of tubes up to 155mm aperture.
  • Total net weight: 5.7kg
  • Payload Capacity: 9kg

Whats included:
  1. Vixen Porta II Mount
  2. Aluminium tripod
  3. 2 handles for fine adjustment
  4. Assembly tool
  5. Storage plate for accessories

As with all of the Bresser Messier range, the EXOS-2 is made to a high quality finish and has an illuminated polar finder scope and precise graduated circles for ease of use. Although this mount is a manual German Equatorial Mount, a powered two-axis GoTo upgrade Kit is available as an optional extra, giving you the benefits of a fully computerised GOTO Mount. The Bresser EXOS-2 has a generous payload of up to 13 kg which allows you to use refractors of up to 152 mm aperture and mirror telescopes of up to 203 mm aperture.

Title: Explore Scientific Alt-AZ Twilight I Mount
Body (HTML):
The Explore Scientific Twilight I is a light-to-medium-duty alt-azimuth astro mount designed for quick and easy setup and its suitable for most small to medium sized refractor telescopes.

Lightweight, fast Newtonians will also pair up nicely with the Explore Scientific Twilight I mount. As long as your telescope does not exceed 7kg and has a Vixen-Style
universal dovetail bar for mounting, you are good to go.

The Twilight I alt-azimuth mount head is made of powder-coated aluminum and has worm gears in both axis making it very smooth to operate. The adjustable head can be tilted forward or back by a 45° angle which allows enough clearance for your telescope to point straight up for viewing at the zenith. The allen key for doing the mount head adjustment can then be safely stored in the integrated magnetic key holder.

Slow-motion control cables are attached on the vertical and horizontal axis, making it easy to scan the night sky, even with gloves on, due to the over-sized
knurled knobs that are attached to the end of each cable. They can be attached to either side of each axis to accommodate right or left-handed users, or different
types of telescopes (e.g. refractors or Newtonian reflectors).

The stainless steel tripod that comes standard with the Twilight I mount has adjustable legs and a wide foot print, which makes the tripod much more stable.
A spreader bar locks against the inside of the legs to secure the tripod even further, and helps keep vibrations to a minimum.

Features:

  • Alt-Azimuth Astro Mount
  • Payload capacity: 7kg
  • Dimensions: (W)100cm x (L) 160cm
  • Weight: 7.2kg
  • Mounting plate: Vixen

Whats included:

  1. Twilight I Alt-AZ Telescope Mount
  2. Stainless Steel Tripod

Title: Bresser Star Tracker Astronomical Photo Mount - PM 100
Body (HTML):
If you already own a DSLR and want to take long exposure deep sky astrophotography then a Star Tracker is a must have item. This mount will automatically compensate for the natural rotation of the earth. The built-in tracking motor rotates the saddle-mounted camera precisely against the earth's rotation and thus the stars remain in pinpoint shape even with long exposures.

If you already own a sturdy photo tripod with a video tilt head you can use the photo mount's head directly with the 1/4 inch & 3/8 inch photo thread holes. The pole height (latitude) is then adjusted by the video tilt head.

All cameras with 1/4 inch (6.3mm) tripod connection thread and bulb length" B "for long exposures are suitable. The Bresser Star Tracker Astronomical Photo Mount PM-100 is designed for a camera & lens of max weight 2kg total to track in polar mode. In Azimut mode a weight up to 5.0kg is possible.

Large aperture, wide-angle lenses are ideal for astrophotography and a shot with a wide-angle lens can be exposed for up to several minutes and the stars will remain sharp, allowing you to capture some of the fainter details in night sky targets such as the Milkyway. However the Polar alignment must be extremely accurate for long exposure lengths but thanks to the integrated pole finder tunnel, this is done quickly and easily. After setting up the light and compact Star Tracker Photo Mount, simply set the approximate latitude (pole height) and aim Polaris through the integrated pole finder tunnel. Then mount the camera with the photo lens using the quick-release plate on the supplied ball head - With the ball head, the camera can pointed to any section of the sky.

The tracking is carried out by a precise stepper motor, which is controlled by an easy digital display screen. Low power consumption allows up to 20 hours of operation with just one battery charge or simply use the micro USB port for an unlimited power supply.

Star Tracker Features:
  • Equatorial Star Tracker Photo-Mount
  • Automatic sidereal tracking against the Earth rotation
  • Different tracking speed setting possible
  • Suitable for northern and southern hemisphere
  • Time lapse: from 15 minutes to 48 hours
  • Ball head with quick release saddle plate
  • and 1/4" Photo thread for Camera mounting
  • Photo-Mount with 1/4" threaded bolt for ball head mounting
  • Additional quick release coupling for ball head removal
  • High precision stepper motor with helical gear for accurate tracking
  • Clear LCD screen and easy setup menu
  • Battery operation 4 x AA batteries or micro USB (optional acc.)
  • Battery life: up to 20 hours
  • Weight Photo-Mont: 0.63kg
  • Load capacity of Photo-Mount: up to 2.0kg/5.0kg (EQ/AZ)
  • Optional Accessory: Polar-wedge, Tripod and carry-case, optical pole finder scope with illumination unit
Weights & Dimensions:
  • Total length: 86 mm
  • Total width: 64 mm
  • Total height: 65 mm
  • Net weight (without access.): 630g
Whats included:
  1. Star Tracker astronomical Photo-Mount (Tripod & Wedge not included)
  2. Ball head with quick release saddle plate
  3. User manual

Title: Bresser ST-3 Stainless Steel Tripod
Body (HTML):
The Bresser ST-3 stainless steel field tripod is a solid and height-adjustable tripod with double tripod leg clamp made of corrosion-resistant stainless steel for direct use with the Bresser Slider binocular mount, among others.

Set the extendable stainless steel tripod to the desired base height and adjust it to your favorite observation position. For example, the full tripod height should be used for land observation while standing or sitting.

For night sky observation, a lower setting is recommended for a comfortable viewing position while sitting or lying down. The tripod is equipped with a standard GP mount head and a central screw with a metric M10 threaded shaft. Also suitable for EXOS-1 and EXOS-2 EQ mounts. The upper tripod leg tubes have a diameter of 50.8mm (2 inches).

Specs:

  • Solid construction made of stainless steel and aluminum
  • Double tripod leg clamp
  • Height adjustable from approx. 68 to 110cm
  • Tripod weight: 5.5kg
  • Transport length: approx. 87cm
  • Diameter of the upper tripod leg tubes: 50.8mm (2 inches)

  2. Accessory tray
  3. Central spindle
