Title: Vixen Polarie - Star Tracker Mount
Body (HTML):
The Vixen Polarie is an important accessory, that enables you to capture sharp, point-like images of the stars and stunninjg shots of the Milkyway using a standard DSLR Camera. It has been developed to track the stars and to compensate for the movement of the earth and is extremely simple and compact designed for use in every location on earth.

If you have ever viewed a romantic, starry sky, you will surely have felt the desire to capture it on a camera but if you have tried to do this, you will know that it’s really not all that easy. This is because you need to have multiple exposures of several minutes if you want to photograph the stars. As our earth is always turning on its axis, the stars keep moving as time passes and as a result, in the photo become they long streaks of light on photographs. Today’s digital technology gives us the option of obtaining shorter exposure times by increasing the sensitivity of the sensor, but, unfortunately, this dramatically increases picture noise and the picture becomes very noisy and harsh. This makes it extremely difficult to take beautiful images of the night sky. For this reason, the Vixen company has developed the Polarie Star Tracker, which eliminates the problem of star migration. When you attach your camera to the Polarie, the device will track in the opposite direction of the earth’s rotation and this allows for sharp, point-like images of the starry sky even when using very long exposure times.

The multi-functional mode dial is adjustable for sky- and landscape-, moon-, sun- and star-tracking. Also included: USB connection for external power supply and a built-in compass for quick orientation. Available as optional extra accessories are a polar finder telescope for exact alignment with the celestial pole for long-exposure photography and a tripod.

Spec:

  • Tracking speed: Sidereal, 0.5x sidereal, Sun, Moon
  • Fine adjustment: F57, 6mm worm wheel with 144 teeth
  • Polar axis: F 40mm
  • Drive: High-precision stepper motor:
  • Bearing capacity: approx. 2kg incl. ball head
  • Orientation aperture: Field of vision 8.9° vinclinometer: 0° to 70°
  • Miscellaneous: Built-in compass (removable)
  • Power supply: 2x AA batteries (compatible with alkaline, Ni-MH, Ni-CD batteries) or external power supply. Compatible with USB mini-B
  • Drive voltage: AA batteries: DC2,4-3.0V, Max. 0.6A
  • External power supply: DC4,4-5,25V, max. 0.3A
  • Operating time: approx. 2 hours with alkaline batteries
  • Approx. 20 hours with external power supply at 20°C with 2kg payload
  • Operating temperature: 0° to 40°
  • Dimensions: 95mm x 137mm x 58mm
  • Weight: 740g without batteries
  • Body material: Aluminium
  • Colour: White
  • Field of application: Long exposure Astro-Photography, DSLR
  • Optional accessories available: Polar finder telescope, tripod, QPL compass & ball head adapter

Whats included:

  1. 1x Star Tracker Camera Mount (Tripod or other accessories not included)
  2. Batteries required: Yes (unless using a separate power adapter)

Title: Nano Tracker Astronomical Photo Mount
Body (HTML):
The Nano Tracker is one of the smallest star tracking devices available for perfect long exposure Astro photos out in the wilderness - Suitable in Northern & Southern Hemispheres. The Nano Tracker is recommended for all DSLR cameras and system cameras with a wide-angle or light telephoto lenses up to 2kg in weight.

Nano Tracker - Incredibly detailed Milkyway Photography:
With Nano Tracker you can take very impressive long exposure photos of the beautiful night sky. All you need is a camera and a photo tripod. The Nano Tracker ensures accurate tracking and is not only intended for experienced astrophotographers who like to be able to shoot on the go but because it so simple to use, its also ideal for beginners in astrophotography.

The Nano Tracker compensates for the Earth´s rotation:
Because the Earth rotates on its own axis, all celestial objects seem to move from east to west i the sky. This means that any kind of long exposure of the night sky would result in the starts becoming long streaks of light instead of pinpoint stars. The Nano Tracker compensates for this movement meaning you can do much longer exposures and the stars appear pinpoint and much brighter in the photo. For an exact alignment in the northern hemisphere, simply align it with the Pole Star and the NanoTracker will be ready to go.

Tip: With a compass and your smartphone´s tilt sensor, you can also set up the NanoTracker perfectly in both the northern and southern hemispheres.

Time lapse and video animation made easy:
With the NanoTracker you can also create beautiful time-lapse series shots and movies, for example of landscapes with the changing shadows and clouds or stunning time lapse movies of the Milkyway. At night such videos impressively show the movement of the stars - especially when they are recorded at half sidereal speed.

This is what you need for successful operation:
The NanoTracker consists of the compact motor unit and the manual control box, which also contains the battery compartment. The motor unit is placed between the photo tripod with video pointer/ball head and a second ball head, which are not included. The manual control box contains the controls where you can set the desired speed. All you need other than the Nano Tracker is a good tripod with a ball or tilt head, and of course a camera. The best choice is a DSLR camera or system camera with a fast wide-angle lens and a programmable remote shutter release. As a photo tripod you can use any stable tripod.

You will also need three AA batteries, which are not included. At 20°C a set of batteries can last up to 5 hours, however as with all batteries, at low temperatures this time reduces. The battery compartment is integrated in the hand controller and is easily accessible so that you can change the batteries on frosty nights without having to adjust the tripod.

Spec:

  • Speed Settings: 1x, 0.5x, lunar, solar and max. 50x star speed
  • Area of application: Worldwide - Northern/Southern hemisphere switchable
  • Motor: Stepper motor
  • Mechanics: Steel-brass worm wheel drive 50 teeth
  • Bearing: 2 ball bearings
  • Connection tripod side: 1/4" female thread
  • Connection camera side: 1/4" male thread
  • Max Payload: 2kg
  • Power supply: 3x AA batteries (LR6) or Mini USB
  • Dimensions: Tracker 60 x 98 x 44mm, hand controller 50 x 105 x 22mm (without cable)
  • Weight: Tracker 350 grams, hand controller 80 grams

Whats included:

  1. Star Tracking unit
  2. Hand controller (Batteries not included)

Title: Bresser Nebula 5 EQ/AZ WiFi Mount
Body (HTML):
The Bresser Nebula 5 EQ/AZ Wifi-Network Mount is a precise and quiet telescope mount which is ideal for long exposure astrophotography. The controller box offers numerous central connectivity options for various accessories such as cameras, filter wheels, and motor focusers via USB (2.0 & 3.0), simplifying the setup of a highly professional astrophotography mount system.

Bresser has excelled on innovation coupled with quality 'Made in Italy' for this very high standard product. The manufacturer's long experience in mount construction guarantees a high-end device with first-class functionality and utmost reliability. Additionally, the in-house development team in Italy ensures quick response times in technical support and the adaptation of new device drivers.

The mount is controlled via pre-installed web-app software, accessible via WIFI and Ethernet cable connection. The philosophy behind the Nebula GoTo system is to provide the user with a control system independent of a standard PC, which can be remotely controlled via a smart device such as a mobile phone or tablet. However, this does not exclude the traditional use of computers of all types and brands, which can be connected to the system either wired or wirelessly.

The Bresser Nebula GoTo System Controller is a Raspberry Pi 4 microcomputer, which allows complete control of the setup (mount, camera, etc.) without the need for any other external device. The Bresser Nebula GoTo system comes equipped with all the Linux-based applications required for performing all your detailed astrophotographic functions. The existing INDI environment allows for the control of almost all devices (cameras, filter wheels, rotators, etc., even including observatory domes) needed for local or remote astrophotography sessions whether at home or somewhere else in the world.

The system also offers high flexibility for users who prefer to use traditional computer client applications such as Cart du Ciel (Star Chart), The Sky X, Sky Safari, Stellarium, and other planetarium programs as well as SGP, Nina, CCD Ciel, and other popular mainstream astrophotography tools. This complete compatibility is ensured through the adoption of the Alpaca communication protocol, which allows for the use of traditional ASCOM platform drivers for native INDI devices.

State-of-the-art mount construction:
The Bresser Nebula mounts are CNC-manufactured from stainless steel and aluminium. The sleek and functional design is courtesy of a renowned Italian mount manufacturer, who has licensed the design and now completely manufactures these high quality Bresser products. So, look forward to a stable yet easily portable mount, which despite its light weight of only 13kg (incl. tripod), allows for a high load capacity of up to 20kg.

Visual Observation:
For visual observation and direct use, control the mount with the hand control box included in the package. Alternatively, connect the Nebula 5 via WLAN directly to your smartphone or tablet and use the virtual hand control box. Of course, all adjustment parameters can also be set via the web application. The user interface is deliberately made simple and clear to ensure intuitive operation.

Astrophotography:
This is where the Nebula 5 mount shows its full strength. Whether mobile or stationary, the capability for remote operation is crucial. Connect your laptop or PC either via WLAN or with an Ethernet cable (recommended for faster data transmission) directly to the Raspberry-Pi control unit of the mount. Then use the pre-installed Kstars/EKOS software to control the mount and all external devices such as cameras, motor focus, filter wheel, etc. Alternatively, you can also directly control the unit with your own software. Applications such as Cart du Ciel (Star Chart), The Sky X, Sky Safari, Stellarium, and other planetarium programs as well as SGP, Nina, CCD Ciel, and other astrophotography tools can be used without any issues.

2-in-1 Mount with EQ and AZ Mode:
If required, the Nebula can be switched from the equatorial mode to the azimuthal mode. This is particularly advantageous for tracking satellites. Therefore, the mount can be used for various applications and is not limited to long exposure astrophotography.

Attachment of up to two optics:
Would you like to adapt multiple optics? No problem. Simply use the option to replace the counterweight bar with another telescope. Use the second optic as a counterweight to the main telescope. Set the Nebula 5 to azimuthal mode, remove the counterweight bar, and screw a suitable second telescope clamp directly onto the mount.

Features:

  • Precise and quiet telescope mount – ideal for astrophotography
  • Extensive connectivity options for various accessories via USB
  • Integrated web app software enables central control of all components
  • Integrated Raspberry Pi with USB-3 ports and Ethernet port
  • Compatible with client applications such as Cart du Ciel (Star Chart), The Sky X, Sky Safari, Stellarium
  • Compatible with SGP, Nina, CCD Ciel, and other astrophotography tools
  • Virtual hand control box and settings menu for smartphones and tablets
  • PC control – ASCOM and INDI compatible
  • USB ports for cameras, motors, filter wheels, etc.
  • Conversion from parallactic to azimuthal mode possible
  • Small hand box for basic functions included
  • Mount CNC-manufactured from stainless steel and aluminium
  • Tooth belt drive for precise and quiet tracking
  • Load capacity: 15kg in EQ mode and 20kg in AZ mode
  • Dual prism clamping for Vixen GP and Losmandy
  • Weight of the mount: 8kg
  • Weight of the tripod: 5kg
  • Max Tripod height - 103cm

Whats included:

  1. Nebula 5 EQ/AZ Mount
  2. Field tripod
  3. Central control unit with Raspberry Pi
  4. Counterweight: 6 kg (1 piece)
  5. Basic hand box
  6. Connection cables
  7. Power supply 230V/12V/3A

Title: Bresser Messier EXOS-2 GOTO German Equatorial Mount
Body (HTML):
The Bresser EXOS-2 GoTo German Equatorial Mount is a full GOTO mount with tracking motors in both axes that follow celestial objects very precisely and can be accurately controlled using the 'Star Tracker' hand controller.

Precision ball bearings in both axes of the mount ensures minimal backlash during all nine possible tracking speeds and the mount can be powered by a 12V battery pack which is conveniently fastened to the tripod shelf and takes eight size "D" batteries. You can also power the mount using a suitable mains adapter or 12V car plug adapter. The rigid tripod and mount assembly allows a generous payload of up to 13kg - perfect for small to medium sized Telescopes.

EXOS-2 GOTO System:
The Startracker GoTo System enables beginners with little experience to start astronomical observations in just a few minutes, and guides you to various objects in the night sky that are not visible through the small finder scope.

At the push of a button you can locate Planets, Nebulae or Galaxies in minutes. The database on the Startracker system holds thousands of celestial objects to choose from.

The Bresser StarTracker GoTo systems also uses servo motors for both axes and features an ST-4 compatible autoguiding input - essential for long exposure Astrophotography. The menu and navigation of the Startracker hand controller is also multilingual and offers a choice of German, English, French, Spanish and Italian.

Mount Spec:

  • Stable parallactic mount with fine drive in both axes
  • Ball bearings in both axes for more precise movements
  • Stable height adjustable stainless steel tripod ( Min. 69cm / Max. 109,5cm )
  • Max Payload: 13kg (10kg Photographic)
  • Circular bubble for easy horizontal alignment
  • GoTo Mount with motors and hand box controller, for easy finding and guiding moon, planets, stars and much more
  • ST-4 compatible autoguider interface
  • Pole height scale for setting the latitude
  • Scaled graduated circular rings to facilitate finding objects using a star atlas or planetarium software
  • Pole finder scope
  • Tripod weight: 4.6 kg
  • Mount weight: 5.3 kg (without counterweight)
  • Total weight incl. counterweight: 19.1 kg
  • Batteries: Eight size D (not included)
  • Equatorial EXOS 2 GOTO mount with stainless steel tripod and StarTracker hand controller
  • All GOTO, Tracking and Autoguiding operations carried out via the Star Tracker Hand Controller - Not recommended for use with ASCOM 
  • Adjustable polar finder scope with optional illumination
  • Stainless steel tube field tripod with accessory tray
  • 1 x 4.5 kg counterweight

Weight & Dimensions:

  • Total length: 1000 mm
  • Total width: 1000 mm
  • Total height: 1600 mm
  • Maximum load capacity: 13 kg
  • Net Weight total (incl. accessories): 15kg
  • Net weight mount (incl. accessories): 5 kg

Title: Bresser Messier Nebula EXOS-2 German Equatorial Mount
Body (HTML):
The Bresser EXOS-2 GoTo German Equatorial Mount is a full GOTO mount with tracking motors in both axes that follow celestial objects very precisely and can be accurately controlled using the 'Star Tracker' hand controller.

The Mount and Tripod:

The Bresser Nebula EXOS-2 is a stable mount with a high load capacity and precise tracking for both visual observations and astrophotography. Double radial groove ball bearings in both axes ensure precise, smooth motion, and the RA axis bearing has been optimized to reduce backlash. Additionally, the tripod is reinforced to suppress vibrations further. The Bresser EXOS-2 can be loaded with up to 13kg of optics for purely visual use or approx. 10kg for Astrophotography.

Nebula - the powerful and flexible Goto system:
With the Nebula Goto system you have the option several control methods. You can either operate the mount directly using its own digital Nebula control interface using your smartphone or tablet (iOS and Android supported). Alternatively, you can also use a planetarium software such as Sky Safari.Manual control remains an option as well using the included hand controller for minor corrections or simple control commands.

In addition to this, with the Bresser Nebula Goto Kit, you can connect your laptop or PC directly via WIFI or LAN cable (recommended for faster data transfer) to the Nebula control unit. This not only gives you full control over the mount but also allows you to connect various devices such as cameras, motor focus, filter wheels, etc. directly to the control unit via various USB ports. This eliminates the need to connect each device to your computer via cables. The pre-installed program KStars / EKOS lets you comfortably control all devices from your PC or laptop.

Electronic polar alignment or guiding can also be easily achieved with this Goto Kit, provided you have a camera connected. You are also not just limited to the software of the Nebula control unit. Thanks to the installed ASCOM Alpaca driver, you can use your own programs on your computer to control the mount - whether it's Stellarium or N.I.N.A. The two stepper motors with a belt drive ensure a smooth, direct drive of the two axes. It's only important to make sure you have a good balance on your mount setup.

Mount Features:

  • Stable parallactic mount with fine drive in both axes
  • Ball bearings in both axes for more precise movements
  • Sturdy height-adjustable stainless steel tripod (Min. 69cm / Max. 109.5cm)
  • Load capacity of up to 13kg (10kg Astrophotography)
  • Spirit level for easy horizontal alignment
  • Polar height scale for setting the latitude
  • Tripod weight: 4.7kg
  • Mount weight: 5.6kg (without counterweight)
  • Total weight including counterweight: 14.8kg
  • Batteries: not included

Features of the GOTO System:

  • Belt drive for a more precise, quieter tracking
  • Stepper motors with high resolution (0.36´/microsteps)
  • Hand controller for direct control of the mount
  • Virtual hand controller for smartphones and tablets
  • PC control – ASCOM compatible
  • USB ports for cameras, motors, filter wheels etc.

Whats included:

  1. Bresser EXOS-2 Mount
  2. Polar finder scope with optional illumination
  3. Stainless steel field tripod with accessory tray
  4. 1x 4.5kg counterweight
  5. 2 stepper motors for the axes (RA and DEC)
  6. Raspberry Pi control unit
  7. Basic hand controller
  8. 230V / 12V / 3A power adapter
  9. Connection cable
  10. Manual for download

Title: Vixen Sphinx SXD2 WL German Equatorial Mount & Tripod
Body (HTML):
Vixen has developed a new generation of Wireless Controlled SX mounts for demanding observers and Astrophotographers.

The SXD2WL mount is easily operated via a WiFi module through a smartphone or tablet. The free STAR BOOK Wireless app is available for user-friendly control of the mount and this allows you to easily use practical celestial navigation functions such as automatic GoTo slewing to specific celestial objects via your smartphone or tablet. The mount's power consumption has also been reduced by up to 20% which enables astronomical observations and astrophotography over longer periods, especially in the field when using a Portable power supply.

Once you tap the desired celestial object from a list on the APP, the mount is automatically slewed to bring the object into the telescope's field of view and tracking begins. An existing STAR BOOK TEN control system can also be used on this mount without any problems. Equipped with the same precision stepper motors as the top-of-the-line AXD mount, the SXD2WL brings a new standard of performance and precision to the Vixen mount family and this mount is capable of a Photographic payload of 15kg.

The mount's axis system weighs just 9.2kg , making it ideal for mobile observing . The motors located in the lower part of the mount also act as counterweights, meaning the mount requires less weight for balancing and only larger or longer Telescopes require the use of the counterweight. The massive motor units are installed in the lower part of the declination axis, so the center of gravity of the SXD2 is below the intersection of the RA and DEC axes.

The heart of the SXD2 are the precision stepper motors, which offer better performance and response than previous models. The Micro-Step Motion Control system scores points with its powerful yet very smooth drive characteristics, which are present in both fine movements and fast panning. The bearings on the RA and DEC axes and the worm gears have been significantly improved to reduce the load on the motors. This allows the motors to run much more smoothly than in previous models. High-precision processing technologies also eliminate worm gear errors. The edges of both the worms and worm gears are particularly smooth, enabling extremely precise tracking.

Latitude Adjustment:
The latitude is adjustable between 0 and 70 degrees (divided into 3 zones, each adjustable by +/- 15 degrees, for high, medium, and low latitudes); the latitude scale is scaled in 2-degree increments; fine adjustment is achieved with a tangent screw head, approximately 0.8 degrees per turn.

Built-in PFL-II Polar Finder with Illumination:
The built-in 5x20 mm polar finder with a 10° field of view features a 3-star alignment system, eliminating the hassle of setting the date and time. The illuminated reticle with variable brightness and automatic shutoff is adjustable in 8 levels and illuminated in red. The adjustment accuracy is 3 arc minutes.

The wireless module in detail:
The Vixen WiFi adapter for EQ mounts  allows you to control your Vixen mount via a smartphone or tablet. This allows you to navigate the sky without any cables using the STAR BOOK Wireless smartphone app (free). The app instantly transforms your mobile device into a controller for the equatorial mount. The response time of the mount, which is considered the biggest disadvantage of wireless connections, has been reduced to a level comparable to that of wired solutions.

Operation similar to the STAR BOOK TEN controller:
The STAR BOOK Wireless app is structured in a similar way to that already known from the STAR BOOK TEN controller. Depending on the star map setting, it contains up to 259,000 celestial objects . Tap a celestial object in the object list and start the GoTo. The mount will then automatically move to this target and bring it into the telescope's field of view. You retain all the popular features of the traditional STAR BOOK TEN.

Convenient operation:
While looking through the telescope, you operate the mount by swiping on the app's star map. Since there are no buttons, you can simply glide your finger over the star map and operate the mount conveniently.

Extensive astronomical data included:
This includes data on easily observable celestial bodies such as Messier objects, NGC objects, and IC objects, as well as the sun, moon, planets, comets, and dwarf planets.

High-precision alignment:
Alignment to one or two stars allows you to position the mount quite precisely. Alignment to three or more stars allows for high-precision alignment of the mount for high magnifications. The objects are then moved precisely and centrally in the field of view of your telescope. The alignment information is saved and can be retained even when the device is turned off. By leaving the telescope in its current state without moving it after completing an observation, you can start with the same settings the next time you observe.

Custom setting options:
As with the STAR BOOK TEN control system, the app offers various custom settings such as gear backlash compensation, night mode in red, autoguider, as well as variable GoTo speed and LED brightness. You can also adjust the time of the lens tube reversal (meridian flip) as desired. Even if the object moves south during tracking, you can prevent the telescope tube from reversing.

** Important Note:
The wireless module is not suitable for use on older SX mounts with the old blue Star Book controller.

Technical information for the Wi-Fi module:

  • CPU with 32-bit CISC processor, 120 MHz.
  • The unit connects to the mount via a D-SUB 9-pin connector, similar to the STAR BOOK TEN.
  • It features a 6-pin, 6-wire modular connector for external autoguider operation.
  • Supported operating systems are Android 6 or higher, iOS 9.0 or higher, Wi-Fi standard: IEEE 802.11b/g/n.

  • DEC sprocket: 180 teeth
  • Axle material and diameter: Carbon steel / Dec. 35mm, RA 40mm thickness
  • Polar finder telescope: 6x20 mm, PFL-II polar finder
  • Height fine adjustment: 0° to 70°, (fine adjustment +/- 15°, height)
  • Counterweight rod: 20mm diameter
  • Azimuth adjustment: worm fine adjustment
  • Power supply: DC 12V; 0.4 ~ 1.7A
  • Maximum photographic payload: 15kg (without counterweight)
  • Counterweight: 1x 1.9kg and 1x 3.7kg
  • Tripod mount: 45mm spigot
  • Dimensions: 36cm (H) x 12cm (W) x 36cm (L)
  • Weight: 8.8kg, without counterweight
  • 32-bit CISC processor 120 MHz
  • Operating system: Android 6 or higher, iOS 9.0 or higher
  • Connection: D-SUB 9PIN connector
  • Autoguider input: ST4
  • Power consumption SXD2WL + Wireless unit: DC12V / 0.3 – 2.0A (load 10kg), 0.4 – 2.2A (load 15kg)

Tripod Spec:

  • Robust Aluminium tripod
  • Also suitable for: GP-, SX- & AP mounts
  • Height-adjustable: 81 - 130cm
  • Weight: 5.5kg

  2. Wireless unit
  3. Robust Aluminium tripod

Title: Explore Scientific EXOS2-GT GOTO PMC 8 German Equatorial Mount
Body (HTML):
The Explore Scientific EXOS2-GT PMC-8 GOTO mount has a completely new Goto controller developed according to strict US military standards and functions completely without the use of a hand controller. It consists of a robust Wifi controller unit, which provides all the necessary interfaces to control the mount using a phone app or computer.

The EXOS2-GT PMC-8 mount includes Nema-11 stepper motors which are connected directly to the unit via a cable and an ST-4 compatible autoguider interface is also available. The digital controller also supports a fine microstep operation to ensure extremely precise tracking. The power supply is via 12 volt direct current and the current consumption is a maximum of 1.6 amps at full load. For Wifi control of the mount, tablets, notebooks or desktop PC can be used, that have at least a 7" (17.5cm) display, a functioning Wifi and an operating system using Windows, 8.1, 10, or iOS or Android 4.4 and higher.

The specially developed APP ExploreStars offers a very convenient graphical user interface which also makes controlling the mount and navigating the sky a pleasure. Once initiated, the currently available alignment stars for initial alignment as well as the celestial objects of the database are displayed as a star map with additional and useful text information. The heart of the controller unit consists of a completely self-sufficient 2-channel multi-processor with 8 CPUs and a Wifi Ethernet 10/100 adapter and an IP function, which allows completely remote operation from anywhere via a web browser, ASCOM, and APP or if you prefer not to use the wireless option, you can even connect directly to the mount using a serial port cable. Whats really unique about the system however is Open Goto software which allows the possibility to write your own firmware and load it into the controller unit, therefore, making individual adjustments to the device functions and also creating your own additions to the object lists.

New and unique PMC-8 Remote Goto System:

  • User-friendly and graphically appealing ExploreStars OpenGoto APP
  • Wifi control via tablet, notebook or desktop PC with at least 7" display and Wifi function
  • Operating system of the optional computer or tablet: Windows 8.1,10, or iOS or Android 4.4 and later
  • Classic control via directional key or joystick for guiding, centering, correcting and moving via touchscreen
  • Intuitive 2 star and 3 star alignment to initialize GOTO control
  • Multiprocessor Micro Controller with 8 CPUs (processor cores)
  • Micro-Stepper Motors NEMA-11
  • High-precision and low-noise timing belt drive
  • ST-4 compatible Autoguider interface
  • ASCOM driver available: YES, also supports pulse guiding
  • You can create your own firmware and object lists and load them into the PMC-8
  • GPS compatible / Settings depend on the computer, tablet or smartphone used

Weight & Dimensions:

  • Total length: 100 mm
  • Total width: 100 mm
  • Total height: 160 mm
  • Payload capacity: 13kg (10kg Photographic)
  • Total net weight (incl. accessories): 19.5 kg
  • Net weight mount (incl. accessories): 5 kg
  • Net weight tripod (incl. accessories): 5.5 kg
  • Counterweight: 9 kg

Whats included:

  1. Explore Scientific EXOS2-GT mount with Open GOTO PMC-8
  2. Stainless steel tripod with built-in can level
  3. Counterweight 2 x 4.5 kg
  4. Polar finder with lighting unit
  5. Power supply 12 Volt / 2 Ampere
  6. ExploreStars APP via software download below
  7. This package does not include a Windows 8.1,10 or iOS or Android computer or tablet.

Important Note: Before starting the system for the first time, you must install the ExploreStars app on your display device.

Title: Explore Scientific iEXOS-100 GOTO PMC 8 German Equatorial Tracker Mount
Body (HTML):
The iEXOS-100 is a complete computerized Wifi or Wired GOTO Equatorial Tracker mount with integrated PMC-Eight electronics suitable for attaching a small telescopes or DSLR Camera to a standard Vixen Style Dovetail Plate. The mount also has an ST4 compatible autoguider port for autoguiding if needed.

This lightweight mount is an excellent choice as a grab and go mount with full GOTO capability. Its ideal for very light optics such as small 60mm - 80mm Refractors or as a Star tracker for larger DSLR cameras with larger lenses. It has no hand controller and is completely controlled using a tablet, laptop or desktop computer - either via Wifi or directly wired.

The PMC-Eight with its versatile connections is supported by free downloadable apps for Windows, Android, and iOS ready to connect to your favorite ASCOM Compliant Astronomical Software, allowing you to control the telescope from a few feet away or via an Internet connection from virtually anywhere in the world.

One of the standout features of the iEXOS-100 system is its German equatorial design. When it comes to tracking the stars with a telescope, there is nothing that compares to a German equatorial mount because it will follow objects as they rise in the east and set in the west. Before you can track an object, you need to find it, and that objective can be daunting when you’re faced with a vast expanse of inky black sky. The iEXOS-100 puts a powerful GOTO system at your finger tips that takes the frustration out of navigating the night sky. This integrated version of Explore Scientific’s PMC-Eight™ system transcends the industry standard single processor by utilizing eight CPUs that operate independently of one another to focus on defined functions. This delegation of tasks among the processors results in a system that offers superior responsiveness, efficiency, reliability and astoundingly fast timing intervals for seamless images and accurate tracking.

Although it is internally complex, the GOTO system can be easily operated from your own Apple, Android or Windows tablet using the ExploreStars app, which has an intuitive nature that makes it simple and quick to align your telescope, navigate the stars and learn specifics about tens of thousands of celestial objects. The iEXOS-100 has locking clutches that will let you quickly reposition your telescope from one side to the other and an altitude knob for smooth height adjustments. The mount base includes a small polar alignment tunnel that allows users to roughly align their observing setup with Polaris. It also has a simple bubble level that comes in handy when stabilizing your tripod. Other features include a bracket for holding the battery pack, which powers the PMC-Eight system™ through 8 C batteries (not included); two 1 kg counterweights for balancing; and glow-in-the-dark markers on certain points of the mount and tripod so you can stay oriented with your setup at night.

Important Note:
To start using the ExploreStars app, download the free app and download the celestial data set that contains the astronomical catalogs, reference images, and reference text. Simply by unzipping the ExploreStars folder containing the expanded celestial data set into your Pictures directory, you will expand the native database from a thousand objects to over seventy thousand objects.

Mount Specs:

  • Integrated Explore Scientific PMC-Eight™ Wifi GOTO system
  • Beautiful full graphical user interface using the Explore Stars App
  • Wifi controlled by Tablet, Notebook or Desktop PC with 7" or larger display, and Wifi function (computer device not included)
  • Classic four-button pattern and virtual joystick for guiding, centering, moving and slewing on the touch screen
  • Intuitive 2 star and 3 star alignment procedure
  • Includes a small polar alignment tunnel
  • Standard Vixen Style Dovetail Adapter
  • Astrophotography load capacity - 7kg
  • Multiprocessor Micro Controller with 8 CPU´s
  • Micro-Stepper Motors and worm gears
  • Silent Belt-Drive System
  • Mini-USB port for INDI/ASCOM wired computer connection
  • ST-4 compatible autoguider port
  • INDI and ASCOM Driver available: YES, supports also Pulse-Guiding
  • Glow-in-the-dark markings on mount and tripod
  • Weight mount-head: 4.0 kg ; weight tripod: 2.5 kg

Whats included:

  1. Explore Scientific iEXOS-100 PMC-8 Wifi Goto Mount
  2. Stainless steel tripod with bubble level
  3. Counter weight 2 x 1.0 kg
  4. Battery compartment 12 volts with bracket / (8 x C-Cells not included)
  5. Coil-cord for DEC motor
  6. ExploreStars Software via download for free
  7. Instruction manual

Download the Explore Stars App here

Title: Celestron Equatorial Mount - AVX
Body (HTML):
The Advanced VX Mounts set the standard for medium-sized telescopes. The mount was developed with the requirements of astrophotography  in mind. The Advanced VX offers many of the features of the large Celestron equatorial mounts, and at a very attractive price point.

The Advanced VX is designed as an ideal platform for astrophotography with smaller telescopes (telescopes up to approx. 13kg - depending on the lever). Thanks to PEC (Periodic Error Correction), the periodic worm error that occurs in all mounts with classic worm gears can be compensated for, so that longer-exposure shots are also possible. You can also track objects far beyond the meridian without having to immediately carry out a Meridian Flip. This means you can observe the most interesting part of the sky without any interruption. The Advanced VX also has a much wider base than its predecessor, which further increases stability even with large loads. The improved motors have a higher torque and can better compensate for slight imbalances.

Since spring 2019, it has also included the dual dovetail clamp, so that both telescopes with the small CG5 rail (EQ standard) and the large CGE rail (3" standard) fit on the AVX - without additional adapters! All you have to do is move the clamping screws. Larger telescopes in particular benefit from the wider rail, which offers more stability.

Third-party dovetail plates:
The Advanced VX is still compatible with Vixen format dovetail rails. However, the rail must be at least 100mm long as the clamping points on the new AVX are 90mm apart. If a user wants to use the AVX with a telescope that has a Vixen (or CG-5) dovetail rail that is shorter than 100mm, the rail must be replaced with a longer dovetail rail however suitable rails are also available from us.

The new AVX mount is not compatible with Losmandy D format dovetail rails. The CGE and Losmandy D formats are similar but not identical. Losmandy rails are about a millimeter wider, while CGE plates are deeper and have more surface contact with the dovetail clamp. To use an AVX with a telescope with a Losmandy D dovetail rail, the existing rail must be replaced with a compatible dovetail rail. Suitable rails are available from us.

Solid cast parts and heavy-duty mechanics:
Based on the proven Advanced GT mount, the Advanced VX not only offers large, easy-to-grip adjustment screws as well as more powerful motors that can cope better with unevenly distributed loads, but it also has a wider base for the tripod connection and an improved dual dovetail mount with two clamping screws. No premature tilting! Tracking is also possible up to 20° beyond the meridian passage.

State-of-the-art software:
The AVX mount is supplied with the cold-resistant, much more powerful NexStar+ hand controller. This means you have a modern computer control system at your disposal - with over 40,000 objects and multi-lingual navigation menu. Thanks to the built-in clock, setting up is even faster than before. The software automatically moves to the reference stars, you only have to center them in the eyepiece. Even the sun can serve as a reference object.

Advanced VX mounts can be also controlled via Celestron PWI Telescope Control Software via the PC connection on the hand controller

Orientation made easy:
With the AVX, you no longer have to laboriously adjust to the North Star using the polar finder scope: Align the mount roughly to the north, perform a 2-star alignment - and then call up the All-Star Polar Alignment. The software will then help you to align the mount precisely to the north, even if you cannot see the North Star. You can look comfortably through the telescope and do not have to kneel under the polar finder scope (which is still available as an option).

Versatile expandable:
In addition to a USB port on the hand controller, the AVX also has an autoguider input and two AUX ports. Here you can connect additional, separately available expansion modules - for example the SkyPortal WiFi module for control via WLAN with iPhone/iPad/Windows PC or the StarSense module , with which the mount automatically moves to its reference stars and centers them perfectly.

Experienced photographers will appreciate how easily this mount can be transported to a dark observing site. If you are new to astronomy or astrophotography, the Advanced VX will make it easy to get started and will serve you well for many years to come.

Mount Spec:

  • Alignment Methods: 2-Star Align, 1-Star Align, Solar System Align, Last Alignment, Quick Align
  • Database: 40,000+ objects, 100 custom programmable objects. Improved information on over 200 objects
  • Counterweights: 1 x 5.4kg (12lbs)
  • Mount: Equatorial mount (motorized)
  • Mount weight: 7.71 kg (17 lbs)
  • Mount control: Computer controlled (GOTO)
  • Tracking speeds: Sidereal, Solar and Lunar
  • Tracking modes: EQ North & EQ South
  • PPEC: Yes
  • Dovetail compatible: Dual dovetail rail (CG-5 and CGE plate)
  • Panning speed: 9 pan speeds - maximum speed 4°/second
  • Features: Celestron's Starry Night Special Edition Software, SkyPortal App
  • Max load capacity: 13.6 kg (30 lbs)
  • Hand control box: NexStar+ hand controller with LCD display, 19 fiber optic backlit LED buttons
  • Motor drive: DC Servo Motors
  • Power requirements: 12V DC 3.5A

Whats included:

  1. Incl. accessories: Advanced VX Mount Head, Tripod, Accessory Compartment, 1 x 5.4 kg Counterweight, NexStar+ Hand Controller, DC Power Cable (connects to the cigarette lighter).

Title: Celestron Equatorial Mount - CGEM II
Body (HTML):
As the successor to the popular CGEM mount, the CGEM II has a modern design and also supports the larger Celestron Schmidt-Cassegrains (up to 11") safely and vibration-free, which is ideal for photographic use as well as for visual observations.

With a payload of up to 18 kg and a slewing speed of up to 5° per second, you can quickly target any object in the database.

The innovations of CGEM II include

  • A dovetail clamp for two sizes (44mm for Vixen/Celestron (CG-5) and CGE/3-inch,
  • 2" heavy-duty tripod legs with height marking,
  • A hand controller with USB 2.0 for connection to a PC,
  • Permanent screw error correction (PEC): The periodic screw error can be compensated by software
  • An autoguider connection
  • The ability to track beyond the meridian so that observations of the most interesting part of the sky are not interrupted

Title: Celestron Equatorial Mount - CGX
Body (HTML):
The CGX mount looks similar to the CGEM-II at first glance, but it has been completely redesigned and offers many more advances in both reliability and performance. This 20kg mount actually has a real photographic payload of 25kg.

Thanks to the large carrying handles, it is even easier to transport than a comparable, slightly lighter classic parallactic mount and it also comes with the dual dovetail clamp for CG-5 (Vixen, Celestron) or CGE (3-inch), you can easily switch between small solar telescopes and large Schmidt-Cassegrains, for example. To make this suitable for photography too, the mount has been given more powerful, responsive motors that are connected to the axes via a sturdy toothed belt. This means that the mount responds almost immediately to control commands, even from an autoguider. There is no play in the gears, and since the worm gears are also spring-loaded, the play is largely eliminated - you do not have to readjust even in the event of large temperature differences, as the worms and gears have optimal contact.

The new, large screws are easy to grip, so you can loosen or tighten them easily even when wearing gloves - the polar height adjustment has also been revised so that you can easily adjust the mount even when it is fully loaded. A polar finder is available available as an option, but is generally unnecessary: ​​With the All-Star Polaralign you can align the mount to any brighter star through the telescope, and for perfection, the Polaralign option has always been superior to the standard polar finder. As a special feature, you can move the mount on the base plate of the extra-wide tripod head - this allows you to position the center of gravity perfectly over the tripod, for the entire usable latitude range from 3 to 65° north or south latitude.

As a photographic mount, it is just as suitable for mobile use as it is for remote operation. Internal sensors ("switches") automatically bring the mount into the home position and prevent it from moving too far and hitting something when panning. The internal cabling also serves to ensure safety: all connections (power, hand controller, AUX and autoguider) are in the base of the mount and do not move with it.

The hand controller can be controlled in the traditional way via ASCOM and the hand controller (with USB connection) via PC, or you can use the control software included as a download, which was developed together with Planewave Instruments. Multipoint GoTo modeling, plate solving and control of the focuser are just a few functions that you normally have to add for remote operation - with the CGX this software is included.

Improved tripod:

  1. Wider tripod head for more stability
  2. Position of the mount head on the tripod is adjustable to optimally place the center of gravity above the tripod and to optimally utilize the large latitude range of 3-65°
  3. Dual dovetail mount for CG-5/EQ and CGE/3" standard
  4. 2" heavy-duty steel tripod with markings for quick height adjustment
  5. Universal tray with recesses for three 1.25" eyepieces, two 2" eyepieces, a smartphone or other accessories
  6. Tripod legs can be folded without removing the accessory tray

Improved ergonomics:

  1. Two handles for easier transport and assembly
  2. Non-slip clamps for dovetail clamping
  3. Innovative and improved system for north alignment
  4. Revised adjustment mechanism for the polar height, even with a fully loaded mount.

Improved Electronics:

  1. NexStar+ hand controller with USB connection
  2. Two AUX sockets, e.g. for control via WiFi with optional SkyPortal module or automatic alignment with StarSense module (both modules are available separately but are not included, these can be purchased seperately)
  3. USB 2.0 socket for direct connection to a PC
  4. Autoguider connection
  5. PPEC Ready - for automatic correction of periodic screw error
  6. 12V power connection
  7. Internal Real Time Clock

Mount Spec:

  • Mount: Equatorial mount (motorized)
  • Mount weight (EQ): 20kg
  • Mount control: Computer controlled (GOTO)
  • Tracking speeds: Sidereal, Solar and Lunar
  • Pole height adjustment: 3º-65º
  • Panning speed: 5º/sec (4º/sec is standard)
  • Features: New PC software to control the telescope
  • Payload capacity (kg): 25kg

Whats included:

  1. Incl. accessories: CGX Mount Head, Tripod, Accessory Tray, 1 x Counterweight.

Title: Celestron Equatorial Mount - CGX L
Body (HTML):
The CGX-L mount is the big brother of the CGX and has a very large payload capacity of up to 34kg - enough for even the largest Observatory grade Telescopes and accessories. With a weight of less than 24kg for the mount and 21kg for the tripod, it is still possible to transport thanks to the large carry handles and modular design.

The CGX-L was developed for small observatories and remote operations, with a focus on a good payload-to-weight ratio, a compact design and innovative details for the use of large telescopes, photo equipment and the latest wireless accessories.

A key role is played by the generously dimensioned 144mm worm gears, which enable smoother running even with heavy telescopes, and the dovetail clamp, which has been extended to 270mm also holds large telescopes securely. For remote operation, there are optical sensors for the home and limit positions, simplified settings for north alignment and improved cable routing. There are also mechanical and ergonomic improvements that make the mount even more stable, user-friendly and transportable.

With the dual dovetail clamp for CG-5 (Vixen, Celestron) or CGE (3-inch), you can easily switch between smaller telescopes and large Schmidt-Cassegrains, for example. For Astrophotography, the mount has powerful responsive motors that are connected to the axes via a sturdy toothed belt. This means the mount responds almost immediately to control commands, even from an autoguider. There is no play in the gears, and since the worm gears are also spring-loaded, the play is largely eliminated - you don't have to readjust even when there are large temperature differences, the worms and gears have optimal contact.

The large screws are easy to grip, so you can loosen or tighten them easily even when wearing gloves - the polar height adjustment has also been redesigned so that you can easily adjust the mount even when it is fully loaded. A polar finder is available as an option, but is generally unnecessary: ​​With the All-Star Polaralign you can align the mount to any brighter star through the telescope, and for perfection, the Polaralign function has always been superior to the standard polar finder. As a special feature, you can move the mount on the base plate of the extra-wide tripod head - this allows you to position the center of gravity perfectly over the tripod, for the entire usable latitude range from 3 to 65° north or south latitude.

As a photographic mount, it is just as suitable for mobile use as it is for remote operation. Internal sensors ("switches") automatically bring the mount into the home position and prevent it from moving too far and hitting something when panning. The internal cabling also serves to ensure safety: all connections (power, hand controller, AUX and autoguider) are in the base of the mount and do not move with it.

The hand controller can be controlled in the traditional way via ASCOM and the hand controller (with USB connection) via PC, or you can use the control software included as a download in the scope of delivery, which was developed together with Planewave Instruments. Multipoint GoTo modeling, plate solving and control of the focuser are just a few functions that you normally have to add for remote operation - with the CGX this software is included in the scope of delivery. Here you do not need the hand controller, but can use the USB connection on the mount directly.

Mount features at a glance:

  1. Compact, low-profile mounting head for greater stability and better portability. More stable and rigid with shorter settling time.
    Improved motors with more torque for better swiveling and tracking even with heavy loads
  2. Heavy-duty toothed belts minimize gear play and enable short reaction times even with heavy loads
  3. Viewing windows in the motor housings show the activity of the drives
  4. Spring-loaded worm gears made of measurement and stainless steel reduce friction and increase the accuracy of fit
  5. Internal wiring, power and lower connectors do not move when the mount pans
  6. Home and limit switches – internal hardware stops for RA and Dec to avoid cable clutter and collisions with the tripod
  7. Internal optical sensors on both axes for easy and safe remote operation
  8. Home sensors allow the mount to always return to the home position, regardless of the position it was in before the power was interrupted
  9. Limit sensors automatically interrupt tracking or panning before the mechanical stops are reached
  10. Includes the sophisticated PWI control software developed in conjunction with Planewave Instruments. Handles multi-point go-to modeling, focusing and plate solving. No additional control software is required, saving you hundreds of euros!
    Software-assisted polar alignment: "All-Star Polar Alignment" enables quick and very precise polar alignment. Use any bright star without additional accessories or apps.
  11. Position of the mount head on the tripod is adjustable to optimally place the center of gravity above the tripod and to optimally utilize the large latitude range of 3-65°
  12. Dual dovetail mount for CG-5/EQ/Vixen and CGE/3" standard
  13. Tracks up to 20º on either side of the meridian, supports SkyPortal WiFi and StarSense AutoAlign modules.
  14. Tripod legs can be folded without removing the accessory tray.
  15. Revised tripod with larger spread angle for more stability. The minimum height of the tripod has been lowered due to popular demand

Improved ergonomics:

  • Two handles for easier transport and assembly
  • Non-slip clamps for dovetail clamping
  • Innovative and improved system for north alignment
  • Revised polar altitude adjustment mechanism, even when the mount is fully loaded. A stationary polar altitude adjustment knob with a newly developed connection system reduces friction when aligning the mount to the north. A revised azimuth adjustment with low-friction Teflon bearings makes it easier to align a fully loaded mount to the north.
  • Easy-to-read latitude scale

Electronics:

  1. NexStar+ hand controller with USB connection
  2. USB 2.0 socket for direct connection to a PC with the PWI software
  3. 2 x autoguider connectors for optimal cable management
  4. PEC sensor, PPEC Ready - for automatic correction of periodic screw error
  5. 12V power connection
  6. Internal Real Time Clock

Mount Spec:

  • Mount: Equatorial mount (motorized)
  • Mount weight (EQ): approx. 23.8 kg (52.6 lb)
  • Mount control: Computer controlled (GOTO)
  • Tracking speeds: Sidereal, Solar and Lunar
  • Pole height adjustment: 3º-65º
  • Panning speed: 4º/second (3º/second is standard)
  • Features: Celestron PlaneWave Instruments
  • Carrying capacity: 34kg (75lb)
  • Mount type: Parallactic mount

Whats included:

  1. Incl. accessories: CGX L Mount Head, Tripod, Accessory Tray, 1 x Counterweight, DC Power Cable (plugs into cigarette lighter socket)

Title: ZWO AM3 Harmonic Mount Head + Carbon Fiber Tripod
Body (HTML):
ZWO AM3 Harmonic Equatorial Mount - GoTo Travel Mount - Mount Head. The traditional equatorial mount requires heavy counterweights. It can be difficult to keep balance in RA and DEC directions, and can be also inconvenient for transit and storage.

To solve the above issues, ZWO developed the ASI Mount series. No need for a counterweight. With a self-weight of 3.9kg, AM3 has a large load capacity from 8kg to 13kg. While portability is very important, stability is also essential in use. The internal structure of the body is optimized with a strain wave gear reducer and synchronous belt, bringing more accurate control and an amazing reduction ratio of 300:1. It is also multi-functional and can be used as both an equatorial mount or an altazimuth mount. You can either control the mount via Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, or a hand controller.

Portable and stable:
The internal structure of the body is optimized with the strain wave gear reducer and synchronous belt, bringing more accurate control and an amazing reduction ratio of 300:1.

Customized Strain Wave Gear:
ZWO developed the special strain wave gear based on the actual needs for astrophotography. It comes with very low periodic error and high torque. Each mount is tested and equipped with an exclusive PE curve before it leaves the factory so that the quality can be guaranteed.

Payload capacity:

  • The load capacity of AM3 without the counterweight is 8kg, and 13kg with the counterweight.
  • Supported counterweight: 5kg - The counterweight should be secured on a counterweight bar of no more than 25 cm in length.

Versatile:

  • Equatorial Mode / Altazimuth Mode can be switched via ASI Mount App or hand controller.
  • Equatorial Mode: Suitable for tracking and photographing objects
  • Altazimuth Mode: Suitable for visual astronomy

All-round 0°-90° Pitch Angle:
Gear 1: Allow you to adjust the pitch angle grip to achieve a degree between 0 and 60.
Gear 2: You can loosen the hex-head screw and then adjust the pitch angle grip to achieve a degree between 30 and 90.

Rocker-style Hand Controller:
Comfortable touch and easy to use. Integrated with a Wi-Fi network allowing for wireless control. You can easily upgrade the firmware of the hand controller and mount on the ZWO webpage.

Title: ZWO AM5N Harmonic Mount + Carbon Fiber Tripod
Body (HTML):
The ZWO "Harmonic Equatorial Mount AM5" is a transportable mount designed specifically for astrophotography. The mount itself weighs less than 5kg but can carry telescopes up to 15kg without counterweight. With counterweight and the counterweight rod (optional) the mount can then carry telescopes up to 20kg in weight. Several years of development and various patents have gone into this exciting new mount and the results speak for themselves.

So many functions and easy operation:
The AM5 can be operated equatorially or azimuthally. For astrophotography, the equatorial mode is normally used and the mount must be aligned as accurately as possible with the celestial pole. For visual observing or lunar and planetary photography, the altazimuth mode is more than sufficient. The status indicator always shows in which mode the mount is: Red represents equatorial mode and green represents altazimuth mode so its easy to identify at a glance.

No more counterweights needed:
Normally, German equatorial mounts need counterweights to balance the telescope weight and this is the only way to ensure proper operation. However the AM5 uses robotics technology and it does not require counterweights for telescopes up to 15kg. This makes the AM5 lighter, more compact and easier to operate. Only for heavier telescopes up to a maximum of 20kg, then we recommend using counterweights to keep mount and tripod in balance.

Smooth tracking is guaranteed:
ZWO checks and measures every AM5 mount before delivery and guarantees a periodic error ("PE") of less than +/-20 arc seconds and in addition to this the periodic error occurs very slowly, so that the autoguider has enough time to correct it. Via ASIAIR or another software the PE can also be reduced electronically.

Useable anywhere on Earth:
As you would expect from a true travel mount, the AM5 can be used anywhere on Earth, from the equator to the poles and the compact design of the mount means it has room in any medium sized luggage case.

Polar alignment of the mount for astrophotography:
In equatorial mode, the mount needs to be aligned exactly with the celestial north or south pole but small errors are of course corrected by autoguiding. Aligning the mount can also be done quickly and easily with the ASIAIR or other suitable software.

No more control cables thanks to WiFi:
All functions of the mount can also be controlled via smartphone when coupled with the ASIAIR for example. With the ASIAIR, everything from the camera to autoguiding and to the mount itself can be controlled via the ASI app using a smartphone or tablet. The mount can also be separately operated with the hand controller without a smartphone if preferred.

Supports cable management to prevent cable entanglement:
The saddle plate now integrates DC output and Type-C port to effectively prevent cable entanglement. The unique design ensures that the internal cables will not be twisted and worn when the DEC rotates.

Important notes:

There is an ASIAIR finder shoe attached on to the side of the AM5 which is meant for attaching a polar finder scope. This finder shoe is not suitable for mounting an ASIAIR as both the cables and the antenna of the ASIAIR can be crushed during movement.

If you want to attach this finder shoe to a different location on the mount which is more suitable, such as on the side of the Losmandy / Vixen dovetail saddle plate, then make sure not to over tighten the Hex screws fully into the side panel or you will damage the insert threads. Keep the length of the inner threads between 3-5 mm.

Newer mounts have M4x3.5mm screws screwed into the saddle plate, these go into the side panel when the finder shoe is attached to the saddle plate along with the M4 x 8mm screws (it will not hold with the shorter screws).

Mount Spec:

  • Mount type: German equatorial mount
  • Operating mode:    Altazimuth or equatorial
  • Gear system: Harmonic Drive
  • Periodic error:    less than +/- 10" - passing time 288 seconds
  • RA Motor: Stepper motor - Synchonous belt + 17 type 100 reduction ratio strain
  • wave gear + brake
  • DEC Motor: Stepper motor - Synchonous belt + 17 type 100 reduction ratio strain
  • wave gear + brake
  • Maximum load capacity: 15kg without counterweights - 20 kg with counterweights
  • Weight of the mount head: 5 kg
  • Operating range: 0° to 90° north / south latitude
  • Telescope mount: Losmandy and Vixen style quick coupling
  • Connection for counterweight rod: M12 x 1.75 female thread
  • Connection on the tripod sinde:    3/8" phototripod thread
  • Maximum adjustment speed: 6° per second
  • Correction speeds: 0.5x, 1x, 2x, 4x, 8x, 20x, 60x, 720x and 1440x
  • Power supply: 12 V - max 3 A (with GoTo) - DC 5.5-2.1
  • Autoguiding: ST4 port
  • Communication: USB/Wi-Fi/Bluetooth

Tripod Spec:

  • Material: Metal & Carbon Fiber
  • Weight: 2.3 kg
  • Max Payload: 50kg
  • Transport length: 500mm
  • Working height: 470 to 800mm
  • Diameter of legs: 40/36 mm
  • Compatibility: ZWO AM5, AM3, iOptron GEM40/45, Rainbow Astro 135E, Skywatcher AZ-GTi

  1. AM5 mount head
  2. Hand controller and cable
  3. Carbon Fiber Tripod (+ Weight Bag for securing heavier Telescopes)

Title: Vixen Sphinx SXP2 Professional German Equatorial Mount & CF Tripod
Body (HTML):
The new SXP2 mount features larger bearings in order to increase the accuracy and load capacity. The mounting housing is made from a stronger material than the previous SX mounts and the equatorial head is clamped into a fork in order to increase the stability of the polar alignment wedge.

Precise tracking with P-PEC function:
The SXP2 mount comes with the modern StarBook 10 control system. This includes a P-PEC function for precise tracking. PEC stands for “Periodic Error Corrections” and corrects errors in the mechanics which lead to periodic errors in the gear systems. The P-PEC function, which is based on the PEC function, is designed for the SXP2 equatorial mount. The P-PEC function saves the records of corrections, even after the power supply to the mount has been switched off. It is not necessary to re-enter the data each time, which enables a quicker setup and more precise tracking.

The belt drive system minimizes backlash and noise:
Conventional motor-driven systems on equatorial mounts use gear wheels, which are driven by the motor. However, this design generates backlash under the gear wheels, which can lead to inaccuracies. To avoid these errors, the drive was converted to a belt drive system. This drastically reduces the backlash of the gear unit, as well as the noise generated by the drive system. It also ensures a quicker reaction when corrections are required.

16 bearings:
The mechanical parts contain a total of 16 bearings. The SXP2 mount uses a set of tapered roller bearings for the RA axis in order to provide additional stability for more precise tracking.

Stable polar alignment wedge:
The SXP2 mount uses the same fork as the heavy AXJ mount. This new construction enables a quick and stable configuration of the latitude setting.

Simple and precise polar alignment via reference star:
The 6x20 polar finder scope is pre-installed. This allows the user to configure the polar alignment (for both the northern and southern hemispheres). The polar finder scope has a variable illuminated reticle with an automatic power-off function. The brightness can be adjusted in 8 levels so that the user can configure the desired brightness. The polar finder scope can be configured directly via three reference stars and can reach an accuracy of up to 3 arc minutes.

Variable mount head:
The mount head has a diameter of 35 mm and features 8 threaded holes for M8 screws spaced at 45 degrees. An optional accessory tray can be attached to the mount head directly or in combination with an optional mounting wedge for dovetail plates. The threaded holes on the mounting head can also be used to mount rails from other manufacturers.

Modern StarBook 10 controller with high-resolution colour display and built-in star chart:
The StarBook 10 controller is a modern control system with a high-resolution colour monitorand the system contains more than 272,000 celestial objects, including 260,000 stars from the SAO catalogue, 109 Messier objects, 7840 NGC objects and 5380 IC objects, as well the soon, moon and planets. Objects can be accessed by name, and information such as images and data can be defined separately.

A combination of innovative, elegant design and user-friendly features:
The improved design of the stable and rigid mount body, which features precise tracking with a P-PEC function and the STAR BOOK TEN controller, offers a highly precise, easy to use mount that is guaranteed to please astrophotographers and observers.

Special motor mount for lighter counterweight:
The heavy RA and DEC motor units are built into the bottom of the declination axis to ensure that the centre of gravity of the equatorial head is below the RA and DEC axis. This enables the declination body to function as a counterweight. Thanks to the flat mounting head, the mount can be balanced with a significantly lighter counterweight.

Retractable counterweight bar:
The counterweight bar is made from solid stainless steel with a thickness of 20 mm, and enables the use of all counterweights from the SX and GP mount series. The counterweight bar is housed in the declination body.

High Strength Carbon Fiber Tripod:
Despite being developed for heavy mounts, the Vixen ASG CB90 carbon tripod is one of the lightest tripods on the market. The hand nuts can be loosened to extend the tripod by one section. The legs of the ASG CB90 tripod can be secured by a reliable screw cap and are equipped with a 2.5 cm interval scale marking.

Specs:

  • Mount Type: German Equatorial Mount
  • Max Payload: 25kg (17kg Astrophotography)
  • RA Sprocket: 73.2 mm Ø brass wheel with 180 teeth
  • DEC sprocket: 73.2 mm Ø brass wheel with 180 teeth
  • Worm shaft: 9 mm Ø brass shaft
  • RA and DEC axis: 40 mm Ø carbon steel bearing, 16 bearings
  • Counterweight bar: 20 mm Ø RA
  • Setting circles: 0.1 minute steps (with StarBook 10)
  • Polar finder scope: PF-L Polar Scope 6x20mm
  • Stepper motors: 250 PPS speed maximum 1000x sidereal rate
  • Power connection: DC 12 V, 0.45-2.2 A
  • Dimensions: 386mm x 419mm x 128 mm
  • Weight of equatorial head: 13.3 kg without counterweight
  • Counterweight: 3.7 kg
Whats included:
  • 3.7 kg counterweight
  • SXP2 Mount
  • Vixen high strength carbon fiber Tripod
  • StarBook 10 controller

    Download the Vixen SXP2 Mount Manual here

Title: Vixen Sphinx SXD2 WL Delux German Equatorial Mount
Body (HTML):
Vixen has developed a new generation of SX mounts for demanding observers and astrophotographers. 

The SXD2 WL mount is simply operated via a Wifi module with a smartphone or tablet. By controlling the mount with your smartphone using the free Star Book Ten Wireless app, you can easily use sky navigation functions such as automatic GoTo panning of celestial objects via your smartphone or tablet. By eliminating the power consumption of the conventional LCD (STAR BOOK TEN), the power consumption on the mount is reduced by up to 20%, thus enabling longer astronomical observation and astrophotography. 

When the desired celestial object is selected from a list, it is automatically panned into the telescope's field of view and tracking begins.  An existing Star Book Ten controller can also be used on this mount without any problems. The mount is equipped with the same precision stepper motors as the top model - the AXD mount, and the SXD2 WL brings a whole new standard of performance and precision to the Vixen mount family. 

With a photographic load capacity of 15kg, the axis cross of the mount weighs just 9.2kg making it ideal for mobile observations. In addition, the motors are mounted in the lower part of the mount and therefore also serve as a counterweight, so the mount requires fewer weights for balancing. 

The SXD2 mount in detail:

Precision stepper motors and micro-step motion control system 
At the heart of the SXD2 are the precision stepper motors, which offer better performance and response than previous models. The micro-step motion control system offers powerful and yet very smooth drive characteristics, which are given both in fine movements and in fast pans. Built-in bearings The bearings of the RA and DEC axes and the worm shafts have been significantly improved to reduce the load on the motors. As a result, the motors move much more smoothly than in previous models. 

High-precision worm gears High-precision processing technologies eliminate worm gear errors. The edges of the two worms and worm wheels are particularly smooth, enabling very precise tracking. Declination axis as counterweight The solid motor units are installed in the lower part of the declination axis so that the center of gravity of the SXD2 is below the intersection point of the RA and DEC axes. This means you need fewer additional counterweights. 

Latitude setting The latitude is adjustable between 0 and 70 degrees (divided into 3 zones and adjustable +/- 15 degrees per zone, for high, medium and low latitudes); latitude scale in 2-degree increments; fine adjustment with a tangent screw head, approx. 0.8 degrees per turn. 

Built-in PFL-II polar finder with illumination:
The built-in 5x20mm polar finder with 10° field of view has a 3-star alignment system. This eliminates the inconvenience of setting the date and original time. The illuminated reticle with variable brightness and automatic switch-off is adjustable in 8 levels and illuminated in red. The adjustment accuracy is 3 arc minutes. 

The wireless module in detail:
The Vixen Wifi adapter for EQ mounts allows you to control your Vixen mount via a smartphone or tablet. With the smartphone app Star Book Wireless (free of charge) you can navigate the sky without any cables. The app turns your smartphone or tablet into a control unit for the equatorial mount in no time at all. The response delay of the mount, which is considered the biggest disadvantage of wireless connections, has been reduced to a level comparable to wired connections. 

Reduced power consumption compared to conventional controllers with LCD monitor 
The power consumption of the mount is reduced by up to 20%, allowing longer observations than with conventional wired controllers such as the STAR BOOK TEN. 

Operation similar to the Star Book Ten controller: 
The Star Book Wireless app has a similar structure to the Star Book Ten controller. Depending on the star map setting, it contains up to 259,000 celestial objects. Tap on a celestial object in the object list and start the GoTo. The mount will now automatically move to this target and bring it into the telescope's field of view. All the popular features of the Star Book Ten are retained 

Convenient operation:
When looking through the telescope operate the mount by swiping on the app's star chart. As there are no buttons, simply slide your finger over the star chart to operate the mount conveniently. 

Extensive astronomical data included:
In addition to data on easily observable celestial bodies such as Messier objects, NGC objects and IC objects, this also includes the sun, moon, planets, comets and dwarf planets. 

High-precision alignment:
By aligning the mount to one or two stars, you can already achieve fairly precise positioning. By aligning the mount to three or more stars, you can achieve high-precision alignment of the mount for high magnifications. The objects are then approached precisely and centrally in your telescope's field of view. The alignment information is saved and can be retained even when the device is switched off. By leaving the telescope in its current state after completing an observation without moving it, you can start the automatic installation with the same settings for the next observation.  

Individual setting options: 
As with the Star Book Ten control unit, the app offers various individual settings, such as gear backlash compensation, night mode in red, autoguider and variable GoTo speed and LED brightness. You can also set the timing of the reversal of the objective tube (meridian flip) as desired. Even if the object moves to the south during tracking, you can prevent the telescope tube from reversing. 

Important note: Cannot be used on old SX mounts with the old blue Star Book! 

Technical information about the Wifi module: CPU with 32-bit CISC processor 120 MHz The unit is connected to the mount via a D-SUB 9PIN connector as with the STAR BOOK TEN. It has a 6-pin 6-wire modular plug for external autoguider operation. Supported operating systems are Android 6 or higher, iOS 9.0 or higher, WLAN standard: IEEE 802.11b/g/n. 

Mount Features:

  • RA sprocket: 180 teeth 
  • DEC sprocket: 180 teeth 
  • Shaft material and diameter: Carbon steel / Decl. 35mm, RA 40mm thickness 
  • Polar finder scope: 6x20mm, PFL-II polar finder 
  • Fine height adjustment: 0° to 70°, (fine adjustment +/- 15°, height) 
  • Backsight rod: 20mm diameter 
  • Azimuth adjustment: worm fine adjustment 
  • Power supply: DC12 V; 0.4~1.7 A 
  • Maximum load: 15kg, photographic - without counterweight 
  • Counterweight: 1x 1.9kg and 1x 3.7kg 
  • Tripod connection: 45mm spigot 
  • Dimensions: 36cm (H) x 12cm (W) x 36cm (L) Weight: 8.8kg (19.4 lb), without counterweight 
  • 32-bit CISC processor 120 MHz
  • Operating system: Android 6 or higher, iOS 9.0 or higher 
  • Connection: D-SUB 9PIN connector 
  • Autoguider input ST4 
  • Power consumption SXD2WL+Wireless unit: DC12V / 0.3-2.0 A (load 10 kg), 0.4-2.2 A (load 15 kg) 

Whats included:

  1. SXD2WL EQ mount 
  2. Wireless unit 
  3. 2 counterweights: 1.9 kg and 3.7 kg 
  4. Mounting tools
  5. Pole finder PFL-II 
  6. Cigarette lighter cable

Title: Vixen AXJ German Equatorial Mount
Body (HTML):
Designed as a complement to the AXD2 equatorial mount, the AXJ mount offers outstanding durability and precision and is the perfect mount for Professional Astronomers and Astrophotographers looking for a high payload, extremely accurate mount drive.

Periodic errors on mounts are usually measured and corrected by the user. Unlike the old StarBook controller, the StarBook 10 controller saves these errors permanently. The periodic error of the mount is measured in the factory (total of 12 points per 30 degrees worm gear) and corrected before delivery. This is known as V-PEC and functions automatically as soon as you use the mount. It delivers an accuracy of +/- 4.0 arc seconds. You can increase the tracking accuracy further by saving your own recorded periodic errors.

Vixen uses a new belt-drive system in the AXJ mount and the gear drive was replaced with a toothed belt. This gives the mount a quicker reaction time and lower backlash and also helps to minimize noise. The 6x20 polar finder scope is pre-installed into the mount. This allows the user to configure the polar alignment (for both the northern and southern hemispheres). The polar finder scope has a variable illuminated reticle with an automatic power-off function. The brightness can be adjusted in 8 levels so that the user can configure the desired brightness.

The mount has 2 bearing sets (4 pieces) which are used for the shaft of the RA axis. Thanks to the newly developed EQ design, the AXJ mount has a higher load capacity of 22 kg. As the motors, worm shaft and worm gear are located in the lower part of the mount, fewer counterweights are required than with conventional mounts and with some smaller OTA's no counterweight at all is required.

The StarBook 10 controller:
The StarBook 10 system contains more than 272,000 celestial objects, including 260,000 stars from the SAO catalogue, 109 Messier objects, 7840 NGC objects and 5380 IC objects, as well the soon, moon and planets. Objects can be accessed by name, and information such as images and data can be defined separately.

Mount Specs:

  • Mount Type: German Equatorial
  • Max Payload: 27kg (22kg Astrophotography)
  • Accuracy of +/-4.0 arc seconds with V-PEC
  • V-PEC (Vixen-Permanent Periodic Error Correction)
  • Belt drive system (prevents backlash and minimizes noise)
  • 14 ball bearings
  • Polar alignment (variable fork fix type)
  • Polar finder with reference star alignment
  • StarBook 10 controller with autoguider input
  • Retractable counterweight bar
  • Net Mount Weight: 17.4 kg
Whats included:
  • AXJ mount
  • Starbook Ten controller
  • 2 counterweights (3.7 kg and 1.5 kg)
  • Note: Tripod not included.

Download the AXJ Mount Manual here

In addition to data on easily observable celestial bodies such as Messier objects, NGC objects and IC objects, this also includes the sun, moon, planets, comets and dwarf planets. 

High-precision alignment:
By aligning the mount to one or two stars, you can already achieve fairly precise positioning. By aligning the mount to three or more stars, you can achieve high-precision alignment of the mount for high magnifications. The objects are then approached precisely and centrally in your telescope's field of view. The alignment information is saved and can be retained even when the device is switched off. By leaving the telescope in its current state after completing an observation without moving it, you can start the automatic installation with the same settings for the next observation.  

Individual setting options:
As with the Star Book Ten control unit, the app offers various individual settings, such as gear backlash compensation, night mode in red, autoguider and variable GoTo speed and LED brightness. You can also set the timing of the reversal of the objective tube (meridian flip) as desired. Even if the object moves to the south during tracking, you can prevent the telescope tube from reversing. 

Important note: Cannot be used on old SX mounts with the old blue Star Book! 

Technical information about the Wifi module: CPU with 32-bit CISC processor 120 MHz. The unit is connected to the mount via a D-SUB 9PIN connector as with the STAR BOOK TEN. It has a 6-pin 6-wire modular plug for external autoguider operation. Supported operating systems are Android 6 or higher, iOS 9.0 or higher, WLAN standard: IEEE 802.11b/g/n.
