Title: ZWO AM3 Harmonic Mount Head
Body (HTML):
ZWO AM3 Harmonic Equatorial Mount - GoTo Travel Mount - Mount Head. The traditional equatorial mount requires heavy counterweights. It can be difficult to keep balance in RA and DEC directions, and can be also inconvenient for transit and storage.

To solve the above issues, ZWO developed the ASI Mount series. No need for a counterweight. With a self-weight of 3.9kg, AM3 has a large load capacity from 8kg to 13kg. While portability is very important, stability is also essential in use. The internal structure of the body is optimized with a strain wave gear reducer and synchronous belt, bringing more accurate control and an amazing reduction ratio of 300:1. It is also multi-functional and can be used as both an equatorial mount or an altazimuth mount. You can either control the mount via Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, or a hand controller.

Portable and stable:
The internal structure of the body is optimized with the strain wave gear reducer and synchronous belt, bringing more accurate control and an amazing reduction ratio of 300:1.

Customized Strain Wave Gear:
ZWO developed the special strain wave gear based on the actual needs for astrophotography. It comes with very low periodic error and high torque. Each mount is tested and equipped with an exclusive PE curve before it leaves the factory so that the quality can be guaranteed.

Payload capacity:

  • The load capacity of AM3 without the counterweight is 8kg, and 13kg with the counterweight.
  • Supported counterweight: 5kg - The counterweight should be secured on a counterweight bar of no more than 25 cm in length.

Versatile:

  • Equatorial Mode / Altazimuth Mode can be switched via ASI Mount App or hand controller.
  • Equatorial Mode: Suitable for tracking and photographing objects
  • Altazimuth Mode: Suitable for visual astronomy

All-round 0°-90° Pitch Angle:
Gear 1: Allow you to adjust the pitch angle grip to achieve a degree between 0 and 60.
Gear 2: You can loosen the hex-head screw and then adjust the pitch angle grip to achieve a degree between 30 and 90.

Rocker-style Hand Controller:
Comfortable touch and easy to use. Integrated with a Wi-Fi network allowing for wireless control. You can easily upgrade the firmware of the hand controller and mount on the ZWO webpage.

Spec:

  • Mount type: German equatorial mount
  • Mount mode: Equatorial mode / altazimuth mode
  • Drive: Strain wave gear + Synchronous belt (Reduction ratio 300/1)
  • Periodic error: <± 15"
  • PE duration: 288s
  • Drive (RA): NEMA35 stepper motor + Model No. 14 (Reduction ratio 100/1) + brake
  • Drive (DEC): NEMA35 stepper motor + Model No. 14
  • Load capacity: 8kg without counterweight, 13kg with counterweight
  • Latitude adjustment range: 0° - 90°
  • Azimuth angle adjustment range: ± 6°
  • Dovetail: Losmandy & Vixen

Title: ZWO AM5N Harmonic Mount Head
Body (HTML):
The ZWO "Harmonic Equatorial Mount AM5" is a transportable mount designed specifically for astrophotography. The mount itself weighs less than 5kg but can carry telescopes up to 15kg without counterweight. With counterweight and the counterweight rod (optional) the mount can then carry telescopes up to 20kg in weight. Several years of development and various patents have gone into this exciting new mount and the results speak for themselves.

So many functions and easy operation:
The AM5 can be operated equatorially or azimuthally. For astrophotography, the equatorial mode is normally used and the mount must be aligned as accurately as possible with the celestial pole. For visual observing or lunar and planetary photography, the altazimuth mode is more than sufficient. The status indicator always shows in which mode the mount is: Red represents equatorial mode and green represents altazimuth mode so its easy to identify at a glance.

No more counterweights needed:
Normally, German equatorial mounts need counterweights to balance the telescope weight and this is the only way to ensure proper operation. However the AM5 uses robotics technology and it does not require counterweights for telescopes up to 15kg. This makes the AM5 lighter, more compact and easier to operate. Only for heavier telescopes up to a maximum of 20kg, then we recommend using counterweights to keep mount and tripod in balance.

Smooth tracking is guaranteed:
ZWO checks and measures every AM5 mount before delivery and guarantees a periodic error ("PE") of less than +/-20 arc seconds and in addition to this the periodic error occurs very slowly, so that the autoguider has enough time to correct it. Via ASIAIR or another software the PE can also be reduced electronically.

Useable anywhere on Earth:
As you would expect from a true travel mount, the AM5 can be used anywhere on Earth, from the equator to the poles and the compact design of the mount means it has room in any medium sized luggage case.

Polar alignment of the mount for astrophotography:
In equatorial mode, the mount needs to be aligned exactly with the celestial north or south pole but small errors are of course corrected by autoguiding. Aligning the mount can also be done quickly and easily with the ASIAIR or other suitable software.

No more control cables thanks to WiFi:
All functions of the mount can also be controlled via smartphone when coupled with the ASIAIR for example. With the ASIAIR, everything from the camera to autoguiding and to the mount itself can be controlled via the ASI app using a smartphone or tablet. The mount can also be separately operated with the hand controller without a smartphone if preferred.

Supports cable management to prevent cable entanglement:
The saddle plate now integrates DC output and Type-C port to effectively prevent cable entanglement. The unique design ensures that the internal cables will not be twisted and worn when the DEC rotates.

Important notes:

There is an ASIAIR finder shoe attached on to the side of the AM5 which is meant for attaching a polar finder scope. This finder shoe is not suitable for mounting an ASIAIR as both the cables and the antenna of the ASIAIR can be crushed during movement.

If you want to attach this finder shoe to a different location on the mount which is more suitable, such as on the side of the Losmandy / Vixen dovetail saddle plate, then make sure not to over tighten the Hex screws fully into the side panel or you will damage the insert threads. Keep the length of the inner threads between 3-5 mm.

Newer mounts have M4x3.5mm screws screwed into the saddle plate, these go into the side panel when the finder shoe is attached to the saddle plate along with the M4 x 8mm screws (it will not hold with the shorter screws).

  • Operating mode:    Altazimuth or equatorial
  • Gear system: Harmonic Drive
  • Periodic error:    less than +/- 10" - passing time 288 seconds
  • RA Motor: Stepper motor - Synchonous belt + 17 type 100 reduction ratio strain
  • wave gear + brake
  • DEC Motor: Stepper motor - Synchonous belt + 17 type 100 reduction ratio strain
  • wave gear + brake
  • Maximum load capacity: 15kg without counterweights - 20 kg with counterweights
  • Weight of the mount head: 5 kg
  • Operating range: 0° to 90° north / south latitude
  • Telescope mount: Losmandy and Vixen style quick coupling
  • Connection for counterweight rod: M12 x 1.75 female thread
  • Connection on the tripod sinde:    3/8" phototripod thread

Title: Askar 130PHQ Astrograph
Body (HTML):
Askar 130PHQ Quadruplet APO Astrograph:

The Askar 130PHQ is a long-focal-ratio, flatfield astrograph newly launched after 107PHQ. Instead of buying extra flatteners, calculating the backfocus of flattener or making tedious connection to match the distance, astrophotographers can simply equip it with any possible imaging devices, make the target stay at the focus, and then the whole optical system is perfect for imaging.

High quality imaging optics:
130PHQ has an aperture 23mm larger than 107PHQ. 130PHQ has a focal ratio of f/7.7 and a focal length of 1000mm. The Petzval-like quadruplet lens with two ED glasses offers excellent control of chromatic and other aberrations. With its self-flattening design, 130PHQ offers strong advantages in astronomical photography. It supports a medium frame 60mm image circle, has a fine spot diagram with only tiny distortion of the peripheral stars, and its central RMS radius is less than 2 microns.

The Askar 130PHQ is a true all-rounder with f/7.7 - it is designed as a telescope for almost all applications:

  • With 1000mm focal length and the large corrected field of view, extended objects can be imaged. But equally, fine details of objects can be brought out when cameras with high resolution are used.
  • The use of different cameras with different flange focal lengths is no problem. Simply focus and you are always at the correct distance.
  • The focuser has large travel, so you can find the focus without problems.
  • The working distance or backfocus from the 2" receptacle is long enough to use 2" star diagonals. This turns the flatfield apo into a wide field telescope or even a planetary telescope, depending on the eyepiece used.

Practical features:
130PHQ comes with a telescopic lens hood, a high quality CNC machined and painted tube and attractive decorative parts. The rigid 3.4" focuser comes with M68, M54, and M48 adapters and a finder base. When used with the optional 3" 0.7x flat field reducer, the telescope can reach a focal ratio of f/5.4 and a focal length of 700mm, effectively reducing exposure time considerably. The multifunctional handle comes with a central slot for attaching an M6 screw with an M6 screw hole. It has a standard Losmandy style dovetail plate, together with sturdy double tube ring and is perfectly suited for both viewing and imaging.

The photographic 3.4" Rack & Pinion focuser:
The CNC focuser is optimized for photography and can handle a load of up to 8kg. The adjustment range is very generous. The focusing is done via rack and pinion which is decoupled from the bearing of the draw tube. This guarantees fine and precise adjustment even at maximum load. In addition to the 1.25" and 2" receptacle, the focuser also offers threads for screw on adaptations.

Every single APO is checked in the technical department before it is put into storage in order to guarantee its consistently delivered to you in the highest quality.

  1. The mechanics are tested and the focuser is optimally adjusted.
    The lens is cosmetically checked and cleaned. The quality team also check that all counter screws are correctly tightened. These often loosen during transportation.
  2. The optics are collimated and the result is checked on the optical bench. The telescope is given a serial number.
  3. An optical test is carried out, which is enclosed with the telescope (star images and ronchi image on the optical bench in autocollimation).
    Only then are the telescopes handed over to the warehouse and prepared for dispatch.

Spec:

  • Aperture size: 130mm
  • Focal length: 1000mm
  • Focal ratio: f/7.7
  • Objective lens: Air-spaced quadruplet apo, consisting of a triplet (including two ED glasses) and a single element
  • Image circle: 60mm
  • Eyepiece connections: 2", 1.25"
  • Focuser: 3.4" dual-speed rack and pinion, max. load 8 kg
  • Focuser travel: 95mm
  • Visual back-focus with focuser fully retreated: 148.5 mm (from the end of 2" eyepiece holder)
  • Rear-end threads: M86x1 male, M68×1 male, M54×0.75 male, M48×0.75 male
  • Rear-end filter adapter: M54×0.75-M48×0.75 (M48×0.75 filter thread inside)
  • Photographic back-focus from base with focuser fully retreated:    186mm (from M86×1 thread), 156mm (from M68×1 thread), 136mm (from M54×0.75 thread), 116mm (from M48×0.75 thread)
  • Dew shield diameter: 169mm front, 162mm back
  • Tube diameter: 146mm
  • Total length with 1.25" receptacle: 842.5mm / 889.5mm (dew shield retracted / fully stretched)
  • Total length with 4-piece adapter: 1011.5mm / 1061.5mm (dew shield retracted / fully stretched)
  • Finder base: Vixen style finder shoe
  • Mount connection: Losmandy style dovetail plate

  • Gross weight: 12.5kg

Title: Celestron - 11" EdgeHD (Optical Tube)
Body (HTML):
The EdgeHD optics (Edge High Definition) combine the compact design of a Schmidt-Cassegrain with significantly improved imaging at the edge of the image. This optical system not only offers the properties of astrographs, but also produces completely undistorted, sharp images right up to the edge of the large visual and photographic field of view.

Not only is the coma outside the optical axis corrected - as with other "coma-free" optical designs available on the market - but also the field curvature!

Many optical systems are promoted as "astrographs"; however, they produce the coveted "pinpoint" star image along a curved image plane. On images taken with modern CCD cameras, the result is a noticeable field curvature that increases towards the edge of the image field and becomes stronger the larger the chip is; i.e. the stars remain round, but are blown up into small rings ("donuts") towards the edge.

With the Celestron Edge HD telescopes, this field curvature is corrected right up to the edge in addition to the coma, so that even images taken with large CCD chips are completely sharp, with a uniformly large star image across the entire chip - right into the corners of the image field.

This also significantly improves the resolution and limiting magnitude compared to competing optical systems with a similar aperture. The Celestron XLT multi-coating also helps the Edge HD optics to achieve a significant increase in performance compared to similar systems on the market.

The EdgeHD optics produce images three times flatter in the image field plane than a standard Schmidt-Cassegrain. The stars are imaged diffraction-limited across the entire chip of a Nikon D3 or Canon 5D !

  • Optical coating: Starbright XLT (Fully multi-coated)
  • Telescope aperture: 279.4mm (11")
  • Focuser size (inches): 3.3" + 2" SC thread, 1.25"
  • Tube (material): Aluminum
  • Tube weight: 13kg
  • Tube length: 24 in (610mm)
  • Aperture ratio: f/10
  • Resolution (DAWES): 0.41 arcseconds
  • Resolution (RAYLEIGH): 0.50 arcseconds
  • Focal length: 2800mm (110 in)
  • Secondary mirror obstruction: 9.5cm

  • Secondary mirror obstruction relative to surface: 11.60%
  • Limit size: 14.7
  • Highest useful magnification: x661
  • Light gathering capacity (compared to the human eye): x1593

Title: Celestron - 14" EdgeHD (Optical Tube)
Body (HTML):
The EdgeHD optics (Edge High Definition) combine the compact design of a Schmidt-Cassegrain with a significantly improved flat field at the edge of the mirror for imaging. This optical system not only offers the properties of astrographs, but also produces completely undistorted, sharp images right up to the edge of the large visual and photographic field of view. Not only is the coma outside of the optical axis corrected - but also the field curvature!

Many optical systems are promoted as "astrographs", however, they produce the coveted "pinpoint" star image along a curved image plane. On images taken with modern CCD cameras, the result is a noticeable field curvature that increases towards the edge of the image field and becomes stronger the larger the chip is; i.e. the stars remain round, but are blown up into small rings ("donuts") towards the edge.

With the Celestron Edge HD telescopes, this field curvature is corrected right up to the edge in addition to the coma, so that even images taken with large CCD chips are able to remain completely sharp right into the corners of the image field.

This also significantly improves resolution and limiting magnitude compared to competing optical systems with a similar aperture. The Celestron XLT multi-coating also helps the Edge HD optics to achieve a significant increase in performance compared to similar systems on the market.

The EdgeHD optics produces a three-times flatter image in the field plane than a standard Schmidt-Cassegrain. The stars are imaged diffraction-limited across the entire chip of a Nikon D3 or Canon 5D for example.

In addition to the new optics, the mechanics and tube have also been completely redesigned. The new features include:

  1. Mirror locks to hold the main mirror in any focus position without exerting pressure on the optical elements. The image always remains stable on the chip, even with long exposure times.
  2. Ventilation openings behind the main mirror ensure rapid air exchange, so that the optics cool down at a much faster rate. Thanks to an air filter system, no dust gets into the tube either.
  3. HyperStar Compatible - All EdgeHD tubes allow you to remove the secondary mirror and replace it with the optional HyperStar optics. The result: your standard Celestron EdgeHD telescope becomes a digital Schmidt Design for your CCD or DSLR camera for prime-focus photography at f/2 (C8, C11) and f/1.9 (C14).
  4. Adapted telecompressors (f/7.5) and Barlow lenses (f/20) are under development.
  5. Axiom eyepieces - The HD 14 comes with an Axiom eyepiece from Celestron. With a 23mm focal length and 82° field of view, which gives you an impressive combination of magnification and field of view.

  • Focal length: 3910mm
  • F Ratio: f/11
  • Secondary mirror obstruction: 11.4cm
  • Secondary mirror obstruction relative to diameter: 32.00%
  • Secondary mirror obstruction relative to the surface: 10.00%
  • Limiting size: 15.3 mag
  • Highest useful magnification: x840
  • Light-gathering capacity (compared to the human eye): x2581
  • Focuser size: 3.3" + 2" SC thread, 1.25"

Title: Celestron - 9.25" EdgeHD (Optical Tube)
Body (HTML):
The EdgeHD optics (Edge High Definition) combine the compact design of a Schmidt-Cassegrain with significantly improved imaging at the edge of the image. This optical system not only offers the properties of astrographs, but also produces completely undistorted, sharp images right up to the edge of the large visual and photographic field of view.

Not only is the coma outside the optical axis corrected - as with other "coma-free" optical designs available on the market - but also the field curvature!

Many optical systems are promoted as "astrographs"; however, they produce the coveted "pinpoint" star image along a curved image plane. On images taken with modern CCD cameras, the result is a noticeable field curvature that increases towards the edge of the image field and becomes stronger the larger the chip is; i.e. the stars remain round, but are blown up into small rings ("donuts") towards the edge.

With the Celestron Edge HD telescopes, this field curvature is corrected right up to the edge in addition to the coma, so that even images taken with large CCD chips are completely sharp, with a uniformly large star image across the entire chip - right into the corners of the image field.

This also significantly improves the resolution and limiting magnitude compared to competing optical systems with a similar aperture. The Celestron XLT multi-coating also helps the Edge HD optics to achieve a significant increase in performance compared to similar systems on the market.

The EdgeHD optics produce images three times flatter in the image field plane than a standard Schmidt-Cassegrain. The stars are imaged diffraction-limited across the entire chip of a Nikon D3 or Canon 5D !

Title: Bresser Star Tracker Astrophoto Mount Set
Body (HTML):
Do you already own a photo camera and would like to create impressive shots of the night sky using long exposures or even making time-lapse shots of the Milkyway? Then the Bresser StarTracker Astrophoto mount set is the ideal base to work from.

Unlike a conventional camera Tripod, a StarTracker mount tracks the night sky to prevent star trailing, allowing you to take very detailed and clear photos of night sky targets.

Not only is this mount particularly well suited for an entry into astrophotography but the built-in tracking motor rotates the saddled camera precisely against the earth's rotation and therefore the stars remain point-shaped even with long exposures. This set contains all the components required (excl. the camera) for a quick and comfortable entry into the world of astrophotography:

How to get setup:
After setting up the lightweight and compact photo mount, simply set the approximate latitude (pole height) on the tripod head MH-100 and target the polar star with the help of the optical polar finder. Then mount the camera with photo lens with the help of the quick-release plate on the heavy ball head included. With the ball head, the camera can be aligned and re-positioned at any time to any section of the sky. As soon as the tracking motor is switched on, the long exposure can be started immediately. All this takes less than 5 minutes to setup.

Camera Suitability:
All cameras with 1/4" (6.3mm) tripod connection thread and the bulb B setting option for long exposure.
The Bresser photo mount is designed to carry and follow a camera with a lens of up to 2.0 kg total weight in polar mode.
In azimuthal mode, the mount also carries cameras with up to 5.0 kg Weight. Fast wide-angle lenses are ideal for starting off, because as the lens focal length and exposure time increase, so to do the requirements for tracking accuracy. Therefore, a shot of several minutes with a wide-angle lens can be taken without problems and the stars remain pin point sharp.

For example, with a long focal length such as a 200mm telephoto lens, the polar alignment of the photo mount must be exactly right which can be done quickly with the integrated alignment tunnel for aligning with the polar star. Typically achievable exposure times with good tracking accuracy are: 16mm wide-angle lens: 5 minutes (300sec.) - Perfect for dramatic shots of the Milkyway and with a 100mm telephoto lens: 1 minute (60sec.)

The tracking is carried out by a precise stepper motor which can be adjusted at different speeds via the operating menu. The low power consumption allows operation of up to 20 hours with a set of batteries or any length of time via USB connection.

StarTracker Astrophoto Mount features:

  • Astrophoto mount for equatorial tracking
  • Automatic compensation of the earth's rotation
  • Extremely compact design - fits in almost any photo bag
  • Different tracking speeds adjustable
  • Switchable for northern and southern hemisphere
  • Time-lapse function and azimuthal movement adjustable from 15min to 48 hours
  • Ball head with quick-release plate and 1/4'' photo thread for camera mounting
  • Photo mount with 1/4'' threaded bolt for ball head mounting
  • Additional quick coupling for removing the ball head
  • Precise stepper motor tracking with worm gear
  • Clear LC display for easy operation
  • Battery operation (4 x AA) or via micro USB socket (Batt. not included)
  • Battery life: up to 20 hours
  • Weight of the astrophoto mount: 0.63 kg
  • Transport weight incl. compl. Accessories: 3.6 kg
  • Adjustment height mount with tripod: 80-155cm
  • Tripod transport dimensions: 60x10x10cm; Tripod weight: 2.1 kg
  • Load capacity of the photo mount: up to 2.0 kg or 5.0kg
Whats included:
  1. Bresser StarTracker Astrophoto Mount PM-100
  2. Bresser ball head with quick-release plate
  3. Bresser Polar Viewfinder for StarTracker PM-100
  4. Bresser tripod head with fine adjustment MH-100 (pole cradle)
  5. Bresser Tripod TP-100 DX with bag
  6. Manual (English)

Title: ZWO ASIAIR-PLUS
Body (HTML):
ZWO ASIAIR PLUS - Astrophotography has never been so easy!

ASIAIR PLUS is an intelligent WiFi controller for all astrophotography applications. It replaces a laptop or an expensive stand-alone autoguider and makes the tangled cables on the telescope a thing of the past. All you need is your smartphone or a tablet, which you connect to the ASIAIR WiFi. The areas of application are diverse and include:

  • Control of all ZWO ASI USB 3.0 cameras - cooled cameras require an additional
  • power supply
  • Autoguiding (see user reports) in combination with a ZWO MINI camera, e.g. with
  • the ASI120 Mini
  • Control of selected mounts, e.g. from Skywatcher or iOptron
  • Control of selected DSLR and system cameras
  • Autofocusing with the ZWO EAF motor focus
  • Debayer function for ZWO color cameras
  • Image preview
  • Alignment routine
  • Planetary and lunar video recordings
  • Live Stacking
  • and much more!

ASIAIR PLUS is the third generation of the ASIAIR and is continuously being developed further by ZWO. These latest developments include:

  1. A built-in WiFi antenna, which significantly amplifies the signal and increases the range.
  2. Four newly added indicators for the 12V DC outputs. Allows you to check the power status and monitor consumption in real time.
  3. New USB-C port so you can connect the ASIAIR Plus directly to your computer to transfer data instead of going through an SD card (not included) and card reader.
  4. ASIAIR Plus is now even more compact and lighter. The housing is made of aluminum and machined using CNC technology, which makes the device even more robust and durable.
  5. Even better operational reliability - ASIAIR OS runs on an eMMC memory. Thanks to a new "Auto Recovery Mode" function, the system automatically detects errors and recovers itself.
  6. The ASIAIR Plus's internal memory for images and videos is a generous 32 GB.

ASIAIR PLUS Features:

Accurate Focusing:
After coarse focusing is completed, select a star, then accurate focusing can be done by curves such as brightness and HFD. It can also be done with ZWO EAF by remote control. 

Polar Alignment:
Based on the powerful plate solving function, you can complete the arcsecond accurate polar axis alignment within a few minutes. 

Accurate GoTo:
With the rich celestial object database, precise GoTo can be achieved after selecting the object.

Stable Guiding:
Independent and stable tracking control can be achieved without the PC. 

Preview Mode:
You can see the image of the object directly under 'Preview'. The images will not be saved automatically. Autorun: Set the object and configure the schedule, ASIAIR will run the image sequence automatically. The images will be saved. 

Live Stacking:
You can see the stacked image (lower noise with calibration shots) of the object directly during shooting.

Supported DSLR and mirrorless system cameras:
ASIAIR PLUS is an intelligent WiFi device that allows you to control many system cameras. A list of compatible DSLR and mirrorless system cameras can be found on the ZWO Website here .

*Note: ASIAIR does not control Astro cameras from other manufacturers, such as QHY or Explore Scientific.

Supported mounts:
ZWO has also worked closely with major manufacturers to ensure compatibility with iOptron, Vixen, Rainbow, Avalon, Explore Scientific and other models (including some new models). For now, the ASIAIR PRO supports hundreds of equatorial mounts from more than 20 manufacturers worldwide. All mounts and cameras supported by the previous version (ASIAIR) will also work with the ASIAIR PRO and ASIAIR PLUS.

Link to a list of compatible mounts:
Mounts compatible with ASIAIR PLUS can be found here.

ASIAIR PLUS Manuals can be found on ZWO's Manuals page here.

Drivers can be found on ZWO's Software and Drivers page here.

Title: 1/4" Female to 3/8" Male Adapter Screw

This photo thread adapter can be screwed into a 3/8" female thread or on a 1/4" male thread in order to change its size for various adaptations:

Title: Celestron Polar Wedge
Body (HTML):
This Polar Wedge fits the Celestron Nexstar 6/8 SE telescopes & Evolution 6/8 Telescopes, It transforms these popular telescopes into mobile platforms for astrophotography. The total weight of the Polar Wedge is 7.5kg.

The NexStar Telescopes are generally suitable for astrophotography with longer exposure times. In azimuthal mode, tracking is achieved by movement in both axes, which is not a problem for visual observation. However, in astrophotography, a field rotation becomes noticeable after just one minute of exposure time, which initially distorts the stars at the edge of the field into lines.

The polar wedge eliminates this problem. It aligns the telescope's azimuth axis to the celestial pole, allowing tracking to be performed solely with the azimuth motor (there is an adjustment option in the hand controller), eliminating the need for field rotation. The wedge can be used worldwide and the tilt angle can initially be roughly adjusted using the scale, and then easily and precisely fine-tuned by hand using the fine-tuning screws with large adjustment knobs. The telescope can be easily mounted by just one person. First, attach a screw to the base and then use this screw to hook it into the paths. Then, the other two screws are inserted and tightened with an Allen key.

Suitable for:

  • Celestron Nexstar 6" / 8" SE Mounts
  • Celestron Nexstar Evolution 6" / 8" Mounts

Whats included:

  1. Polar Wedge Assembly

Body (HTML):

The CPC telescopes and the NexStar Evolution 925" are generally suitable for astrophotography with longer exposure times. In azimuthal mode, tracking is achieved by movement in both axes, which is not a problem for visual observation. However, in astrophotography, a field rotation becomes noticeable after just one minute of exposure time, which initially distorts the stars at the edge of the field into lines.

The polar wedge eliminates this problem. It aligns the telescope's azimuth axis to the celestial pole, allowing tracking to be performed solely with the azimuth motor (there is an adjustment option in the hand controller), eliminating the need for field rotation. The wedge can be used worldwide and the tilt angle can initially be roughly adjusted using the scale, and then easily and precisely fine-tuned by hand using the fine-tuning screws with large adjustment knobs. The telescope can be easily mounted by just one person. First, attach a screw to the base and then use this screw to hook it into the paths. Then, the other two screws are inserted and tightened with an Allen key.

Title: Celestron SkyPortal Wifi Module
Body (HTML):
The SkyPortal Link WLAN module enables wireless control of almost any Celestron GOTO telescope using the optional iPhone/iPad app “SkyPortal” or via a Windows PC using the optional NexRemote software and the freely available from Celestron.com here. In this app (a complete planetarium program), you can simply tap an observing target on the star map or in a list, and the telescope will automatically move to it. Alternatively, the telescope can be operated via SkyPortal without a hand controller, even the Star alignment process is possible via SkyPortal.

You can also access your SkyPortal adapter with the Celestron SkyPortal software. SkyPortal is a full-featured planetarium program: Point your smartphone at the sky, and you'll see the objects you've set up on the map, or search for an object, and it will guide you there.

After SkyPortal has connected to your telescope via the WiFi module and the alignment has been completed, you can conveniently control the Telescope via your smartphone as usual.

The software is based on SkySafari and is available for free for iOS (in the App Store) and Android (in the Play Store). Versions of SkySafari 4.x with telescope control now also support the SkyPortal adapter.

Special features of the SkyPortal app:

  • Complete wireless control of your Celestron telescope via the app (not included).
  • Telescope alignment – You can perform the entire alignment process via your iPhone or iPad.
  • Planetarium interface – Tap any object on the SkyPortal app’s star map and your telescope will automatically move to it.
  • The optional SkyPortal app offers Sky Tour – Creates a list of the most beautiful stars, galaxies and nebulae that are currently visible.

SkyPortal has been successfully tested with the following computer-controlled Celestron devices (however a firmware update may be necessary on your particular mount)

  • Advanced GT
  • Advanced VX
  • CGE Pro
  • CGEM, CGEM II
  • CGEM DX
  • CGX, CGX-L
  • CPC
  • SLT
  • SE 6/8
  • SE 4/5
  • LCM
  • SkyProdigy

Sky Portal does NOT work with the following Telescope Mounts:

  • NexStar GPS
  • NexStar i
  • NexStar GT

Unfortunately, it is also not possible to upgrade older mounts to make them compatible with SkyPortal. With the optional NexRemote software, SkyPortal can also be controlled via PC. You will need the SkyQ Link PC software, which is available for download from Celestron.com

Whats included:

  1. SkyPortal Wifi Module

Title: Pegasus Astro Ultimate Powerbox Control Hub - Gen 3
Body (HTML):
Pegasus Astro Ultimate Powerbox v3 (UPBv3)
The Ultimate Powerbox V3 (UPBv3 in short) is the flagship of Pegasus Astro´s Powerbox series.

UPBv3 is a Wi-Fi and USB controlled power hub. A USB 3.1 Hub allows you to switch on/off 8 USB ports, 8 x 12V power outlets, 2 x adjustable outputs (3-12V and 12-24V), 3 dew heaters, a stepper controller that can drive almost any stepper motor in the astronomy market silently and almost vibration-free as well as a power relay and an expansion port for devices that communicates with the UPBv3 Controller!

If you are tired of carrying multiple power packs and dealing with a mess of power and data cables, the Ultimate Powerbox v3, a sophisticated power control unit, is the "Ultimate" solution. Having all your power and data needs centralised, you minimise cables which can disturb the movements of the mount, only the main power cord and one USB data cord are attached to the Ultimate Powerbox which branches off to power all other devices.

6 x 12V DC Power outlets for your equipment:
Six powerful smart MOSFET transistors provide "electric power" to your equipment. Sophisticated short circuit and overload per port protections cut the power and report the incident into the software. Every MOSFET is capable of providing up to 6 amps of current.

Built-in Power Sensors:
A precise voltmeter and an ammeter (can measure up to 20A) measure and display in real-time the power input. If the input is more than 14.5V the power is instantly cut off to protect your equipment.

Individual Current Meter per 12V smart output:
Each smart 12 V output has an internal and independent digital current meter. You can view each port´s power consumption in the software.

Additional Power Outputs and Sensors:

  • 2 x Always ON 12V outputs increase the total 12V outputs to 10.
  • 1 x Adjustable Voltage Step Down output can be regulated from 3V to 12V and provide up to 3 amps of power.
  • 1 x Adjustable Voltage Step Up output can be regulated from 12V to 24V and provide up to 4 amps of power.
  • 3 x Dew Heater outputs - the three pulse width modulation (PWM) outlets are capable of providing power to your "thirsty" dew heaters / flatpanels or telescope fans. Eliminate the moisture that is fuzzing your equipment and destroying your clear nights. These outlets can be remotely tuned from your laptop using the supplied software.
  • 1 x Switch Relay can pass 250V / 10A and used to switch ON/OFF any 3rd party equipment.
  • A built-in ambient temperature and relative humidity sensor provides frequently readouts of the environmental conditions and automatically adjusts the heat intensity of your dew heater strips.

Embedded Stepper Motor Controller:
A silent and low vibrating stepper motor controller will precisely move your drawtube of your focuser. The controller drives a Pegasus Motor Focus Kit or almost any other stepper motor in the market (Unipolar or Bipolar) e.g. Rigel, Robofocus, Moonlight, Starlight motors. Backlash compensation is already implemented in the firmware and can be enabled, tuned and disabled from the software. A fully ASCOM6 compliant focuser driver is already available.

Supported Stepper Motors:
Make sure you have the correct cable for your motor. Every manufacturer uses its own pinout. Contact us if you have any question for the type of your motor.

  • Pegasus Motor Focus Kit (v1/v2): requires RJ45 to RJ45 common straight network cable
  • Robofocus: requires cable PEG-CMOT-RJ45DB9
  • Moonlite: requires cable PEG-CMOT-RJ45DB9
  • Lakeside: requires cable PEG-CMOT-RJ45DB9
  • Starlight HSM 20, 30, 35: requires cable PEG-CMOT-HSM
  • Starlight MSM 20, 30, 35: requires cable PEG-CMOT-MSM
  • Starlight DirectSync motors: requires cable PEG-CMOT-HSM
  • Starizona Microtouch: requires cable PEG-CMOT-MSM
  • Optec DirectSync or Quicksync motors: requires cable PEG-CMOT-HSM
  • Rigel nStep motor: requires cable PEG-CMOT-MSM
  • Starlight POSI Drive Motor: requires cable PEG-CMOT-HSM
  • Lacerta Motor: requires cable PEG-CMOT-LCRT

VESA compatible enclosure:
The UPBv3 enclosure is compatible with VESA mounts. Available screw holes allow an e.g. Intel NUC to be stacked up with the Ultimate Powerbox v3.

Supported By ASCOM 6:
Ultimate powerbox fully supports ASCOM6. In combination with Pegasus Astro´s Unity Software which acts as a server, you can use the latest ASCOM 6 supplied drivers to:

  • Control the Stepper Motor (ASCOM Focuser)
  • Pass environmental settings to supported software (e.g Sequence Generator Pro / MaximDL /NINA ) (ASCOM ObservingConditions)
  • Switch ON or OFF all 12 V outputs or USB Ports (ASCOM Switches - NINA/ MaximDL)

INDI Driver:
Ultimate Powerbox v3 is fully supported by INDI and INDIGO:

  • Indigo driver: Click Here
  • Indilib driver: Click Here
  • StellarMate

N.I.N.A.:
The Ultimate Powerbox v3 is fully supported by NINA.

Other Key Features

  • Zoomable and Exportable Graphs
  • Software logs all voltage, current, temperature and relative humidity readings. All these plots are zoomable and easily exportable in PNG image & CSV text format. Keep a full record of your night conditions.
  • Scheduler to control outputs
  • Enable or disable each power or USB port by setting a timer and creating groups of ports. You can easily define which output (power or USB) should turn ON or remain OFF during startup. The settings are stored in system´s EEPROM memory.

Auto Adjustment of PWM (Dew Outputs):
Device can auto adjust the Heater Outputs by consulting the environmental sensor and calculate the Dew Point. Just click "Auto" and leave to Ultimate Powerbox v2 to decide if it is time to switch on your dew heaters.

* You can easily select which Dew Heater output is controlled by the "Auto Dew" function.

Reverse Polarity Protection:
Ultimate Powerbox has been designing with reverse voltage polarity protection. It will protect your equipment if you accidentally connect the main power supply in reverse polarity!

A hardware watchdog:
A hardware watchdog resets the device if for any reason there is no response from the controller for two seconds. A neat feature in the unlikely event of a controller freeze, is when you own a remote observatory and you need to be certain that everything can be quickly recovered.

Upgradable Firmware:
The firmware supports re-programming via the USB or Wi-Fi connection using upgrade software (only available for Windows), for future upgrades which may become available. Pegasus Astro constantly receives feedback from their customers and regularly updates the firmware and software with new features.

Spec:

  • Input voltage: 12 to 14V, auto cut-off at 14.5V
  • Maximum current consumption: 20A
  • Power input connector: XT60
  • Switchable 12V outputs: 6x 5.5/2.1mm, tip positive, 6A each, PWM or constant, Ammeter for each port.
  • Always-on 12V outputs: 2x 5.5/2.1mm, tip positive, 8A each
  • 12V dew heater outputs: 3x RCA connector, 6.5A each
  • Variable outputs: 1x 3 to 12V, 3A, and 1x 12 to 24V, 4A
  • Power relay switch: 250V, 10A
  • USB power hub, industrial grade: 6x USB3.1, 2x USB2, each up to 2.2A, all protected against short circuit, overload and ESD, all switchable
  • Stepper motor output: RJ45 socket for unipolar or bipolar stepper motors, 2A per phase
  • Humidity sensor: 0 to 100% humidity, built-in
  • Temperature sensor: -40 to +80 °C, built-in
  • Voltmeter: 5 to 15V
  • Ammeter: 0 to 20A
  • Body dimensions: 127.25mm x 116mm x 29mm
  • Weight: 400g

Whats included:

  1. Ultimate Powerbox V3 Controller
  2. 4x DC 1m 5.5/2.1 to 5.5/2.1 male cable
  3. USB Cable Type B (1.8m)

Title: Celestron Power Tank Lithium - 84 Watts/h
Body (HTML):
The PowerTank Lithium keeps the charge going for the astronomer on the go. The Lithium-Iron Phosphate (LiFePO4) battery chemistry has significant advantages over other battery chemistries, including:

  1. The LiFePO4 has an un-recharged shelf life of 10 years compared to 3 years for the Lithium Iron and 6-9 months for a Sealed Lead-Acid battery.
  2. The battery performance of the PowerTank Lithium phosphate degrades at a much slower pace than other chemistries.
  3. The LiFePO4 can be charged and discharged 2000 times compared to only 500 for a Lithium Iron battery and 300 for sealed lead-acid designs.
  4. The batteries will last as long as the telescope you use it with!
  5. The LiFePO4 uses phosphates instead of environmentally hazardous elements like cobalt or lead commonly found in other rechargeable batteries.
  6. Can withstand higher temperatures than lithium-iron designs and will not be a fire danger if accidentally punctured.
  7. This combined with its rugged design make it the perfect outdoor power supply.
    Keep your telescopes, smartphones, tablets, GPS systems, cameras and other USB-powered devices as active as you are with PowerTank Lithium—the ideal outdoor portable-charging solution for your electronic gear.

Spec:

  • Battery Capacity: 84.4 Wh
  • Charging Input: 16VDC @ 2000mA
  • Charge Time (from flat): 4 hours
  • Telescope Power Port: 12VDC @ 3000mA, Tip positive
  • Car Battery Adapter Port: None
  • USB Charging Port 1 Output: 5VDC @ 1000mA
  • USB Charging Port 2 Output: 5VDC @ 2100mA
  • Auto Shutoff Threshold Current: (12V Port) - Less than 250mA for a long period of time
  • Operating Temperature: -20°C to 60°C
  • Light Panel: Red or White with two brightness settings for each color
  • Weather Proof/Dust Proof: IP-65 rating
  • Telescope Power Cord: 6.5 ft (2m) with power connector for Celestron telescopes
  • Holding Strap: 2" wide hook and loop strap for attachment to tripod leg and a 10" hanging strap
  • Product Dimensions: 190.5mm x 76.2mm (7.5" x 3")
  • Product Weight: 1.02 kg

Whats included:

  1. Battery pack
  2. AC mains charger
  3. Power cord for Celestron telescopes
  4. Strap for attaching to tripod
  5. Strap for hanging

Title: Nebula upgrade kit for Bresser EXOS-2 mounts
Body (HTML):
So you already own a Bresser EXOS-2 mount and want to take a big step forward into the world of Astrophotography? Then the Nebula Goto Kit is exactly the upgrade that will take your Astrophotography to another level. This kit contains the same motors and control unit fitted to the premium Bresser Nebula astrophotography mounts.

This modern system offers you several options for control. You can operate the mount directly via its own Nebula control interface using your smartphone or tablet (iOS and Android supported). Alternatively, you can also use a planetarium software like Sky Safari or Stellarium for example.

Of course, fully manual control remains an option too. For this, a hand controller for minor corrections or simple control commands is included in the delivery.

In addition, with the Bresser Nebula Goto Kit, you can connect your laptop or PC directly via WLAN or LAN cable (recommended for faster data transmission) to the Nebula control unit. This not only gives you full control over the mount, but also allows you to connect several devices such as cameras, motor focus, filter wheel, etc., directly to the control unit via various USB ports. This eliminates the need to connect each device to your computer via separate cables. The pre-installed program KStars / EKOS lets you comfortably control all devices from your PC or laptop.

Electronic polar alignment or guiding can also be easily implemented with the Goto Kit, provided you have a camera connected. Additionally, you are not limited to the software of the Nebula control unit. Thanks to the installed ASCOM Alpaca driver, you can use your own programs on your computer to control the mount - be it APT or N.I.N.A. The two stepper motors with belt drives ensure a smooth, direct drive of both the two axes. You just need to make sure you mount is correctly balanced.

Features:

  • Belt drive for more precise, quieter tracking
  • Stepper motors with high resolution (0.36´/microstep)
  • Hand controller for direct control of the mount
  • Virtual hand controller for smartphones and tablets
  • PC control – via ASCOM
  • USB ports for cameras, motors, filter wheels, etc.

Whats included:

  1. 2 stepper motors for both axes (RA and DEC)
  2. Raspberry Pi control unit
  3. Basic hand controller
  4. 230V / 12V / 3 A power supply
  5. Connection cable
  6. Manual for download

Optical pole finder scope for fast and precise polar alignment of the Explore Scientific iEXOS-100 EQ mount. 

This Explore Scientific Pole Finder Scope is used with the light-weight iEXOS-100 EQ mount and allows yo to very precisely align the mount to the celestial pole by using the illuminated crosshairs and constellation markings. Simply adjust the pole height and azimuth until the constellation markings in the polar finder match the constellations in the sky - that's it. Ideal for optimizing tracking accuracy in astrophotography.

Title: Explore Scientific Telrad View Finder
Body (HTML):
The Telrad viewfinder is a projection finder that can be installed on any telescope and makes it extremely easy to align the telescope with stars in the night sky.

The Telrad viewfinder is a practical alternative to classic optical viewfinders and illuminated red dot viewfinders. You can see the complete starry sky without magnification, and not just a small section as with a normal optical viewfinder. Against the background, three red luminous concentric rings are projected, with apparent diameters of 4 degrees, 2° and 0.5° in the sky. Move the telescope so that the object you are looking for is in the inner ring to make sure your primary scope is aligned with it.

The base of the Telrad viewfinder is self-adhesive and can be mounted on most telescopic tubes from about 10cm diameter upwards. The length of the base is about 18cm. This base remains on the telescopic tube while the Telrad viewfinder itself can be removed and attached at any time by means of the quick coupling. The Telrad is powered by two normal AA batteries (these are not included).

Details:
  • Telrad projection finder
  • Illuminated rings of 4 degrees, 2° and 0.5° in the sky
  • See the complete starry sky without magnification
  • Easy installation
  • Can be installed on nearly all telescopes
  • Base with quick release coupling included
  • Powered by two AA batteries (not included)
  • Very long battery life because of LED technology
Weight & Dimensions:
  • Total length: 180 mm
  • Total width: 60 mm
  • Total height: 120 mm
  • Net weight (without access.): 200g
Whats included:
  1. Telrad viewfinder with projector and battery compartment
  2. Telrad base with quick-release coupling for the viewfinder
  3. Adhesive tape for attachment to telescope

Title: TS-Optics 50mm Complete Autoguiding Package
Body (HTML):
TS-Optics full Autoguiding Set for Astrophotography:
This complete set is everything you need to get setup for Autoguiding and long exposure deep space astrophotography. It consists of a compact 50mm Guide tube (Ideal for Autoguiding using imaging scopes up to 1000mm F/L or 8" Aperture) and a powerful autoguiding camera, for long exposures with your telescope.

This complete solution is easy to install and enables active tracking control, also known as autoguiding.

A viewfinder shoe is also included, so you can mount the Guidescope on tube clamps or in a separate place of your telescope. The software for the ASI120 Mini guide camera is suitable for a number of different Autoguiding software packages including PHD Guiding, Guidedog, Metaguide, Guidemaster (Freeware) or AstroArt, MaxIm DL (chargeable).

Step-by-Step Setup:

  1. Attach the Guidescope & Camera to the main OTA
  2. Use the ST-4 autoguider socket of your mount to connect the guide camera and your mount (Your mount needs to be ST4 compatible)
  3. Connect the tracking camera to your Windows computer and connect to your guiding software of choice.
  4. Focus the guide camera with the focuser - and you're ready to start astrophotography. Note: this is a brief overview and exact steps will vary depending on what Guiding software you decide to use.

Specs:

  • Guidescope Aperture: 50 mm
  • Guide Scope Focal Length: 162 mm
  • Optics: 2-element achromatic lens with multi-coating
  • Focusing: 1.25" receptacle with 3 fixing screws
  • Weight: Only 450g
  • Material: The guide tube and clamps are made entirely of metal
  • Suitable for: Standard Vixen viewfinder shoes
  • Camera: ZWO ASI120MM mini camera with 1.2 MP mono CMOS sensor with 4.8x3.6 mm size
  • Pixels: 3.75 μm pixels - 1.2 MP
  • Sensitivity: 75% QE for short exposure times
  • Mounting connection: ST-4 Autoguiding connector
  • Power supply: via USB
  • Operating System: Windows 7, 8, 10

Whats included:

  1. TS Optics 50mm Mini Guide Telescope with adjustable mount
  2. Viewfinder Shoe
  3. 1.25" Parfocal Ring
  4. Tracking Camera and Astro Camera ASI120MM mini
  5. USB Cable & ST4 Autoguider cable

Title: TS-Optics Guide Scope Rings for 50 - 60mm Scopes
Body (HTML):
Good tube clamps are crucial for the success of astro-imaging. These TS tube clamps are solidly made from aluminium however they are not excessively heavy. The clamps accept compact telescopes from 49mm to 75mm tube diameters. This means that all viewfinder telescopes and guide telescopes with 50mm and 60mm aperture can be used.

The 6 ring clamping screws also contain nylon tips so you don't scratch or damage the scope while its in place.

The versatile dovetail rail is included and it fixes the clamps at the optimal separation apart - The distance of the clamps is also adjustable. The rail fits directly into all mounts with an EQ5-level (Vixen type) quick coupling. In addition, the rail at the base offers two 1/4" internal threads and a 3/8" internal thread and so makes it possible to connect ball heads and tilt heads as well as to photo tripods.

Title: Explore Scientific (8 x 50) Guide Scope / Finder Scope with Helical Focuser
Body (HTML):
This universal 50mm Guide Scope & Finder Scope has a focal length of 220mm and although initialy designed for the Explore Scientific range, its also suitable for use on a wide range of other telescopes.

This excellent 8x50 Finder Scope has a detachable eyepiece unit and crosshairs with adjustable red illumination for ease of use in the dark. The very precise helical focuser has many connection possibilities such as a 1.25" / 31.7mm plug-in connector, as well as the T2 camera connection thread (M42x0.75mm) to enable the autoguiding camera required for long exposure astrophotography. It can even be used as a small mini travel telescope.

The scope viewfinder also has a very large field of view (FOV) of 6.96 degrees, making it much easier to search for and target objects. The existing scale markers (division =1 degree) of the crosshairs are a good reference for estimating distances and the open center marking also facilitates the precise centering of objects. All the lens surfaces have a multi-coating and guarantee a bright viewfinder image due to the high light transmission values. The adjustable red LED lighting is powered by two LR41 button cells. The main lens and crosshairs can be focused independently, giving you perfect focus for your eyes.

Compact tracking unit for Auto-guiding:
One of the main applications for this telescope is auto-guiding. For this purpose, the Guide Scope is inserted into the existing scope shoe of the primary optics and aligned in parallel. If the existing scope shoe is not compatible, a second shoe is also included. A tracking camera can be mounted with the 1.25 inch/31.7mm plug-in connector at the rear of the scope or via T2 threaded connection (M42x0.75mm) - Please note the required back focus for your tracking camera. The focus plane (or back focus) is about 22mm behind the T2 thread. The precision focuser allows you to focus sharply onto the guide star and for easy repetition of the focus point, the focus tube has a white millimeter scale of 0 to 28mm laserd on top.

Use as a mini travel telescope:
This Finder / Guide Scope can also be easily used as a mini travel telescope. A magnification of x 8 to x 40 can be achieved with optionally available eyepieces. Almost all eyepieces with an eyepiece focal length of 5 to 26mm and 1.25 inch/31.7mm plug-in connection type are suitable.

Metal viewfinder holder and viewfinder shoe:
The base holder of the viewfinder and guide telescope is made entirely of aluminum and forms a stable base. If the existing viewfinder shoe is not compatible, a suitable viewfinder shoe which is included can be attached to the OTA using 4 x M5 screws. The bore distances of the viewfinder shoe on the longitudinal and transverse axis are 31.7mm. All the adjustment and clamping screws have plastic tips that effectively prevent scratching of the viewfinder housing and the viewfinder holder.

Telescope Spec:

  • 8 x 50 Finder / Guide Scope
  • Can also be used as a mini travel telescope
  • Perfect image sharpness
  • FMC Multi-coated Lens Surfaces
  • Lens focal length: 220mm
  • Maximum permissible camera weight: 550g
  • Removable eyepiece/crosshair unit
  • Camera connection via 1.25 inch / 31.7mm plug-in connector or T2 thread
  • T2 thread: M42 x 0.75mm
  • Precise helical focuser for focusing the field of view
  • Setting distance of the helical focuser: 28mm
  • Close focusing limit: 3m
  • Laser-engraved millimeter scale from 0 to 28mm on the focuser
  • Sharpness plane (back focus) is approx. 22mm behind the T2 thread
  • Separate focus of the crosshairs on the eyepiece
  • Very large field of view FOV of 6.96 degrees
  • With adjustable red crosshair lighting
  • Scale markings of the crosshairs with 1.0 degree pitch
  • Power supply: Two LR41 button cells
  • Ring clamping made of brass and 3 clamping screws on the 1.25 inch plug-in connection
  • With optional eyepieces, magnifications from 8x to 40x can be achieved

Title: Sharpstar Z4 100 APO
Body (HTML):
Askar Sharpstar Z4 100mm f/5.5 6-Element Flatfield Apo.

Note: These Telescopes are ordered directly from the Manufacturer which can have an additional lead time. Feel free to contact us for more info if needed.

The Z4 is a sextuplet astrograph with three pieces of lens at the front and three pieces at the back, and two of them are ED glasses.

Just like other Sharpstar astrographs, the Z4 is designed as self-flattening so there is no need to calculate the back focus. You can just focus the target and the optical system is perfectly corrected for imaging. It is especially ideal for capturing stunning wide-field images of the deep sky over a 36mm (APS-C) sized image circle, however the Z4 is not recommended for use with full-frame cameras.

The tube ring has a handle on the top which makes it easy to carry and assemble. The handle is also designed as a slot where you can mount a finder base etc.

The entire tube has a length of just 482mm with the dew shield retracted and it weighs just 4.3kg. It has a back focus of 77mm, so common M48-rings will work fine when using DSLR cameras or you can use astronomical cameras with accessories.

The Z4 uses a large 3.4" focuser with a 1:10 fine adjustment knob and a 360° rotator for easy focusing and angle adjustment. It has M86, M68, M54, M48 adapters, and the M48 one has an internal thread that can fit 2" filters.

A 300mm Vixen-style dovetail plate also makes it easier to balance on the equatorial mount.

Spec:

  • Objective lens: Fully air-spaced sextuplet apo (including two ED glasses)
  • Aperture: 100mm
  • Focal Length: 550mm
  • Focal ratio: f/5.5
  • Image circle: 36mm
  • Focuser: 3.4" rack and pinion, dual speed
  • Back focus: 77mm from the M48 thread
  • Rear-end thread: M48x0.75 male thread
  • Adapters: M86x1-M68x1, M68x1-M54x0.75, M54x0.75-M54x0.75, M54x0.75-M48x0.75 (with M48x0.75 filter thread)
  • Dew Shield: Retractable
  • Total length: 482mm
  • Weight of tube without tube ring and dovetail bar: 4.3kg
  • Weight tube incl. tube ring and dovetail bar: 5.6kg
  • Gross weight incl. case and all accessories: 9.3kg

Thanks to the triplet design, this image field corrector provides very good correction of the image field while simultaneously providing very good illumination up to full frame format for sharp astrophotos.

Title: Sharpstar 61 EDPH III (incl. x0.75 Reducer)
Body (HTML):
Sharpstar 61EDPH III 61mm Triplet Apochromat:

Note: These Telescopes are ordered directly from the Manufacturer which can have an additional lead time. Feel free to contact us for more info if needed.

The 61EDPH series has long been popular with astrophotography amateurs, in order to have a better user experience for users, Sharpstar has optimized the 61EDPH II and launched the 61EDPH III which has more diverse functions and greater performance.

The 61EDPH III still has high-quality optical standards like before and adopts an air-spaced triplet APO design. However, compared to the 61EDPH II, it has an upgraded two pieces low dispersion ED glass for more excellent imaging performance. 61EDPH III (without reducer) has a focal length of 360mm, a focal ratio of f5.9, and supports the 44mm full-frame image circle. Its also a high-quality portable telescope.

The 61EDPH III upgraded the handle of the 61EDPH II to a multifunctional handle, which provides an additional universal Vixen style finder base. In addition to this, the 61EDPH III is equipped with a 200mm long Vixen style dovetail plate, easier to connect to the equatorial mounts and accessories, and makes the OTA easier to balance on the mount. As before, the tube uses high-quality CNC machining, high-grade surface painting, and polished oxidation, which is both elaborate and durable.

The x0.75 Reducer (included)

The special full-frame reducer: On this reducer, one end of the reducer features an M68×1 thread to connect to the focuser drawtube, the other end of the reducer has an M48×0.75 male thread with built-in 2" filter thread. The back focus is 55mm. If it needs to be extended, this reducer can also be split to reveal an M54×0.75 female thread, and then the back focus becomes 75mm. The reducer adopts an air-spaced quadruplet structure, supporting full-frame imaging. With the reducer installed, the focal ratio of 61EDPH III is reduced to f/4.5 and the focal length reduced to 270mm.

An optional full-frame flattener and a full-frame reducer are available for the 61EDPH III, providing users with even more options:
The special full-frame flattener: One end of the flattener features an M68×1 male thread to connect to the focuser drawtube, the other end of the flattener has an M48×0.75 male thread with built-in 2" filter thread. The back focus is 55mm. If it needs to be extended further, the flattener can be split to reveal an M54×0.75 female thread, and the back focus becomes 81.5mm. The flattener adopts an air-spaced triplet structure, the peripheral light reduction control is excellent and can effectively improve the curvature of the field which improves the corner image quality, and reduces aberrations.

Spec:

  • Lens: Air-spaced triplet apo (including two ED glasses)
  • Corrector: Air-spaced quadruplet design, fully multi-coated
  • Aperture: 61mm
  • Focal length: 270mm (Reducer installed)
  • Focal ratio: f/4.4 (Reducer installed)
  • Limiting visual magnitude: 10.7
  • Resolution: 1.93 arc seconds
  • Image circle: 44mm
  • Focuser: 2.5" dual-speed rack-and-pinion precision focuser, 360 rotatable
  • Back side connections: M48x0.75 male thread, M54x0.75 male thread with increased back focus
  • Back side connections without reducer:    M68x1 male thread, 2", 1.25"
  • Back focus: 55mm (75mm from M54 thread)

Title: Bresser Messier AR-102XS/460 EXOS-2 PMC 8
Body (HTML):
The Bresser Messier AR-102XS/460 telescope and the EXOS-2 PMC-Eight GoTo mount,  allow you to experience fascinating wide-field observations and astrophotography in the highest quality. 

The Telescope:

The compact optics, with its focal length of only 460mm, enables impressive wide-field views of many deep space nebula and larger galaxies. Thanks to the ED glass, the telescope provides exceptionally high image quality with minimal colour aberration. The modern mount, equipped with its precise GoTo control system and the ExploreStars app, delivers exact tracking and intuitive navigation of the night sky. A perfect set for ambitious beginners and advanced users alike!

With the high-quality solar filter, you can safely observe sunspots, eclipses, and planetary transits. (Warning: Never point the telescope at the sun without a solar filter.)

The EXOS-2 PMC-Eight Mount:

The Explore Scientific EXOS-2 PMC-Eight GoTo Mount is equipped with a modern and very precise GoTo control system. It consists of a robust Wi-Fi controller unit that provides all the necessary interfaces. The NEMA-11 stepper motors are directly connected to this unit via cable, and an ST-4 compatible autoguider interface is also available. In addition, the control system supports micro-stepping to ensure precise tracking.

Intuitive operation via app and graphical star chart:
The ExploreStars App, developed specifically for the PMC-Eight system, impresses with a very well-designed, intuitive user interface. The featured 'alignment stars' for initializing the control system, as well as all celestial objects in the database, are displayed as a star chart with additional text information. All these objects can be easily viewed and selected.

Powerful controller unit with Open GoTo for customization:
The heart of the controller unit consists of a completely autonomous 2-channel multi-processor with 8 CPUs and a Wi-Fi Ethernet 10/100 adapter with IP function. This allows remote operation via browser, ASCOM, app, or serial connection. The Open GoTo also allows you to write your own firmware and upload it to the controller unit. This enables custom adjustments to the device’s functions as well as the creation of custom object lists, etc.

Polar finder included:
The included and pre-installed polar finder scope allows for quick and precise polar alignment for longer exposure times without star trails. The integrated LED lighting unit further enhances the comfort of using the polar finder.

Telescope Spec:

  • Type: Refractor telescope
  • Lens diameter: 102mm / Focal length: 460mm / F/4.5
  • OTA Weight (incl. acc): 2.8kg
  • Maximum useful magnification: x204
  • High-quality Hexafoc focuser with 2.5" clear internal diameter
  • 6x30 finder with crosshair eyepiece; optimised finder mount for comfortable viewing
  • 31.7mm (1.25") star diagonal mirror
  • Prism rail with stainless steel clamping surface (44 mm universal dovetail for GP/EQ5/LXD75)
  • 50.8mm to 31.7mm adapter with integrated T2 adapter (optional T2 ring required)

Mount Spec:

  • Powerful PMC-8 Open GoTo system
  • User-friendly and graphically appealing ExploreStars OpenGoto App
  • Wi-Fi control via a tablet, notebook, or desktop PC with at least 7" display and Wi-Fi function (not included)
  • Compatible operating systems: WIN8.1, WIN10/11, iOS, or Android 4.4 and higher
  • Classic control via directional buttons or joystick for guiding, centering, correcting, and moving with a touchscreen
  • Intuitive 2-star and 3-star alignment for GoTo control initialization
  • Multiprocessor microcontroller with 8 CPUs (processor cores)
  • Micro-stepper motors NEMA-11
  • Highly precise and quiet belt drive
  • ST-4 compatible autoguider interface
  • ASCOM driver available, also supports pulse guiding
  • Possibility to create your own firmware and object lists and load them into the PMC-8
  • GPS compatible / settings depend on the computer or tablet used
  • Power supply via 12V DC, power consumption at full load max. 1.6 amps
  • Max Load: 13kg

Whats included:

  1. Refractor Optical tube
  2. 26mm Super Plössl eyepiece (31.7mm / 1.25")
  3. 31.7mm (1.25") star diagonal mirror
  4. Integrated 31.7mm and T2 adapter
  5. Prism rail with stainless steel clamping surface (44 mm universal dovetail for GP/EQ5/LXD75)
  6. 6x30 finderscope
  7. Rotating star chart
  8. Objective solar filter
  9. Astronomy PC software Stellarium (via download)
  10. EXOS2-GT mount with Open GoTo PMC-8
  11. Stainless steel tripod with built-in spirit level
  12. Counterweight 2 x 4.5kg

SAFETY NOTICE: Never look directly at the Sun through your Binoculars or Telescope - immediate and permanent eye damage may result. For Solar viewing please ensure you have a dedicated Solar Filter fitted correctly to your telescope.

Title: Bresser Messier AR-152L/1200 EXOS-2 PMC 8
Body (HTML):
This is the perfect Telescope for ambitious or experieinced planetary observers. This complete set consists of the Bresser Messier AR-152L/1200 Refractor Telescope and the modern EXOS-2 PMC-Eight GoTo Mount. With the large aperture and long focal length of 1200mm, the high-quality optics deliver razor-sharp, high-contrast images that will impress even the most experienced Astronomer.

The telescope is especially suitable for detailed views of Mars, Jupiter, and other celestial bodies. You can also explore the sun using the included objective filter. The mount is equipped with a precise GoTo control system and is very easy to use with the intuitive 'Explore Stars' App.

The Telescope:

The Bresser Messier AR-152L is a dream Telescope for demanding Planetary observers. Discover structures in Jupiter’s cloud bands, the finest grooves and craters on the moon’s surface, and structures on Mars, including the ice-covered polar caps of our neighboring planet! Observe Jupiter’s moons around the planet and the greenish glow of Uranus far beyond Saturn’s orbit. The combination of large aperture and long focal length enables sharp, high-contrast images that will impress you every time. And with the high-quality objective solar filter, you can also safely observe our own star. (Caution: Never point the telescope at the sun without a solar filter!)
