SAFETY NOTICE: Never look directly at the Sun through your Binoculars or Telescope - immediate and permanent eye damage may result. For Solar viewing please ensure you have a dedicated Solar Filter fitted correctly to your telescope.

Title: Celestron NexStar Evolution - 6" SC
Body (HTML):
Celestron's computer-controlled telescopes reach the next level with the NexStar Evolution: the first Schmidt-Cassegrains with built-in WiFi. You no longer need a hand controller - point the telescope at the most beautiful celestial objects with a click on your smartphone or tablet.

Connect your mobile device to the wireless network of your NexStar Evolution telescope and explore the universe with the Celestron app for iOS and Android.

The planetarium program on your smartphone shows you the current sky view or a list of observation targets for your location. The easy-to-use SkyAlign is integrated into the Celestron app, so you can set up the telescope and adjust the three reference stars in just a few minutes.

Simple and convenient operation:
The NexStar Evolution telescopes have been developed based on customer feedback from the past few years. They offer many well thought-out details so that you can enjoy the most beautiful night possible under the starry sky. 

No more worrying about batteries or an external power supply. The NexStar Evolution is the first amateur telescope to have a built-in lithium iron phosphate battery. One charge lasts up to ten hours. You can even use the Evolution's USB port to power other devices you want to use at night.

The NexStar Evolution is easy to set up thanks to the large, ergonomic handles. The steel tripod has markings so you can easily extend all legs to the same length. The azimuth and elevation clamps allow you to point the telescope at a target even without power. Up to seven eyepieces can be stored in two storage compartments - one even has a dimmable red LED light.

More power and safety thanks to lithium iron phosphate battery:
Instead of a typical lithium polymer battery, a lithium iron phosphate battery is used in the Evolution telescopes. These LiFePO 4 batteries have several advantages over simple LiPo batteries:

High safety & Reliability:

  • Unlike LiPo batteries, LiFePO 4 batteries cannot explode or ignite, but are considered intrinsically safe. The improved power density ensures a high load capacity even with continuous current consumption.
  • Long service life and cycle stability.
  • Wide temperature range for storage and operation
  • Low self-discharge
  • Excellent tracking accuracy, suitable for astrophotography

If you're interested in astrophotography, a NexStar Evolution is an excellent and affordable way to get started. It's the only fork-mounted telescope series in this price range with worm gears, along with improved motors. Planetary photography with a DSLR or a planetary camera is also no problem at all, and with a polar wedge you can also set it up equatorially to take long exposure deep sky images, be it with a DSLR or an Astro Camera.

The Schmidt-Cassegrain telescopes with the StarBright XLT coating deliver bright, sharp images and are just as interesting for visual observers as they are for astrophotographers.

The NexStar Evolution telescopes come with a StarPointer finder scope, two 1.25” Plössl eyepieces, a star diagonal, power supply and a hand controller.

Specs:

  • Optical design: Schmidt-Cassegrain
  • Resolution (DAWES): 0.77 arcseconds
  • Resolution (RAYLEIGH): 0.92 arcseconds
  • Focal length: 1500mm
  • Secondary mirror obstruction: 5.6cm
  • Secondary mirror obstruction relative to diameter: 37.00%
  • Secondary mirror obstruction relative to surface: 14.00%
  • Limit size: 13.4 likes
  • Highest useful magnification: x354
  • Light gathering capacity (compared to the human eye): x459
  • Lowest useful magnification: x18
  • Optical coating: Starbright XLT (Fully multi-coated)
  • Telescope aperture: 150mm (5.91")
  • Focuser size (inches): 2" SC thread, 1.25"
  • Tube length: 41cm
  • Aperture ratio: f/10

Mount Specs:

  • Axis weight: 7kg
  • Alignment Methods: SkyAlign, 3-Star Align, Solar System Align
  • Database: Hand controller with over 40,000+ objects, 100 user-defined entries, additional information on over 200 objects; SkyPortal app with over 120,000 entries
  • Mount: Azimuthal mount (motorized)
  • Mount control: Computer controlled (GOTO)
  • Tracking speeds: Sidereal, solar and lunar
  • Tracking modes: Azimuthal, EQ-North, EQ-South
  • Dovetail compatible: EQ Standard (Vixen Style)
  • Panning speed: Max. 4°/second, nine speeds
  • Carrying capacity (kg): 11kg
  • Mount type: Alt-Azimuth single-arm mount
  • Connections: 1 hand controller, 3 AUX for optional accessories, USB on the hand controller
  • Hand controller: NexStar+ hand controller, two-line LCD display with 16 characters, 19 backlit keys, USB 2.0 port for PC connection
  • Power requirements: Built-in LiFePO4 battery

Whats included:

  1. Focal length eyepiece: 40mm, 13mm
  2. Incl. accessories: 6" Schmidt-Cassegrain telescope, pre-assembled steel tripod,
  3. accessory tray, computer-controlled Nexstar Evolution mount with NexStar hand
  4. controller, built-in battery and WiFi, StarPointer red dot finder, 40mm eyepiece,
  5. 13mm eyepiece, 1.25" star diagonal
  6. Viewfinder: StarPointer
  7. Zenith prism: 1.25"
  8. Accessory tray: with eyepiece tray

Title: TS-Optics N-AG Newtonian - 14"
Body (HTML):
TS Optics 14" f/5.13 Newtonian Astrograph is an excellent telescope for Astrophotographers who want to use a CCD camera or a DSLR camera with large sensors. It also offers a fully corrected and illuminated image field of 54mm diameter.

Telescopes for astrophotography without compromises:

  • High-quality carbon fiber tube made in Germany - manufactured as carbon fiber hard foam sandwich for optimal stiffness at low weight. The telescope obtains its optimal temperature properties from the carbon fiber materials therefore with medium temperature changes, refocusing is not necessary anymore.
  • The Primary and secondary mirror cell are also made in Germany. The entire collimation of the telescope can be done without tools.
  • Very effective 3.0" dual-speed focuser - this focuser clamps 3" accessories together and it also allows for screwed connections.
  • The built in N-AGK3 3" coma corrector provides some of the best illumination of all 3" correctors - it's suitable for all common sensors and perfectly suitable for high-resolution sensors right up to very large format sensors. The attachment to the M68 x 1 ZEISS style adapter thread is included.
  • High-quality primary and secondary mirror for maximum sharpness. After assembling, every N-AG14 is checked on the optical bench prior to shipping and a production journal is included with every telescope.
  • The edge of the secondary is also well blackened to prevent stray light and reflexes.
  • CNC machined metal tube rings offer the best stability and elegant design and mounting to dovetail bars is done via female M6 threads.
  • The N-AG14 Astrographs also offer two further focus positions for all common 2" and 3" correctors.

Anti-reflex paint for maximal contrast:
Berger Anti reflex colour paint is used as it darkens the inner wall of the tube. Apart from the lower weight, the main advantage is that the paint produces almost no rust and the optics stay perfectly clean.

Connecting your CCD camera to the telescope:
The N-AG14 Astrograph offers a generous working distance of 69.3mm from the M68 x 1 connecting thread.

Important note for using full-frame DSLR cameras:
Every N-AG14 Astrograph is made to use cameras with large sensors. However, you will see vignetting when using DSLR cameras. This comes from the body of the camera or from the adaption via the M48 adapter. By using flats, you can eliminate this vignetting. Full-frame CCD cameras are not affected by it, as the distance to the sensor is bigger and the cameras usually have a larger connection thread.

Spec:

  • Aperture: 358 mm / 14"
  • Focal ratio (without corrector): f/4.5
  • Effective focal ratio: f/5.1 (due to the extension factor of the corrector)
  • Focal length: 1837mm
  • Primary mirror: Mirror substrate Pyrex, conical
  • Secondary mirror: Diameter 104mm minor axis
  • Tube: Diameter 412mm - Wall thickness 11mm
  • Primary mirror cell: fully adjustable primary mirror cell

* As this is a Special Order Telescope for specialised Astrophotography, please contact us for more detailed information if needed prior to purchase.

Whats included:

  1. 14" Optical tube assembly
  2. CNC tube rings
  3. 8x50 finder, straight view
  4. Dust cap for the front side
  5. 3" Newtonian focuser with reduction to 2" and 1.25"
  6. N-AGK3 corrector
  7. VIP-3010-M68 - M68 connection
  8. Collimation manual and manufacturing protocol

Title: TS-Optics UNC f/4 Newtonian - 12"
Body (HTML):
The TS Optics UNC Newtonian series offers an alternative to Newtonians made in the far east. With these telescopes you do not have to settle for any compromises. UNC stands for Universal Newtonian telescope with Carbon tube. Each UNC Newtonian is individually manufactured for you in Germany.

These Telescopes are specially made to order.

The 10" f/4 UNC Newtonian is a versatile and relatively compact telescope for portable and stationary use. The high speed of f/4 makes the Newtonian the ideal telescope for astrophotography. We recommend an EQ6 or CGEM mount, which comfortably holds a Newtonian of this size with good stability when used for astrophotography.

Checkout some examples of photos taken with this Telescope on Astrobin here >

The advantages of the TS UNC Newtonian telescope:

  • High-quality carbon tube made in Germany with maximum stability - customized manufacturing to suit your needs.
  • Optimized focus position as desired and therefore also best possible illumination
    Primary mirror cell and secondary mirror cell has been further improved by Teleskop-Service in Germany
  • Easy collimation of primary and secondary mirror - by hand, without tools
  • The edge of the secondary mirror is blackened
  • TS Rack and Pinion focuser with M54 x 0.75 intermediate thread, also suitable for heavy cameras
  • The secondary is attached to the secondary mirror mount with the correct offset before its shipped to you.
  • 94% reflectivity on primary mirror and secondary mirror for a brighter image
  • Diffraction limited primary mirror - each individual telescope is tested on an optical bench before shipment

Every UNC Newtonian is darkened inside:
The tube inner side of the UNC Newtonian telescopes is darkened which prevents reflections and provides better contrast. The TS "Black" anti-reflective paint or a velour film is used. The result is a matte black tube interior. Velour film and the TS "Black" have a similar effect and darken better than the commonly used chalkboard paint.

The Carbon Tube - finest precision work:
The carbon tube is extra solid and completely reinforced, and not only around the focuser which makes the tube much stiffer. The openings for the secondary spider vanes are precisely fitted with turned mating parts, to ensure that the secondary spider vanes are correct and the telescope produces perfect spikes right from the start.

Focus position optimized for astrophotography:
The focus point is 135mm above the tube. This allows you to use different focusers and still have a comfortable working distance. With the standard focuser you even get 80mm working distance, which even allows the use of focal reducers or a binoviewer with moderate glass path compensation. For standard correctors like the Baader MPCC or the TS-Optics MAXFIELD corrector we recommend the 20mm spacer, which goes between the focuser. This gives you 60mm backfocus. Note: For visual observations you need a 2" extension tube.

The 2" TS UNCN2-G2 focuser:
A core component of the TS UNC-Newtons is the modern TS UNCN2-G2 focuser. The focuser builds up only 58mm from the tube edge and still carries heavy cameras and accessories without tilting. This type of focuser is also far superior to conventional Crayford focusers.

  • Focuser Features:
  • High stiffness with extremely short length
  • Precise 1:10 dual-speed gear - for perfectly focused Astrophotographs
  • The adjustment is decoupled from the ball bearing - a clear advantage over Crayford focusers
  • Can be adapted with motorized focusers
  • The ball bearings are adjustable, so the focuser tension can be adjusted perfectly - but its delivered with the focuser already optimally adjusted.
  • Accessories can be screwed on - the 2" receptacle can be unscrewed, providing you with an M54 x 0.75 female thread.

More information about the focuser UNCN2-G2:

Parabolic primary mirror:
Newtonian primary mirrors made of fused silica are free of strain and provide an image that is usually even much better than diffraction limited. The surface is coated with an enhanced 94% reflection layer and a protective quartz layer. The primary mirror has a central marking as an adjustment aid.

Primary mirror fan for faster cool-down:
A fan accelerates the cooling down to ambient temperature. As long as a mirror has not cooled down properly, it generates warm air currents that degrade the image - regardless of which mirror substrate is used. This effect only stops once the mirror has cooled down.

Every TS Carbon Newtonian is tested on an optical bench before shipping:
After assembly, each UNC Newtonian is subjected to an optical test in the workshop before shipping. This ensures that the telescope will adapt perfectly with your accessories and also delivers the optical performance you expect.

Before shipping, the primary mirror with the cell is removed from the tube and packed separately. This is done to ensure a safer shipment and avoid unnecessary transport damages.

Choose your focus positions and secondary mirror diameter:

  1. Focus Position No.1 - Astrophotography with normal coma correctors - 65mm distance from the 2" connection of the focuser (Standard Version) This version is perfect for nearly all 2" Newtonian coma correctors. For visual observing, you will need a 35mm 2" extension tube.
  2. Focus Position No.2 - Astrophotography with ASA 2" Reducer/Corrector - 90mm distance from the 2" connection of the focuser.
    This version is made for the well known ASA 2KORRR Reducer and Corrector. The focal ratio will reduced from f/4 to f/2.8 with really good field correction.
  3. Focus Position No.3 - Optimized for visual observing with for example, TeleVue Paracorr Coma Correctors - 35mm distance from the 2" connection of the focuser is still required using an extension adapter. This version is perfect for amateur astronomers looking for a telescope for visual observing through the eyepiece. For this version a 63mm secondary mirror is used.

Important:
As these Telescopes are made to your specifications, please allow a little extra delivery time as the workshop prepares and tests your new Telescope before shipping.

Assembly and collimation instructions:
The telescope is delivered disassembled into several units for safety. The assembly and adjustments are not complicated, you can download the instructions in advance. The PDF can be found here.

Spec:

  • Telescope type: Newtonian
  • Aperture: 305mm - 12"
  • Focal length: 1200mm
  • F Ratio: f/4
  • Primary mirror: Parabolic, fused quartz
  • Optical quality: Significantly better than diffraction limited
  • Reflectivity: 94%
  • Secondary diameter: 100mm (minor axis). Other sizes upon request
  • Tube: Carbon fibre with aluminium reinforcement rings, 7 mm thickness
  • Inner tube diameter: 344mm
  • Support surface on the bottom of the tube rings: Flat support surface with an M6 thread
  • Support surface on the top of the tube rings:    Flat support surface with a 1/4” internal thread (tripod socket)
  • Focuser: 2" UNCN2-G2 RAP focuser with 54 mm thread for screwed adaptations
  • Weight: approx. 19 kg with tube rings
  • Length: approx. 1200mm (depending on your chosen focus position)

Whats included:

  1. TS UNC Carbon Newtonian telescope with 2" UNCN2-G2 focuser
  2. Aluminium tube rings with two flat faces
  3. Vixen level finder shoe
  4. 8x50 straight finder with bracket
  5. 1.25" reducer
  6. Instructions for assembling and collimating the telescope

Title: TS-Optics UNC f/4 Newtonian - 8"
Body (HTML):
The TS Optics UNC Newtonian series offers an alternative to Newtonians made in the far east. With these telescopes you do not have to settle for any compromises. UNC stands for Universal Newtonian telescope with Carbon tube. Each UNC Newtonian is individually manufactured for you in Germany.

These Telescopes are specially made to order.

The 8" f/4 UNC Newtonian is a compact and transportable all-round telescope. It is ideally suitable for visual observation and astrophotography. Astrophotographers will appreciate fine stars because of the small secondary mirror and in combination with suitable coma-correctors, deep-sky photography are possible in a relatively short time.

The advantages of the TS UNC Newtonian telescopes:

  • High-quality, German-made high quality carbon tube.
  • Easy collimation of primary and secondary mirror - by hand, without tools.
  • The edge of the secondary mirror is blackened.
  • TS UNCN2-G2 2" rack and pinion focuser with M54x0.75 intermediate thread.
  • The secondary is Pre-attached to the secondary mount with the correct offset.
  • 94% reflectivity on primary mirror and secondary mirror for a brighter image
  • Diffraction limited primary mirror - each telescope is tested on an optical bench before shipment

The carbon tube - finest precision work:
The carbon tube is extra solid and completely reinforced, not only around the focuser. This makes the tubes much stiffer and the adjustment stability is high. The openings for the secondary are precisely fitted with turned mating parts, ensuring that the secondary spider vanes are correct and the telescope produces perfect spikes right from the start.

Focus position optimized for astrophotography:
The focus point is 135mm above the tube. This allows you to use different focusers and still have a comfortable working distance. With the standard focuser UNCN2-G2 you even get 80mm working distance, this even allows the use of focal reducers or a binoviewer with moderate glass path compensation. For standard correctors we recommend a 20mm spacer, which sits between the focuser. This gives you 60mm backfocus.

Note: For visual observation you need a 2" extension tube - Click here.

The 2" TS UNCN2-G2 RAP focuser:

  • A core component of the TS UNC-Newtons is the modern TS UNCN2-G2 focuser. The focuser builds up only 58mm from the tube edge and still carries heavy cameras and accessories without tilting. The focuser is superior to conventional Crayford focusers.
  • High stiffness with extremely short length
  • Exact 1:10 dual-speed gear - for perfectly focused astrophotographs.
    Adjustment is decoupled from the ball bearing - a clear advantage over Crayford focusers
  • Threaded connection of accessories is possible - the 2" receptacle can be unscrewed, then an M54x0.75 female thread is available.

Parabolic primary mirror:
Newtonian primary mirrors made of fused silica are free of strain and provide an image that is usually much better than diffraction limited types. The surface is coated with an enhanced 94% reflection layer and a protective quartz layer. The primary mirror has a central marking as an adjustment aid.

Primary mirror fan for faster cool-down time:
A cooling fan to accelerate cool-down time to ambient temperature. Until a mirror is properly cooled down, it will create currents of warm air that will deteriorate the image - no matter which mirror substrate is used. Only after the mirror has cooled down does this effect stop.

Every TS Carbon Newtonian is tested on our optical bench before shipping:
These are a solid telescope for life. After assembly, Each UNC Newtonian is subjected to an optical test at the workshop before shipping. This ensures that the telescope will fit your accessories perfectly and will deliver the optical performance promised.

Before shipping, the primary mirror with the cell is removed from the tube and packed separately. This is to guarantee a safe shipment and avoid unnecessary transport damages.

Choose your focus positions and change of secondary mirror diameter:

  1. Focus position No.1 - with 60mm above the 2" receptacle has proven to be very versatile. Nevertheless, we can also offer you individual focus positions and other secondary mirror sizes - Just contact us prior to purchase.
  2. Focus position No.2 - 30mm above the 2" connection - optimal for visual observation. The secondary mirror can be slightly smaller, we recommend a secondary mirror with 63mm (minor axis) which is sufficient even for 2" eyepieces.
  3. Focus position No.3 - 90mm above the 2" connection - this allows you to use a 0.73x reducer/corrector and change the focal ratio from f/4 to f/2.9 (@580mm). The combination is then designed for cameras up to APS-C format. We recommend the secondary mirror with 70mm (minor axis).

Assembly and collimation instructions:

Title: TS Hyperbolic Ritchey-Chrétien - 6"
Body (HTML):
TS GSO 6" f/9 RC Ritchey-Chrétien Telescope.

Most large professional telescope are designed and constructed to the Ritchey-Chrétien principle. Until recently, these telescopes were unaffordable for amateurs as they are quite difficult and complex to produce, due to their unique design, Ritchey-Chrétien telescopes are primarily aimed to amateur astronomers with an interest in high resolution Astrophotography however an RC can also still be used for visual observing with an eyepiece if needed.

How to reach focus on the 6" RC:
Without extension sleeves, the back focus from the 2" connection is about 159mm. But included are three M90 extension sleeves (1x 50mm 2x 25mm) which are simply screwed between the focuser and the tube. This allows you to focus any accessory needed such as 1.25" and 2" zenith mirrors and also various correctors and most common cameras.

Astrophotography with the TS 6" RC telescope:
Better and sharper astro photos without a corrector and with shorter exposure times is exactly what this Ritchey-Chrétien telescope allows you to do with astro cameras and SLRs up to APS-C sensors. As a pure mirror system, you can even use the infrared light. You can achieve up to 25% shorter exposure times and sharper imaging than, for example, through a comparable Schmidt-Cassegrain telescope. For the use of a reflex camera without focal length reduction you need the 50mm and the 25mm extension between focuser and telescope.

The generous backfocus also allows the connection of correctors (which we recommend for the use of full-frame sensors). You can also connect a focal length reducer, thus further increasing the light intensity of the Ritchey-Chrétien.

Accessories - 0.67x CCD reducer for Astrophotography:
The CCD47 reducer improves the focal ratio from f/9 to f/5.96, therefore reducing the exposure time by around 50%. With this, you can capture dim nebulae and galaxies with more moderate exposure times.

Primary and secondary mirror of quartz glass with 94% enhanced reflectivity:
Quartz glass does not change its dimensions if temperature changes. When the temperature changes slowly during an exposure, other mirror substrates, like Pyrex, tend to a deformation of the mirror and thus to a shift of the focus. This problem does not exist for mirrors of quartz glass. Therefore the focus is better maintained which is very important for long exposures. Both mirrors are coated with 94% reflectivity material which means the image is obviously brighter than many other designs with only 90% reflection.

The advantages of TS Ritchey-Chrétien telescopes for Astrophotography:
The TS RC astrographs are true Ritchey-Chrétien telescopes. Maksutovs and Schmidt-Cassegrains have spherical mirrors and need correctors for making a large field usable. With Schmidt-Cassegrains, you can see the aberrations in the field even when working visually. Most times, Maksutov-Cassegrains are so slow that they are not suitable for astrophotography. RC telescopes have hyperbolical primary and secondary mirrors. They are more difficult to manufacture, but offer a significantly sharper field with less aberrations throughout the field.

What makes the Ritchey-Chrétien Telescope superior to Schmidt-Cassegrain telescopes for Astrophotography:
Schmidt-Cassegrains generally require a corrector for Astrophotography. Additionally, these telescopes have a Schmidt plate at the front side which is prone to dew. The RC is a pure reflection system without lenses in the light path. Thus you can use the complete light even in the infrared range. The image is brighter and the exposure times get shorter. The field of an RC telescope is coma-free by design and relatively flat.

No shifting problem with TS RC telescopes:
Telescopes with focusing via a movable primary mirror often suffer from mirror shifting problems. The image shifts while focusing or even jumps. TS Ritchey-Chrétien telescopes do not have this problem, as their primary mirror is fixed. Focusing is done via a high-quality focuser. An additional advantage is the optimal distance from primary to secondary mirror which gives you the guarantee of the best possible image if the primary mirror moves relative to the secondary, you will almost never have the optimal distance.

Telescope Spec:

  • Optical Design: True Ritchey-Chrétien with a hyperbolic primary and secondary mirror.
  • Aperture: 6" / 154mm
  • Focal Length: 1370mm (918mm using the CCD47 Reducer)
  • Focal Ratio: f/9 (f/5.96 using the CCD47 reducer)
  • Resolution: 0.76"
  • Reflectivity: 94% reflectivity non-tarnishing mirror coatings
  • Back Focus: 159mm from 2" connection of the focuser
  • Tube Diameter: 191mm
  • Tube Length: 500mm with focuser
  • Tube Weight: 5.4kg
  • Obstruction by secondary: 77mm
  • Focuser: 2" dual speed Crayford focuser
  • Connecting Thread: M90x1

Title: TS Hyperbolic Ritchey-Chrétien - 8"
Body (HTML):
TS GSO 8" f/8 RC Ritchey-Chrétien Telescope with Carbon Tube.

Most large professional telescope are designed and constructed to the Ritchey-Chrétien principle. Until recently, these telescopes were unaffordable for amateurs. Due to their unique design, Ritchey-Chrétien telescopes are primarily aimed to amateur astronomers with an interest in high resolution Astrophotography however an RC can also still be used for visual observing with an eyepiece if needed.

The advantages of the TS RC Telescopes:

  • Hyperbolic primary and secondary mirror for a large fully illuminated field of view.
  • Astrophotography with camera sensors up to 30mm diameter is possible without corrector. For larger sensors, like full-frame size, a specialised corrector is available.
  • 94% enhanced reflectivity on the main and secondary mirror for an even brighter image.
  • Significantly shorter cooling down time due to open construction
  • Internal baffles in the tube for even more contrast.
  • High back focus for correctors, reducers and also binoviewers.
  • Due to a redesign of the baffle tube, problems with stray light no longer occurs. Nevertheless, the illumination is still very good. Sensors up to full frame format can be used.

Astrophotography with the TS  8" RC telescope:
Better and sharper astrophotos without a corrector and with shorter exposure times is exactly what this Ritchey-Chrétien telescope allows you to do with astro cameras and SLRs up to APS-C sensors. As a pure mirror system, you can even use the infrared light. You can achieve up to 25% shorter exposure times and sharper imaging than, for example, through a comparable Schmidt-Cassegrain telescope. For the use of a reflex camera without focal length reduction you need the 50mm and the 25mm extension between focuser and telescope.

The generous backfocus also allows the connection of correctors (which we recommend for the use of full-frame sensors). You can also connect a focal length reducer, thus further increasing the light intensity of the Ritchey-Chrétien.

Accessories - 0.67x CCD reducer for Astrophotography:
The CCD47 reducer improves the focal ratio from f/8 to f/5.36, thus reducing the exposure time to less than 50%. With this, you can capture dim nebulae and galaxies with more moderate exposure times.

The advantages of a carbon tube over a metal tube:
The weight reduction is minimal - only about 300 grams - the main advantage is the focus stability when temperature changes which is important for Astrophotography. When temperatures drop, metal contracts and the focus moves meaning refocusing is necessary. A carbon tube does not change, the combination of quartz glass mirror and carbon composite tube makes a readjustment of the sharpness obsolete, even for long time exposures.

The 2" Monorail focuser:
The Monorail focuser combines the ease of movement of a Crayford focuser with the stiffness of a rack-and-pinion focuser.

Focuser Features:

  •  A stainless steel bar instead of small ball bearings for more stiffness.
  •  No tilting anymore when locking the drawtube.
  •  360° rotation for optimal object alignment
  •  Female M69 x 1 thread for threaded adaptions
  •  2" and 1.25" compression rings for push adaptions
  •  1:10 dual speed for accurate focusing
  •  Motor focus can easily retrofitted
  •  Lined scale for quick retrieving of the focus.
  •  Easy operation

  • Reflectivity: 94% enhanced reflectivity
  • Back focus: 254mm from the tube´s backside or 159mm from the 2" receptacle of the focuser

  • Tube Length: 580mm with focuser

Title: TS-Optics Hyperbolic Classic Cassegrain - 6"
Body (HTML):
TS-Optics 6" f/12 Hyperbolic Cassegrain telescopes are excellent high contrast and optically sharp instruments, particularly well suited for lunar and planetary viewing and imaging.

In terms of optical quality, Cassegrain telescopes are traditionally more advantageous than other similar designs such as SCT's which generally contain more basic spherical mirrors and a larger central obstruction. Being an open ended system, similar to Newtonian designs, these cassegrains are also less susceptible to dew formation and also adapt to temperature changes much more quickly.

Advantages of the TS-Optics Cassegrain design:

  • Well corrected field due to parabolic primary and hyperbolic secondary mirror with less field curvature compared with other cassegrain designs.
  • These are a pure reflection system without a Schmidt plate, resulting in better sharpness as well as the possibility for IR Photography
  • Significantly quicker temperature adaption thanks to Newtonian style open ended design.
  • Brighter image due to 96% dielectric coating on primary and secondary mirror.
  • No mirror shifting while focusing, because the primary mirror is fixed.
  • Includes a high-quality 2" Crayford focuser with micro-gear reduction and compression rings for 2" and 1.25" accessories
  • Only 38% obstruction caused by secondary mirror.
  • Better sharpness on the optical axis due to precise mirror surfaces and the lack of a front plate
  • Several interior baffles for even higher image contrast
  • Generous backfocus allowing the use of 2" accessories.
  • Compact tube with only 500mm length - so can be operated with smaller mounts
  • Primary and secondary mirrors are adjustable

  • Suitable for Infrared photography: yes
  • Backfocus: Roughly 150mm from the 2" receptacle

  • OTA length: Approx 500mm
  • Weight: 5.4 kg

  • Focuser: 2" Crayford focuser with micro-gear reduction
  • Connection thread of the focuser: M90x1 on the tube

Title: Vixen SXD2-R200SS Newtonian Reflector
Body (HTML):
The very fast f/4 200mm optics of the R200SS has a parabolic primary mirror and provides extremely sharp images without chromatic aberration. The use of a special coating (state-of-the-art technology) provides an optimal surface for Celestial observations and astrophotography of deep-sky objects.

The large aperture and the short design make this device ideal for astrophotography of nebulae, star clusters and comets and the focuser has a holder for 2" eyepieces - larger eyepieces of course means more light and less vignetting. The R200SS also comes with 232mm pipe clamps and Vixen dovetail rail.

Aluminum Vacuum Evaporation System:
Vixen has a unique aluminum vacuum evaporation system that creates extremely precise mirror surfaces. This very unique Vixen system enables the controlled coating of the primary mirror and therefore achieves much higher accuracy thank many other designs in this class.

The SXD2 mount comes with the new Starbook Ten controller and the PFL-II polar finder, which allows the mount to be aligned quickly and easily via reference stars. With a combination of the best features of the Sphinx series and the new Starbook Ten controller, Vixen has developed a new generation of SX mounts for demanding observers and astrophotographers alike.

The SXD2 is quieter and quieter in its tracking than the previous SX mounts and the increased precision of the motors allows for improved performance during long exposures in astrophotography. Precision stepper motors and the micro-step motion control system are at the heart of the SXD2, which offer even better performance and response times than other mount models.

The bearings of the R.A. and DEC axes and the worm shafts have been significantly improved to reduce the load on the motors. This makes the movement of the mount extremely quiet and more robust R.A. and DEC shafts increase the performance and overall robustness of the SXD2 mount.

The STARBOOK TEN controller features:

Large LCD color monitor:
The LCD monitior of the STAR BOOK TEN has a 5 inch TFT Color Liquid crystal display with high WVGA (800×480 pixels, 65,535 colors) resolution.

Functional Moon Map:
The latest version of the STAR BOOK TEN firmware includes a "Moon Map" function. This allows the user to view a map of the visible part of the moon on the screen. All major landmarks on the surface of the moon are highlighted and can be selected for the GoTo feature.

Night mode in red:
During astronomical observations at night, the eyes of the observer adapt to the darkness. The observer sees less of the night sky because bright white light reduces this dark adaptation of the eyes. For this reason, the display of the Starbook Ten can be switched to red backlight. The red light does not affect this dark adaptation as much as white light.

Illuminated buttons:
All command and direction buttons can be illuminated in red so that you can keep track even in the dark. The illuminated buttons can be switched on or off.

Fast CPU:
Starbook Ten has a CPU with 324 MHz clock frequency, which is about 5 times as fast as the CPU of the old STAR BOOK. This will make the star map load faster and make the screen more vivid.

Simple menu:
With the STAR BOOK TEN you can call up your celestial bodies in both scope and chart mode. In addition, you can select your objects by scrolling the star map in chart mode. Frequently used menus can be found on any of the ten buttons. This allows you to quickly and easily reach the most important functions directly at the touch of a button.

Object Database:
The STAR BOOK TEN contains more than 270,000 celestial objects, including 258,977 stars from the SAO star catalog, 109 Messier objects, 7,840 objects and NGC 5386 IC objects, the sun, the moon and the planets of our solar system. Simply call the objects with their common names.

P-PEC function:
You can save a periodic error correction to improve tracking accuracy of the mount. This is stored and retained even if you turn off the device and put it back into operation the next time.

On the hunt for satellites:
You can enter the orbital elements of a satellite directly into the Starbook via the LAN connection of a PC. You can store up to 10 satellites in your Starbook.

Viewing Comets:
You can enter the orbital elements of a comet directly into the Starbook via a LAN connection of a PC. You can save up to 10 comets in your Starbook.

User defined objects:
The Starbook Ten is able to save user-defined objects. You can save other interesting celestial objects that you want to observe or photograph on your Starbook Ten. You can enter position data of up to 10 objects directly on the Starbook Ten or via the LAN connection of a PC.

Multiple tracking speeds:
It is possible to change the speed rate according to the type of object you are observing. The movement of the sun, moon, planets or comets can be tracked at different speeds.

Advanced alignment algorithm:
You can achieve an exact alignment of the mount by simply approaching 2 stars with a distance of at least 10 degrees one after the other and saving them. You can enter the position data of up to 20 stars on the Starbook Ten controller.

The more stars you store, the more accurate the positioning of the mount will become. If you save more than 20 stars, existing position data will be deleted The Starbook Ten memory has a large backup storage in which your information can be stored. This allows you to turn off the device and conserve the batteries. When the mount resumes its work, the data remains stored.

Atmospheric refraction:
This option allows you to compensate for or reduce atmospheric refraction on the celestial objects near the horizon.

Cross Over Meridian:
The mount has a safety function that rotates the optical tube in the opposite direction when the observation object comes to its highest position to prevent the optics from hitting the mount. However, you are free to choose or turn off this feature if you want to shoot with your equipment.

Telescope & Mount Features:
  • Optical Design: Newtonian Telescope
  • Aperture: 200mm
  • Focal Length: 800mm
  • Focal Ratio: f/4 (Ideal for Astrophotography)
  • Maximum Magnification: x 400
  • Professional SXD2 mount - Max Payload: 20kg (15kg Astrophotography)
  • Computer Control Starbook Ten
  • Starbook Ten built-in autoguider port
  • Starbook Ten high-resolution monitor with star maps program
  • More than 270000 stored celestial objects
  • Total Weight of complete setup: 27.9 kg
  • Made in Japan
Whats included:
  1. SXG-HAL130 Tripod
  2. SXD2 Mount
  3. Starbook Ten control with cables
  4. R200SS Photo Newton
  5. 2x Counterweights 1.9 and 3.7 Kg
  6. 7x50 viewfinder telescope

Title: Vixen VMC200L Maksutov-Cassegrain OTA - 8"
Body (HTML):
This high-precision Maksutov-Cassegrain offers simply incredible views of the moon and the planets - Something Maksutov designs are especially renowned for. A specially coated spherical mirror enables an extremely sharp image and at 8" diameter and 1950mm focal length, this enables extremely clear and high resolution views of the moon and planets, particularly some of the larger ones like Jupiter & Saturn.

Due to the open system (i.e no front lens), the optics cool down faster and therefore adjust to temperature changes more quickly. This is important as closed systems such as Schmidt Cassegrain designs can need regular re-focusing due to temperature differences.

The extremely short length of only 510mm makes the telescope very transportable. Vixen has a unique aluminum vacuum evaporation system that creates extremely precise mirror surfaces and the revolutionary Vixen system allows the controlled coating of the primary mirror achieving incredibly high contrast and detail. This same coating is also used in both the VMV200/VC200L and the R200SS.

Title: TS Optics Super Plössl Eyepiece - 1.25" (Various Sizes)
Body (HTML):
Super Plössl eyepieces have been very popular among amateur astronomers for a long time. TS Optics Super Plössl eyepieces are perfect for amateur astronomers who put emphasis on a good image sharpness and detail which is also as bright as possible.

The advantages of the TS Super Plössl eyepieces at a glance:
  1. Extremely high quality optics compared to many basic eyepieces.
  2. No "tunnel vision" effect through the 52° apparent field of view.
  3. Multi-coated on all air-to-glass surfaces for maximum contrast and image brightness
  4. Blackened lens edges prevent reflections.
  5. 1.25" barrel with thread for 1.25" filters - fits straight into telescopes with a 1.25" eyepiece connection, or using a 2" to 1.25" reducer for larger telescopes.
  6. Foldable rubber eyecups - ideal if you wear glasses.
TS-Optics Super Plössl eyepieces for astrophotography:
These optics offer high contrast and fine internal blackening which make the TS Super Plössl eyepieces also suitable for astrophotography. You can even remove the rubber eyecup and directly attach the camera T2 adapter (see optional accessories) for effective eyepiece projection.

It is extremely important how much light reaches the observer through the optics, especially when viewing weak nebulae and galaxies and this light transmission can mean the difference between the object being clearly visible or not visible. TS Super Plössl eyepieces offer a very well balanced transmission with no colour cast, especially in the range where the human eye is very sensitive.

Features:
  • Focal lengths available: 6mm, 9mm, 12mm, 15mm, 20mm
  • Design: Super Plössl
  • Field of view: 52° apparent field of view
  • Number of lenses: 4 elements in 2 groups (2 elements in each one)
  • Connection to the telescope side: 1.25" barrel with filter thread
  • Coating: Fully multi-coated
  • Eye cup: yes - foldable

Title: Explore Scientific 68° Argon filled Eyepiece - 16mm (1.25")
Body (HTML):
When it comes to visual Astronomy, a good eyepiece is one of the most important accessories you can have to ensure a sharp unobstructed view through the telescope. In fact a good quality eyepiece can really enhance your whole experience by providing you with an almost 3D sensation when viewing the expanse of space.

Enjoy the unique combination of excellent edge-to-edge image quality even with fast optics, as well as excellent contrast and unmatched observation comfort. These eyepieces incorporate a wide variety of modern glass materials, manufactured to the highest standards, something which has been a long tradition at Explore Scientific.

The fold-down eyecups also allow optimal user comfort, especially when wearing glasses. The patented "EMD" coating in addition with internal apertures ensure a high contrast view and avoids internal reflections. The Argon filling effectively prevents fogging from the inside, and as they are completely sealed, they are well protected internally from dust, glass fungus or the ingress of cleaning liquid. This guarantees that they will enjoy these high-quality eyepieces for many years and countless observations.

All eyepieces in the 68° collection are homofocal - (i.e they require very little change in telescope focus when swapping the eyepiece for a different focal length)

Features:

  • Focal length: 16mm
  • Field of view: 68° apparent field of view
  • Connection to the telescope side: 1.25" barrel with filter thread
  • Coating: Fully multi-coated
  • Eye cup: yes - foldable

Title: Explore Scientific 2" Focal Extender - (x3)
Body (HTML):
With tele-extenders it's possible to extend the effective focal length of a telescope system, resulting in higher magnification for the observation of the moon, the planets or small Deep-Sky objects with the same eyepieces.

These tele-extenders incorporate a tele-centric optical design that delivers excellent image sharpness over the whole field of view and are premium choices for visual observations and astrophotography. The combination of excellent fully multicoating with superior optical design makes the Focal Extenders superior to the classic Barlow lenses.

Features:
  • Size: 50.8mm (2") - Focuser End
  • Magnification: x 3
  • Suitable for visual observations and astrophotography
  • Doubling the effective total focal length of the telescope
  • Four lens tele-centric design
  • Fully multicoated
  • Filter thread for color or nebula filters
  • Includes 2" to 1.25" Eyepiece Adapter

Title: TS Optics 1.25" Barlow Lens X2
Body (HTML):
This x2 Barlow lens doubles the magnification of your telescope with minimal loss of quality. Due to the large lens diameter, you can also use long focal length eyepieces such as the TS Super Plössl 32 mm without having to worry about vignetting.

Due to the multi-coated lenses and blackened lens edges, the x2 Barlow from TS Optics has extremely good image quality.

There are 2 ways to use this Barlow:

  1. (x2 Power) - Just plug the eyepiece into the Barlow and they have a doubling effect of the magnification.
  2. (x1.5 Power) - Screw the Barlow element directly into the filter thread of your 1.25" eyepiece and the extension factor will be shortened to x1.5.

Thanks to the integrated T2 thread, you can also screw the Barlow directly onto a T2 ring. The extension factor here is about x2.5. With the Barlow you can also connect your DSLR camera to smaller entry-level telescopes and focus it without any problems.

The Barlow shifts the focus further outwards, so in the case of entry-level Newtonian telescopes with 76 mm, 114 mm or 130 mm aperture, the Barlow is often the only way to photograph with a DSLR camera. Of course, it works well with all other telescopes also.

Features:

  • Magnification factor visually: x2 or x1.5
  • Optical design: 2-element achromatic, short
  • Free opening: 23 mm
  • Glass coatings: Full multi-coating on any glass-air surface
  • Lens edges: Blackened against reflections
  • Housing: Completely made of metal
  • Barlow Lens element: Can be unscrewed with 1.25" filter thread
  • Connection on the telescope side: 1,25"
  • Connection visually: 1.25", clamping with brass clamping ring
  • Connection to camera: T2 thread

Title: Reducer Adapter 2" to 1.25"
Body (HTML):
This plug-in type adapter allows you to use 1.25" accessories such as eyepieces in Telescopes with a larger 2" focuser. On the telescope side, a 2" filter thread M48x0.75 also allows you to also use 2" threaded filters.

This is extremely helpful if you already own 1.25" eyepieces and accessories and want to use them on another telescope with 2" fittings.

Title: Explore Scientific Star Diagonal Mirror - 2"
Body (HTML):
Diagonals provide a user-friendly observing position, particularly for refractors and Cassegrain telescopes. The Explore Scientific 2" Diagonal Mirror is precision machined from aluminium with light weight carbon fibre. The large eyepiece port diameter of 2"(50.8mm) is ideal for modern wide angle eyepieces and a non-marring brass compression ring holds the eyepiece in place securely.

The dielectric coating of the mirror delivers 99% reflectivity and is very durable against environmental influences. A step-down reducer to 1.25"(31.8mm) is included, so all of your 1.25" eyepieces and accessories can also be used.

Details:
  • Star diagonal mirror for focuser with 2" barrel
  • High quality flat mirror
  • Dielectrical mirror coating delivers 99% reflectivity
  • Very durable against environmental influences
  • Brass eyepiece clamping ring
  • Housing completely made of metal
  • Dust caps included
Whats included:
  1. Diagonal mirror
  2. Dust caps

Title: TS-Optics 1.25" Erecting / Amici Prism - 90°
Body (HTML):
This 1.25" Amici prism provides an upright and laterally correct image. Due to the 90° deflection, you still have a comfortable view even when viewing very high object positions close to the zenith.

This prism is suitable for refractors, Schmidt-Cassegrains, Maksutov-Cassegrains and similar telescopes.

Note: It is not suitable for Newtonian reflectors due to the light path length.

Title: Replacement Rubber Eyecups
Body (HTML):
These replacement rubber eyecups are designed for eyepieces with a housing diameter of 31mm to 33mm on the eyepiece end (most standard Plossl eyepieces). The eyecup is simply pulled over into the eyepiece cup groove on the housing.

Eyepiece cups help prevent the penetration of lateral stray light and spectacle wearers can observe with glasses and the rubber prevents scratching of the glasses against the metal edge of the eyepieces.

Whats included:
  1. One replacement rubber eyecup

Title: TS Optics Star Diagonal Mirror - 1.25"
Body (HTML):
This Star Diagonal zenith mirror provides a correctly viewed upright image (but still laterally reversed). It is particularly well suited for Refractors and Cassegrain telescope designs by offering a much more comfortable viewing position meaning you can view the object through the eyepiece quite comfortably standing up.

The mirror provides ah high-contrast image and is suitable for Refractors, Schmidt-Cassegrains and Maksutov-Cassegrain Telescopes. It cannot be used on Newtonian reflectors due to the light path length.

Details:
  • Adapter telescope side: 1.25"
  • Adapter eyepiece side: 1.25"
  • Reflectivity: 91%
  • Materials: Metal & Glass
  • Corrective angle: 90°
Whats included:
  1. Diagonal mirror

Title: Grey ND96 Moon Filter - 1.25"
Body (HTML):
The neutral density filter transmits light uniformly across the entire visual spectrum. It serves as an excellent filter to reduce glare and when observing the Moon with any telescope 4" and larger.

The ND96 filter may also be used in the splitting of close double stars where one of the binary pair significantly exceeds the other in brightness.

Features:

  • Size: 1.25" Grey Moon Filter
  • Reduces brightness for a higher contrast
  • Ideal for observing the moon
  • Can be combined with other colour filters

Title: Explore Scientific Filter Set for Moon & Planets - Set 3 (6" Telescopes)
Body (HTML):
Moon and Planetary filters help increase the contrast and detail visible while viewing or photographing the moon and planets. Color Filters darken the light slightly, that reaches the eye or the sensor of the camera which helps improve contrast. The result is that your view/picture turns out sharper with more detail.

This set of 4 includes the following filters:

Explore Scientific Filter 1.25" Light Blue No.82A
The light blue colour of this filter really helps improve the detail on the high clouds on Mars and the dark red structures will be shown even darker, so this also works well viewing the big red flecks on the gas planet Jupiter. The rings of Saturn will be accentuated and the structures of the atmosphere on Venus will be even finer.

Explore Scientific Filter 1.25" Violet No.47
The purple filter is perfect for viewing Venus. With this filter, the dark clouds of Venus's atmosphere become even clearer. It also helps increase visibility in the structures of the rings around Saturn.

Explore Scientific Filter 1.25" Light Red No.23
Using this filter, the blue/blue green light is totally blocked. The contrast between the darker and the lighter zones will therefore increase making it very helpful when you view Jupiter or Saturn or even the changing poles on Mars.

Explore Scientific Filter 1.25" Yellow-Green No.11
This filter helps increase the contrast and sharpness when viewing the Moon and also planets such as Mars. On giant gas planet Jupiter, when using the filter, you can start to see the contrasts between the cloud-bands and a lot more detail.

Features:

  • Made from high-quality optical glass
  • Filter glass is absolutely parallel
  • All optical surfaces have anti reflex coatings
  • Filter housing from black anodized aluminum
  • Filter threads on both ends (female/male)
  • Multiple filters usage is possible
Whats included:
  1. 4pcs color filter
  2. 4pcs protection-case

The ND96 filter may also be used in the splitting of close double stars where one of the binary pair significantly exceeds the other in brightness.

Features:

  • Made from high-quality optical glass
  • Filter glass is absolutely parallel
  • All optical surfaces have anti reflex coatings
  • Filter housing from black anodized aluminum
  • Filter threads on both ends (female/male)
  • Multiple filters usage is possible
Whats included:
  1. 4pcs color filter
  2. 4pcs protection-case

Title: Explore Scientific Filter Set for Moon & Planets - Set 2 (4" Telescopes)
Body (HTML):
Moon and Planetary filters help increase the contrast and detail visible while viewing or photographing the moon and planets. Color Filters darken the light slightly, that reaches the eye or the sensor of the camera which helps improve contrast. The result is that your view/picture turns out sharper with more detail.

This set of 4 includes the following filters:

Explore Scientific Filter 1.25" Green No.56
The green filter is to increase the contrast between the red and the blue regions of the cloud structures on the gas planets Jupiter and Saturn.

Explore Scientific Filter 1.25" Orange No.21
This one really supports the detection of the dark areas on the planet Mars. The details of the clouds of Saturn and Jupiter are also so much more visible using this Filter.

Explore Scientific Filter 1.25" Yellow No.12
This filter helps increase the contrast and sharpness when viewing the Moon and also planets such as Mars. On giant gas planet Jupiter, when using the filter, you can start to see the contrasts between the cloud-bands and a lot more detail.

Explore Scientific Filter 1.25" Blue No.80
The light blue colour of this filter really helps improve the detail on the high clouds on Mars and the dark red structures will be shown even darker, so this also works well viewing the big red flecks on the gas planet Jupiter. The rings of Saturn will be accentuated and the structures of the atmosphere on Venus will be even finer.

Features:

  • Made from high-quality optical glass
  • Filter glass is absolutely parallel
  • All optical surfaces have anti reflex coatings
  • Filter housing from black anodized aluminum
  • Filter threads on both ends (female/male)
  • Multiple filters usage is possible
Whats included:
  1. 4pcs color filter
  2. 4pcs protection-case

Title: Explore Scientific ‘Sun Catcher‘ Solar Filter - (Various Sizes)
Body (HTML):
Explore Scientific's Sun Catcher Variable Large Aperture Solar Filters are available in many sizes to work on most telescopes from 60mm up to 10-inch Schmidt-Cassegrain. The Solar Filter material being used is the new advanced 'Solarlite' Film manufactured by world famous Thousand Oaks Optical through years of research and development. 'Solarlite' is a new solar film that has the optical quality of glass with the advantages of impregnated polymer - Perfect for safe solar viewing and photography.

Specs:
  • Special objective filter for safe solar observations
  • ISO12312-2 rated
  • Field-stop diameter 90mm
  • Fits to outer telescope tube diameter from 90 to 160mm
  • Quick individual match with your telescope diameter
  • Fast Setup - Easy Use

Important - Please Read:

Observing the sun can be fun, and extremely interesting, as the surface features visible on our own star are constantly changing by the minute. However when observing the sun, safety measures can not be overstated.  Failure to comply with safety measures can result in serious injury or permanent damage to your eyes. as well as damage to your equipment.

Please see some of our additional guidelines below:

  1. Ensure that all Solar Filters are securely attached to your telescope.
  2. Never use filters that are cracked, torn or otherwise damaged.
  3. Make sure the filter is fitted securely BEFORE you point the telescope at the Sun
  4. Only use certified filters specifically designed for solar viewing.

Title: Optolong L-Pro Deep Sky Light Pollution Filter - 2"
Body (HTML):
The L-Pro Filter is the best choice for light pollution suppression and allows astrophotos to be taken of broadband emission objects such as galaxies, reflection nebulae and globular star clusters.

The relentless spread or urbanization and its associated light pollution have become a big problem for all amateur astro photographers around the world. One solution is to purchase a Mono camera but this can be expensive and might also require the purchase of several types of narrowband filters and a filter wheel.

L-Pro is a multi-bandpass filter which offers much better color balance by maximizing the transmission band. The balanced transmission allows astrophotos to be taken with minimal color cast to broadband emission objects such as galaxies, reflection nebulae and globular star clusters. L-Pro remains the best choice for viewing or photographing broadband targets in light polluted areas.

L-Pro (L-Professional) filter is designed to improve the visibility of various deepsky objects by selectively reducing the transmission of wavelengths of light pollutants, specifically those produced by artificial lights such as mercury vapor lamps, both high & low pressure sodium vapor lights and the unwanted natural light caused by neutral oxygen emission in our atmosphere (i.e. skyglow). Together with the highly transparent main emission lines at OIII (496nm and 500nm), H-beta (486nm), NII (654nm and 658nm), H-alpha (656nm) as well as SII (672nm), the filter is suitable for enhancing the contrast and details for both visual and photograghic purpose at sub-rural areas with heavy light pollution.

L-Pro has a multiple anti-reflective coating on the optical substrate and uses a precision coating based on ion deposition coating technology. This ensures durability and scratch resistance as well as stability on the CWL (central wavelength), which is not affected by temperature changes.

IMPORTANT WARNING: These nebula filters are NOT designed for observation of the Sun. Do not use this filter to look at the Sun as serious eye damage, blindness as well as damage to equipment may result.

Features:
  • Professional visual and photographic filter for astronomy
  • Improves deep sky nebula constellation photography
  • Best choice for broadband light pollution suppression
  • Filter diameter: 2 inch
  • Connecting thread: M28.5 x 0.6mm (Eyepiece thread 1.25 inch)
  • Selected optical glass material
  • Spectrum: 380-750nm
  • Surface Quality: 60/40 (Refer to MIL-O-13830)
  • Fine-optically polished glass to ensure accurate 1/4 wavefront and highest parallelism over the both surfaces
  • High transmission at major nebula emission lines (i.e. H-alpha 656nm, OIII 496nm&500nm, SII 672nm and H-beta 486nm)
  • Precision off-band blocking, specifically the major emission lines of artificial light pollution (i.e. Na 589nm, Hg 435nm and 578nm)
Whats included:
  1. L-Pro filter (2")
  2. Dust protection box

Title: Baader Planetarium Solar Viewer Glasses - Single Pair
Body (HTML):
These Solar Viewers by Baader Planetarium are a high-quality product which is specifically designed for naked-eye solar observations. Safe solar observation! 100% UV-protection, 100% IR-protection, sun light intensity reduced by 99,999%.

During an Eclipse for example, as the moon passes slowly in front of the sun, you can easily observe how the sun disappears behind it through the Solar Viewer glasses. However, these Solar Viewer glasses are not only used to monitor solar eclipses, you can also see larger sun spots through them, or even planetary transits such as Venus.

Safety instructions and information about AstroSolar® Silver/Gold Film:

  1. AstroSolar® Silver/Gold Film has been specially developed for visual solar observation at zero magnification for use with solar viewer glasses (Danger - not suitable for use with a Telescope, Binoculars or even a camera lens).
  2. The optical density of Solar Viewer Solar Viewer AstroSolar® Silver/Gold is OD 5.0. These Solar Viewer are also fully CE-certified and comply to the Norm EN ISO 12312-2:2015 – therefore they are certified for a safe and direct view into the sun.
  3. Baader AstroSolar® Silver Film has been produced for more than 25 years. In the year 1999, during the grand total eclipse over Europe, more than 20 million solar viewers equipped with this film were in use.
  4. In contrast to the black, soot-filled light-absorbing films from other manufacturers, the reflective metal-layers of these AstroSolar® Silver/Gold Films are much more efficient at blocking the red (and especially the invisible infrared) light, and therefore achieving a better security rating at the necessary optical densitiy of OD 5.0.

Remember the Golden Rule: Never try to look at the sun with your naked eyes, even wearing regular sun glasses or insufficient filters, as it may cause permanent eye damage.

Baader Solar Viewer AstroSolar® Silver/Gold are CE-tested and certified by DIN CERTCO to the following standards:

  • DIN EN ISO 12312-2:2015-11: Filters for direct observation of the sun.
  • EU 425/2016: Regulation on personal protective equipment (PPE).

The following safety instructions must be observed when handling Baader Solar Viewers:

Safety Instructions:

  • Never look at the sun without adequate eye protection, permanent eye-damage may occur
  • This high quality Solar Viewer was produced and tested in conformity with all relevant safety regulations and norms for personal safety
  • It enables you to look directly at the sun without danger when used correctly
  • Before use check if this Solar Viewer is in perfect condition. Do not use if damaged, if they are dispose of them.
  • Ensure a correct fit of the Solar Viewer glasses, so that direct solar radiation cannot reach your eyes unfiltered
  • Do not use in combination with other optical instruments (binoculars, telescopes, camera etc.)
  • This product is not a toy and children wearing these Solar Viewer glasses should be closely supervised by their parents.
  • Limit any continuous use to a maximum of 3 minutes.
  • If you suffer or have suffered from an eye disease, only use the Solar Viewer after consultation with your Opthalmologist

Instructions for use and storage:

  • Do not move around when using solar viewers, in case they fall off.
  • Store glasses with utmost care in a dry and airtight container – or dispose of after use
  • Do not store glasses together with rough or sharp objects to prevent damage. Even a slight scratch in the film can result in eye damage when looking at the Sun.
  • Recommended storage time: up to 10 years after first use, or even longer after inspection they are still in perfect condition.

Technical Specs:

  • AstroSolar Film: AstroSolar® Silver/Gold Film
  • Optical Density: 5.0
  • Solar Wavelength: Whitelight (integral light)
  • Filter mounted: No
  • Inner Diameter / Clear Aperture (mm): approx. 3.7 x 2.8 cm
  • Usage: Visual solar observation only
  • Solar Viewers AstroSolar® films have an optical density of at least 5.0
  • This reduces sunlight intensity by 99.999% (factor of 1:100,000) to a safe value of 0.0001% of sunlight
  • No dangerous UV or IR radiation reaches the eye
  • Made in Germany

Whats included:

  1. A single pair of Solar Viewer Glasses.

Title: Explore Scientific SII 6.5nm Filter - 2"
Body (HTML):
The Explore Scientific SII filter is specifically designed for emission nebulae. These objects glow in certain colors, the so-called emission lines. The emission lines are associated with certain chemical elements - and in this case its ionized sulfur.

The Explore Scientific SII nebula filter blocks all other colors (and therefore almost all artificial light) and lets only the emission lines of ionized sulfur at 672 nm through. The result is simply amazing as suddenly, nebulae become visible in places that appear completely empty without the filter. In slightly brightened skies, many planetary nebulae, emission nebulae and supernova remnants can be seen without any difficulties when using this filter. A must for every visual observer and astrophotographer.

All Explore Scientific nebula filters come with an individual test report - so you can be sure to get high quality filters.

Features:

  • Simplifies the observation of planetary nebulae, emission nebulae and supernova remnants
  • Blocks almost all artificial light
  • Only lets the emission lines of ionized sulfur at a 672nm pass
  • 2" Filter Thread
  • Transmission bandwidth: 6.5nm
  • Allows for more contrast in faint deep sky objects
  • Ideal for use in cities or heavily brightened skies
  • Individual test certificate included to guarantee you receive a premium filter
Whats included:
  1. A 2" S-II nebula filter

Title: ZWO UV/IR Blocking Filter - 2"
Body (HTML):
This filter blocks out ultraviolet and infrared light which improves the imaging and viewing on many telescopes. This is especially useful for camera sensor chips that have no UV protective AR glass and are sensitive to UV and IR light.

The filter is used for luminance imaging and for Moon and Planet images. Infrared or IR light is invisible to the human eye, and so even though most telescopes are not designed to focus IR light, it does not matter when you are using your telescope visually.

However, when you add a camera to the mix, its a whole other story! Unlike the human eye, a silicon sensor is very sensitive to light in the infrared portion of the spectrum, and that is a problem and can cause blurring in your images. That means your nice, sharp visual light image is degraded by the addition of the infrared layer. This problem can easily be solved by blocking the infrared, and the ZWO IR-Cut filter will do just that.

Specs:

  • Filter type: UV/IR Cut Filter
  • Filter thickness: 2 mm glass thickness
  • Connection: 1.85" filter thread (outside)

Title: Explore Scientific Astro R-Lite - Red LED Torch
Body (HTML):
The Astro R-Lite red light flashlight is perfect for reading star charts or operating your equipment at night without losing the dark adaptation of your eyes. The Astro R-Lite offers 3 useful features:
  1. Continuous light bright / Continuous light dark / Flashing.
  2. The large diffusing lens results in a very large and evenly illuminated light cone, which can also be adjusted by a sliding mechanism.
  3. By using a power-saving LED lamp, the battery life (1 x AA-LR6) is extended up to 100 hours.
Of course, the robust lamp housing is made from light weight aluminium and is splash-proof to a rating of IPX4 and is therefore particularly well suited for outdoor applications. The side cutouts on the front of the Astro R-Lite housing provide a 360° signal function and it also includes a 50cm long carrying strap with quick coupling and an extra belt clip to ensure that the flashlight is always ready to hand.

Details:
  • Red Light Flashlight
  • Ideal for reading star maps at night
  • Dark adaptation of the eyes is retained
  • Continuous light bright / Continuous light dark / Flashing
  • 360° signal function
  • Large diffusing lens produces a uniformly illuminated light cone
  • Carrying strap and belt clip included
  • Battery life up to 100 hours - Battery (1 x AA-LR6)
  • Splash-proof according to IPX4
  • Robust lamp housing made of aluminium

Title: Telescope Dew Shields - (Various sizes)
Body (HTML):
Glass surfaces such as telescope lenses pointing to the clear sky are prone to having dew forming on the lens during the night - especially if its humid. They also tend to capture stray light, which reduces the contrast of the target.

As many astronomers and astrophotographers have experienced, on clear nights, dew is often a real problem and if it forms on your lens it can render your nights observing session over. After only a very short time, the optics can start fogging, making viewing or photography impossible. A good dew shield reduces the risk of fogging and extends the observing time. Note: on extremely humid nights, dew heaters will also be required. Dew shields are not required for Newtonian reflectors.

Lateral stray light from street lights can also enter the lens which reduces contrast and often cause unwanted reflections in photographs. These dew shields are also blackened out inside with non reflective felt, to help prevent stray light from entering the telescope.

Features:

  • These dew shields are available in various diameters
  • The velcro fasteners are sewn and cannot detach. The dew shields themselves are made from weather-proof and non-ageing plastic.
  • These dew shields are extra flexible, the retentive area for the Velcro is much broader than the from many other designs. This offers a larger retentive area and also a better adaption to the diameter of your telescope.
  • Once attached to the tube, they hold very well. The contact surfaces to the tube are coated with a non-slip foam rubber.
  • They can be combined with dew heaters on extremely humid nights.

Title: Celestron StarSense AutoAlign Module
Body (HTML):
The fastest and easiest way to get started with the fascinating hobby of astronomy.

Simply enter the observation location and local time once in the evening, and you won't have to do anything else for the rest of the night. The StarSense camera eye takes three pictures of the sky after the telescope is switched on. This takes about three minutes. After that, the device knows where in the sky which stars, planets, galaxies, and gas nebulae are located and shows them to you at the touch of a button! It even suggests the most beautiful objects in the sky. You really don't need any prior experience to become an amateur astronomer on your first night with this fantastic new technology. In fact, 40,000 celestial objects are stored in its database!

Even experienced amateur astronomers will appreciate the affordable StarSense module. StarSense replaces expensive software and enables excellent horizon-to-horizon positioning accuracy thanks to any number of calibration stars. And of course, you can use the short time the telescope automatically completes the alignment procedure to prepare for the night.

StarSense for Celestron is compatible with all current computerized Celestron telescopes, as well as many of the older models too.

StarSense on Azimuthal telescopes:
The StarSense module can fully demonstrate its capabilities on alt-azimuth telescopes – including motorized Dobsonians. No north alignment is required, you simply need to set up the device under a clear, dark sky with an unobstructed view of the surrounding sky. At least three-quarters of the sky should allow a clear view of the starry sky. Then simply enter the date, time, and location as usual. For devices with built-in GPS or the optional SkySync GPS receiver, this is unnecessary as the GPS module will detect this information automatically.

The StarSense camera then scans the sky, and after about three minutes, it has enough data to create a model of the sky. Then all you have to do is select the objects you want to observe from the handheld controller's extensive database. If you were caught off guard by good weather and didn't have time to prepare for the night of observation, that's no problem either as The TOUR function suggests the most beautiful objects currently visible in the night sky at your present location.

StarSense on Equatorial telescopes:
The StarSense module can also be used on equatorially mounted telescopes (such as the Celestron Advanced VX, CGEM, CGEM DX, CGE Pro, or even certain SkyWatcher SynScan mounts such as the EQ6, EQ8, AZ-EQ5, and AZ-EQ6).

However, if you're using the mount while on the move, you'll still need to align it north – after all, the tracking axis must be parallel to the Earth's axis. The StarSense module can help with this too: If you've only roughly aligned the mount north (i.e., you've placed the telescope in its starting position and can see Polaris in the finderscope) and switch on the StarSense module, the telescope will search for the reference stars. If you use more than two reference stars, you can increase the GOTO accuracy for visual use. 

You can then call up the All Star Polar Alignment, familiar and proven from the Celestron NexStar controller, to align the mount to another reference star. Since you have to turn the mount's adjustment screws for this, the StarsSense module can only help here. But you save yourself the tedious task of haveing to kneel under the polar finder scope and can still set up the mount accurately enough for photography – conveniently and easily. 

The StarSense module then carries out the subsequent re-alignment independently.

Celestron Mounts Compatible with the Module

  • NexStar SE 6/8
  • NexStar Evolution
  • CPC, CPC DX
  • CGE Pro
  • Advanced VX
  • CGEM, CGEM DX, CGEM II
  • CGX, CGX-L
  • CGE
  • NexStar SLT
  • AstroFi series

Celestron Mounts NOT compatible with the Module

  • NexStar SE 4/5
  • NexStar Series
  • NexStar 90GT
  • NexStar i Series
  • NexStar GPS
  • Ultima 2000
  • Advanced GT
  • Early GoTo mounts (such as Compustar)
  • LCM series

Please note: A motor controller firmware update may be necessary for the mount to support StarSense Module. This requires the Motor Control Update Software, which you can find links to under Downloads for each telescope or download directly from Celestron.com . Unfortunately, it is not possible to upgrade older (unsupported) mounts to make them compatible with StarSense.

Whats included:

  1. StarSense Auto Align Module

View the StarSense Manual Here

Title: TS Optics 2" Extension tube - 35mm
Body (HTML):
Extension tube for 2" receptacles - 35mm long. This extension tube is the ideal solution if the focal point is too far away from the focuser. In many cases, it also allows the use of a camera with a telescope for photography. This extension bridges 35mm optical path. So the focuser does not have to be screwed out to the hard stop and so the mechanical stability is increased.

In the calculation of the optical length, the 2" barrel is not taken into account because it sits inside the focuser´s drawtube.

Spec:

  • Locking with two knurled screws and brass compression ring
  • Solidly CNC machined aluminium
  • 2" filter thread at the telescope side
  • No safety groove - no tilting - perfect for brass compression clamping
  • Telescope side connection: 2" nosepiece with filter thread (M48x0.75)
  • Eyepiece side connection: 2" receptacle with brass compression ring
  • Optical length: 35mm
  • Overall length: 70mm

Whats included:

  1. 1x TS 2" extension

Title: Bresser Mobile Power Station - 500 Watts/h
Body (HTML):
This large 500W Mobile power station is just what you need for those long dark nights whether in the garden or off the beaten track at a dark sky location. With the various connection options, you can operate and charge almost all common electronic devices via the powerful and rechargeable 520Wh lithium-ion battery. Perfect for Telescope Mounts, Dew heaters, Laptops etc. In addition, this mobile power station is a silent and an environmentally friendly alternative to running the car engine or using small conventional power generators. In combination with a suitable solar panel, the built-in solar charge controller allows you to easily use the sunshine to directly charge your Power Station to keep it topped up during the day.

Connection options:
You can charge up to 4 x USB mobile devices such as Smartphones, MP4 players, Cameras, Drones etc. and all at the same time. The device offers 1 x USB-A and 1 x USB-C fast charging output with Qualcomm Quick Charge 3.0 support. You can also power up to 5 x 12 volt devices with a total of 10 amps of current draw. Use 1 direct car cigarette lighter connector socket and 4 x DC 2.1/5.5mm connector sockets.

The built-in battery:
The powerful 520Wh 43Ah/12Volt (140400mA/3.7V) lithium-ion battery reliably stores your enough power in just one charge to operate multiple telescopes at once for many nights out in the open or for a single setup for even longer. It takes around 8 hours to charge from zero and a clear display shows you all relevant information such as the battery charge status, battery charging process, USB output ON/OFF and AC/DC output ON/OFF.

Possible operating time with typical applications:
How long does the Power Station charge or operate your devices? You can easily calculate the approximate operating time yourself with this very simple formula. Runtime (approx.) = Power Station 520 watt-hour battery x 0.85 / devices input power in watts. - For example a notebook with 45 Watt input power: 520 W/h x 0.85 / 45 Watt = runtime in hours; 520 x 0.85 / 45 = 10 hours runtime.

Extensive electronic protection of all current inputs and outputs:
The Power Station is protected against short circuit, overvoltage, over- and deep discharge of the battery and against overheating.

Please note that for use with Astronomy mounts, such as the EXOS-2 Goto, a cigarette lighter adapter is additionally required - These are normally supplied with your mount but can be purchased separately.

Power Station Features:

  • Portable energy storage (Power Bank / Power Station)
  • Self-sufficient power supply for outdoor, hobby and professional use
  • Charging and operation of various electrical appliances
  • Operate or charge up to 11 devices at the same time
  • Pure sinus wave for both 230V outputs
  • Also suitable for sensitive devices such as notebooks or musical instruments
  • Many connection options and adapters included
  • Environmentally friendly and silent alternative to power generators
  • Integrated solar charge controller for direct charging via solar panel
  • Comfortable carrying handle with non-slip rubber coating
  • Powerful 520Wh 43Ah/12 Volt (140400mA/3.7V) lithium ion battery
  • 3 x USB A with each 5-9 Volt 2.1 Ampere) and 1 x USB quick charge output with Qualcomm Quick Charge 3.0 support
  • 1 x USB C with 5-12 volts 3.0 amps (for smartphones and tablets of the latest generation)
  • 4 x 12 Volt DC out 5.5/2.1mm hollow plug (max. total load 10 Amps, short time 12 A)
  • 2 x 230 Volt AC out (500 Watt continuous power, short time 1000 Watt)
  • Indication of battery charge status and USB/DC/AC output on/off staus on display
  • Input charging socket: 13-22 Volt / 6 Amps (via power supply or solar panel)
  • Charging time 0-100% approx. 8 hours
  • Temperature range: from -10 to +40 degrees Celsius
  • Lifetime/charging cycles: > 500 times
Whats included:
  1. Mobile Power Station
  2. Charger 230V 6A
  3. 230V power cord for Europe
  4. 230V power cord for IRL/UK
  5. Car charger 12V
  6. Adapter 5.5/2.1mm to cigarette lighter socket (2 pcs.)
  7. IRL/UK socket adapter for 230V output (2 pcs.)
  8. Instruction manual
