Title: Celestron Heater Rings - (Various sizes)
Body (HTML):
Glass surfaces such as telescope lenses pointing to the clear sky are prone to having dew forming on the lens during the night - especially if its humid. They also tend to capture stray light, which reduces the contrast of the target.

As many Astronomers and Astrophotographers have experienced, on clear nights dew is often a real problem and if it forms on your lens it can render your nights observing session over. After only a very short time, the optics can start fogging, making viewing or photography impossible. These Celestron Dew Protection Heater Rings are the ideal solution for preventing this problem.

The dew-protection heater rings are available in various sizes depending on your telescope OTA size and they replace the retaining ring on your existing Celestron Telescope. Installation is quick and easy (Follow instructions in the manual here).

How does it work?
The dew-protection heater ring replaces the plastic retaining ring on your telescope's Schmidt plate and provides efficient heating of the front lens. The ring is made of lightweight, durable aluminum and its rigid frame supports both the cabling and the telescope's Schmidt plate. Unlike other heating bands or strips, which inefficiently heat the entire OTA cell to warm the glass, the Celestron dew-protection heater ring transfers heat directly to the Schmidt plate, providing the most efficient heat transfer to prevent dew formation.

Simply connect the ring to an external 12V DC Dew Heater power source for a consistent, continuous heat supply that prevents dew formation, even in high humidity. The dew-proof heating ring features two storage clips to safely store the power and thermistor connectors when not in use, and a dust cover for the telescope.

The dew-proof heater ring also comes with a cable management clip that can be attached to the front of the OTA. This allows you to secure the power and thermistor jack-plugs for strain relief and to neatly route the connecting cables.

The ring also includes an extension cable that allows it to be connected directly to one of the controller's heater outputs or to the heater output of another controller. (Note: The heated ring also has an integrated temperature probe (thermistor) however this is only compatible with Celestron's Smart Power and Dew Control box) We also recommend using a dew cap. While not required, it reduces the energy required by the dew heater ring to keep the optics clear.

Whats included:

  1. Dew protection heating ring
  2. Cable management clip
  3. Extension cable for the power socket
  4. Paper cover to protect the Schmidt plate during assembly

Title: ZWO ASI Dew Heater Band for Astro Cameras
Body (HTML):
There's nothing more frustrating than an imaging session cut short because of dew or frost forming on your optics. While dew heater bands can protect the optics of your telescope from this problem, it can also happen on your camera sensor itself, especially when you begin to cool it to sub zero temperatures.
 
This anti-dew heater strip is used for anti-dew on the front window of the ASI cooled cameras (for ones which don't already have build in heaters). This kit includes the zip-tie, anti-dew heater strip, and a Y power cord.

The thickness of the anti-dew heater strip is 0.2~0.3 mm. The Y power cord is designed to connect in-line with the camera's cooler power supply for convenience. 

We recommend a 12 V DC adapter with at least 0.35 A, as the heating power on the strip is approx. 4.2 watts. You can use the same power cord to power both fan and heater simultaneously, but its important to make sure not to exceed the recommended amount of amperes.

Features:

  • Easy adaptation to the front of the camera
  • No extra power supply required
  • These heaters are only compatible with the ZWO cameras, as it is controlled via the cameras electronics.
  • The cuff fits all cooled cameras of the PRO series


How to use it:

  1. Remove the protective film on the adhesive tape.
  2. Put the anti-dew heater strip on the front facing of the camera and position it so that when the cable is folded back, it will align with the DC plug at the rear end of the camera.
  3. Secure the black heater cable with the tie-wrap on the camera body.
  4. Plug in the power cord, and your ready to go.

Tech Specs:

  • Recommended: 12V at 0.35A
  • Heating Power: approx. 4.2 Watts
  • Thickness of spacers: 0.3 mm and 0.5 mm
  • Outer diameter of the heater: approx. 7.5 cm
  • Inner diameter of the heater: approx. 5 cm

Title: Vixen Lens Heater Band 360III
Body (HTML):
The 360III lens heater is designed to prevent the fogging of camera lenses, small telescopes and eyepieces too.

The heating element is a carbon fiber heater, with a high thermal efficiency and the fabric heating element provides great flexibility compared to other heating materials. The USB power cable has particularly high flexibility even at a low temperatures. A velcro strap, allows quick and easy attachment and removal of the heater from the lens or eyepiece. The heating tape itself, has a very low power consumption and can be operated with a portable mobile phone 10,000 mA battery for up to 12 hours.

The Vixen Lens Heater 360III in detail:

Dew condensation is caused by small droplets of water that occur on a surface when its surface temperature is less than the temperature of the moisture in the surrounding ambient air. Due to the nature of Astrophotography in the field, this is a common problem and it can render an imaging session cut short due to this occurring. As temperature and humidity change throughout the night and the camera becomes cooler than the ambient temperature, it is important to heat the lens of the lens or telescope by using heating elements to prevent the lens from fogging up.

This lens heater is equipped with a detachable 50cm long power supply spiral cable (USB Type-C) and consumes only 3W of power (5V - 0.6A). With a mobile USB battery of, 10,000 mA for example, it can operate continuously for about 12 hours (at 20°C outside temperature). However, the operating time varies greatly depending on the environment and temperature. The soft and non-slip surface of the heating tape also allows easy attachment to the lens, eyepiece or telescope.

The heater band consists of a 30mm wide and 600mm long heating tape and is suitable for diameters of lenses or telescopes up to a maximum of 100mm.

Features:

  • Heating type: Carbon fiber fabric heater band
  • Temperature: 10 degrees Celsius above ambient temperature outdoors (at 20°C, no wind)
  • Power source: USB, 5V, 0.6A, 3.0W
  • Power cable: USB A (male)
  • Connection: USB type C plug detachable spiral cable 20cm to 50cm in length
  • Operating Time: About 12 hours with fully charged 10,000mAh battery (at 20°C outside temperature)
  • Recommended for lenses with a width of 30 mm and an outer diameter of 45 mm to 100 mm
  • Dimensions: 30mm x 600mm
  • Total weight: 67g
Whats included:
  1. Lens Heater band 360III
  2. USB spiral cable

Title: Pegasus Astro Advanced Pocket Powerbox Control Hub - Gen 2
Body (HTML):
PegasusAstro Pocket Powerbox Advance (PPBADV) - Universal Power Supply

This Pocket Powerbox Advance (PPBADV) is a welcome addition to Pegasus Astro´s "Powerbox" product series. It has been designed to provide more advanced features in a more compact / quality design.

4 x 12 V DC power outlets for your equipment:
A powerful MOSFET transistor provides "electric juice" to your precious equipment. It supplies 4 electrical outputs which can be switched on/off via software (not individually).

Adjustable regulated output:
An adjustable output is suitable to provide power to your DSLR or mirrorless system camera. You can tune the voltage to different levels (3, 5, 8, 9, 12 V). Pegasus Astro provides different battery couplers for Canon, Nikon, Sony, FUJI cameras.

Built in voltmeter:
A precise voltmeter measures and displays in real time your input voltage. If the input is more than 14 V, the power is instantly cut off to protect your equipment.

Built in Amp-meter:
An Amp-meter placed on the input reports the total current consumed.

In addition to this, there are three additional amp-meters. One for the 12 V outputs and two for the dew heater channels. Now you can monitor the detailed power consumption of your equipment

More than 12 A of total power:
Controller has been designed to support up to 12 Amps of total current.

Standalone operation:
Pocket Powerbox Advance can work "out of the box" as a standalone device. Just plug the cables, setup the "autodew" functionality and every time you boot the device, it will retrieve your settings. So, if you don´t want to connect a PC every time, you don´t have to. Simple as that!

Two channel duty cycle PWM outputs:
Two pulse width modulation (PWM) outlets are capable to provide power to your "thirsty" dew heaters. No more moisture fuzzing your equipment and destroying your clear nights. These outlets can be remote controlled from your laptop using the supplied software.

Auto adjustment of PWM (dew outputs):
Controller can auto adjust the heater power levels by consulting the environmental sensor dew point reading. Just click "Auto" and leave it for the Pocket Powerbox to decide if its time to turn on and precisley tune the level of your dew heaters.

Embedded USB3 hub - 2 x USB3 & 2 x USB2 Ports:
A powered USB3 hub at the back of the device provides
 2 x USB3 SuperSpeed Ports
 2 x USB2 High-Speed Ports

The new Super Speed hubs operate in parallel with the USB 2.0 controller, so 5 Gbps Super Speed data transfers are not affected by slower USB 2.0 traffic.

1 x USB high power output:
A special USB port (Port 1) provides 5.2 V / 3 Amps. You can connect any device that requires 5 V. For example a Raspberry PI 3/4 or an Intel Compute Stick M3/M5 can be powered from this port.

Expansion port (EXT):
EXT (expansion) port is available for device expansion. This RJ12 socket allows the connectivity of current and future Pegasus Astro products. Plugged devices can be controlled from the Pocket Powerbox Advance standalone software or a dedicated ASCOM driver.

Compact aluminium enclosure:
A high quality robust, blue anodised aluminium enclosure houses the electronics of the Pocket Powerbox Advance. Size is 100 mm x 71 mm x 24 mm. Weighs 250 grams.

ASCOM 6 fully supported:
Pocket powerbox fully supports ASCOM6. In combination with the main program which acts as a server you can use PegasusAstro´s latest ASCOM 6.4 supplied drivers to:
Pass environmental settings to supported software (for example Sequence Generator Pro / MaximDL) (ASCOM ObservingConditions)
Switch ON or OFF all 12 V outputs. (ASCOM Switches)

INDI fully supported:
Pocket powerbox fully supports INDI, so you can bundle it with Stellarmate or any other device that can use INDILib.

Led indications for power and failure states:
Led's can blink in patterns to warn you regarding important power issues (like over or under voltage). In addition to this the lights can be turned off using the software. The led is very dim but just in case you don't want them switched on, you can switch it off via the software.

Power cables are included in the package:
Four power cables with DC connectors 2.1 mm to 2.1 mm male (1 m) are included in the package.

External environmental sensor:
External one (1) meter temperature & relative humidity sensor is included in the package. Know exactly the environment conditions of your location. Temperature, humidity and dew point measurements are displayed in the software.

Connectivity:
Connect the device to your laptop/PC and control Pocket Powerbox Advance from the supplied software or ASCOM drivers

Reverse polarity protection:
Pocket Powerbox has been designed with a reverse voltage polarity protection. It will definitely save your night if you accidentally connect the main power supply in reverse polarity!

Watchdog:
A hardware watchdog resets the device if for any reason there is no response from the controller for two seconds. A neat feature in the unlikely event of a controller freeze - when you have a remote observatory and you need to be certain that everything works as expected.

Upgradable firmware:
Device is firmware upgradable to support future features and bug fixes.

Mounting accessories:
Optional mounting accessories (brackets and top plate) are be available - made of black anodised aluminium - Please contact us at sales@horizonastronomy.ie for more info.

Spec:

  • Power Input Connector: DC 5.5/2.1mm
  • Connectivity: USB3 - Type B USB Connector
  • 4 x 12 V Outputs: Maximum current 10 amps in total, 5.5/2.1mm tip positive,
  • software-controlled ON/OFF for all ports
  • 2 Channel x 12 V PWM Outputs: Maximum current 5 A each, black colored RCA
  • connector, pulse width modulated (suitable for dew heaters or a Flatbox), software
  • control for duty cycle % / OFF
  • 1x Sensor Input: Mini stereo socket, connectivity with environmental sensor, 0-
  • 100% humidity readings with 2-5% accuracy, -40 to 80 °C temperature readings with ±0.5 °C accuracy
  • Camera / DSLR Output: Max 3 Amps, 3/5/8/9/12 Volt, connector 5.5/2.1 mm, tip positive
  • Embedded Powered USB3 Hub: 2 x USB2 Ports & 2 x USB3 Ports Available (USB3 ports are backwards compatible with USB2 devices)

Title: Pegasus FocusCube V3 Motor Focus
Body (HTML):
Pegasus Astro FocusCube v3 Universal - Standalone Motor Focus
Introducing this cutting-edge solution for achieving fast, reliable, and precise focusing of your telescope in the ever-evolving field of astrophotography.

In an era where fast optics and advanced camera devices are essential, maintaining accurate focus is naturally of paramount importance.

Focuser Overview:
The below features collectively make FocusCube 3 a versatile and user-friendly device for achieving accurate and repeatable focus in astronomy, catering to both automated and manual control preferences.

  • Fast and Precise Focusing: Swift and accurate focusing for modern telescopes and cameras.
  • Automated Focusing with Temperature Compensation: Maintains optimal focus by automatically adjusting for temperature changes.
  • High Torque Motor: Can move up to 6kg even when pointing at zenith.
  • Low Backlash: Minimized play for precise focus v-curve points.
  • Universal Bracket: Fits various focusers (4mm to 8mm couplers included).
  • Digital Temperature Sensor: Monitors ambient temperature changes.
  • USB-C Connectivity: Single cable for power and data.
  • Wi-Fi Enabled: Hotspot and wireless 2.4 GHz client support.
  • Web Browser Access: Control via web browser on any device, making it OS-independent.
  • ASCOM Alpaca Support: Seamless integration with popular software.
    Firmware Upgradability: Future-proof with software updates.
  • Optional External Hand Controller: Ideal for visual observers who prefer manual control.

Key Features

  • Adjustable and Universal Bracket for Seamless Focuser Compatibility - This versatile Universal bracket features custom-made holes and rails, meticulously designed to ensure seamless integration with most telescope systems.
    Whether you have a refractor, reflector, or any other telescope type, the FocusCube 3’s bracket can be effortlessly adjusted to meet your exact needs.
  • High resolution Geared Stepper Motor coupled with a robust gearbox, delivering an exceptional level of torque that can effortlessly lift and support telescope equipment weighing up to 6 kg, even when pointing at the zenith. What sets this motor system apart is its meticulous attention to precision, as the backlash has been minimized to achieve very low values.
  • Solid motor couplers included in the package - The package features a selection of five solid motor couplers, each featuring a different bore size. This thoughtful provision allows you to precisely match the coupler to your telescope focuser’s shaft, ensuring a secure and snug fit.
    With options ranging from 4mm to 8mm couplers, you have the flexibility to seamlessly integrate the FocusCube 3 with a wide range of telescope setups.
  • USB & Wi-Fi Connectivity - The FocusCube 3 offers streamlined convenience with a single USB-C cable for both power and data, reducing complexity in your telescope setup. Additionally, it’s Wi-Fi enabled, allowing you to control and monitor focus remotely from your mobile phone.

Successful installation on the following telescopes: 
The installation of the Universal L bracket on a wide range of telescope focusers has proven to be exceptionally straightforward and swift, ensuring a hassle-free experience for users.

  1. Baader Diamond Steeltrack
  2. Baader Steeltrack
  3. Explore Scientific Focuser
  4. Askar Telescopes Focusers
  5. MoonLite Focusers
  6. Skywatcher Esprit Series Focuser
  7. StarField Optics Focusers
  8. Starlight Feathertouch Series
  9. Stellarvue Focusers
  10. Takahashi FS-60, TSA-120, Epsilon Focusers
  11. Takahashi FSQ & TOA Focuser
  12. Vixen ED81S
  13. William Optics GT71
  14. William Optics RedCat

Other Features include:

Accurate and Repeatable Focus V-Curves with FocusCube 3
FocusCube v3 Harmonizes with Leading Imaging Suites - NINA, SGPro, Voyager, APT, MaximDL, and More!

The V-Curve results achieved with the FocusCube 3 are consistently accurate and reliably repeatable every time the autofocus routine is initiated.

The FocusCube 3 offers a hassle-free "focus and forget" operation, allowing you to set their focus parameters and continue you observations without constant manual adjustments.

ASCOM Alpaca Native Support
FocusCube 3 offers Alpaca native support and a convenient web interface for easy smartphone control of your device.

ASCOM Alpaca outshines classic ASCOM drivers with its platform independence, modern web standards, streamlined installation, remote control capabilities, extensibility, and open-source options. This ensures superior compatibility and user-friendly performance, making it the preferred choice for advanced astronomy applications.

FocusCube 3 comes equipped with an integrated web server that seamlessly communicates with Alpaca clients natively. This integration enhances the user experience by providing easy access to telescope focus control through ASCOM Alpaca but also monitoring from any device with a web browser such as a smart phone. Upon connecting to the FocusCube hotspot, the focuser control is automatically spawned for immediate use. Furthermore, you can conveniently access it from any web browser by simply typing "focuscube.local" in the address bar.

Additional Features

Temperature Probe:
The FocusCube 3 features an external digital temperature sensor input on the focuser’s side, and it comes with a digital temperature sensor. This sensor can be placed near the focuser, allowing you to monitor the exact temperature of both the focuser and the surrounding environment in real-time through the included software or ASCOM driver.

Expansion Port / Manual Focus:
FocusCube 3 features an expansion RJ12 port situated at the rear of the enclosure, designed to accommodate the EZY-Focus Hand Controller for manual focus control. This optional accessory allows users to enhance their setup with precise manual focusing capabilities.

ASCOM and INDI support:
FocusCube v3 boasts full support for the latest ASCOM, ASCOM Alpaca, and INDI frameworks, ensuring compatibility with a wide range of astronomical software and platforms.

Title: Pegasus FocusCube V3 Motor Focus (For Celestron SCT Telescopes)
Body (HTML):
A must have for successful automated astrophotography sessions, this Auto-Focuser is fast, reliable and designed with high quality materials and modern electronics. FocusCube can provide digital precise focus control from a PC.

The device includes a stepper motor for very accurate position focusing with all the electronics and stepper motors enclosed in a compact-sized box.

The stepper motor provides high speed, focus accuracy, and zero backlash. Attach the FocusCube Zero to your Celestron SCT telescope with the correct adapter, plug in the power, the USB cable and download ASCOM drivers or the Pegasus Unity platform and you are ready to go!

IMPORTANT NOTES:
FocusCube is a standalone device and includes full focus control functionality. No physical hand controller is included or required.
DO NOT pair it with the Dual Motor Focus Controller or any other controller on the market.
DO NOT connect this RJ45 port to the Ultimate Powerbox RJ45 Stepper Output - The RJ45 port at the back is only for the hand controller or the included temperature sensor.

Zero backlash stepper motor:
The embedded bipolar stepper motor provides a zero-backlash movement. The motor allows you to quickly move from any focus point to another. As there is no reduction gearbox the speed is suitable to move the primary mirror or focuser in or out at very fast rates.

Easy and repeatable V-Curve focus:
A V-Curve is the result of moving the focus of a telescope from an outside focus position into the focus and then further into the same direction out of focus again. With FocusCube Zero you can achieve a nearly perfect v-curve leading to a sharply focused image.

SCT bracket:
A special shaped black anodised aluminium bracket, which is stiff and hard to bend, can be attached to most of the Celestron SCT telescopes. Pegasus has successfully tested them on the following:

  • Celestron Classic & EdgeHD 6, 8, 9.25
  • Celestron Classic & Edge HD 11
  • Celestron Classic & Edge HD 14
  • Celestron RASA 8"
  • Celestron RASA 11" (V2 - for V1 you will need a separate Celestron Retrofit Kit)
  • Celestron RASA 14"

For Celestron SCT Telescopes: Please note that Pegasus provides three different focuser adapters for the SCT range. The difference is in the metal pulley bore diameter & the screw length in the package. Before purchasing please ensure you have selected the correct type.

Please note that some older SCT series are not compatible with the SCT bracket.

Temperature Probe:
An external digital temperature sensor input is located near the motor connector. A digital probe of one meter (3 feet) length is supplied. The probe can be placed near the focuser so the exact temperature of the focuser / environment can be seen through the supplied software or ASCOM driver.

Expansion Port / Manual Focus (optional accessory):
FocusCube includes an expansion RJ45 port at the back of the box. This port provides the input for the temperature sensor. An optional hand controller for manual focus control can be acquired separately for those who might want to add this functionality.

ASCOM supported:
The controller is fully compatible with latest ASCOM 6 version.

INDI (Open Astronomy Instrumentation) supported:
Pegasus Focuscube is fully compatible with INDI.

Official INDI Driver available Here

Firmware upgrade support:
Controller firmware supports re-programming via the USB 2.0 connection using upgrade software, for future upgrades which may become available. Pegasus Astro constantly receive feedback from customers and keep updating the firmware and software with new features.

Unity Platform Support:
Pegasus Astro Unity Platform is the new all around application. The goal is to provide a robust and modern application that is going to support current and future Pegasus products under one roof.

A modern frontend allows the full control of all Pegasus Astro devices.
In addition, a REST JSON api helps developers from 3rd party software developers to interact with Pegasus products.

  • Hold torque: 0.8 kp*cm
  • Detent torque: 0.18 kp*cm
  • Belt drive: 16 and 60 teeth, ratio 1
  • Voltage: 12 - 13.8V DC
  • Power connector: Coaxial power connector 5.5/2.1mm, tip positive
  • USB connectivity: USB 2.0 Type B plug
  • Hand controller connector: RJ45
  • Thermal sensor resolution: 9-bit degrees Celsius temperature measurements
  • Operating temperature: -40 °C to +80 °C

  • Total weight: 280g

Title: TS Focus Motor Set for 2" Focusers
Body (HTML):
This electrical focus motor allows you to focus your Telescope without touching the focuser by hand - this is very helpful when trying to avoid unwanted movement of the telescope while trying to focus at high magnifications as even the slightest touch of the telescope causes vibrations making precise focus a big challenge

Apart from this, it is simply more comfortable and relaxing if you only need to press a button to control the telescope focuser and concentrate only on looking through the eyepiece or at the screen to reach the best possible focus sharpness.

For astrophotographers, a motor-driven focus drive like this is almost a necessity.
The image of the star is on the screen of the computer which is often located a bit further away from the focuser on the telescope, especially with Newtonian telescopes. A motor-driven focuser reduces the constant need to stand up and adjust the manual focuser.
Two large push-buttons on the controller allows for changing the direction of focuser movement and the controlling knob allows for adjusting the speed.

Mounting to focusers:
Included is a versatile base with long bores for adapting the this Focuser to the bottom side of the focuser on the telescope. The base is used for fixing the motor securely to the focuser itself.

Then, the motor itself is connected directly to the focuser shaft by a flexible connection.

This focuser is suitable for Skywatcher and Orion Crayford focusers, but can also be easily adapted to many other fosusers with a bit of technical skill.

Our Recommendation:
If you are a planetary imager or are visually looking at the Moon or Planets through the eyepiece then we would definitely recommend this focuser as you will likely be viewing at very high magnification meaning any vibrations as a result of manual focusing will be amplified much more and will make reaching optimal focus and sharpness a very difficult task.

Specs:

  • Power supply: 9 V internal battery (eg. 6LR61 Rectangle type)
  • Cable: Flexible spiral cable - up to 1 m
  • Motor: DC motor
  • Control functions: Change of the directional movement and continuous adjustment of speed.
  • Max. focus shaft diameter: 6mm

Whats included:

  1. Focus motor with adapter plate
  2. Controller box

Note: Additional modifications may be needed on the adapter plate depending on your focuser. Not suitable for TS CC Telescope Focusers.

Title: Bahtinov Mask - (Various Sizes)
Body (HTML):
The Bahtinov Mask is a focusing tool which enables extremely precise adjustment of your telescopes focus - particularly useful if trying to focus a dedicated astro-camera (but also works fine for DSLR)

Attaching the Bahtinov Mask to your telescope or lens is very simple. Each mask is supplied with 3 screws. Remove the plastic from the screws, put them through the designated holes and then pull the plastic covers back over the screws. Now you can attach the focusing mask to the front of your telescope or lens and start focusing.

Some useful tips:
  • Using a Bahtinov Mask for focusing works really well for Deep Sky astrophotography. Correctors and Barlow Lenses are also fine to use too.
  • Ideally you want to use a star with medium brightness for focusing. It should neither be too dark nor too bright. The lines of the Bahtinov interference pattern will need to be clearly visible.
  • The chosen star shouldn´t be positioned in the center of your live view, because most telescopes or lenses, although corrected, do not produce a flat field of view. We recommend positioning your selected star to the outer part of your field of view, That way, you will achieve a better overall sharpness across your whole field of view.

Title: ZWO Atmospheric Dispersion Corrector (ADC) - 1.25"
Body (HTML):
What is an atmospheric dispersion corrector:
An ADC corrector is a small unit that corrects the refraction of light in the atmosphere. For example, a large object like Jupiter has a red and blue color fringe and also appears distorted. This effect is caused by the refraction of light in the Earths atmosphere which acts like a prism. This effect becomes more prominent, depending on how high the object is above the horizon. The deeper the object is, the stronger the effect comes into play. Since especially in northern countries the planets are only very low, the effect here is particularly strong, and the corrector is particularly worthwhile here.

How does the ZWO ADC corrector work?
Our atmosphere refracts the light to varying degrees, depending on the wavelength. Red light is refracted differently than blue light. The closer the object is to the horizon, the stronger the effect. With the adjustment levers on the ADC, you adjust the two prisms in the corrector and thus counteract the effect of the Earth's atmosphere, neutralizing this color shift. this makes a huge difference to the clarity and sharpness of your images.

Important Tip for use:

  1. For the maximum effect, the corrector must be correctly oriented to the horizon. This is usually the case when the superimposed handles of the compensator are parallel to the horizon line in the focuser.
  2. It should be noted that in the case of equatorially mounted telescopes, the position to the horizon changes over time, which must of course be taken into account.

Specs:

  • Connections on the corrector: T2 female/male thread
  • Also included: 1.25" receptacle for telescope and 1.25" adapter with ring clamping for eyepiece
  • Remuneration: Multicoating
  • Housing: Aluminium
  • Prisms: Two wedge-shaped prisms - rotatable to each other
  • Weight: approx. 200 grams

For more information how to use this ADC please download the ZWO ADC Manual here

Title: Pegasus Astro Flat Panel - Flatmaster 150
Body (HTML):
The FlatMaster 150 is a Pegasus Astro flatfield electroluminescent panel. It provides a uniform source of illumination for up apetures up to 150mm and produces high quality flat field frames for astrophotography and photometric captures.

Dimmable EL Panel:
Unlike other EL panels in the market, the FlatMaster can very easily adjust its brightness. Forget sheets of paper between your telescope and the panel. Remotely control the brightness of your panel and store the brightness per filter allowing you to easily retrieve the correct value you need between imaging sessions.

Please note: that FlatMaster can boost its brightness via the supplied software, but it will require to be plugged into a USB3 or USB3 SuperSpeed / charging port. A USB3 port can provide twice the current of a normal USB2 port.

Manual Button:
The device has a small push button which sets five levels of brightness just in case you would like to manually operate the FlatMaster or have no access to a laptop.

One cable operation:
Only one cable (USB) is required to provide power and control of your flatpanel.

Carry bag:
A carry bag is included allowing you to easily bring the FlatMaster 150 to any location.

Standalone Software:
The software allows to set filter names and store / retrieve brightness levels of your FlatMaster panel

Native support by most popular imaging software:
FlatMaster is supported by most popular imaging software like SGPro, APT, Voyager or N.I.N.A

  • Power requirements: 5 V DC provided by USB type B cable
  • Material: Strong black ABS plastic

Title: Pegasus Astro USB Control Hub
Body (HTML):
The Pegasus Astro USB Control Hub (in short UCH).

A SuperSpeed (SS), low power, switchable USB3.1 Gen1 hub and fully compliant with USB-IF´s USB 3.1 Gen1 specification. The hub supports Hi-Speed (HS), Full Speed (FS) and Low Speed (LS). The new SuperSpeed hubs operates in parallel with the USB 2.0 controllers, so that 5 Gbps SuperSpeed data transfers are not affected by slower USB 2.0 traffic.

6 x USB3.1 Active Ports:
This device has 6 x USB 3.1 Ports. All ports are backwards compatible with USB 1.0 and USB 2.0 devices. In addition to this, each port can deliver up to 2.5 A of current. There is a smart current limit sensor in every port which automatically limits or cuts power in case of a short-wire or power consumption that is above 2.5 A. Each port is monitored by the USB controller and in case of a current limit, it triggers a warning popup in the operating system.

Aluminum Enclosure:
A high quality robust, blue anodised aluminum enclosure houses the electronics of the USB hub. The metal enclosure designed and tested to survive ±5 kV ESD strikes

Switchable USB Ports:
Each USB port can be controlled and switched ON/OFF by Pegasus Astro´s standalone software (power + data). You are going to love this feature. No more pull out and re-plug USB cables of your equipment.

12 V DC Operation:
The 12 V DC operation was Pegasus Astro´s first design requirement. As most of your astro-equipment work with 12 V DC why to use something different?

The Hub accepts 12-14 V for operation. This means that you can plug unregulated 12V power from a battery.

Industrial grade temperature support:
Most USB hubs in the market (well, nearly all of them) operate under room temperatures as they were design to work inside your cosy warm room. This is one of the reasons why you experience USB disconnects and instability during a cold night.

This product is certified to work flawlessly from -40 °C to +85 °C. All USB hub electronics has been selected to support industrial grade temperature ranges.

ASCOM Switch support:
Device fully supports ASCOM switch. This means that you can switch ON/OFF each USB port via ASCOM supported software.

Expansion Port (EXT):
An RJ12 external ports allows future device expansion.

Standalone Software:
Switch ON/OFF USB Ports on demand. Monitor USB voltage levels. Easily name each USB port based on the device that is attached on it.

Compatibility:
Device is fully compatible with Microsoft Windows 10, 8, 7, XP, Apple OS X 10.4+, and Linux hub drivers.

Spec:

  • USB Ports: Six downstream USB 3.1 Gen1 / 2.0 ports
  • USB Switchable Ports: All of them [1-6], power & data
  • DC Input: 12-14 VDC, 5.5/2.1mm coaxial power connector
  • Amperage on individual port: 2.5 A
  • Maximum Total Amperage:    8A
  • Operating Temperature: Industrial grade temperature support (-40 °C to +85 °C)
  • Size: 100 mm x 72 mm x 24 mm / 3.9" x 2.8" x 0.94"
  • Weight: 200 g / 7 oz

Whats included:

  1. USB Control Hub Unit
  2. USB 3 cable, 1.5 meter long, male A to male B

Title: TS-Optics x0.67 CCD47 Reducer
Body (HTML):
This CCD reducer for Ritchey-Chrétien and other F/18 to F/8 telescopes was developed for reducing the focal length of RC (Ritchey-Chrétien) telescopes. Practical tests have also shown an excellent suitability for all telescopes with flat field, like apochromats with built-in corrector lens, Celestron EHD or Meade ACF telescopes.

We especially recommend this reducer for GSO, TS Optics & AstroTec Ritchey-Chrétien telescopes.

The features of the CCD47 reducer:

  • Barrel size is 2" - easy connection to all focusers with 2" receptacle
  • With thread for 2" filters at the telescope side
  • Camera connection via M48x0.75 thread
  • Optimal working distance from the connection thread: 85 mm to the camera sensor. Between 70-90 mm, the results are very good.
  • Reduction by 0.67x - an RC with F/8 changes to fast f/5.3. A telescope with f/10 still turns into f/6.7. The exposure time will be more than halved.
  • An illuminated image field of 29mm allows using all camera sensors up to APS-C format.
  • Designed for use with the long working distance of most common cameras whether its CCD, CMOS or DSLR.

Tech Specification:

  • Barrel size: 2"
  • Filter thread: 2" filter thread at the telescope side
  • Camera connector: M48 x 0.75 thread (male, 5mm long)
  • Body length: 29.2mm (w/o male thread)
  • Working distance: Between 70-90mm - optimal results are achieved at approx. 85mm
  • Factor:    0.67x
  • Clear aperture:    44 mm

In the EdgeHD reducers,the lenses made of glass with lanthanum which enable clear, high-contrast images with minimal chromatic aberration. All glass-air surfaces are multi-coated for maximum light transmission and color fidelity
Each lens also has blackened edges to prevent internal reflections and increase image contrast. They are optimized for APS-C format sensors: Fits most DSLR cameras as well as many CCD cameras

Th Reducer has a CNC-machined aluminum housing for precise lens spacing and alignment. Metal screw caps for both ends of the reducer protects the optics from dust and scratches.

Title: Celestron Schmidt Cassegrain Reducer / Corrector - 0.63x
Body (HTML):
This lens focal reducer shortens the focal length of Schmidt-Cassegrain telescopes by a factor of 0.63.  The f/ratio changes by the same amount, from 1:10 to 1:6.3. This results in a significantly larger field of view and exposure times that are three times shorter than without the reducer.

The optical correction system of this Reducer/Corrector flattens the slightly curved field of view of all Schmidt-Cassegrain telescopes, providing a fully corrected, vignetting-free "richfield" field of view with a diameter of 24mm.

This Reducer / Corrector is suitable for the following Celestron Telescopes and changes the Focal length and f/ratios as follows:

  • C5 from 1250 to 788mm/ f6.3 
  • C6 from 1500 to 945mm/ f6.3   
  • C8 from 2000 to 1260mm/ f6.3
  • C9.25 from 2350 to 1480mm/ f6.3
  • C11 from 2800 to 1764mm/ f6.3
  • C14 from 3910 to 2457mm/ f7.3

The Celestron Focal Reducer can also be used for visual purposes. It features the Celestron SC thread on both sides and screws directly onto the telescope tube. It can also be used in combination with the Radial Guider for photography and for CCD cameras.

The reducer weighs just 0.11kg and has a 2" internal thread.

Whats included:

Title: Optolong L-eNhance Dual Narrowband Filter - 2"
Body (HTML):
The L-enhance Filter is a Tri-band filter, perfect for deep sky nebula photography from the city as it uses tight narrowband limits - blocking out unwanted glow from the city. The relentless spread or urbanization and its associated light pollution have become a big problem for all amateur astro photographers around the world. One solution is to purchase a Mono camera but this can be expensive and might also require the purchase of several types of narrowband filters and a filter wheel.

These filters open up a whole new opportunity for fast newtonian telescopes, double-lens ED refractors or even achromats, allowing for extremely detailed and high class astronomical images even from heavy light polluted cities as it blocks out all artificial light pollution sources as it is a Tri-bandpass filter, only allowing for the wavelengths of O-III, H-Beta & H-Alpha.

L-eNhance provides an economical and practical solution for amateurs using DSLR or color CMOS and monochrome CCD cameras. The convenience and cost-effectiveness of this filter allows amateurs to take detailed astronomical images, even in bright, heavily light-polluted areas thanks to its maximum transmission lines of up to 90%. The narrow bandpass for the wavelengths of O-III, H-Beta and H-Alpha really help control the impact from light polluted skies.

L-eNhance has a multiple anti-reflective coating on the optical substrate which uses a precision coating based on ion deposition coating technology. This ensures durability and scratch resistance as well as stability on the CWL (central wavelength), which is not affected by temperature changes.

IMPORTANT WARNING: These nebula filters are NOT designed for observation of the Sun. Do not use this filter to look at the Sun as serious eye damage, blindness as well as damage to equipment may result.

Features:
  • Professional photographic filter for astronomy
  • Improves deep sky emission nebula photography
  • Best choice for enhanced light pollution suppression
  • For taking pictures also from highly light polluted areas
  • Tri-band filter with high transmission for O-III, H-Beta and H-Alpha lines
  • Does not require very large or extremely expensive telescopes
  • Excellent results also with inexpensive newtonian telescopes, double-lens ED refractors or even achromats
  • CMOS colour cameras can deliver an image quality that comes close to CCD monochrome cameras
  • Balanced colour for a natural image
  • Filter diameter: 2 inch
  • Connecting thread: M28,5 x 0,6mm (Eyepiece thread 1.25 inch)
  • Selected optical glass material
  • Spectrum: 300-1000nm
  • Off-Band Blocking: > 99%
  • Surface Quality: 60/40 (Refer to MIL-O-13830)
  • Fine-optically polished to ensure accurate 1/4 wavefront and highest parallelism over the both surfaces
  • High transmission at major nebula emission lines (i.e. H-alpha 656nm, OIII 496nm&500nm and H-beta 486nm).
Whats included:
  1. L-eNhance 2" filter
  2. Dust protection box

Title: Pegasus - Camera Field Rotator V2
Body (HTML):
The Pegasus Astro Falcon Rotator V2 is a light-weighted, low profile camera field rotator. Its very easy to operate via ASCOM drivers or by using standalone software which will make your life much easier by allowing you to automatically adjust your exact camera field of view with precision.

Operating the Falcon Rotator V2 is a seamless experience, thanks to its compatibility with classic ASCOM, native ASCOM Alpaca drivers and the Unity Platform software. This user-friendly design simplifies the process of automatically and precisely orienting your camera field, making your astrophotography endeavors significantly more convenient and efficient.

M68 threads on both sides and low profile:
Both sides of the rotator are M68 threaded, so it is possible to use large sensors without vignetting. The thickness of the rotator is just 15.5mm and the weight only 700g, but it can handle a 6kg payload.

Adapters for both sides:
There are adapters for many common threads available which can be purchased separately.

Precise rotation:
A powerful geared / low backlash stepper motor ensures that the rotator will lock to the designated degree angle. High quality mechanical components inside the focuser prevent flexure at any point during a full circle rotation.

High rated load:
Falcon Rotator V2 has been tested at 6Kg (13lbs) of imaging setup. The mechanical design allows it to custom tighten internal bearing so it can easily handle higher payloads with almost zero flexure.

One Cable Operation:
The rotator can be connected with a USB-C cable for both power and data, reducing complexity in your telescope setup. Additionally, it´s Wi-Fi enabled, allowing you to control your field rotation remotely from your mobile phone.

Field De-Rotation support for Alt/Az mounts:
The rotator has the mechanical precision to achieve field de-rotation. The supplied Unity Platform calculates Rate of Rotation (RoR) based on the site latitude, target altitude and azimuth position. By fine-tuning the micro-step drive control of the motor, derotation can achieve a resolution as precise as 5 arc-seconds.

ASCOM & INDI support:
The rotator is fully ASCOM 6 supported. INDI support will follow by the time of the launch.

Standalone software:
Control the Falcon Rotator with the supplied standalone Windows software.

Specs:

  • Free aperture: M68
  • Payload: 6kg
  • Telescope connection: Female thread M68x1
  • Camera connection: Female thread M68x1
  • Back focus: 15.5mm
  • Data connection: USB 2.0, USB-C port
  • Operating power: 5V, 0.7A (via USB)
  • Housing material: Aluminum
  • Dimensions: 180mm x 140mm x 56mm
  • Weight: 0.7kg

Whats included:

  1. Falcon rotator V2
  2. 2 x Adapters - M68x1M to M54x0.75F
  3. USB-C cable (1.5m)

Title: ZWO Motorised Filter Wheel 8 x 1.25"

This motorised filter wheel is compact and weighs less than 400g (without filters).The USB2.0 is used for powering and the max power consumption is around 150 mA. so you can even connect the USB cable directly to the USB2.0 hub of many cooled Astrocameras.

Title: Homestar Flux Planetarium
Body (HTML):
Imagine enjoying the night sky full of stars while sitting in the comfort of your own home. The Homestar Series of Planetariums were developed by the Japanese inventor & entrepreneur Takayuki Ohira - A recognized and award winning specialist for professional planetariums.

The Homestar Flux provides a beautiful natural sky-scape scene in high definition thanks to the ultra-bright 5-watt LED's and its rotating movement. It projects some beautiful images of the night sky across the room wall and ceiling creating a truly mesmorising outdoor experience.

The two interchangeable disks included contain the fixed stars and constellations for the northern hemisphere and with the integrated “shooting star” mode you can add a real sense of realism to the scene.

The main difference between the Homestar Flux Planetarium and the previous original version is that the Flux incorporates 5-watt LED's projecting an even brighter and sharper image with much more stars and a slightly wider projection area too. The Flux can also be powered via USB and a portable power bank.

Tip: Correct focus depends on how far away the wall or ceiling is and is adjusted using the manual focuser ring on the projector lens. Stars may sometimes appear less sharp at the edge of curved or angled surfaces. This is a normal characteristic of concaved shaped lenses.

Features:

  • The handy timer lets you fall asleep while gazing at the stars, turning off the planetarium automatically after 15, 30 or 60mins.
  • 60 000+ stars.
  • Light source: 5-watt white LED.
  • Projection surface: Ceiling, Wall or other flat surfaces.
  • Projection distance: 120 cm to 290 cm (adjustable focus).
  • Projection area: circle with a diameter of approximately 290 cm.
  • Projector dimension: 16 × 16 × 15 cm,
  • Weight: 620g
  • Available Plugs: EU or IRL/UK.
  • Age recommendation: from 6 years upwards.

Whats included:

  1. One Homestar Original Planetarium
  2. One 110-240V power converter lead (EU or IRL/UK)
  3. Two projection discs of the northern hemisphere sky - one with just stars, the other with constellation lines
  4. Manual (English and German) and a Sky Map.

Note: Please ensure that you select the correct 'Power Lead' during purchase.

Title: Homestar Planetarium Disc - La Silla & Atacama Large Millimetre Array
Body (HTML):
This optional additional disc adds a new dimension to your Homestar Planetarium and features a stunning panoramic view of our Milkyway galaxy from the La Silla and the large Atacama Millimetre Array which is located in Chile and is a large Telescope network run by the European Southern Observatory.

- This disc is designed for use with the Homestar Planetarium.

Title: Homestar Planetarium Disc - Sky Disc Galaxies
Body (HTML):
This optional additional disc adds a new dimension to your Homestar Planetarium with a panoramic view of the night sky filled with some of the many different nebula and deep space galaxies visible from Earth in space.

- This disc is designed for use with the Homestar Planetarium.

Title: Celestron NexStar Evolution - 8" SC
Body (HTML):
Celestron's computer-controlled telescopes reach the next level with the NexStar Evolution: the first Schmidt-Cassegrains with built-in WiFi. You no longer need a hand controller - point the telescope at the most beautiful celestial objects with a click on your smartphone or tablet.

Connect your mobile device to the wireless network of your NexStar Evolution telescope and explore the universe with the Celestron app for iOS and Android.

The planetarium program on your smartphone shows you the current sky view or a list of observation targets for your location. The easy-to-use SkyAlign is integrated into the Celestron app, so you can set up the telescope and adjust the three reference stars in just a few minutes.

Simple and convenient operation:
The NexStar Evolution telescopes have been developed based on customer feedback from the past few years. They offer many well thought-out details so that you can enjoy the most beautiful night possible under the starry sky. 

No more worrying about batteries or an external power supply. The NexStar Evolution is the first amateur telescope to have a built-in lithium iron phosphate battery. One charge lasts up to ten hours. You can even use the Evolution's USB port to power other devices you want to use at night.

The NexStar Evolution is easy to set up thanks to the large, ergonomic handles. The steel tripod has markings so you can easily extend all legs to the same length. The azimuth and elevation clamps allow you to point the telescope at a target even without power. Up to seven eyepieces can be stored in two storage compartments - one even has a dimmable red LED light.

More power and safety thanks to lithium iron phosphate battery:
Instead of a typical lithium polymer battery, a lithium iron phosphate battery is used in the Evolution telescopes. These LiFePO 4 batteries have several advantages over simple LiPo batteries:

High safety & Reliability:

  • Unlike LiPo batteries, LiFePO 4 batteries cannot explode or ignite, but are considered intrinsically safe. The improved power density ensures a high load capacity even with continuous current consumption.
  • Long service life and cycle stability.
  • Wide temperature range for storage and operation
  • Low self-discharge
  • Excellent tracking accuracy, suitable for astrophotography

If you're interested in astrophotography, a NexStar Evolution is an excellent and affordable way to get started. It's the only fork-mounted telescope series in this price range with worm gears, along with improved motors. Planetary photography with a DSLR or a planetary camera is also no problem at all, and with a polar wedge you can also set it up equatorially to take long exposure deep sky images, be it with a DSLR or an Astro Camera.

The Schmidt-Cassegrain telescopes with the StarBright XLT coating deliver bright, sharp images and are just as interesting for visual observers as they are for astrophotographers.

The NexStar Evolution telescopes come with a StarPointer finder scope, two 1.25” Plössl eyepieces, a star diagonal, power supply and a hand controller.

  • Optical design: Schmidt-Cassegrain
  • Resolution (DAWES): 0.57 arcseconds
  • Resolution (RAYLEIGH): 0.68 arcseconds
  • Focal length: 2032mm
  • Aperture ratio: f/10
  • Secondary mirror obstruction: 6.9cm
  • Secondary mirror obstruction relative to diameter: 33.8%
  • Secondary mirror obstruction relative to surface: 11.40%
  • Highest useful magnification: x480
  • Light gathering capacity (compared to the human eye): x843
  • Lowest useful magnification: x29
  • Optical coating: Starbright XLT (Fully multi-coated)
  • Telescope aperture: 203.2mm (8")
  • Tube length: 43cm
  • Tube weight: 5.67kg

Mount Specs:

  • Alignment Methods: SkyAlign, 3-Star Align, Solar System Align
  • Database: Hand controller with over 40,000+ objects, 100 user-defined entries, additional information on over 200 objects; SkyPortal app with over 120,000 entries
  • Mount: Azimuthal mount (motorized)
  • Mount control: Computer controlled (GOTO)
  • Tracking speeds: Sidereal, solar and lunar
  • Tracking modes: Azimuthal, EQ-North, EQ-South
  • Dovetail compatible: EQ Standard (Vixen Style)
  • Panning speed: Max. 4°/second, nine speeds
  • Carrying capacity (kg): 11kg
  • Mount type: Alt-Azimuth single-arm mount
  • Connections: 1 hand controller, 3 AUX for optional accessories, USB on the hand controller
  • Hand controller: NexStar+ hand controller, two-line LCD display with 16 characters, 19 backlit keys, USB 2.0 port for PC connection

Title: Celestron CPC 1100 - GPS
Body (HTML):
The CPC 1100 GPS XLT is the portable fork-mounted top-class telescope from Celestron and features the StarBright XLT coating. The telescope is perfect for visual observations and, with an optional polar wedge and an astro camera, also enables professional astrophotography.

If you point the telescope at the planets, you'll see fascinating details on the surface of Jupiter, the Cassini division of Saturn's rings, and surface details on Mars. Even Uranus, Neptune, and Pluto are within your reach.

Professional XLT computer telescopes:
With the CPC series, Celestron is introducing the most stable fork mount that has ever been available in the 40 years of production of Celestron Schmidt-Cassegrain telescopes. The completely newly designed tripod and a huge 280mm ball bearing in the fork base enable vibration-free observation even at the highest magnifications.

The azimuthal fork mount is not as variable as the German mount, as it is tailored to the tube diameter. This disadvantage is compensated for by the compact design, low weight, good portability and, most importantly, incredibly quick setup. You are ready to observe in just a few minutes. Simply set up the tripod, level it with the built-in bubble level, put on the fork mount - and switch it on.

Built-in GPS:
The 16-channel GPS receiver transmits the time, date and location coordinates to the electronics. This means you no longer have to enter the time and location yourself - the telescope automatically has the exact data.

Sky Align:
This is the name of the brand new alignment process from Celestron for perfect GoTo positioning. The telescope no longer needs a defined base position: you place three bright stars (planets and the moon are also possible) in the field of view of the telescope one after the other and voilá, your CPC telescope is ready for automatic GoTo positioning on any object from the hand control database.

SkyAlign calculates the setup of your telescope from the travel distances of the three stars and the corresponding angles. SkyAlign also gets the other data required (date, time, and location coordinates) via the integrated 16-channel GPS receiver.

"SkyAlign" only works when the telescope is in azimuthal operation, i.e. when the telescope is operated directly on the tripod without a polar wedge. But Celestron also has some new and simplified alignment methods for parallactic operation in the CPC series.

Extensive database:
The CPC telescope database contains over 40,000 celestial objects, including the Messier and Caldwell catalogs, as well as galaxies and nebulae from the NGC catalog and the planets. You can narrow down your selection to make searching this comprehensive database easier and to hide objects that are currently below the horizon.

The "Identify" function tells you what you are currently seeing in the telescope and also allows you to easily explore the sky. Simply point the telescope at any area of the sky and have it show you, for example, the nearest Messier objects - the telescope will navigate to them for you. You can do this in different areas of the sky and with different objects!

The CPC telescopes also score points with the following details:
The azimuthal fork mount has been completely redesigned. It is less susceptible to vibrations and the drive motors and gears run "whisper quiet" in GoTo mode. The tripod that supports the mount and telescope has also become more stable.
The completely newly designed tripod (landing pad) has a self-centering mounting device - no searching in the dark for the right attachment point for the mounting foot on the tripod. By rotating the mount on the tripod, the screw holes lock into the right position. Three spring-supported screws, which are anchored in the tripod, enable quick and, above all, effortless assembly in a matter of seconds. The built-in bubble level makes leveling easier. The large tripod triangle also serves as a storage area for several eyepieces.

Other features include:

  • Illuminated on/off switch on the top of the housing - so no more searching in the dark,
  • Large, easy-to-grip clamping wheels (suitable for gloves) in both axles instead of fiddly small clamping levers,
  • The "Permanent PEC" function stores the periodic errors of the screw to improve the tracking accuracy,
  • The electronics work with all autoguiders and planetarium programs available on the market,
  • The "Alignment Sync" function allows you to improve positioning accuracy during operation by confirming a new alignment object,
  • The "Precise Goto" function allows very faint objects to be brought extremely precisely into the center of the field of view or a CCD chip. First, a bright star close to the object being searched for is selected by the electronics and moved to it. The observer must then move it precisely to the center of the field of view using the arrow keys on the hand controller. The computer then calculates the distance from this star to the object being searched for and moves to it with high precision.
  • Finally, another new "feature" of the hand controls of version 4.0 of the CPC series: thanks to a flash EPROM, the control and motor software can be upgraded via the Internet.

Avoid electronic damage – remember to use the right power supply!
To ensure the device works properly, please only use high-quality power supplies that meet the specifications for astro-use, i.e. outdoor use – cheap power supplies often only deliver the specified voltage and power at room temperature and can even damage the electronics in the worst case. Suitable high-quality power supplies can be found on the left under Optional Accessories.

Spec:

  • Optical design: Schmidt-Cassegrain
  • Optical coating: Starbright XLT (Fully multi-coated)
  • Telescope aperture: 280mm (11")
  • Resolution (DAWES): 0.41 arcseconds
  • Resolution (RAYLEIGH): 0.50 arcseconds
  • Focal length: 2800mm
  • Secondary mirror obstruction: 9.5cm
  • Secondary mirror obstruction relative to diameter: 34%
  • Secondary mirror obstruction relative to surface: 11.60%
  • Visual field: 0.6°
  • Highest useful magnification: x661
  • Light gathering capacity (compared to the human eye): x1593
  • Focuser size (inches): 3.3" +2" SC thread, 1.25"
  • Aperture ratio: f/10

Mount Spec:

  • Alignment Methods: SkyAlign, Auto Two-Star Alignment, Two-star Align, Solar System Align, EQ North, EQ South, One-Star Align
  • Database: Over 40,000+ properties, 100 custom listings, More information on over 200 properties
  • Mount control: Computer controlled (GOTO)
  • Tracking speeds: Sidereal, solar and lunar
  • Tracking modes: Azimuthal, EQ-North, EQ-South
  • Screw Error Control (PPEC): PEC, permanently programmable

  2. Incl. accessories: 11" Schmidt-Cassegrain in computer-controlled CPC double fork mount, height-adjustable tripod, storage plate, 8x50 finder, 1.25" Zenith prism
  3. Viewfinder: 8x50 finder with quick coupling.
  4. Zenith prism: 1.25".
  5. Accessory tray: Tripod spreader/eyepiece holder.

Title: Celestron CPC 925 HD - Deluxe
Body (HTML):
The CPC 925 HD Deluxe is the portable fork-mounted top-class telescope from Celestron and features the StarBright XLT coating. The telescope is perfect for visual observations and, with an optional polar wedge and an astro camera, also enables professional astrophotography.

New Optical Design:
EdgeHD (Edge High Definition) optics combine the compact design of a Schmidt-Cassegrain with significantly improved image quality at the edge of the image. This optical system not only offers astrograph characteristics, but also produces completely undistorted, sharp images right up to the edge of the large visual and photographic field of view. This not only corrects off-axis coma—as with other so-called "coma-free" optical designs available on the market—but also field curvature! All EdgeHD telescopes deliver a large, flat field of view, enabling sharp star images even at the edge of large CCD sensors.

Built-in GPS:
The CPC Deluxe HD telescopes feature a built-in GPS sensor that automatically receives the date, time, and your exact location from the GPS satellites. This eliminates the need to manually enter this data.

SkyAlign:
This is Celestron's incredibly easy alignment process for perfect GoTo positioning. The telescope no longer requires a defined home position: Simply align three bright stars (planets and the moon are also possible) one after the other in the telescope's field of view, and voilà! Your CPC telescope is ready for automatic GoTo positioning to any object from the hand control's database.

SkyAlign calculates your telescope's alignment based on the trajectories of the three stars and the corresponding angles. SkyAlign retrieves the other required data (date, time, and location coordinates) via the integrated 16-channel GPS receiver.

" SkyAlign " only works in azimuthal mode, i.e., when the telescope is operated directly on the tripod without a polar wedge. Celestron also offers several new and simplified alignment methods for equatorial operation in the CPC series.

Comprehensive Database:
The CPC telescope database contains over 40,000 celestial objects, including the Messier and Caldwell catalogs, as well as galaxies and nebulae from the NGC catalog and planets. You can narrow down your search to simplify your search in this comprehensive database and hide objects that are currently below the horizon.

The "Identify" function tells you what you're currently seeing in the telescope, and it also lets you easily explore the sky. Simply point the telescope at any area of the sky and, for example, display the nearest Messier objects—the telescope will move to them for you. You can do this in different areas of the sky and with different objects!

With "Solar Sys Align" you can align the telescope using the sun or moon even during the day to observe the planets or the brightest stars in the daytime sky.

Hyperstar Compatible: All EdgeHD tubes allow you to remove and replace the secondary mirror. The result: With the optional HyperStar optics, your standard Celestron EdgeHD telescope becomes a digital Schmidt Design for your CCD or DSLR camera for primary focus photography.

Innovative features of the Mount:

Design - For the CPC Deluxe HD telescopes, Celestron has redesigned the drive mechanism. It features a 15 cm (6 inch) brass gear with 180 teeth and a stainless steel worm gear, as well as a unique steel and nylon ball bearing design for even smoother tracking for long-exposure deep-sky imaging.

Innovation - The CPC Deluxe HD telescopes feature the innovative All-Star™ Polar Alignment . When used with the optional polar wedge, you can align the telescope to any bright star in equatorial mode—no need to look at Polaris! Astrophotographers will also appreciate the Permanent Periodic Error Correction (PEC) feature. You can record the helical error so it's automatically corrected in the future.

Power Management - The redesigned electronics supply the motors with constantly regulated voltage, allowing them to move the telescope even when it's not fully balanced. This maintains smooth operation and high GoTo accuracy.

Performance - You can track objects far beyond the meridian, allowing you to observe the most interesting part of the sky without interruption.
Avoid electronic damage – remember to use the right power supply!

Mount Spec:

  • Alignment methods: SkyAlign, Auto Two-Star Alignment, Two-star Align,
  • SolarSystem Align, EQ North, EQ South, One-Star Align
  • Database: Over 40,000+ objects, 100 custom objects
  • Mount control: Computer-controlled (GOTO)
  • Tracking speeds: Sidereal, solar and lunar
  • Tracking modes: Azimuthal, EQ-North, EQ-South
  • Screw defect control (PPEC): PEC, permanently programmable
  • Panning speed: Nine speeds, maximum 3°/second
  • Type: Azimuthal double fork
  • GPS: Built in - 16 channels
  • Hand Control Box - Yes
  • Power Consumption: 12V DC, 2.5A

Telescope Spec:

  • Resolution (DAWES): 0.49 arcseconds
  • Resolution (RAYLEIGH): 0.59 arcseconds
  • Focal length: 2350mm (93 in)
  • F/Ratio: f/10
  • Telescopic Aperture: 235mm (9.25")
  • secondary mirror obstruction: 8.5cm
  • Secondary mirror obstruction relative to diameter: 36.20%
  • Secondary mirror obstruction relative to the surface: 13%
  • field of vision: 0.8°
  • Highest useful magnification: 555x
  • Light gathering capacity (to the human eye): 1127x naked eye
  • Lowest useful magnification: 34x
  • Optical design: EdgeHD
  • Optical coating: Starbright XLT (Fully multi-coated)
  • Telescope series: CPC Deluxe HD
  • Tube weight: 30 kg (telescope and mount, without tripod)

Whats included:

  1. Focal length eyepiece: 23mm
  2. Incl. accessories: 9.25" Schmidt-Cassegrain in computer-controlled CPC double fork mount, height-adjustable tripod, storage plate, 8x50 finder.
  3. Viewfinder: 8x50 finder with quick coupling.
  4. Zenith prism: 1.25".
  5. Accessory tray: Tripod spreader/eyepiece holder.

Title: Celestron CPC 1100 HD - Deluxe
Body (HTML):
The CPC 1100 HD Deluxe is the portable fork-mounted top-class telescope from Celestron and features the StarBright XLT coating. The telescope is perfect for visual observations and, with an optional polar wedge and an astro camera, also enables professional astrophotography.

As the largest instrument in this series, the CPC Deluxe 1100 HD telescope gathers the most light out of all the range - almost 90% more than the 8" model and still over 40% more than the 9.25" model. The CPC Deluxe features the newly redesigned fork mount and modern EdgeHD optics.

Thanks to sophisticated software features such as the hibernate function, the telescope remembers its position from one night to the next - assuming it is not moved during that time, of course. This makes it ideal for permanent installation in an observatory. Yet it is compact enough to be easily transported to an observing site.

The conveniently positioned carrying handles and an instrument weight of just under 30kg make it easy to set up in your own garden or transport to your favorite observing spot.

Title: Vixen WiFi Adapter Module
Body (HTML):
The Vixen Wifi adapter for EQ mounts eleminates the need for the Star Book Ten hand controller and allows you to control your Vixen mount via a smartphone or tablet via a WiFi connection.

With the smartphone app Star Book Wireless (free of charge) you can perform celestial navigation without any wiring. The app turns your smartphone or tablet into a controller for the equatorial mount in no time. The response delay of the mount, which is considered the biggest disadvantage of wireless connections, has been reduced to a level comparable to wired ones. 

Reduced power consumption compared to conventional controllers with LCD monitor 
The power consumption of the mount is reduced by up to 20%, allowing longer observations than with conventional wired controllers such as the Star Book Ten. 

Operation similar to the Star Book Ten controller:
The Star Book Wireless app has a similar structure to the Star Book Ten controller. Tap on a celestial object in the object list and start the GoTo. The mount will now automatically move to this target and bring it into the telescope's field of view. All the popular features of the Star Book Ten are available.

Convenient operation:
When looking through the telescope operate the mount by swiping on the app's star map. Since there are no buttons, simply slide your finger over the star chart for convenient operation of the mount. 

Extensive astronomical data included:
This includes data on easily observable celestial bodies such as Messier objects, NGC objects, IC objects as well as the Sun, Moon, planets, comets and dwarf planets. 

High-precision alignment:
By aligning to one or two stars, you already get a fairly accurate positioning of the mount. By aligning to three or more stars, you can achieve high-precision alignment of the mount for high magnifications. The objects will then be approached precisely and centrally in your telescope's field of view. The alignment information is stored and can be retained even when the telescope is switched off. By leaving the telescope in its current state without moving it after completing an observation, the next time you observe you can start the automatic setup with the same settings for the next observation. 

Individual setting options:
As with the Star Book Ten controller, the app offers various individual settings, such as gear backlash compensation, night mode in red, autoguider and variable GoTo speed and LED brightness. You can also set the timing of the lens tube inversion (meridian flip) as desired. Even if the object moves south during tracking, you can prevent the telescope tube from inverting. 

Important information: Cannot be used on old SX mounts with the old blue Star Book.

WiFi Module Features: 

  • Can be used on: SX2, SXD2, SXD2-PFL, SXP, SXP-PFL, SXP2, AXJ (without encoder), AXD, AX 
  • Not compatible with old SX mounts with blue Star Book 
  • CPU: 32bit CISC processor 120MH 
  • Connector: D-SUB 9-PIN socket 
  • Autoguider connector: 6-pin modular connector for SBIG 
  • Operation: Android 6, iOS 9.0 or higher 
  • Wifi standard: IEEE802.11b/g 
  • Data encryption: WPA2-APK 
  • Firmware update: via WiFi connection 
  • Operating voltage: DC12V 0,1A (max) 
  • Power supply: via mount 
  • Dimensions: 56 x 36 x 19.5mm, weight: 60g 
  • Can be used with ASCOM Driver - Download latest driver here >

Whats included:

  1. Vixen Wifi adapter

Body (HTML):
This reducer reduces the focal length of your telescope to 1278 mm and allows a faster f-ratio of f/6.4. The higher f-ratio delivers faster results for astrophotography. The reducer is also full coated to ensure maximum light transmission.

Features:

  • For use with the VC200L Cassegrain
  • Reduces the focal length by a factor of x0.71 (1278mm @ f/6.4)
  • Distance to chip: 63.5mm
  • Weight: 83g

Whats included:

  1. x0.71 focal length reducer for VC200L
  2. Dust caps

Title: Vixen Tripod Accessory Shelf
Body (HTML):
This additional tripod shelf offers a practical storage space for eyepieces and various accessories as well as improving the overall stability of the tripod. The shelf can be used on the HAL130 and SXG HAL 130 for GP and SX as well as on the Porta II tripod.

Whats included:
  1. Storage plate for tripods
  2. Screw Set

Title: Vixen SD Image Field Flattening HD Kit
Body (HTML):
This High-quality Field Flattener is specially designed for Vixen ED and SD refractor telescopes. With this image field flattener you get razor-sharp star images right up to the edge of the field of view. The Flattener illuminates a 44 mm image circle and is therefore suitable for the full-frame cameras.

For professional astrophotography:
The same anti-reflective AS coating is also used for the high-end astrograph VSD 100 f/3.8, which allows for a light transmission of 99.9 percent per lens surface. Light losses, reflections and scattered light is almost completely eliminated by the complete non reflective matte interior coating.

Can be used on the SD81S, SD103S and SD115S as well as the predecessor ED series refractors. Note: For DSLR cameras, you will also require a wide photo adapter and a T2 ring

Features:
  • High light transmission
  • Flat image field right to the edge
  • Very high contrast
  • Can be used on the SD81S, SD103S and SD 115S
  • Optics: 2 elements in 1 housing.
  • Suitable for full-frame cameras
  • Illumination 44mm

Title: GOTO upgrade set for Bresser EXOS-2 mounts
Body (HTML):
With the BRESSER StarTracker GoTo kit you can upgrade any existing BRESSER EXOS-2 mount allowing you to navigate the night sky at the touch of a button as well as enter into the world of long exposure deep sky astrophotography.

This Bresser StarTracker GoTo System enables beginners to start astronomical observations in just a few minutes, and guides you to objects that are hard to localize through a standard finder scope. Just select your target on the handset and the GoTo System will find planets, nebulae or galaxies for you and position your telescope automatically for you. The GoTo System database includes over 100,000 astronomical objects and still has space for your own additions.

The Bresser StarTracker GoTo systems uses servo motors for both axes and features an ST-4 compatible autoguiding input and guiding speeds can be set on the mount itself. The menu navigation of the Startracker hand controller is also multilingual and offers multiple language options of German, English, French, Spanish and Italian.

Features:
  • Objects in database: > 100.000
  • Slewing speed: 2°/sec
  • Auto-Guider Port: Yes / ST-4 compatible, guiding levels can be adjusted
  • LC Display: 36 x 63mm ; 8 rows with 21 digits
  • Motors: DC Servo with Encoders
  • Operating voltage: 12V DC
Whats included:
  1. 2 Servo motors for both axis (RA and DEC)
  2. GoTo computer control StarTracker
  3. Startracker handbox DE/GB/FR/ES/IT
  4. Battery pack* with power cable
  5. Conncetion cable for motors
  6. Connection cable for handbox
  7. Mounting material (gears, screws, Allen keys)
  8. User Manual
* Note: Batteries not included; 8 type D (LR 20) batteries 1.5V required, or alternatively a suitable car plug or mains adapter

Title: M48 Extension Ring (2") - 28mm
Body (HTML):
Aluminium Extension Tube 2" with double sided 2" filter thread - length 28mm
The extension tube is simply screwed into the M48 filter thread from 2" eyepieces or 2" adapters and therefore will extend the barrel. Therefore the fitting accuracy of an adapter can be greatly improved.

These tubes are also important for astrophotography when the correct distance between corrector and camera sensor is required. In this case, just a few millimeters can be critical.

Title: TS Tilt Adjuster Plate - (M48)
Body (HTML):
M48 Camera Tilter - This tilting plate allows you to accurately match the tilt of your telescopes focal plane and camera sensor.

Many Astro photographers will know this problem - Even after precisely focusing, in one or two corners the stars are still not exactly pinpoint. This is often due to the focal plane and the camera sensor not being precisely parallel with each other.

Some possible causes of this problem are:
  • A tilted camera sensor (manufacturing imperfections by a fraction of a millimeter)
  • A tilted focuser
  • A tilted focal plane of the telescope (common with Newtonians)
  • Tilted optical accessories caused by unprecise clamping accessories

With this M48 Tilter, you can adjust the tilt of the cameras sensor to match the focal plane of your telescope. Just make sure, once adjusted, you keep the orientation of the image train the same or you will have to re-adjust it again.

The adjustment of the tilt is done by using knurled screws, which can be done quickly in the field without the requirement for additional tools.

Details:

  • Connection via M48 X 0.75 thread
  • Only 11mm optical path from the M48 female to M48 female
  • M48 conversion adapter included - Converts the M48 female to an M48 male thread
  • Solid Metal Design

Some possible causes of this problem are:

The adjustment of the tilt is done by using knurled screws, which can be done quickly in the field without the requirement for additional tools.

Title: DSLR Camera T-Ring Adapter (M48) - Nikon
Body (HTML):
Camera specific bayonet adapter (camera T-ring) for Nikon DSLR cameras with M48 x 0.75 mm internal thread for astrophotography.

By using the large thread M48 x 0.75 mm, the vignetting which can occur in a DSLR full format sensor is effectively avoided. Compared to the small T2 thread M42 x 0.75, this adapter has a free inner diameter of 41.2 mm. This camera ring is made of matt black anodised aluminium and weighs only 30 grams. The light path (overall length) is 8.0 mm.

Title: TS-Optics x0.73 Reducer for Newtonians
Body (HTML):
Newtonian Coma Corrector and 0.73x Focal Reducer for your Newtonian telescope:

This corrector increases the speed of your Newtonian telescope and corrects for Newtonian coma. The exposure times during astrophotography can essentially be almost halved. This corrector was designed by H. Ackermann (USA).

The corrector is usable for the following Newtonian telescopes:
Basically, the corrector/reducer can be used with all Newtonians from f/3.5 to f/8. It has an M48 thread at the camera side. The adapter shifts back the focal plane by 15-16 millimetres. This value results from the reduction factor of the reducer. You need approximately 85mm from the 2" receptacle of the focuser to the focus to make the reducer operational. UNC and ONTC Newtonian telescopes from TS Optics can be prepared for the use of this special corrector.

Because of the increased speed, you also have to pay attention to accurate clamping because even minimal tilting results directly in unsharp stars at the edge of the field.

Usable image field of the TS-Optics corrector-reducer:
The design of the corrector allows for a usable field of 22mm diameter with 100% illumination. With a little trick during focusing, this field can be extended to approx. 30mm - For example, don't use a star in the middle of the field, but use a medium bright one in the outer third of the field.

Practical tip - how do I get 55mm working distance using this corrector?
The distance of the corrector is 67mm (+/- 0.5mm) from the M48 connection thread. The working distance is always calculated from the corrector to the camera which is typically 55mm for most cameras :

  • Distance 55mm with T2 connection: Using a 1mm spacing ring , a 5mm Extension , an M48x0.75 to T2 high profile adapter
  • Distance 55mm with M48 connection: Using a 1mm spacing ring (x2) , a 10mm Extension

Spec:

  • Barrel size: 2"
  • Connection thread at the camera side: 2" filter thread (M48x0.75)
  • Working distance from the camera thread: 67mm to the sensor (+/- 0.5mm)
  • Reduction: Focal length reduced to 0.73x
  • Filter thread: 2" filter thread at the telescope side
  • Coating: Fully multi-coated
  • Corrected field: 22mm diameter - usable up to 30mm diameter
  • Length: 56mm

Whats included:

  1. TS Reducer Corrector
  2. Dust caps
